job_description: About the job Data Analyst for Sweden's leading bank intermediator.  They're a bank intermediator that brings the power back to the consumer by allowing them to compare and analyse their options. In comparison to other companies in this market, they are leading by miles in popularity and growth, which has now allowed them to further focus on building the business internally.  This isn't your typical analyst role, it's a technically hands-on and business orientated position that encourages you to use data to make business-decisions. As a modern company, their data is entirely digital so there is plenty for you to play with and also plenty of room for you to make analysis decisions using your expertise.  You will be working alongside colleagues who are supportive, fun, down-to-earth and equally as passionate about the things they're good at (including sales, development, marketing, finance, video games and more).  Main responsibilities include:  Analyze large datasets with different types of data sources as well as several different types of customer data. Each project solves different needs, but we deliver predictive models, segmentations, profiling, campaign and channel analyzes, follow-ups and tests.  Prioritize and lead their analysis agenda - a lot of responsibility in driving your own data initiatives and pinpointing where the business can improve. Genuine feedback loop where your contributions are listened to and commended.  Be a key player in our collaboration with other teams and stakeholders (eg Product, Sales, Customer Support, Marketing, etc.)  Heavily involved in visualisations (Tableau), running scripts (Python), handling data and presenting findings.  The Analytics team want to cover the blanks and help their consumers understand these missing data points, by predicting the data.  The role involves discovering underlying trends in data, deriving value-add information from these trends, and driving implementations to drive revenue; since they're an entirely digital business, you have thousands of data points at your fingertips.  What can they offer you?  They're highly data-driven already so your work is valued from day one.  Stability of a large global organisation but has a feel of a smaller more autonomous environment, with plenty of opportunity to work with people across the globe and relocate if you want.  Fantastic culture of likeminded people who want to succeed - everybody is very sociable, friendly and passionate about what they do. Lots of knowledge sharing and chances to collaborate with different teams and people in the business.  Plenty of progression opportunities and room to grow into areas you enjoy.  Very collaborative environment as working very hands-on with various teams. Working with customer deliveries also means you can see the impact of your work immediately and often on a long-term basis as well when you will work with a customer on multiple projects.   Does this sound like a good fit to your experience and passions? Then apply to this advert and we can schedule in a chat to go into even further depth of how these guys are making a difference.  I am also available on +46 8-502 425 38 and m.mcdermott@nigelfrank.com, or you can find me on LinkedIn ( https://bit.ly/2TORgSb )

About the job Does it really bother you when people mistake correlation for causality? Are you passionate about experimentation, with an insatiable appetite for learning, and curiosity to figure out the how and the why? Check this opening out 👀  Challengermode was founded in 2014 with the mission to make esports truly accessible. Today, we're running a platform that provides the fundamental online esports infrastructure to all the key stakeholders in the industry including players, organizers, and game developers.

About the job We are looking for an engineer with backend experience interested in quantitative modelling. You will be part of a small but growing team of data scientists and analytics engineers that specialise in the development of forecasting models and datasets to support the understanding of the Spotify Freemium business. As part of the job, you will drive the architecture of the forecast service to enable data scientists across the company to leverage our models and insights. This is an impactful role where you will be a key person influencing the direction of the technical architecture and roadmap of the team, which currently uses a combination of BigQuery, Scio (a Scala API for Apache Beam) and Python running on Google Cloud Platform.  What You'll Do   Who You Are   Where You'll Be   Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.  Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.    Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.

About the job We are Sinch. With presence in more than 55 countries, we're a growing global organization that helps amazing companies engage with customers on their mobile phones. And whether you know us or not, you've definitely used our tech. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year.  This is a chance for you to dream even bigger than ever. And because we believe that equal opportunities are the key to our success, no matter who you are, you'll be able to explore career options, face fascinating challenges, building your skills alongside amazing experts. It's not easy to reach every person, on every phone, on every channel, everywhere. Create the software that makes it happen. Join our team as a Senior Data Analyst based in either Stockholm or Malmö!  Bring your solid understanding of data visualization, preparation & analytics together with your tech knowledge and natural curiosity into play in this new role and be part of a pioneering data and analytics team bringing data, visualization and business insights to life in our commercial areas!  The department's key focus is to deliver timely insights through data from across the Sinch business, helping shape decision-making both for operational optimisation purposes and tactical or even strategical decision recommendations. The key partners of this role will be multifunctional in areas such as Marketing, Finance, Operations, Sales and Product.  This role will help both enrich our current data landscape and bring new data variables to life, but also enable important data development projects around the business to use data that will both increase accuracy in the models and speed up insights to action.          We're a worldwide group of people, committed to diversity. We're working to offer an increasingly inclusive workplace wherever you are. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore new career and growth options - sharing your voice, building your path and making it happen with us.  We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered to join our team regardless of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, and more.    Being a Sincher is all about learning and being in pursuit of new challenges. Working in the offices, at home, or in a hybrid model, that means celebrating change and the unknown, rolling up your sleeves and seeing what impact you can have on the world. The only way is up, and you'll be reaching for the opportunities that match where you want to take your career. It's closer than you think.

About the job TUI is well on its way to transforming our marketing to be highly relevant to each individual customer, driven by what we understand about their history and reacting to the events and behaviours of each customer.  Now is the perfect time to join the team as we embark on the next phase of our journey. We are moving to customer journeys, campaigns and activities that are highly personalised and automated by data and analytics in real-time.  Working within the Marketing Platform team you will operate as Senior Data Analyst to enable direct marketing through best practice data management and profiling techniques. You will provide key insights to inform our strategy for customer data capture and management for CRM marketing activity to ensure we maintain a consistent high level of data quality and grow the size of our contactable customer base.  At TUI, we never stop looking ahead, seeking new ways to delight our customers and grow our business. We recognise the power of digital and the massive contribution this brings to creating a truly unique and differentiated customer experience.             We want to be the best-loved holiday company not only for our customers, but for our colleagues too. That’s why we offer a variety of benefits that go above and beyond a competitive salary, so we can help you to live your best life happily at TUI. Click here to find out more.  We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA  If you require any further information regarding this opportunity, please email careers@tui.co.uk  We really value your interest in TUI and will be back in touch with you shortly after the application closing date.

About the job Vill du vidareutveckla din analyskompetens i nära samarbete med alla delar i Lendos organisation samtidigt som du får stor möjlighet att påverka och bidra till vår affär? Kom och bli vår nya kollega i rollen som Data Analyst i vårt strategiteam! Vi söker dig med analytisk förmåga, kommunikativa färdigheter, affärsförståelse och en vilja att dela insikter och sprida kunskap i organisationen. Sök tjänsten idag och bli en del av vår expansionsresa!  Vi har identifierat ett behov av att stärka vår förmåga inom dataanalys då vi ser att det har stora möjligheter att tillämpas och användas i flera olika delar av vår affär. Vi söker dig som vill vara med på den resan och har erfarenhet av att ha besvarat affärsmässiga utmaningar genom att fördjupa dig i stora mängder data samt att du på ett begripligt sätt kunnat förklara dessa till övriga delar av en verksamhet och har erfarenhet av att ha visualiserat dessa med hjälp av visualiseringsverktyg. Utöver detta är det meriterande att ha arbetat med prediktiv modellering och textanalys. På Lendo har vi mycket data som vi vill att du tar ett grepp om och agerar på tillsammans med olika avdelningar för att ytterligare utveckla Lendos produkt och affär. I rollen som Data Analyst har du flera kontaktytor och kommer att arbeta med kollegor inom områden som Data & Machine Learning, BI, Marknad, Produkt och Partnerskap, CRM och Kundservice. Du kommer att arbeta med såväl utmaningar kopplat till affären idag samt ingå i projektgrupper som arbetar tvärfunktionellt med större strategiska förändringar och initiativ. Din huvudsakliga uppgift är att ta fram agerbara insikter som skapar affärsvärde. Vidare kommer du också att delta i arbetet för strategiavdelningens fortsatta utveckling inom Lendo.  För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har en akademisk examen, gärna med inriktning mot statistik, ekonomi eller likvärdig ingenjörsutbildning. Vi söker dig med något eller ett par års erfarenhet av att jobba med dataanalys, med fördel inom branscher med stora datamängder och/eller kundbaser. Du är van att arbeta i SQL och har erfarenhet av exempelvis Python, R eller liknande verktyg och har mycket goda kunskaper inom Excel och Powerpoint. Vi ser att du är affärsmässig, analytiskt lagd och har god kommunikationsförmåga i skrift och tal. Som person lägger vi stor vikt vid att du är nyfiken, engagerad och driven. Du gillar fria ramar och ser inga problem med att självständigt sätta din struktur och ditt tillvägagångssätt. Genom ditt analytiska och strukturerade arbetssätt kan du växla mellan det övergripande strategiska perspektivet och detaljer i leveransen av dina analyser.  Lendo har under flera år byggt upp en stark position på den svenska fintechmarknaden och är idag Sveriges största jämförelsetjänst för lån. Lendo är en del av Schibstedkoncernen, vilket gör att vi kan kombinera snabbheten i ett mindre bolag med tryggheten och styrkan i en större koncern. Vår kultur kännetecknas av laganda, kund- och leveransfokus samt en vilja att ständigt förbättra oss själva och vår verksamhet. Strategiteamet består idag av tre engagerade individer med erfarenhet inom strategi, affärsutveckling och analys. Vi arbetar brett med samtliga delar i vår affär och har stor möjlighet att påverka vår framtida färdriktning som bolag. Det gör att vi får stora samarbetsytor inom Lendo som både är stimulerande och utmanande för oss. Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via denna annons. Urval och intervjuer kommer pågå löpande och tillsättning av tjänsten kan därför komma att ske innan sista ansökningsdag. Vi kommer att skicka ut en enkät via TrustCruit där vi mäter kandidatupplevelsen av rekryteringsprocessen - svara gärna på den! Har du frågor kring rollen är du välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterande chef Philip Hellqvist på philip.hellqvist@schibsted.com Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

About the job TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

About the job THIS IS US  TIER Mobility is Europe's leading shared micro-mobility provider, with a mission to Change Mobility for Good. By providing people with a range of shared, light electric vehicles, from e-scooters to e-bikes and e-mopeds, powered by a proprietary Energy Network, TIER helps cities reduce their dependence on cars. Founded in 2018 by Lawrence Leuschner, Matthias Laug and Julian Blessin.  TIER is headquartered in Berlin and currently operates in 190+ cities across 20 countries in Europe and the Middle East. With a focus on providing the safest, most equitable and most sustainable mobility solution, TIER has been climate neutral since 2020.    Thanks to our remote work policy, you can decide, whether you’d like to work from Hungary, Greece, Poland, Spain or Germany.    We are a diverse team of Data Engineers, Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists helping TIER advance in all things data. We are from 10 different nations and like to geek out on different data stacks and technologies. We strive to build great data infrastructure and enable teams across TIER to take data-informed decisions        We actively encourage a diverse and inclusive environment that fosters each employee’s individuality at TIER. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for your application, regardless to your nationality, ethnic or national origin, skin colour, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation or gender identity. Come as you are and join our ride!  In case you are living with disabilities, chronic illness or neurodiversity please inform us, to provide you with the proper assistance in the application process.  If we could spark your interest and you want to change mobility for good with us, apply now and let us know why you’re the one for the job! We encourage everyone to apply and grow with us. Even if you may not tick all the boxes of the requirements, we are happy to hear about the value you can add to the team. We are all learners!

About the job Working as part of a global team of analysts and data experts across TUI, the Data Analyst within our Marketing, Sales and Service (MSS) Business Intelligence team will be accountable for the design and development of the analytical solutions using a variety of technologies, and techniques, and working alongside IT, business and other data science colleagues. You will be deriving and maintaining the data requirements needed in transformation from source-market specific reporting to group reporting and be an evangelist for data management best-practices.  As a Data Analyst, you have a fantastic opportunity to shape our new reporting landscape within Marketing Sales and Service and work closely with experts across source markets and group to drive alignment between local and global reporting and a common business understanding of the data. You will need excellent communication and influencing skills to bring multiple and varied stakeholders together, as well as project management skills to handle dependencies and drive a timely delivery of data in line with the project roadmap.                       We want to be the best-loved holiday company not only for our customers, but for our colleagues too. That’s why we offer a variety of benefits that go above and beyond a competitive salary, so we can help you to live your best life happily at TUI. Click here to find out more.  We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA  If you require any further information regarding this opportunity, please email careers@tui.co.uk  We really value your interest in TUI and will be back in touch with you shortly after the application closing date.

About the job Rovio's Stockholm Studio is the studio behind the hugely popular Angry Birds 2, the bigger, badder and birdier sequel to the global phenomenon Angry Birds. The studio is dedicated to making the Angry Birds 2 game experience ever more exciting for players, developing continual improvements, as well as running world class live ops every day.  In addition to Angry Birds 2, Stockholm studio is actively developing new titles with the Angry Birds brand as well as new original IPs. Our approach is to focus on highly accessible yet innovative cores paired with Rovio's light-hearted aesthetic. At the same time, we still aim to deliver a deep meta that can keep players engaged for decades. Our development is driven by our players as we push to become masters of our genre. We use data to provide insights into our players' needs, and we always strive for improvement through continual iteration.  Our ambitious teams are full of passionate gamers who are eager to leave their mark.  Coming into this role, you will build an understanding of the game and different business levers and use that knowledge to build new game features, optimising existing ones, structure vague problem statements in collaboration with stakeholders such as product manager, designers, producers.  You will bring an objective perspective to all phases of decision making by leveraging strong technical skills to mine raw data for valuable information. Finally, we hope that you are a curious team player who is motivated and wants to have fun with data because at the end of the day we are a casual gaming studio, where we strive to have an environment that is fun and enjoyable while at the same time enables you to grow professionally.      Data is at the heart of everything we do at Rovio. It enables us to continually improve our games and provide incredible experiences for the millions of users who play our games every day. All of this data is only valuable if it can be used to guide our day to day operations. It is the job of Rovio data craft to turn that raw data into actionable insights for Rovio’s games teams and other business units. The data craft aims to empower Rovio’s teams with insightful data, and also with relevant tools and models that support decision making.

job_title: Customer Insight Analyst at SEB in Stockholm
job_description: About the job SEB is a leading financial services group, a large organisation with many areas in which one can accelerate, drive, or support our core business. Bring an entrepreneurial mindset, passion for learning, and a collaborative nature, and you will have the opportunity for a long and exciting career here. Does that sound like a fit for you?  Do you see the potential in data and want to gain insights with a true holistic view of SEB’s clients? Do you want to use data for deep dive analysis and to build statistical models? Then this is the right challenge for you.  My name is Magnus Klint, Head of Customer Insight Analytics at Customer Growth in C&PC. I am looking for a Customer Insight Analyst, who will be part of a team with other analysts.    In your role at Customer Insight Analytics, you will be part of a center of excellence working exploratory cross customer segments, product areas and distribution channels to enhance a more data driven and customer-oriented way of working.  As a Customer Insight Analyst, you will primarily work with increasing our understanding of customer behavior, needs and preferences. You will identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets through various, data-driven analysis.  You will co-operate with colleagues from other departments where you play an important role in the understanding of customer behavior and you will present, report and visualize your findings. You will also support internal stakeholders by working proactively to identify potential within different areas.    We are looking for you with a passion for business and a changing environment. We like you to challenge us, now and for the future.  To succeed as a Customer Insight Analyst, you need to have experience from analyzing data in SAS, R, Python, Spark, or similar. You are also used to work independently with predictive modelling, segmentation, clustering and data mining of large datasets. You have an academic degree (or equivalent) within the field of Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or similar, and a minimum of 3-5 years’ experience from working with quantitative analytics.  We think that you are used to hold presentations and interact with stakeholders, both orally and written, as good social and communication skills will be success factors when working with our cross-functional teams and presenting your findings to stakeholders with a non-analytical background. We appreciate that you are committed, skillful and a dedicated team player.  Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career  It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.      You are welcome with your application as soon as you can, but no later than 2022-09-01. We select candidates ongoing. If you have questions about the position, please contact Magnus Klint, Head of Customer Insight Analytics, magnus.klint @seb.se or Sanna Söderlind, Talent Acquisition Partner, sanna.soderlind @seb.se

About the job foodora is in constant growth and is always focusing on developing our business and industry alike. We are now looking for someone who loves to deep dive into large sets of data and create tangible analysis and actionable insights out of them. You most probably have a strong business acumen and have the ability to see the bigger picture. You are strong at visualizing how your day-by-day analytics can contribute and benefit the business and move us forward as a company. You will be a big part in fortifying us as a future-proof business. If you see yourself as a part of this journey, come join the quick commerce revolution at foodora as our next Data Analyst!

Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.  Our recruitment process will include the following:  💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.  💻 Digital HR interview - Let’s get to know each other a bit better!  💼 Case interview - Do your magic and meet us face to face.  💌 Reference check - Almost there!  ✔️ Background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.    We’re foodorians, a driven and happy gang of food lovers eager to create the LMD* service of the future! Our core values help concretize what we’re aiming for: . We’re people from all backgrounds, with different experiences, opinions and ideas. This is something we value highly, since we fully believe that diversity is what builds our culture and success.  Success is fun, but let’s be clear: it cannot happen at the expense of sustainability. Since January 2020 we’re a carbon neutral business and we hope to lead the way for sustainability within our industry - from supplying 100% electrical transportation to promoting more environmentally friendly food choices. Please check out our Instagram, foodorapeople.se, to see what’s going on right now.

job_title: Data Engineer to Analytics and Reporting at SEB in Stockholm
job_description: About the job SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?  Take a driving role in enabling data accessibility throughout one of the Nordic’s biggest banks as Data Engineer at SEB.  What you will be doing  Take the next step in your career and elevate our Big Data solutions! As Data Engineer at SEB in Stockholm, you build large-scale Big Data solutions, streaming and processing data to our Data Lake. Making data accessible is central to our business and solutions, and our work enables the delivery of our digital services to our customers. With us you make this possible, working with our modern tech stack and the Accounts and Payments data that is at the core of our business.  As Data Engineer you will:  Who we are looking for  We believe that you are a person who understand complex issues and challenges. You like to solve problems with a systematic but still innovative approach. This role includes close contact with your team and other stakeholders; therefore we believe that you are a person with great communication skills who likes to cooperate with others.    In this role you will be building Big Data solutions from scratch with modern techniques and tools and get a role where you contribute to our important work with Accounts and Payments data, being highly involved in decision-making and our technical road map.  What we offer  We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are  Learn more about working at SEB www.sebgroup.com/career is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. Ready to join?Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2022-03-31. If you have questions about the position please contact Delila Mauritzon, Team Manager Analytics & Reporting 2 at phone no 070-772 3039 or by mail delila.mauritzon @seb.se    sebgroup.com/techcareers

About the job Data & Analytics är ett centralt team som tillhör affärsområdet Digitalt. Vårt teams uppdrag är att driva förändring och skapa förutsättningar för att Tre och hallon ska bli mer datadrivna.  Om rollen  Som Data Analyst blir du en central spelare i vår resa att blir ännu mera datadrivna och det händer mycket på den fronten hos oss. Förutom att bidra med analytisk kompetens till hela organisationen driver vi ett antal större projekt. Ett av våra fokusområden är Marketing Data Analytics, där vi bygger nya förmågor kring att köpa media på ett mer sofistikerat sätt. Vi bedriver också projekt tillsammans med vår Network-organisation med syfte att använda nya datakällor och metoder för exempelvis prioritering av hur vi utvecklar vårt 5G-nät. Du kommer utöver ovan också vara delaktig i att definiera vår framtida data och analys-stack och vilka verktyg vi anser att hela organisationen behöver.  I din roll som Data Analyst arbetar du i projekt tillsammans med andra analytiker och stora delar av verksamheten där du har helhetsansvar för analys och att skapa förutsättningar för nya datadrivna arbetssätt. Det innebär bland annat att driva olika typer av projekt och fokusområden tillsammans med verksamheten, du ser möjligheter med appliceringar av prediktiva modeller i verksamheten.  Dina fem närmaste kollegor är smarta Treor som jobbar med olika verktyg inom analys, data mining, prediktiv modellering, textanalys och visualisering. Vi arbetar med verktyg så som SAS, R, SQL, Python och Google BigQuery. Andra avdelningar som vi har nära samarbeten med är bland annat BI-teamet, lojalitet, marknad, webanalys-teamet, kundtjänst och ledningsgrupper inom B2C, B2B och Hallon.      Du är van att gå ner på djupet och grotta i data, samtidigt som du har örat mot verksamheten och förstår affären. Du trivs i en roll att pedagogiskt hjälpa andra att förstå och tolka data samt presentera faktabaserade slutsatser.  Vi tror att du har en akademisk bakgrund och flera års erfarenhet av relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom analys. När det kommer till tekniska erfarenheter är du bekväm att arbeta i de system och tekniker vi använder. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av bolag med stora datamängder och kundbaser.    Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Tillsättning av tjänsten sker enligt överenskommelse. Vid frågor kontakta rekryterande chef Rikard Jakobsson.  Varmt välkommen till Tre!

About the job Senior Data Analyst - Talarian  We’re Talarian, the makers of YAMM, Form Publisher and Awesome Table. We’re a small, growing, and profitable software company that is building the future of spreadsheet-driven business applications.

About the job We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet  Who We Are  Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.  We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.  Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.    We are now looking for a Data Analyst with expertise in predictive and prescriptive analytics to join our Product department and to help drive innovation and decisions in our products.  As a Data Analyst, you will perform in-depth analysis and visualization datasets, to drive decisions with the Product Managers and Product Leads in the area that you will cover. You will play a key role by working closely with the business to identify the use cases, where external or internal data insights can make an impact and improve business decision-making. This is a unique opportunity to leverage academic and professional experience in publishing, statistics and data analytics to increase the quality of published science, maximize the efficiency of the publishing process and make peer-review more objective.          With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.  Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.      Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).    All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.    We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.    Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

About the job Paradox puts the player in focus and we need Data Scientists to do that. Do you want to join us on our journey?  We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Data, Analytics & BI department. As a member of the Analytics team you will work closely with the product/marketing teams to help them become truly data-driven. You will also support high impact business decisions by analyzing external and internal data and producing reports and visualizations.  On a day-to-day basis you will work with our digital marketing teams and support them with insights based on quantitative data generated by our users. You’ll function as the data specialist, proactively working with stakeholders to support business decisions and evangelizing a data-driven culture at Paradox.        If you think that this description matches your background, we highly encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we will interview candidates continuously for this position. In your application, please show us why your previous experiences and skills would work for this role and why you are interested in working at Paradox.  Since we strive for a diverse workplace, we highly encourage anyone, no matter who you are, to apply for this job if you think that you'd be able to come into this position if you think you’d be a great fit.        Paradox Interactive is a leading global publisher of PC-based strategy games. World-renowned for its strategy catalog, the company holds a particularly strong presence in the United States and Europe. We have offices in Stockholm and Umeå, Sweden. We work with renowned distributors world wide and are present on all major digital download portals. We share a passion for gaming and gamers and our goal is to provide deep and challenging games with hours of gameplay to our growing 2 000 000 + member community.

About the job Stora Enso has defined a clear vision and target state for HR modernization, and we have embarked on an exciting journey to make our vision a reality!  One step closer to reaching our goals is to find a People Data Analyst who will join our HR Modernization team. You will report to Analytics Lead. Location could be Finland, Sweden, Czech, Poland, Latvia, Lithuania or other Stora Enso main locations.    Part of the global bioeconomy, Stora Enso is a leading provider of renewable products in packaging, biomaterials, wooden construction and paper, and one of the largest private forest owners in the world. We believe that everything that is made from fossil-based materials today can be made from a tree tomorrow. Sustainability and responsible business practices are deeply embedded in our strategy.    The People organization plays a vital part in driving and supporting our strategy execution and business transformation. As our business success in the future will be highly dependent on our ability to develop, attract and retain our people, we need to ensure that we can provide an excellent employee experience for everyone working in the company.  We are currently on the way to implement Workday with scheduled go-live in January 2023. The project includes the following functionalities: Core, compensation, talent, performance and recruiting. On reporting and analytics, we will also use PRISM.  In the Workday People Data Analyst role, you will work with counterparts across Stora Enso HR and business organization. You will be part of a process to define reporting requirements and have the main responsibility to configure the reports according to defined business needs.  In the role you will have the following key responsibilities:     We believe that our employees are key to our success. We offer a total rewards package to engage our employees, including elements such as compensation, employee benefits, professional development, growth opportunities, recognition and wellbeing. Joining us, you will get to be a part of the journey Stora Enso is on – transforming from a traditional forest industry company, into a renewable materials growth company.  Stora Enso has defined a clear vision and target state for HR modernization, and with the full support of our Leadership Team we have embarked on an exciting journey to make our vision a reality! Target is to provide user friendly tools and service models designed for managers and employees; aiming to support people development, to simplify handling of HR actions and to provide easy access to information and analytics on the digital platforms for the future.    In order to succeed in this role, we see that you have a genuine interest in data and analytics and have strong analytical and data management skills. You are proactive and have self-motivated approach including passion to find and develop solutions with attention to details and ability to use critical thinking. You have the ability to consider report design and development from different persona point of views. You have the skills and willingness to share information and coach colleagues on Workday reporting topics. Your proficiency is based on a university degree or work experience in relatable positions, and we see it preferably if you have 1-2 years’ experience with Workday reports.  Our culture and work towards a more sustainable future is based on these themes which, we hope, will resonate with you as well:     We work with the recruitment process on an ongoing basis, so apply as soon as possible, but no later than August 31st, 2022. Due to the Summer holiday season we keep these job postings open for a longer period of time. With this we are now trying to catch the eye of those that is browsing the market and looking for new opportunities during their summer leave. Don’t be alarmed if you don’t hear back from us immediately, we are screening continuously.  Hiring manager, Johanna Kähkönen, johanna.kahkonen@storaenso.com, is happy to answer your questions about the open position.  Questions regarding the recruitment process can be directed to Recruitment Specialist Isabelle von Schalien, +46 70 276 81 94, Isabelle.von.schalien@storaenso.com.  We accept applications submitted through our recruitment system only.    To prepare yourself for our recruitment process, please explore the page provided: https://www.storaenso.com/en/careers/applying-for-a-job  Part of the global bioeconomy, Stora Enso is a leading provider of renewable products in packaging, biomaterials, wooden construction and paper, and one of the largest private forest owners in the world. We believe that everything that is made from fossil-based materials today can be made from a tree tomorrow. Stora Enso has approximately 22,000 employees and our sales in 2021 were EUR 10.2 billion. Stora Enso shares are listed on Nasdaq Helsinki Oy (STEAV, STERV) and Nasdaq Stockholm AB (STE A, STE R). In addition, the shares are traded in the USA as ADRs (SEOAY). storaenso.com/investors

About the job Do you want to be part of our exciting growth journey and help our customers optimise their promotion campaigns through our world class retail analytics platform?  We are currently hiring for the position as Data Engineer to join our growing team in our office in central Stockholm.

About the job WELCOME TO UTOPIA  Music is incredible. It can excite hundreds, and unite thousands. But as an industry, it has been slow, complicated, and disparate. While the tech world has moved into the future, the music industry continues to be shaped by inefficient systems of the past. At Utopia we believe there is a better way. Which is why today we are setting out to transform the entire industry; creating new revenue streams, consolidating the data and decluttering the admin. Unlocking the industry’s full potential by unifying it all in one truly holistic space. Some might call that a Utopia.  Funnily enough, so do we.    The open secret is that the music industry is struggling with the very basics of music accounting: What was played, when and where? Who should get paid and how much?  Utopia Music is bridging the data gap by connecting global consumption, accurate metadata, and fast payments to an industry-wide trust platform. Our goal is to unlock creative value and enable to make a better world for Music. The solutions we offer do not threaten to usurp the role of industry incumbents - it is about bringing transparency in the industry and supporting efficient royalty collection for all.    We are looking for data analysts who would like to join our team to deliver insights, recommendations and even new data products for the entire music industry. On our journey to deliver best-in-class services on a global scale, we want to leverage advanced analytics and a pure data-driven approach in all aspects of our business to go beyond solutions that are available today, and would love it if you’d like to join us on fulfilling that mission!                   As we want to bring transparency, trust, and clarity to the music industry we serve, we know a change comes from within. Utopia is a transparent, trust-based organization striving to have clarity in thinking and doing what we set out to do.  We execute urgently and innovate to grow faster. We ship things that make a difference today, so we can make them better tomorrow. We embrace fairness and are all accountable.  Strictly diverse and inclusive.  We celebrate our diverse backgrounds and we welcome everyone who identifies with the above to apply.  We’re eager to meet :)  Utopia Music is a Swiss Music fintech company through clear, transparent, and reliable data-based solutions. We support the whole Industry to make more money, faster, with less costs, and less errors.  In Utopia, the Industry sees market opportunities live. Investors elevate Music catalogs into a real asset class. Collection societies track more and spend less. Labels, publishers, and distributors simplify and enhance their business. And everyone gets Fair Pay for Every Play.  Utopia is serving the music copyrights and the industry from creation to consumption, and will never compete against it. It means that we will never own copyrights. We will never be owned by the major stakeholders of the industry. We will never share or sell data of our customers to anyone else.

We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.    Partner Development is a team of creative entrepreneurs that develop solutions for Agoda’s accommodation partners and promote Agoda’s top and bottom line growth. We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we roll out new product to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.    This role is designed to mainly growth opportunity identification among mid to long tail hotels, experiment execution and data tracking within Partner Development team for the global teams. You will get to work directly with the regional team to design and put in place global experimentation and initiatives to drive tangible impact in each market. About the job Job ID: 3086  We are looking for a Group Financial Crime Prevention (GFCP) Expert to join the Transaction Monitoring Source Data team to support us in further developing our monitoring capability and improving our data quality. This is an opportunity for you to be part of one of the most exciting and challenging efforts going on within Nordea on our journey to fight financial crime.  In today’s world, change is the one thing you can count on. But whatever the future brings, our customers remain at the heart of everything we do.  At Nordea, we’re committed to dinaymically fight against international financial crime by using the latest technologies and processes. You will play a part in building a better bank that fulfills a meaningful role in society. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. You’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.    You’ll join the Source Transaction Monitoring Data team within Transaction Monitoring Change Management. We add value by securing that our customers and Nordea will not be used in illegal ways that could harm them and as well harm our society where we act. As GFCP Expert you will play a valuable role in fighting against financial crime.  TM Change Management is part of Group Financial Crime Prevention (GFCP), which provides group-wide solutions to fight financial crime in Nordea. TM Change Management specifically develops, manages and optimises automated TM controls across all the financial services businesses that together comprise the Nordea Group.  The high focus on Financial Crime in the group gives the appointed candidate a unique and exciting opportunity to continue to build “best in class” TM control solutions and lay the foundations for the future.    Job location will be Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Tallinn, Estonia or Łódź, Poland. The position is likely to require some travel to other Nordea international sites. Welcome to our team where you can bring your talent and engagement to work in an international and dynamic environment.    Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the four key values that guide us in being at our best.      If this sounds like you, get in touch!    Submit your application no later than 18/10/2022. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Nadia Wilson. nadia.wilson@nordea.com  At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.  Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

About the job At Pleo we like to build. Like, a lot.  As is one of the fastest growing spend management SaaS in Europe, and we need you to help us launch Pleo to the next stratosphere.  How are we doing this?  Building out a world class Support Operations function to set people up for success in order to deliver great distribution experience across the end2end customer life-cycle which results in unlocking true growth potential & improving customer lifetime value.  Support Operations is a relatively new function in Pleo and is nestled under the Customer Support domain and its main objective is to ensure customer support effectiveness and efficiency.  We are looking for a data nerd to lead efforts in building reporting structures, optimising existing analytical solutions as well as creating new models and reports to enable our Customer Support team to take data-driven decisions about budgets, campaigns and channels.  You’ll be an individual contributor reporting to our Head of Operations, and will have a pivotal role on directly impacting our customer experience and smooth journey.  In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to make a real impact on the future of one of Europe’s fastest growing FinTech Unicorns. So if all of this has got you nodding your head and feeling excited, we’d love for you to click apply and make the introduction.        At Pleo, we use English for all our internal communication to keep everyone on the same page; please submit your application in English unless otherwise stated above.  We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs.  Not everyone interviews the same: if you have accessibility needs that you would like us to know about, send an email to our Inclusion team at belonging@pleo.io and we’ll make sure to design an interview format that works for you.  Why work here?  Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Through fintech we've seen a way to impact how people work; we think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Based on some pretty amazing Series C-round investment in 2021 we think we're onto something big.  So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 800+ team, from over 74 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal, or Lisbon offices – and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by sensible things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us we'll help you get up the best remote setup possible, and will fly you in for our amazing team camps ✈️  Things to look up about us  Sometimes, we win awards 🤩 🏆  If you want to know how we hire company-wide, there's a post on our blog.  Or have a sneak peek into what happens when get together for Pleo Team Camp on our YouTube 👈🏾  Check out what we think about the realities of working remotely on our blog.  No one says it quite like our customers. Hear what they have to say this week on Trustpilot.  Also, check out Glassdoor if you'd like to hear about us from other people.  PS. we treat all candidates equally: 🙂

About the job Välkommen att ansluta till ett erfaret och växande team med data scientists och konsulter som jobbar med att driva ökad effekt av marknadsföringen för några av Sveriges och världens största varumärken.  Som en del av den ledande mediebyråkoncernen GroupM arbetar vi på Acceleration med att omvandla stora datamängder till lösningar på komplexa problemställningar inom media och marknadsföring. Projekten inkluderar såväl machine learning, konsulttjänster och strategiprojekt som algoritmer och dashboards.  Acceleration driver GroupM och resten av industrin framåt genom innovation kring teknik och data och jobbar nära de största annonsörerna, publicisterna och teknikbolagen inom industrin. Detta är en position med en uppsjö av möjligheter till tillväxt både professionellt och personligt.    Tjänsten innefattar att i ett team med erfarna kollegor:     Vi är ett team präglat av hög nivå som tror på ständig utveckling och en entreprenöriell drivkraft.  Professionellt tror vi att du är nyutexaminerad alternativt arbetat ett antal år inom data science eller analys med följande kunskaper:   På ett personligt plan tror vi att du är intresserad av att:     Hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta med många av Sveriges och världens mest ambitiösa varumärken, tillsammans med ett team som brinner för digital marknadsföring, och med marknadsledande teknologier. Du kommer att sitta i centrala lokaler på Birger Jarlsgatan med inspirerande kollegor från olika bakgrunder, som tillsammans driver digital marknadsföring till nästa nivå genom innovation och gediget arbete. Vidare finns stora möjligheter för personlig utveckling och karriärsutveckling inom GroupM Sverige, såväl som inom vårt globala nätverk.    Vi är ett familjärt företag som är en del av WPP, en stor internationell koncern, och vi arbetar för att kombinera det bästa av dessa två världar. Du erbjuds att arbeta på en stimulerande och utvecklande arbetsplats med hög trivselfaktor och kollegor som har nära till skratt.  Förutom det självklara, som bra arbetsvillkor, trevlig arbetsmiljö och spännande utmaningar så finns det ett par saker som gör det lite extra bra att jobba här:     Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med tillträde efter sommaren. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning.  Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, så skicka så snart som möjligt in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev.    Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Andreas Nordfors (andreas.nordfors@acceleration.biz)Director Sweden, Acceleration. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via epost.    GroupM är en av Sveriges största mediebyrågrupper och består av Wavemaker, MediaCom, Mindshare och Acceleration. GroupM:s främsta mål är att skapa fördelar för våra kunder via samarbeten med gruppens byråer. Det gör vi bland annat genom skalfördelar inom trading, teknik och data. Vi är en del av WPP som är en av världens största koncerner inom marknadskommunikation med över 190 000 medarbetare på global basis. GroupM Sverige har cirka 350 medarbetare i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.

About the job About Agoda  Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.    The Agoda Content department is currently looking for a curious and questioning self-starter and proactive analyst, who will help drive decision making with insights from content, marketing and partner performance data.  You will get the opportunity to own analytical projects to direct our department’s focus, and prioritize our actions. By joining Agoda, you will become part of a truly international team, with leading experts of different backgrounds coming from 50+ countries around the world. This is a genuine opportunity to gain valuable experience in a challenging and cutting-edge tech environment. The ideal candidate would have a passion for high-converting content, great user-experience, data and analysis tools and methods.
