job_title: Data Analyst / Engineer to Nordax Bank
job_description: About the job Nordax Bank is a leading Nordic specialist bank that offers consumers private loans, savings, mortgages and mortgages for those aged 60+, capital release loans. Nordax has about 300,000 customers, mainly in Sweden, Norway and Finland.  Ever since Nordax was founded in 2003, the company has grown and formed an organization based on great know-how and commitment. Through responsible lending, we help people make well-thought-out choices for a life they can afford. Since January 2019, Nordax owns Svensk Hypotekspension AB and then added capital release credits to the product portfolio and during November 2021, the acquisition of Bank Norwegian was also completed. With the acquisition of Bank Norwegian, Nordax has doubled its size regarding its loan portfolio and will receive another product in the form of a credit card.    Our Data Engineering team is currently expanding, and we are currently looking for a Data Analyst / Engineer! You will be a part of IT and your stakeholders will be all over the organization. The team is currently in an expansion phase with new architecture under design. This is a great career opportunity for a data analyst or engineer to grow in front end, backend and design matters. You will also have possibility to influence new end to end data architecture and flows and designing data solutions from the start (On prem, Cloud and hybrid).       To thrive and succeed in the role you should be passionate about data, technical solutions, modern software development methodologies and learning new things related to data. You have an eye for details and are a driven person that has demonstrated “pulling up the sleeves” to reach your goals.     As a person you are result-orientated and you are an inclusive team player with a willingness to grow and develop. You have an ability to mentor other developers in all aspects of their engineering skillset. You are fluent in English and have excellent communication and presentation skills.          Please feel free to contact hiring manager Nina Alias at nina.alias@nordax.se if you have any specific questions about the role. If you have any question about the application or recruitment process, please contact recruiter Maria Moberg at maria.moberg@nordax.se. Due to GDPR, we are unable to handle applications sent to us by e-mail.      We will review applications continuously and the position may be filled before the application deadline, so make sure not to wait until the last day! The applications should include your CV, written in English or Swedish.  We believe in evidence-based tests in order to eliminate unconscious bias and increase hiring precision - the right person for the right position. For this reason, we use Alva Labs assessment methods for our recruitment processes to help us identify candidates with the greatest probability to succeed in this role.  We also want to inform you that we take UC (check payment remarks) and ask for an excerpt from the police criminal record for all positions at Nordax.      Nordax is one of the leading niche digital banks in Northern Europe that helps people make informed financial decisions for their well-being by acting as a strong alternative to traditional banks. We are proud of our sound and data-driven competence that allows us to lend responsibly and earn our customers’ trust based on transparent and clear pricing models. We are experts in mortgages, savings accounts, private loans and equity release products.

About the job Craft  Data, Analytics & Strategy  Job Description  We are looking for a Principal Data Scientist, interested in pushing the boundaries of games analytics with a proven ability to apply your skills, be it technical, behavioural or economic, practically in order to generate business value. You will both act as a senior mentor as well as an individual contributor.    You will be part of the In- app- purchases & Economy team in Candy Crush Saga, working closely with varied stakeholders in a fun, dynamic and fast- paced environment. You’ll possess the role of a subject matter expert in the data science area while helping us to further understand, model, predict and segment our players. While working closely with data scientists in the team, you will make sure and educate others on using up to date algorithms and technology.      Our ideal candidate will have solid experience leading an analytical team in a commercial environment. There is plenty of scope at King for you to learn from your colleagues in the areas where you have less experience, and to share your own skills where you are stronger.  Specific factors that are helpful to excel in this role include:      King is the game developer behind the world- famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top- grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.    Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.    Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!  Applications need to be in English.  Discover King at careers.king.com

About the job BCG Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

About the job Do you want to be part of our exciting growth journey and help our customers optimise their promotion campaigns through our world class retail analytics platform?  We are currently hiring an additional Data Scientist to join our growing team in our office in central Stockholm.

About the job Qualifications Degree in a computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics or engineering Business level fluency in the local language and English (verbal and written) mandatory Ability to write clean, maintainable, and robust code in Python Advanced knowledge of SQL required    As a data scientist at QuantumBlack, you will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organisations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.      While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies Python, PySpark, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, Kedro (an OSS developed by QuantumBlack), container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP or Azure, and more!    You will join our Copenhagen, Oslo or Stockholm office. As a data scientist at QuantumBlack, you will work with other data scientists, data engineers, designers and strategy consultants on interdisciplinary projects, using maths, statistics and machine learning to derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.  You'll work hands in hands with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives.

job_title: Lead Data Analyst for Customer domain @H&M Group
job_description: About the job Company Description  H&M Business Tech is established to take the lead in changing the fashion industry completely, combining business and technology with innovation to create new business and customer value. We want to release the power of people and believe the best ideas evolve when great minds with different perspectives meet. We believe in our people, and always encourage new ideas and initiatives… Are you up for a challenge? Do you continuously want to surprise and delight our customers?    The Lead / Data analyst role has a dual focus – staff responsibility and delivery. As a Competence Lead you will have staff responsibility for employees within the same/adjacent competence as your own, working in different product teams. Your staff responsibility goes across different Product Teams and tasks include competence specific conversations, salary review and other staff related activities. You will support, coach and help your team members grow and develop.  As a lead you will work with product managers, product owners, and other competence leads to secure the right competences and skillsets across the Data Analyst community. You will collaborate with stakeholders in other product teams/areas and enabling functions and build a broad network within Business Tech. You will be able to try out your creative and innovative ideas – and have a large impact on how we shape the future of fashion retail analytics.  As a Data Analyst you will work as a key enabler to secure realization of business and customer value from analytics, data and models in our products. You have a strong customer focus, a commercial mindset and innate curiosity. At H&M Business tech you will get the opportunity to work in a large data analyst community and in an organization, which heavily relies on making data driven decisions. We have over 1 billion customers with 130 million members in 70 different markets along with 8 unique brands in a fast-paced, ever-changing retail industry.    To be successful in this role we believe you are equally passionate about being a leader supporting, coaching and helping your team members grow while having a keen analytical ability with an eye for change and improvement opportunities.       Send us your application with CV. Last day of application is but we look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible.  For questions regarding the position please send an email to talent acquisition specialist shriti.shetty@hm.com

About the job Data Analyst for a leading non-bank provider of wealth management, corporate pension and insurance services across the Nordic region.  Do you want to develop in data analysis and Power BI in a role with a lot of personal responsibility?  Then become part of my clients growing team that develops the business area's Pension BI structure!  You will be working proactively to ensure that their customers live a safer and richer life tomorrow. Their purpose is to help people and companies make informed decisions on issues that affect their finances and lives.  The Business Intelligence team within the Pension Business Area has the task of supporting colleagues around the organisation with data, analyses and insights, so that the right decision can be made every month and every day. The team develops and manages data collection, data distribution and data presentation.  You will belong to a small but growing team that independently manages and further develops the company's BI infrastructure. You will provide analysis and reporting with the support of colleagues in the team, but also in close collaboration with both the management team and other business functions. This gives great self-determination and the opportunity to fundamentally influence the design of the solutions that are developed, but in return also requires a far-reaching responsibility for what is built and the ability to find pragmatic solutions to the problems that sometimes arise.  As a person , they are looking for some who enjoys working as part of a team, contributing to common ways of working and best-practice, but you also appreciate designing and developing solutions independently.  Some tasks that are part of the role      My client is looking to begin the interview process ASAP, so don't miss out, apply now!  This is just a brief description of the role, for the full information, simply apply to the role and I will call you to discuss.  LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/anna-jean-short/  Email: a.short@nigelfrank.com

About the job We are looking for speakers of several languages to join us in an innovative and interesting project to improve Artificial Intelligence and technology (i.e., speech or text recognition, input methods, keyboard/swipe technology, or other areas of human-machine interaction related to languages).  As a Language Data Analyst for the Artificial Intelligence Division, your main task will be to classify, sort, label, and annotate data.

About the job Som en av dagligvarubranschens största aktörer gör vi inom Axfood stor skillnad i miljontals människors liv – varje dag. Tillsammans vill vi skapa mer livskvalitet för alla vi berör genom våra olika koncept, verksamheter och varumärken. Vi tror på ständig förbättring och utveckling, och på att visa omtanke till omvärlden medan vi förändras. Var med på en resa i en spännande bransch där nytänkande, engagemang och prisvärd, bra och hållbar mat är viktiga ingredienser. Välkommen till Axfoodfamiljen!    Dagligvaruhandeln är inne i en transformation som gör den till en av de mest spännande branscherna just nu. Är du övertygad om att data som genereras av miljontals kunder varje dag kan förändra en verksamhet i grunden och vill du få en möjlighet att kombinera din analytiska förmåga med ditt kommersiella driv? Då vill vi ha med dig på resan!  Med vår unika tillgång till medlemsdata från ett av Sveriges största och snabbast växande kundprogram och vår e-handel - som når fler hushåll än någon annan i branschen - kan vi inspirera, belöna och förenkla vardagen för miljontals människor.  Du kommer ingå i ett litet tight team med flera andra data scientist där vi genom nära samarbete skapar stora resultat. Avdelningen driver Axfoodkoncernens utveckling av e-handel, avancerad analys, kundprogram, digital marknadsföring i nära samarbete med andra delar av koncernen. Dina kollegor är affärsutvecklare, data scientists, e-handelsspecialister, etablerare, affärsanalytiker och många fler.    Som data scientist är du drivande i att ta fram de bästa analytiska modellerna för varje utmaning du ställs inför. Oftast är vår rekommendationsmotor en central del av lösningen så en viktig del av ditt uppdrag är att tillsammans med teamet ständigt utveckla, utmana och trimma den för att göra Axfood ledande inom personifiering. Utöver det kommer du bland annat att jobba med att motverka kundbortfall (churn), segmentera kunder på alla möjliga ledder och skapa relevanta digitala kundresor.  Vi arbetar med rena och välstrukturerade data i en modern molnbaserad miljö och dina arbetsverktyg består i huvudsak av Python, SQL, AWS SageMaker och Airflow. Avancerad analys är ett prioriterat område för hela koncernen och som data scientist är du en viktig del i vår analys-community där vi i olika forum tillsammans med koncernens alla olika analytiker och data scientists delar kunskaper, erfarenheter och inspiration.  Axfood är i ständig utveckling och arbetar medvetet och långsiktigt tillsammans med dig för att du ska utveckla din kompetens. För rätt person finns stora möjligheter att utvecklas hos Axfood!      och/eller insikter från data  och förklara modellresultat och utvärderingar av pågående experiment på ett begripligt sätt  Om du vill veta mer om vad tjänsten innebär, kontakta David Hamilton, 0731-522375/david.hamilton@axfood.se. Vi ser gärna att du vid intresse skickar din ansökan så snart som möjligt, då tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag den 2022-07-01. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via våra jobbsidor.    Hos oss finns trygghet och stora utvecklingsmöjligheter. Våra medarbetares olika kunskaper, kompetenser och perspektiv skapar nya möjligheter och genererar bättre beslut. Vi uppmuntrar därför en mångfald av sökande till alla våra tjänster och eftersträvar att spegla våra kunder. Hos oss har vi ett öppet klimat där alla har möjlighet att utvecklas. Att vi växer och utvecklas tillsammans gör att vi kan leda vägen och utmana en hel bransch. Välkommen till en familj av möjligheter!    Axfood grundades år 2000. Koncernen består av en familj av varumärken och är unik i sitt slag på den svenska marknaden.  Inom Axfood tror vi på att allas rätt till prisvärd, bra och hållbar mat. Här ingår butikskedjorna Willys och Hemköp, liksom Tempo och Handlar´n. Grossistförsäljning sker genom Snabbgross och Dagab ansvarar för koncernens produktutveckling, inlöp och logistik. I Axfood ingår även Middagsfrid och Urban Deli samt delägda Apohem, Eurocash, City Gross och Mathem.

About the job WHO WE ARE Netlight is the leading, and award-winning, IT consultancy in providing premium quality consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry. To unleash the potential of the world’s most prominent digital companies, we take responsibility for world-class knowledge sharing to make sure each Netlighter has all of Netlight’s combined knowledge available (close to 2000 Netlighters across Europe). To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, equality, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.

About the job BI Consultant- Fully Remote  I am looking to fill BI/data consultant positions in Sweden! The role is for a fast-growing company with exciting projects, using the latest technologies! Voted one of Europe's best places to work, the company offers its employees an amazing culture with a wide range of benefits.  In this role you will get to work on a number of projects in a variety of industries with a group of consultants who you can grow with and learn from.  Requirements and responsibilities for the role:   * Building dashboards and visualisations: Qlik* or Power BI*   This has been voted one of Europe's best places to work 2 years in a row so offers an excellent culture as well as a competitive salary. They also give their consultants the opportunity to complete certifications!  If you think this role would suit your skillset and would be interesting to you, please get in touch!  email: a.taylor@nigelfrank.co

About the job Business/Data Analyst for one of Sweden's fastest growing Fintech companies  Do you want to further develop your analysis skills in close collaboration with the internal organization, while at the same time giving you a great opportunity to influence and contribute to the business? Then I have a role for you.  They are looking for someone with analytical ability, communication skills, business understanding and a willingness to share insights and spread knowledge in the organization.  Responsibilities for the role:  They have identified a need to strengthen our ability in data analysis as they see that it has great opportunities to be applied and used in several different parts of their business. They are looking for someone who wants to be part of that journey and have experience of having answered business challenges by immersing yourself in large amounts of data and that you have in an understandable way been able to explain these to other parts of a business and have experience of having visualized these using visualization tools. In addition to this, it is an advantage to have worked with predictive modelling and text analysis.  In this role you will work with both challenges related to the business today and be part of project groups that work cross-functionally with major strategic changes and initiatives. Your main task is to develop actionable insights that create business value.  Requirements for the role:  To succeed in the role, they see that you have an academic degree, preferably with a focus on statistics, economics or equivalent engineering education. We would like you to have relevant experience of working with data analysis, with advantage in industries with large amounts of data and / or customer bases. You are used to working in SQL and have experience of, for example, Python, R or similar tools and have very good knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint. They see that you are business-like, analytical and have good communication skills in writing and speaking.  As a person, we attach great importance to you being curious, committed and driven. You like free frames and see no problem with independently setting your structure and your approach. Through your analytical and structured approach, you can switch between the overall strategic perspective and details in the delivery of your analyses.  If this sounds like something you would be interested in, call or email me to find out more!  Email: a.short@nigelfrank.com  Call: +46 8 502 425 47

About the job Do you want to help us unleash the secret to how happy employees create a happy business? We are an innovative, agile and continuously growing modern tech company on a path to improve the work lives of millions around the world.  We develop workforce management solutions - a software that makes scheduling and time reporting more smooth and flexible for almost a million users across the world!

About the job With great focus on customer satisfaction, we are a group of committed employees who help private customers to better finances. As colleagues, we are a group of friends who share the hunger for constant development and the pursuit of becoming the Nordic region's largest loan broker. We are more than just a workplace and place great emphasis on corporate culture, cohesion and community.

About the job Kambi is searching for a motivated self-starter to join our Data Science Team. For the right candidate, the position will provide the opportunity to research and develop the best-of-breed solution supporting our B2B Sportsbook operations. The candidate will join a team based in central Stockholm, working as an agile software engineer and quantitative researcher, to build and refine Kambi's BI solutions.      The position reports to the Data Science Manager.          If you want to be part of a very dedicated team in central Stockholm please apply below. Since we will be interviewing candidates continuously send your application as soon as possible.  #wearekambi    Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.  Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.  With offices in Malta (HQ), Bucharest, London, Manila, Sydney, Uppsala and Stockholm and together with over 1000 passionate and highly skilled people; Kambi live and breathe sports betting. It is in everything we do. From delivering a premium service to our operators, to creating an entertaining experience for the end user; we are unwavering in our mission to create the worlds’ leading sports betting experience.

About the job At Gimi, we believe that Financial Superskills are essential in a modern cashless society and that kids should learn early-on how to earn, save and spend their own money. Our reward winning app combines hands-on money management tools with digital lessons based on the latest research within digital didactics.  Welcome to Gimi  We are here to make a difference, to empower kids with the necessary knowledge to make sound financial decisions now and in the future.  Background  Gimi is on a mission to Educate 10M children in personal finance by 2025. Our app has over 1M downloads and is used by tens of thousand parents and children each month. Gimi is looking for a full-time Data Analyst that can help us drive data-informed decision making across the business. You’ll join and be part of starting up our analytics team, reporting to our Head of Data analytics.  The core of the role will be to working with our product team. You will use insights and analysis to guide product decision making, and help the team create a great financial education experience that parents and children love to use. Work includes improving retention and adoption of features, creating a better understanding of how parent and children manage money, and evaluating the learning impact of different features.  In addition, expect to support other teams with their analytics needs, such as management, marketing and sales teams.  The role is hands-on, expect to write SQL, build reports/dashboards in Mixpanel, and perform validation data quality as part of your tasks.        Nice to haves   Some facts about Gimi   Does this sound like you or someone you know? Apply or drop a line to Andreas, Head of Analytics, at andreas@gimitheapp.com with a link to your linkedIn profile or CV.

About the job HAYPP GROUP  We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.  Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in 9 countries where we serve more than 300 000 active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches as well as Swedish style snus online. With our headquarters located on Birger Jarlsgatan in Stockholm we are 140 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.  If you are interested in hearing more, watch our CEO Gavin O’Dowd explaining more about Haypp Group here: Haypp Group - A Brief Introduction    As Data Analyst at Haypp Group, you will join a strong and well versed team of sixteen incredibly talented individuals and focus on generating actionable insights to make sure we become more and more data driven by the day. The team you will join is called Haypp Lab which is our insights & analytics division, working with everything from market research to machine learning and data engineering.  By joining us, you'll work hand in hand with our Data Engineers and a Data Scientist defining and integrating new KPIs and prediction models that will enrich Haypp Group’s database. You'll then gather this data and enrich it with customer surveys, product tests, etc. to come up with comprehensive analyses/visualizations that will drive key business decisions. These decisions will be both internal - suggesting improvements in all business areas such as Marketing, Logistics or Finance etc. - and external - helping manufacturers develop stronger portfolios and make wise investments.  Some of your daily challenges will include the following:     We are looking for a driven and proactive team player who is not afraid to leave their comfort zone to learn and grow.  Successful candidates also meets the following requirements:     We are a values driven company with our values , , and at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.  Because we recognise that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:     We hope that you are enjoying summer vacations as much as we are. As we are taking a short break, our response on your application will be somewhat delayed. Talk more in August! About the job Data Specialist | Power BI | ML/AI | Financial Services  This company helps people and businesses make informed decisions on financial and insurance questions, and now they're further expanding their data team with a Data Specialist to help them on this journey. The Business Intelligence team's mission is to support colleagues with all things data: databases, advanced analytics and insights, therefor making the right decisions. They do this with a mix of Data Engineers, Data Analysts and BI Developers. They develop and manage the central infrastructure for data collection, distribution and presentation; the platform is a cornerstone of the business and what they've achieved on a data and development level - it is crucial for the data-driven culture that they are cultivating.  As the Data Specialist you will have the opportunity to fundamentally influence the design of the advanced analytics and the reach this has across the business.  You will do this by working in a team and contributing to the best-practice, designing and developing solutions independently, and since this is a fairly new team, there is plenty of opportunity to put your stamp on this way of working. An 'anything is possible' attitude is highly desired so you can be involved in decision-making and taking steps to ensure group's mission to be data-driven is achievable.  They're a Microsoft partner and therefore allow you to work closely with Microsoft,  Main responsibilities include:   Requirements for the position:   Data is at the very core of what they do, so if you're passionate about data-driven decisions within the financial market and seeing how data can improve businesses from the inside-out, then this is the place for you.  What else can they offer you?   Does this sound like a good fit to your experience and a potentially interesting next step for you? Then apply to this advert and we can schedule in a chat to go into even further depth of how this company is making a difference. Responsibilities:   Requirements:   You will be immersed into a great company culture where management wants to hear your opinions and how you want to work, which is reflected in the team and the work flow. You have trust from day one that is fed down from the CEO meaning you are never micro-managed and have a high level of responsibility for decision making.  The company itself have the financial strength of an enterprise company but have the same successful leadership team from when they first started, meaning they still have that close-knit start-up feel - but with genuine structure. About the job Business/Data Analyst for one of Sweden's fastest growing Fintech companies  Do you want to further develop your analysis skills in close collaboration with the internal organization, while at the same time giving you a great opportunity to influence and contribute to the business? Then I have a role for you.  They are looking for someone with analytical ability, communication skills, business understanding and a willingness to share insights and spread knowledge in the organization.  Your new role  They have identified a need to strengthen our ability in data analysis as they see that it has great opportunities to be applied and used in several different parts of their business. They are looking for someone who wants to be part of that journey and have experience of having answered business challenges by immersing yourself in large amounts of data and that you have in an understandable way been able to explain these to other parts of a business and have experience of having visualized these using visualization tools. In addition to this, it is an advantage to have worked with predictive modelling and text analysis.  In this role you will work with both challenges related to the business today and be part of project groups that work cross-functionally with major strategic changes and initiatives. Your main task is to develop actionable insights that create business value.  Your background  To succeed in the role, they see that you have an academic degree, preferably with a focus on statistics, economics or equivalent engineering education. We would like you to have relevant experience of working with data analysis, with advantage in industries with large amounts of data and / or customer bases. You are used to working in SQL and have experience of, for example, Python, R or similar tools and have very good knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint. They see that you are business-like, analytical and have good communication skills in writing and speaking.  As a person, we attach great importance to you being curious, committed and driven. You like free frames and see no problem with independently setting your structure and your approach. Through your analytical and structured approach, you can switch between the overall strategic perspective and details in the delivery of your analyses.  If this sounds like something you would be interested in, call or email me to find out more!  Email: a.taylor@nigelfrank.com  Call: +46 10 138 92 10

Our main goal is to empower people, and to reduce the amount of energy being used unnecessarily all around the globe – with the help of cool fancy tech. Good for our customers, their wallets, and the planet.

job_title: Data Engineer, Common Data Warehouse - Marketplaces
job_description: About the job We (Analytical Foundation) are designing and building a Common Data Warehouse to serve the Common Analytical Model to Schibsted’s 45+ brands. We want our users to be able to share, discover and leverage analytical data in a standardised yet autonomous fashion realising our vision:  “Enable all the people in Schibsted to leverage any data in Schibsted”  The CDW Marketplace Teams main focus is to enable user friendly data to Schibsted brands like blocket.se, bilbasen.dk, dba.dk, finn.no, tori.fi and our pan nordic organisation. This, to enable the consumers in the nordics to exchange goods, find jobs and housing in a sustainable, safe and efficient way.  Our users vary, from Data Scientists, Data Analysts and BI Developers to Business Controllers, Product Managers and Corporate management. In short, any person in Schibsted is potentially our customer.  We aim to serve the data we engineer, model and visualise as products. We retrieve our brands data; clean, process and model it for them in a common context to optimise for value capture, both for the business and our users and customers.  Since our responsibilities span over 4 countries and about 10 brands, striving for common ground and scalable approaches will be of grave importance. But also being able to collaborate with people with other roles and responsibilities than yours will be a developing challenge.  We offer you to work with many loved and well-known brands, modern technologies, an open and inclusive culture and many opportunities to develop and learn new things.            You make sure data you manage creates value - a holistic perspective on the whole data value chain.  You can be decisive and experiment your way towards a good enough solution  You aim to create transparency and understanding of how data changes shape and transforms to give every data consumer the best possible conditions to succeed in their job.    Hi, my name is Lukas and I’m your new manager. I have about 15 years of experience from the Data & Analytics field, early on as a Data Analyst and later as a Data & Analytics leader. I’ve been managing different teams in the data and analytics field over the past 8 years.  I believe in building a strong team culture with rituals that create belonging and team spirit, with a high level of feedback culture. The importance of an environment where everyone can feel safe and comfortable and anyone can thrive.  Privately I love to spend a lot of time with my family, preferably in our summer house in the Finnish archipelago or in the mountains snowboarding and skiing. I do spend a lot of time in the gym to keep my body strong and sound to keep on doing what I love, skateboarding and snowboarding. I do pick up my guitar every now and then and love to watch 80’s movies.

About the job Qualifications Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus 2+ years of post-university experience in technology- and strategy-related roles in a professional services, blue-chip, industry or start up environment    You will work with C-suite executives problem-solve on their key issues and provide actionable recommendations leveraging your technology know-how and business sense.  You will play an active role in all aspects of a client project, typically working in teams of 3 to 5 consultants alongside experts and partners of all tenures, including developers, designers, data engineers, agile coaches and others. Your responsibilities will include gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. You will also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.  You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on your teams. This support includes a partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career as well as more formal training in your first few years. Additionally, you’ll receive guidance and support from your local office and practice in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.  Your role as Analytics Consultant with McKinsey Digital differs from our regular consultant position in that you will be taking a hybrid role of both a management consultant and a data scientist. This will signify working on projects focused on analytics and leveraging programming to conduct more advanced analyses.    You will be based in our Stockholm office as part of our McKinsey Digital practice.  Digital McKinsey brings together the best of McKinsey’s digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses. As part of this group, you’ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and digital strategy to cloud, advanced analytics and digital business building.  You’ll have the opportunity to work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm, but have a focus on our more advanced projects in terms of analytics and digitalization. You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company, frequently in teams together with our data scientists and data engineers, to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, primarily on technology topics but also non-technology topics.  Our office culture is casual, fun and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.

Bolaget arbetar med många olika typer av kunder vilket ger möjlighet till uppdrag i många olika branscher och områden. Vilket uppdrag du är på kommer så klart påverka vilka verktyg du kommer hantera. Sannolikt sitter du mycket i SQL och kommer få bredda din kompetens inom BI-verktyg så som Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, etc. Om du vill vara del av ett litet, familjärt bolag med variationen som en konsultroll erbjuder, men samtidigt med en hög grad av kontroll över vilka uppdrag du kommer ta dig an, är detta platsen för dig! About the job What We Do At Detectify  The fear of cyber threats should never stand in the way of digital greatness. That is why we are changing the fundamentals of how cyber security works. We collaborate with ethical hackers to build a powerful platform that automates and scales crowdsourced vulnerability research.  For us, security is not just about protecting what you have but more so a tool to achieve what you want. At Detectify, your opinion and ideas matter. You belong to a dedicated, driven and forever curious team that recognises the power of knowledge sharing and challenging the status quo.  We value diversity of minds, different backgrounds, and perspectives. We are all here because we want to make a positive impact in the world. If you are collaborative and passionate about what you do, then you too could be a Detectifyer.    As a Data Analyst at Detectify, your mission will be to understand and turn information into valuable insights that can help make better business decisions. You will work together with a product manager, designers and engineers in a cross-functional product team specialized at solving customer needs in a specific area, and you will promote a data driven mindset throughout that journey.    In engineering we strive to create an enabling, empowered culture where you have the ability to make use of all your skills and personality. A fun and engaging environment where we can have unfiltered and passionate discussions to learn and grow together. A highly diverse culture allowing all genders, preferences, personalities and backgrounds to thrive.  You will sit together with one of our cross-functional teams within the Attack Surface Discovery product area. Their mission is to help our customers discover their externally exposed attack surface and what assets, technologies and ports they are exposing to the internet that could be open for hacker attacks.  You will also be part of the Data team, which works horizontally throughout the company to promote a data-driven culture and its mission is to enable other teams by providing access to information and recommendations to promote impactful decisions. You will be supported by the central data team with data engineering and data science if the need arises, and you are also expected to share your insights with the data team and take part in shaping the data organization to better adapt to the needs of product teams across the company.    As a Data Analyst in one of our product teams, you will have the responsibility to foster a data-driven approach to the development of our product.  Together with the product manager and product designer, you will be responsible for:   You will build and maintain metrics and dashboards in Looker. You will also build and maintain data models in production using SQL and perform data analysis with Python (using packages such as Pandas, NumPy, etc.).    You are a creative person who sets and achieves goals in a collaborative and stimulating environment and you evaluate and reflect on your own solutions, as well as actively seeking constructive feedback to improve your skills. As a person, you embrace bi-directional feedback and share the mentality that collaboration is important to achieve high quality team output. Furthermore, you have great communication skills and you are comfortable explaining complex methods and results to both technical and non-technical audiences.     If you wish to be a part of this innovative, problem-solving tech team helping other developers to build a more secure internet, send us your contact details through the application below and we'll take it from there. This is going to be fun!    This position is for the Stockholm office. We offer remote working, with access to our office in central Stockholm. We think you should be able to work from anywhere but for tax reasons we need you to be located in Sweden, and we are more than happy to help you relocate.

About the job Kambi Sweden is looking for a team-oriented Data Engineer with a love of learning new things. The team is located in central Stockholm with responsibility for the continuous extract, load, transform and integration of data from various sources and provide pipelines for data scientists, analytics and our customers. They also work on business intelligence, and are a focal point for supplying data in a presentable format.  In order to thrive, you need to be a true team player, with the ability to learn quickly and adapt to new situations. You are humble enough to learn from and listen to your colleagues and enjoy sharing your knowledge. A strong sense of team spirit , engagement and lots of laughs characterizes the team today !  Whilst this team is very collaborative and cross-functional, the ambition of the team is to be self-organizing, so every member is expected to contribute and be open to try new ways of working and improving the team’s methods.  The team offers a lot of independence, freedom and autonomy to be creative with how you solve problems.                      If you are interested to be part of a dedicated team in central Stockholm, apply now.    Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.  Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.  With offices in Malta (HQ), Bucharest, London, Manila, Sydney, Uppsala and Stockholm and together with over 1000 passionate and highly skilled people; Kambi live and breathe sports betting. It is in everything we do. From delivering a premium service to our operators, to creating an entertaining experience for the end user; we are unwavering in our mission to create the worlds’ leading sports betting experience.

About the job Beskrivning av uppdraget  Vill du vara med och skapa möjlighet att fatta datadrivna beslut som i slutändan ger de 1 miljon människor som reser i Stockholms lokaltrafik varje dag en bättre resa?  Kika då vidare på detta uppdrag!  Vi söker en Produktägare till vår kunds agila team inom Data Analysområdet.  De utvecklar en ny informations- och dataplattform enligt en Big Data-arkitektur (Lake House), som innefattar en data lake lösning i AWS Inledningsvis kommer du jobba med Lakelösningen för inläsning och lagring av data samt möjliggöra self-service konsumtion av data. Men även andra tjänster och produkter inom området kan komma att ingå i ditt uppdrag.  Det finns ett flertal produkter och tjänster inom information och data där du samspelar med andra produktägare för vidareutveckla tjänster och förmågor.  Som produktägare för ditt team samarbetar du tätt med de övriga produktägarna och med övriga intressenter. Det är därför viktigt att du är strukturerad, kommunikativ och har mycket god samarbetsförmåga. Du lyssnar in och kan anpassa ditt agerande utifrån behov. Vidare har du erfarenhet från roller där du haft flera intressenter som behöver enas, och du bör vara van att leda dialoger och workshops. Du har även erfarenhet av att använda verktyg för planering, exempelvis JIRA.  Hos vår kudn sker förändring och anpassning till nya krav och behov löpande, och konsulten på denna roll ska också kunna bidra till organisatorisk utveckling.      Som produktägare samarbetar du med intressenter för hela kedjan från vision till sub-task på teamets tavla. Du är ledande i arbetet med att definiera MVP-er i tidiga steg, förmedla dess värde, samt ta fram en roadmap och driva det strategiska utvecklingsarbetet för de produkter och tjänster som ingår i ansvarsområdet. I en tät dialog med intressenter och team jobbar du med att specificera, bryta ner och prioritera teamets backlogg för att maximera värdet av teamets arbete.  Du kommunicerar transparent kring teamets fokus och progress och följer upp att ni har helhetsbilden i sikte.    Som en naturlig del i arbetet hanterar du budget för teamet. Du följer upp och uppdaterar utvecklingsbudget utifrån pågående arbete, samt attesterar fakturor. Du upprättar också underlag för produktens fortsatta utveckling. I arbetet får du bland annat stöttning av sektionens controller.  I ditt arbete ingår att hjälpa till att estimera framtida leveranser till stöd för beslut, samt upprätta preliminära hållpunkter för utvecklingen.    Vår kund har är en ung organisation, med stora möjligheter till utveckling. I samarbete med andra produktägare, scrum masters och ledningen förväntas produktägaren vid sidan av arbetet med teamet att verka för förbättringsarbete inom sektionen.  De applicerar ett agilt tankesätt och agila metodiker i det de gör.  Även arbete med andra produkter/team kan förekomma inom ramen för uppdraget.  Uppdraget kan utföras både på distans och på plats på kontoret på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Dagar och tider för detta styrs efter behov i detagila teamet.  Uppdragets omfattning i timmar per vecka är 40h.       2022-09-01  2023-09-01  1+1+1+1 år.    S      .

About the job At ConsenSys we have a vision of a world where data sovereignty and financial well-being is accessible to every person and organization. We believe Ethereum and decentralized protocol technology is a more trustworthy and equitable foundation for how we create and share value across the web. On this trusted, open source foundation, we can accelerate the world’s transition to a universally accessible network of distributed participants where transparency, security and freedom are fundamental.

About the job About Sileon Sileon’s mission is to create trust between sellers and buyers, and we do this by making it possible to Buy Now and Pay Later.  Sileon is a BNPL (Buy Now Pay Later) SaaS company that enables the financial industry as well as enterprise merchants to compete in a growing and evolving international BNPL market. The company offers fast-to-market and world-class technical BNPL functionality to banks, fintech, and large merchants.  Sileon is listed on the Nordic Growth Market and is an FSA-approved Payment institution. Since 2020 the company has been led by CEO David Larsson, and the office, with around 50 employees, is located on Söder Mälarstrand in Stockholm.  Analytics is an exciting and growing area within Sileon, and they are now strengthening their Analytics team with an Analytics Analyst. The growing team consists of talented data professionals shaping and transforming how Sileon utilize Data & Analytics to create value and improve decision making at all levels of the organization. As part of the analytics team, you will collaborate with management, finance, product, and pretty much all parts of the organization to drive analytics initiatives and business improvement.  As a tech company, leveraging Data & Analytics for process improvement and business development is a key driver for success. As part of the Analytics team, you will be part of developing our Analytics platform while raising data literacy in the organization and championing the data culture we are fostering within the organization.    In the role as Analytics Analyst, you will tackle data challenges within both data engineering and business intelligence. Preferably, you have an engineering degree and a few years’ experience within the Analytics field. You know your way around data modelling in SQL and developing BI reporting using visualization tools. Above all else you are a person who wants to learn and develop yourself within the broader Analytics area. Sileon is using a mix of technologies that includes Tableau, Metabase, Airflow, Pentaho, C#, Redshift, S3, MS SQL, PostgreSQL and they are taking steps towards moving the last on-prem pieces of their Analytics platform to the cloud.    To succeed in this role, you are an ambitious and motivated problem solver that is passionate about your job and personal development. You are a team player who enjoys working in smaller entrepreneurial companies where processes and boundaries are not always defined.  Sileon are a growing fintech company with motivated colleagues that are passionate about their work. They believe in the personal development of their colleagues and teaming, you will be supported by your team members in all of these endeavours.  Start: As soon as possible or by agreement Extent: This is a full-time position Location: Stockholm Salary: Fixed, monthly by agreement

About the job Craft  Job Description:  Job Description  Candy Crush Saga is one of the biggest games in the world, entertaining millions of players every day, and we are looking for people who are as excited as we are about making it even bigger and better. Working in a talented cross- functional team, you will play a key role in the development of Dashboards, tools and analytical products to deliver insight and business information.  We’re looking for a Data Visualization Engineer to help us deliver groundbreaking new Dashboards and tools and support our suite of artisan built products and front end tools. If you’re excited by pushing the boundaries of visualization in business intelligence and reporting then this is the role for you!  We are a complete end to end Data Warehouse team given autonomy to design and build products to help our business users understand and make decisions on our high volume data.          King is the game developer behind the world- famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top- grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.    Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.    Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!  Applications need to be in English.  Discover King at careers.king.com

job_title: Analytiker till avdelningen Data- och verksamhetsutveckling
job_description: About the job Vill du vara med och bidra till Finansinspektionens (FI:s) förändringsresa mot en mer digital och datadriven myndighet? Då kan det här vara jobbet för dig.  Om jobbet  Avdelningen för Data- och verksamhetsutveckling har ett övergripande ansvarar för att leda och samordna myndighetens data- och digitaliseringsfrågor och arbetar i hög utsträckning med utvecklande effektiviserande förändringsaktiviteter. Avdelningen arbetar kontinuerligt med införande av ny rapportering till följd av förändrade nationella och internationella regelverk.  Som analytiker på avdelningen Data- och verksamhetsutveckling är du delaktig i hela flödet från granskning av inrapporterad data från våra finansiella institut, kontakter med bolag såväl som andra myndigheter till utrapportering och visualisering av data.  Arbetet som analytiker innebär ett nära samarbete med övriga verksamhetsområden på FI för att tillsammans bidra till FI:s förändringsresa mot en mer digital och datadriven myndighet.    Vi söker dig som   Det är meriterande om du     I det här jobbet behöver du   FI bidrar till ett stabilt finansiellt system, en hållbar utveckling och ett högt skydd för konsumenter. Vi erbjuder dig att arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppgifter, där du är med och påverkar den finansiella marknaden.  På FI arbetar cirka 600 personer och våra värderingar präglas av att vi är engagerade, beslutsamma, målinriktade och hjälpsamma. Vår arbetsplats ligger centralt i Stockholm. Det finns även möjlighet att delvis arbeta på distans.    Vi baserar vår rekrytering på kompetens. Det innebär att vi noggrant definierar vilka kvalifikationer som efterfrågas och sedan utgår från dem genom hela rekryteringsprocessen.  Vi arbetar aktivt för mångfald och likabehandling och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser.  Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.  Arbetspsykologiska tester ingår i rekryteringsprocessen.  På FI arbetar vi aktivt för att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare där du som medarbetare trivs och utvecklas. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på FI och vad vi erbjuder: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/lediga-jobb/vi-erbjuder/  En anställning på FI kan innebära att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll görs enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen.    Välkommen med din ansökan som ska innehålla cv, personligt brev och relevanta intyg eller examensbevis.  Vi avböjer all hjälp med rekrytering och annonsering.    Anställningen är tillsvidare och inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.    Heltid    Gabrielle Bergquist, biträdande avdelningschef, 08-408 985 54    2022-08-31

About the job SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a significant impact for our customers and colleagues. You are motivated to understand complex business initiatives, models and systems and enjoy ever-changing challenges. You have a passion for learning in general.  What we offer  We offer an opportunity to join an organisation where data is at the core, a friendly team to grow within, and extensive opportunities to build your network within the bank for further personal and professional growth.  Ready to join?  Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to SEB. Since we select candidates on running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2022-09-01. About the job We are hiring freelance English and Swedish speaking Online Data Analyst’s for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.  Requirements:   Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks. job_title: Data Analyst / Engineer to Nordax Bank
job_description: About the job Nordax Bank is a leading Nordic specialist bank that offers consumers private loans, savings, mortgages and mortgages for those aged 60+, capital release loans. Nordax has about 300,000 customers, mainly in Sweden, Norway and Finland. Ever since Nordax was founded in 2003, the company has grown and formed an organization based on great know-how and commitment. Through responsible lending, we help people make well-thought-out choices for a life they can afford. Since January 2019, Nordax owns Svensk Hypotekspension AB and then added capital release credits to the product portfolio and during November 2021, the acquisition of Bank Norwegian was also completed. With the acquisition of Bank Norwegian, Nordax has doubled its size regarding its loan portfolio and will receive another product in the form of a credit card. About The Role Our Data Engineering team is currently expanding, and we are currently looking for a Data Analyst / Engineer! You will be a part of IT and your stakeholders will be all over the organization. The team is currently in an expansion phase with new architecture under design. This is a great career opportunity for a data analyst or engineer to grow in front end, backend and design matters. You will also have possibility to influence new end to end data architecture and flows and designing data solutions from the start (On prem, Cloud and hybrid). About the job Who's behind Deel?  We're a global team that loves to build and solve problems, especially when it comes to the world of remote work. Made up of self-driven people spanning 150+ countries, Deel's unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and improving.  Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we're building the tools to make that a reality. Our market-leading tech, expertise, and, most importantly, the team are crucial. As a whole, we find fulfillment in working together towards our shared mission.    A significant shift has occurred within today's workforce, and with it, business as we know it has drastically changed. At Deel, we see a world without hiring borders, but we needed to find a solution to make it happen. A 30-mile hiring radius should no longer limit how companies hire because great talent lives everywhere. Deel exists to stay on top (and ahead) of the accelerating global talent market by offering global teams all the tools needed to hire, manage, pay, and scale at rocket speed.  And speaking of scale, Deel has officially raised $425 million in Series D funding, bringing our valuation to $5.5 billion. There's never been a more exciting time to join Deel - the market leader in international payroll and compliance.             At Deel, our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are, no matter their location. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all. Because a good life brings great innovation.     Perks are nice, but perks don’t make a company or individual successful - the work does. At Deel, we’re building technology and products to engage the ever-changing global workforce and to ensure businesses may hire anyone anywhere. While you’re building for our customers, we’re building for you.

About the job Manage the largest dataset in the world when it comes to golf tracking, participate at the cutting edge of golf-tracking innovation  ABOUT US Toptracer Technologies have users and viewers all over the world. Our mission is to help people enjoy the wonderful game of golf even more by tracing contributions to TV and driving range technology. Our range technology is used in 31 countries and the broadcast is aired over 270 times every year. All of our products are developed, tested and deployed from our R&D office in Mörby Centrum, Stockholm.

About the job Ideal Candidate: Candidates for this position will need to have good research skills and a strong understanding of local and national information. Cultural, geographical, social media and current affairs knowledge are important in this role     :     The position will allow you to work from home as an Independent Contractor on a flexible schedule of up to 20 hours per week completing tasks in a web-based evaluation tool. The tasks will involve determining the relevance and accuracy of information by performing online research and referring to guidelines provided to you. You will be rating tasks to validate data. You will be helping to authenticate data that will be used in live online search tools and applications by millions of users across the world.

About the job We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to offer domain expertise and client support for our UK market. You will work closely with stakeholders and various client-side departments to oversee design, development, and validation of Analytics data for the Google or Adobe Analytics platforms.  This role focuses on the design and implementation of customized analytics and attribution strategies as well as creating training and deployment processes that scale globally. This includes the assessment of user-level data and integration with real-time technologies; formulating testing mechanisms to measure and optimize media performance; and overseeing the execution of recommendations for optimal performance across the wide base of paid and unpaid, online and offline media channels our clients leverage.                  Upon meeting the Company's eligibility requirements mentioned above, you will/may also be entitled to the following benefits at the discretion of the Board:     Media.Monks is on a mission to create a new future for this industry. Our vision? Build everything with a belief that changing for good comes from changing who does the work. Yep, that means you. Welcome to the party—one global, cross-cultural collective with a passion for using our skills to create better and a better world. That’s how we’re able to connect the dots between data, content, digital media, and technology from everywhere we are—a true end-to-end model. Joining the Media.Monks collective means having the opportunity to create award-winning work with some of the most gifted, focused, joyful, talents from all over the world.  At Media.Monks, you’ll be joining a highly ambitious company on a global mission to win the decade by changing the industry for good. Partner to 8 of the 10 most innovative companies in the world, Media.Monks works with established as well as up-and-coming global, regional, DTC and B2B brands, helping them own their data and build out customer ecosystems to elicit smart, efficient, high-impact engines for growth. We deliver table stakes quickly, creating cost efficiencies from day one to push up the creative effectiveness of our work with every cycle.  We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.

About the job The Composer tribe at Spotify is based within the broader Financial Engineering org. We are responsible for transforming billions in commercial events into the financial statement. In this team you will be working with the revenue of users that enables creators to live off their art.  We work at the heart of Spotify and contribute to the overall vision and mission of the company. Our duty is to provide accurate, reliable and timely financial results and provide essential insights. This means understanding the enterprise processes end to end and how it relates to our systems, both in our custom infrastructure and in our SaaS platforms.  We are looking for engineers who bring innovative ideas to solve new and old problems, especially engineers who are looking to hyper-automate the financial domain.  We expect our engineers to be collaborative, display leadership qualities, and be passionate about tackling problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.  Spotify works extensively with Google Cloud Platform technologies such as DataFlow, Kubernetes, BigQuery, and Cloud Pub/Sub, and builds on top of them with open-source frameworks such as Scio.  What you will do   Who you are   Nice to have   Where you’ll be   Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.  Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.    Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.

job_title: Dataanalytiker och Verksamhetsutvecklare till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset
job_description: About the job Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är ett av Europas största universitetssjukhus med cirka 15 000 medarbetare. Sjukhuset är ledande inom den medicinska utvecklingen i Sverige och internationellt och vi rankas bland världens främsta sjukhus.  Vårt arbete präglas av ett professionellt, utvecklande och verksamhetsinriktat angreppssätt som aktivt stödjer Karolinskas strategier och mål samt bidrar till utvecklingen av Karolinska utifrån sjukhusets värderingar; ansvar, helhetssyn och medmänsklighet.  En förutsättning för vår verksamhet är rätt person på rätt plats vid rätt tillfälle. För att uppnå det behöver vi aktivt arbeta med vår kompetensförsörjning. En effektiv kompetensförsörjning säkerställer en personalstyrka av rätt storlek och rätt kompetens för att möta framtidens vård, utbildning och forskningsbehov. För att ytterligare utveckla detta arbete arbetar vi för närvarande med att etablera en ny enhet för expertis inom kompetensförsörjning på Karolinska, ”Karolinska Kompetensförsörjningscentrum”.    En viktig del av Kompetensförsörjningscentrums arbete är analyser och skapande informationsstrukturer. Karolinska vill i en större utsträckning ska styra datadrivet och med bättre digital information som beslutsstöd och så även inom kompetensförsörjning och därför tillsätter vi två nya tjänster i vårt team med fokus på dataanalys (och viss verksamhetsutveckling). Ta chansen att bli en betydelsefull del av ett ambitiöst arbetslag med ansvar för Karolinska Universitetssjukhusets uppföljning och informationsförsörjning inom kompetensförsörjning!  Om du är intresserad av de flesta av dessa begrepp tror vi att det här är arbetsplatsen för dig:      Du kommer att arbeta på avdelningen Kompetensförsörjningscentrum som är placerat inom HR och arbetar nära sjukhusets ledning. Teamet arbetar även med strategiska, taktiska och operativa frågor på sjukhusövergripande nivå – både genom att driva, utveckla och förvalta processer samt som stöd i större projekt.  I samarbete med verksamheten kommer du använda din pedagogiska och tekniska förmåga för att förse verksamheter med data och beslutsunderlag samt med att strukturera och utveckla datadriven styrning och verksamhetsutveckling. Du bidrar till att Karolinskas patienter får den vård de behöver och får samtidigt en stor förståelse för hur ett sjukhus fungerar och styrs.    Vi söker dig som har en förmåga att djupdyka i olika datakällor samt har god analytisk förmåga och öga för att skapa intuitiva visualiseringar. Du kan effektivt ta fram och genomföra kvantitativa och kvalitativa analyser samt kommunicera resultat på ett tydligt och strukturerat sätt. Vi ser även att du är en person som är noggrann, lyhörd och lösningsfokuserad.  Du har en god förmåga att pedagogiskt beskriva dina resonemang i både tal och skrift samt behärskar att anpassa redovisningar och presentationer till olika målgrupper som exempelvis sjukhusledning, styrelse, chefer, sjuksköterskor, läkare och roller däremellan. Vi arbetar i en dynamisk miljö med högt tempo och omväxlande arbetsuppgifter.          Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.       Läs mer om rekryteringsprocessen på Karolinska på https://www.karolinska.se/jobba-hos-oss/rekrytering-pa-karolinska/    Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.  Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.  Läs gärna mer om oss på www.karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!    För att stödja sjukhusets alla kliniska verksamheter arbetar jurister, ekonomer, kommunikatörer, HR, Inköpare och IT för att vi tillsammans ska generera vård i världsklass och vara en verkligt Attraktiv Arbetsgivare! På https://www.karolinska.se/om-oss/om/organisation/Administrativa-verksamheter/ kan du läsa mer om oss.    Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.  Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.  Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen.  Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion.  Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm  Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2022/4571 | Kontakt: Per Wennström 0725-815774, | Facklig företrädare: SACO saco.karolinska.karolinska@regionstockholm.se, Vision vision.karolinska@regionstockholm.se, | Publicerat: 2022-06-13 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2022-08-31
