About the job We’re creating our own future  At Volvo Cars, we are making bold digital visions come true. We aim to be the leader in the automotive world by creating a digital ecosystem built around making our customers' lives less complicated. What we all have in common at Volvo Cars is our passion for protecting lives, our endless curiosity, and our dedication to create a new future for the automotive industry. Our human centric focus is what separates us from all other car companies.  Would you like to influence and craft the technical strategy that helps Volvo Cars to grow and reach our goal of being an electric car company by 2030? Excellent, then we would like you to join our Cluster as Data Engineer!  The Data & Identity Cluster is a part of the Global Online Experience (GOX) area and our mission is to ensure we know our customers well and keep this information safe and secure. We support the rest of the organisation in using this knowledge to serve the customers in the best possible way. We’re looking for someone that will help us craft a world class data ecosystem that spans across multiple product teams and clusters. We have only just begun this journey in earnest, and you’ll be joining us at a time where you can really have a great impact and help us set the tone for the next chapter in our company's history!          Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.  Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

About the job Mentimeter's vision is to transform presentations and meetings into fun and interactive experiences by making it easy to listen and to be heard. We believe in giving everyone a voice, in every meeting and presentation. We are building a modern, friendly, and diverse product-first tech company based in Stockholm and we would love for you to join us!  The Data Platform Team at Mentimeter builds data products and platforms that influence the future path of the company. The team is part of the larger Data and Analytics organization which consists of other embedded and central teams of data scientists, analysts and insight people. Here, you’ll be working on a data ecosystem that serves all of the departments (Product, Marketing, Sales and Finance) with both data as well as infrastructure. You will have a direct impact on the future of Mentimeter’s business and product decisions.

About the job    One of the Swedens most exciting Tech companies are now looking for a Data Scientist/Analyst to join in a consultant assignment with big possibilities to land in a fixed contract after the assignment!

About the job Do you love working with modern technology and creating lasting value for our customers and society? We are now looking for data engineers for our team in Sweden; people who like to dig into data and analytics as well as consulting clients and customers in the process!  Data Engineer looking for a new home? Solita are hiring!    We have data professionals all across 6 countries, and we work with data solutions in almost all technologies. Our data engineers build technical solutions that consist of data modelling, ETL/ELT, data integration and data pipelines based on cloud. A large part of the time they work hands-on with configuration, integration, installation and scripting of data, but also with design architecture and meetings where they explain the solutions to our customers. Not infrequently, you sit at the same table as the top managers of our customers.  Regardless of customer, project or industry, we always have access to a vast network of fantastically knowledgeable, passionate data colleagues, who are just a slack message away. In addition, you can constantly learn new things through our autonomous competence communities, countless info sessions and the opportunity to take various certifications, and more. We also work a lot with our tech partners such as AWS, Azure, Snowflake and Semarchy. If you really want to develop and be at the forefront of data solutions, we have quite a lot to come up with!    However, the most important thing for us is that you share our values and that you are happy to share your knowledge with your colleagues. Our employees at Solita have chosen our own values.  In our blogs you can read more about what your future colleagues have to say about AI, data and analytics.    Our corporate culture is very, very important to us, and we value low hierarchy, independence and responsibility, value-creating work, and nice colleagues. Read more about Solita as a company!        We value your knowledge, but are also curious about you as a person. Tell us what you are passionate about and dreaming, and we will get back to you shortly!

The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

About the job About Us  Uniting pedagogy and technology — that’s our expertise. We enable better learning inside and outside of the classroom by creating engaging learning experiences that lead to better student outcomes.  Kognity is an all-in-one curriculum-aligned teaching and learning platform with interactive textbooks, analytics, and assessment support. We offer comprehensive digital teaching and learning resources for the secondary school programs IB Diploma Programme, IGCSE, and NGSS.  Our vision is to radically improve learning for the world’s school students. This is just the beginning of our journey. We’re looking for great people to help us make an impact on education.  The Analytics team delivers reports to support business decisions and works closely with Kognity’s various Business functions. We're a team of 3 today, and we have an opportunity for a Senior Data Engineer to design and build a reliable data foundation.  How you’ll make your mark…  We value…  Our Values    Kognity is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates. Please refrain from including your picture and age with your application.  Please note that we do not accept any applications through email due to GDPR.  Please submit your application in English.

About the job About us  Uniting pedagogy and technology — that’s our expertise. We enable better learning inside and outside of the classroom by creating engaging learning experiences that lead to better student outcomes.
About the job Det går att effektivisera vården!  Vill du bidra till en av samhällets kritiska utmaningar? Vill du vara med och bygga ett företag? Vill du jobba med smarta och trevliga kollegor?

About the job Har du en passion för att med hjälp av data skapa insikt i komplexa frågeställningar? Har du erfarenhet att jobba med Business Intelligence och Datavisualisering? Ta chansen att bli en del av oss på Atkins som Business Intelligence Analyst med fokus på datavisualisering.  Om Tjänsten  Vi välkomnar mångfald och nyfikenhet. Vi uppmuntrar till experimenterande med nya verktyg och arbetssätt. Detta är något vi tror föder innovation i vårt dagliga arbete och möjligheten att ligga steget före våra konkurrenter. För oss är transparens, kunskapsutbyte och lärande en del av processen.  I rollen som Business Intelligence Analyst ingår följande ansvar och arbetsuppgifter:  Du kommer in i ett innovativt Analytics-team om sex personer, där du får ansvar för visualisering, användargränssnitt och kundleverans. Vi sitter i fina, nyrenoverade lokaler på Västgötagatan på Södermalm med ett stort utbud av bra restauranger, affärer med mera runt knuten.      Du gillar att visualisera data och skapa goda användarupplevelser. Du trivs i samarbeten, oavsett om det är med externa kunder eller interna kunder från våra andra verksamhetsgrenar. Du ser möjligheter och gillar att komma med innovativa förslag.  Det är meriterande om du även råkar ha erfarenhet av spårfordon, antingen från ägare, operatör eller underhållare.  Här kommer du som är ansvarstagande och självgående få möjlighet att påverka hur ditt område ska utvecklas och vilka verktyg och metoder som skall användas framöver. Är du som oss; positiv och har ett lösningsorienterat förhållningssätt till problem och utmaningar så kommer du snabbt komma in i vår miljö och verkligen gilla ditt jobb!    Atkins är en del av SNC-Lavalin och ett globalt design- och ingenjörsföretag. Vår övergripande vision är “Engineering a better future for our planet and its people”. Det är ett inspirerande men utmanande mål som kräver att vi hela tiden försätter vara nyfikna, innovativa och flexibla. Sist men inte minst behöver vi dig som vill bli bättre tillsammans med oss!    Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i Stockholm där resten av teamet finns. Vi är eventuellt även öppna för placering på något av våra kontor i till exempel Malmö, Helsingborg eller Göteborg. Vi erbjuder flexibla villkor med möjlighet att arbeta ett par dagar i veckan på distans.    Vill du veta mer om tjänsten? Kontakta rekryterande chef Johannes Leo på telefonnummer 076 628 53 49 eller mail johannes.leo@atkinsglobal.com. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande och vår ambition är att höra av oss till dig så snart som möjligt.  Det är endast möjligt att ladda upp ett dokument när du söker jobb hos oss. Bifoga ett CV där till exempel dina erfarenheter och utbildning framgår. Vill du skicka in din portfolio? Länka till den i ditt CV eller maila den till oss separat.

About the job Innovation starts with being curious.  At Volvo Cars, we believe that being curious and truly committed to understanding people is the key to future success. We are people who care about other people, working together to create new technologies and innovations for safe, sustainable and convenient mobility. Want to join us?    Would you like to influence and craft the technical strategy that helps Volvo Cars to grow and reach our goal of being an electric car company by 2030?  Excellent, then we would like you to join our Cluster as Senior Data Engineer!  The Data & Identity Cluster is a part of the Global Online Experience (GOX) area and our mission is to ensure we know our customers well and keep this information safe and secure. We support the rest of the organization in using this knowledge to serve the customers in the best possible way. We’re looking for someone that will help us craft a world-class data ecosystem that spans across multiple product teams and clusters. We have only just begun this journey in earnest, and you’ll be joining us at a time where you can really have a great impact and help us set the tone for the next chapter in our company's history!    As an early joiner in a new team within a highly prioritized area, you will play a key role in setting technical direction and building a world-class data architecture based on Data Mesh principles.        Please note that applications via email will not be accepted due to GDPR. For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Ellinor Magnusson, Lead Recruiter - Engineering via ellinor.maagnusson@volvocars.com.    Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.  Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

job_title: Senior Data Engineer to Customer Relationship Management to SEB
job_description: About the job Data Engineer to Customer Relationship Management to SEB in Stockholm  SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a massive impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?    We are now looking for a new colleague to strengthen our CRM team to be able to develop towards the data driven strategy, with the aim to be proactive and enable customer 360 view. In this role, you will join a new team with primary focus on building and modernizing the solution from scratch.  The CRM solution contains a lot of information about SEB’s customers that provides insights both to the customer service function and the marketing department, to mention a few. The insights and information are stored and handled in the data warehouse.  Together with your team you will be given the exciting mission to work with data onboarding, build data pipelines and integrate all 40+ data sources and rebuild the current solution towards new architecture, which will be cloud based with Google Cloud Platform.  You will pave the way forward and work with modern techniques and tools and get a role where you contribute to our important work with CRM data, being highly involved in decision making and our technical road map.  As part of this team, you get the opportunity to influence and take a holistic approach to future solutions and optimize development to suit our users' needs. You are also welcomed to improve and streamline ‘the way of working’ in our new team and share your knowledge.    To succeed in this role, we believe you are a curious team player with excellent communication skills, along with a positive, and open mindset. You are a data engineer or a developer with a strong tech background and experience from working with integrations and big data in complex environments. Since we will build new solutions, we see creativity and problem solving as great advantages preferably combined with skills in some of these areas:  If you also have experience working in a Hadoop environment and experience of Python and JavaScript - we will be thrilled!    We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:     It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.    Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than August 2022. If you have questions about the position please contact Katarina Pihl Talent Acquisition Partner at Katarina.pihl@seb.se    sebgroup.com/techcareers

About the job MAJORITY is a groundbreaking digital banking service for migrants, nomads, internationals and immigrants. Our all-in-one membership includes an FDIC-insured account, Visa® Prepaid card, international money transfers, cross-border, bill pay solutions and international calling. We are built for migrants, by migrants.  Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are following their dreams, love or new experiences, more and more of us are leaning towards new environments. Our purpose at MAJORITY is to empower the amazing, the brave, and the talented and help them achieve all of their ambitions. We believe that everyone deserves the same opportunity to succeed. Our mission is to provide migrants the tools to thrive in their new country. Come join us!    As our Senior Data Engineer, you will be a part of the data team where you will play a key role in bringing our data stack to the next level. This is a highly impactful role where you can take the lead in driving the direction of the technical architecture and roadmap for the company. In our data team you can work with everything from integrating with APIs with AWS Lambdas to advanced SQL queries and data streams.  Our data platform is key in helping migrants from all over the world!  Current stack: Snowflake, dbt_, Looker, Airflow, AWS (Kinesis, S3, Lamda), Terraform

About the job Hos oss arbetar Skandinaviens främsta Data-, Analytics & AI-experter, vilket ger oss bästa möjliga förutsättningar att hjälpa våra kunder att lyckas på sin resa mot ett datadrivet beslutsfattande.  I din roll som Data Engineer hos oss kommer du att arbeta med att designa, modellera och integrera data från strukturerade- och ostrukturerade datakällor. Du kommer att bygga robusta dataflöden, att skapa effektiva datatransporter och du kommer att arbeta med att bygga dataarkitektur för Machine Learning-lösningar och BI-lösningar.

About the job Come work with us and join our team! We are an engaged, tech-savvy, fun and kind group of people that are focusing on basically high related to Data and AI. We are involved in everything from designing advanced solutions with large amounts of data to modelling, optimizing and programming data pipelines. And yes, we know how to build machine learning solutions as well. You get the picture.  If you are interested in working with Data Engineering on Google Cloud in a friendly team with clients that are disrupting the market, and you appreciate learning new things then stop looking. Accenture is Google’s #1 business partner globally. We are collaborating closely with our global expert networks in areas such as Google Cloud and Industry specifics. You will be an integral member in our entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business.  We are looking for a tech-savvy, kind, curious, engaged data engineer who has previous experience in GCP that wants to work with us and build an exciting career within Accenture together with a mentor.  As a Google Cloud Data Engineer, you help our clients to democratize their data to enable data-driven decision making. You will be responsible for designing and developing data solutions such as data sinks, data pipelines and data warehouses using GCP tools like Pub/Sub, Dataflow, BigQuery etc. This is an exceptional opportunity to grow technical skills in some of the market’s biggest and toughest challenges.

About the job Software development that makes a difference  At Volvo Cars, we are making bold digital visions come true. We aim to lead in the automotive world by creating a digital ecosystem built around making our customers' lives less complicated. Now we are looking for curious, creative people who want to change the world through innovative thinking.    Would you like to influence and craft the technical strategy that helps Volvo Cars to grow and reach our goal of being an electric car company by 2030?  Excellent, then we would like you to join our Cluster as a Senior Data Engineer!  The Car Service Cluster is a part of the Global Online Experience (GOX) area and our mission is to provide our customers with a personalized, hassle-free, and cost-efficient car service experience. We support the rest of the organization in using this knowledge to serve the customers in the best possible way.  We’re looking for someone that will help us craft a world-class data ecosystem that spans across multiple product teams and clusters. We have only just begun this journey in earnest, and you’ll be joining us at a time where you can really have a great impact and help us set the tone for the next chapter in our company's history!    As an early joiner in a new team within a highly prioritized area, you will play a key role in setting technical direction and building a world-class data architecture based on Data Mesh principles. You will work in a multi-functional agile team to continuously experiment, iterate, and deliver on product objectives. Leverage our large and diverse datasets to enable use cases with a direct impact on the end customer's digital experience.  Work with state-of-the-art data processing frameworks, technologies, and cloud platforms. In this role, you will have the opportunity to develop in different technologies and languages ranging from Java and Scala to Python and SQL. You will help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve data quality.  Being active in advocating and advancing modern, agile software development and helping develop and foster good engineering practices is important in this role.    We think you are an experienced Data Engineer who’s worked on modern data architecture principles specialized in either the Data Lake or Data Warehouse tech stack. You know and care about sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, defensive programming, and automated testing.  You are passionate about crafting clean code and have a steady foundation in coding and building data pipelines in a cloud-based environment. You have knowledge of how to write distributed, high-volume services in Java, Scala or Python and are well versed in the SQL language and databases.  To be successful in this role you understand the value of collaboration and partnership within a team. We like to have fun at work and take great care in making sure everyone always feels welcome and included, we hope you do the same!  You fully embrace a growth mindset and encourage others to do the same. It is important that you have integrity and a change management mindset.      Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.  Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

About the job It’s an exciting time to work at Hive Streaming! We have grown significantly over the last few years and now rank among the top SaaS companies in the Nordics. In 2021, Microsoft selected Hive to become the recipient of its prestigious ISV of the Year award.  In these turbulent times, excellent employee video communication is crucial for enterprise companies to create engagement and alignment to survive and succeed. At Hive Streaming we are proud to offer an industry-leading solution to this demand. We help multiple Fortune 500 customers analyse, secure, and optimize their video experience on a daily basis.    We have been a hypergrowth company for a long time, doubling our revenue yearly. For the next phase of our journey, we want to continue that growth by financing it ourselves. By the end of 2022, we will be able to drive additional growth without the need for external capital. This is an exciting thing!  We want to grow sustainably when it comes to revenue, when it comes to our people and our customers; they are what truly makes us succeed.  To help our customers to grow sustainably, we will help them by creating alignment and engagement of their employees. We will help them to reduce their carbon footprint through less travel and by increasing the lifespan of their existing infrastructure. All this is at the core of our product, the Hive Video Experience Platform.    We are looking for a versatile with strong software engineering skills to join our Video Analytics team. You will be part of our hybrid workplace, which means you will be working partly remotely and at our office in Stockholm.  In this role, you will be a major contributor in designing and implementing the big data pipelines - real-time and batch - powering our innovative video analytics products! You will, together with the team, help to evolve our state-of-the-art data platform and share the responsibility for delivering high quality reliable data solutions on top of it.    The Video Analytics team is a part of Hive Streaming's Product Office and works from Hive’s office in Stockholm. The team is responsible for Hive’s industry leading video analytics products. We offer actionable and personalized insights on our customers' video communications based on unique data on employee engagement, network performance, video quality and reach.  Our wide skill set allows us to independently handle product and feature requests from design to release. From the ingestion of data and live or “on-time” data processing, to presenting the valuable insights through powerful, user-centric data visualizations. In our team we share the responsibility for our work and strive for empowerment and innovation.    🏂🏼 At the office, at home or on the ski slope (did I go too far?) - your way is the best way but flexibility is everyone's way at Hive! We use Microsoft Teams to collaborate, we have digital kick-off's and provide you opportunities to work either remotely or in a hybrid setting.  🧡 We are a fast-paced, global (over 35 nationalities among our 100 co-workers around the globe) scale-up company that empowers every single co-worker. Everyone is unique and important for our growth. You will play an important role in the company’s future success.  🧘🏽‍♀️ (cannot say it enough)... we have flexible working hours to encourage work-life balance.  🌎 Hive helps enterprises to communicate through video instead of flying people in from across the globe, which means Hive employees directly contribute to a greener world!  🌈 ... salaries are good, insurances are good, awesome health benefits (did someone say free massage at the office?) and hopefully you stay good (& healthy)!

company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
job_description: About the job CEVA Logistics' Data Management/Data Science team is seeking a Data Engineer! The role can be based in any major European city but prefer Warsaw or Marseille. YOUR ROLE A data engineer develops and constructs data products and services and integrates them into systems and business processes. The employee is involved in shaping the data sets needed for successful analysis and is comfortable with using at least one common programing language to work with data (i.e. Python, r or similar). In addition, preferably a data base focused language such as PySpark, SQL or Scala. She or he should be able to lead the creation of data pipelines and data models for data products. The employee will work to set up and manage the backend data bases for data products.

About the job The opportunity We are looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our agile team. In this role, you will work with the outstanding and flexible PaymentIQ engine which processes more than 1M transactions a day, and as an application, currently, it works with the MySQL database, for ETL solution uses Debezium and Kafka, and the analytics solution using Kibana and Elasticsearch.

About the job Job ID: 3085  We are looking for a Group Financial Crime Prevention (GFCP) Senior Expert to join the Source Transaction Monitoring Data team to support us in further developing our monitoring capability and improving our data quality. This is an opportunity for you to be part of one of the most exciting and challenging efforts going on within Nordea on our journey to fight financial crime.  In today’s world, change is the one thing you can count on. But whatever the future brings, our customers remain at the heart of everything we do.  At Nordea, we’re committed to dinaymically fight against international financial crime by using the latest technologies and processes. You will play a part in building a better bank that fulfills a meaningful role in society. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. You’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.    You’ll join the Source Transaction Monitoring Data team within Transaction Monitoring Change Management. We add value by securing that our customers and Nordea will not be used in illegal ways that could harm them and as well harm our society where we act. As GFCP Senior Expert you will play a valuable role in fighting against financial crime.  TM Change Management is part of Group Financial Crime Prevention (GFCP), which provides group-wide solutions to fight financial crime in Nordea. TM Change Management specifically develops, manages and optimises automated TM controls across all the financial services businesses that together comprise the Nordea Group.  The high focus on Financial Crime in the group gives the appointed candidate a unique and exciting opportunity to continue to build “best in class” TM control solutions and lay the foundations for the future.    Job location will be Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Tallinn, Estonia or Łódź, Poland. The position is likely to require some travel to other Nordea international sites. Welcome to our team where you can bring your talent and engagement to work in an international and dynamic environment.    Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the four key values that guide us in being at our best.      If this sounds like you, get in touch!    Submit your application no later than 18/10/2022. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Nadia Wilson. nadia.wilson@nordea.com  At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.  Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

About the job Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other, and lead more enriched lives.  With international calling, mobile top-up service and more, we design products with the needs of modern migrants in mind.  Our ambitious team reflects our international audience. We are a diverse group of people from all over the world that come together every day—and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances.  Location Stockholm, Sweden  We are now looking for a Data Engineer to help us take the infrastructure and usage of data to the next level. We are launching new products and looking to fuel our growth driven by insights from the vast amounts of data we generate. We are also looking to work on some really exciting initiatives such as building the next generation of fraud prevention and churn prediction models. You will work closely with our stakeholders from departments like finance, operations, product, and commercial.  Current stack: AWS (Kinesis, S3, Lamda), Snowflake, Airflow, Matillion, DBT, Looker, Kubernetes              We are Rebtel. People from all around the world, as of now 18 countries and more to come. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About the job One of my clients are looking for a Power BI consultant to grow their fast growing team. They provide consulting services to clients in the Nordic region from their office in Stockholm based on the latest technology leading platform providers such as Microsoft, Amazon and Google. The demand around cloud based analytical platforms is constantly growing and they realise this and are now looking for candidates with strong technical competence and a can-do attitude. You will take part in their client implementation projects to help and guide our clients to become more data-driven.  Business Intelligence Developers are data experts that interact with internal stakeholders to understand the analytical and reporting needs, and then to collect requirements, design, and build BI and reporting solutions. They design, develop and support new and existing data warehouses, ETL packages, data models, dashboards and analytical reports. his role requires a strategic, analytical approach to business solutions to improve business decision making.  You will be responsible for solving business solutions and options by designing and building ETL packages, OLAP, designing algorithms, queries and designing sophisticated reports and top-line dashboard charts, tables and graphics.

About the job Hos oss på Capgemini Insights & Data arbetar några av Nordens främsta experter inom Data, Analytics & AI, vilket ger oss bästa möjliga förutsättningar att hjälpa våra kunder att lyckas på sin resa mot ett datadrivet beslutsfattande.  Vi bistår våra uppdragsgivare med datadriven affärs- och verksamhetsutveckling hela vägen från strategiska vägval till implementerad lösning och realiserad nytta.  För att möta våra kunders behov söker vi nu dig som vill fortsätta att utvecklas inom främst Microsofts BI stack. För denna roll söker vi personer som har erfarenhet av och kompetenser inom hela Microsofts BI portfölj, dvs allt ifrån SQL Server & Azure till Power Bi. Självklart kan du vara starkare inom något område och/eller ha större intresse för några områden!  Inom Insights & Data är vi ett stort team med specialister och våra tjänster spänner över områden såsom – rådgivning, framtagning av digitala strategier och roadmaps, design och implementation av AI-, IoT-, Analytics- och Data Management-lösningar. Givetvis understött av molnarkitektur och cybersäkerhet. Vår CFO Office-funktion bidrar även med expertis inom finansiell planering, budgetering och prognos samt finansiell konsolidering och koncernrapportering.    Vi söker nu dig som har flera års erfarenhet inom Analytics-området och som vill fortsätta utvecklas antingen mot bredare roller eller mot att bli mer specialiserad. Du har beprövad erfarenhet av att jobba med hela Microsofts BI-portfölj och du har även ett driv och intresse för att kommunicera möjligheterna med dessa produkter & tjänster till våra kunder. Du kommer att vara en nyckelspelare i projektens alla faser; från affärs- och dataförståelse till produktionssatta lösningar.  För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll har du tidigare erfarenhet ifrån att ha implementerat BI-lösningar och Self Service-lösningar. Som person är du driven, verksamhetsorienterad och du trivs lika bra med att arbeta självständigt som i grupp. Du sätter stort fokus på dialogen med kund men är även intresserad av att engagera dig i att utveckla oss till att bli en ännu bättre arbetsplats.     Det är viktigt att du är analytisk, lösningsorienterad och nyfiken, att du har en god samarbetsförmåga samt lätt för att kommunicera. Du har relevant högskoleutbildning och du kan svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.  Hos oss är medarbetarnas utrymme att utvecklas stort och kulturen präglas av frihet under ansvar. För dig som lockas av att vara med i Sveriges vassaste team inom Data, Analytics och AI, är detta ett jobb med framtidsmöjligheter för dig.

About the job Data Engineer - Stockholm - Cutting edge, fast-moving company.  Are you an aspiring Data Engineer, with some existing experience working with data? Would you like to work within a team that have extensive cloud data platform knowledge?  My client is a small, fast-growing company who have been around since 2015, with just over 100 employees. They provide a digital service subscription to their users, and data is at the heart of all this. The company HQ is in Stockholm where most of the tech and data team are based, but they have offices internationally, as well as many international employees.  You will be working with data in a modern cloud platform, working cross-functionally with senior team members, with effective communication across the team and management. You will continuously learn new things, so this must be a driving factor in your career.  The role involves a lot of collaborative work, you will be offered continuous support when completing your tasks, such as designing and building pipelines.  Requirements:   The company prides itself on being an encouragement of personal growth and providing a working environment where each individual can develop. They allow you to decide your own future with using the latest techniques and technologies, so if this is something that sounds interesting to you - please apply below.  Email me today: k.defty@nigelfrank.com, give me a call on +46 8 5024 2576, or message me on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/kaelin-defty-895464228/ for more information on this role, or other exciting roles we have to offer.  Nigel Frank International is the global leader in Microsoft technology recruitment. Since 2006, we've found over 19,000 permanent and contract Microsoft professionals for partners, ISVs, and end users in the ecosystem.

About the job Vill du arbeta med analys av finansiella stabilitetsrisker och att utforma åtgärder för att hantera dessa risker? Då kan det här vara jobbet för dig.  Om jobbet  Som analytiker på staben Ekonomisk analys på Finansinspektionen (FI) arbetar du med analys av finansiella stabilitetsrisker, framför allt kopplat till de finansiella marknaderna. Tillsammans med kollegor kommer du att utveckla metoder, bedöma risker och utforma åtgärder för att hantera identifierade risker.  Du kommer vara placerad på avdelningen Finansiell stabilitet på staben Ekonomisk analys. Arbetet innebär ett nära samarbete såväl internt med FI:s övriga organisation som externt med andra myndigheter, branschen och internationellt.    Vi söker dig som   Det är meriterande om du     I det här jobbet behöver du   Finansinspektionen (FI) bidrar till ett stabilt finansiellt system, en hållbar utveckling och ett högt skydd för konsumenter. Vi erbjuder dig att arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppgifter, där du är med och påverkar den finansiella marknaden.  På FI arbetar cirka 600 personer och våra värderingar präglas av att vi är engagerade, beslutsamma, målinriktade och hjälpsamma. Vår arbetsplats ligger centralt i Stockholm. Det finns även möjlighet att delvis arbeta på distans.    Vi baserar vår rekrytering på kompetens. Det innebär att vi noggrant definierar vilka kvalifikationer som efterfrågas och sedan utgår från dem genom hela rekryteringsprocessen.  Vi arbetar aktivt för mångfald och likabehandling och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser.  Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.  Arbetspsykologiska tester ingår i rekryteringsprocessen.  På FI arbetar vi aktivt för att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare där du som medarbetare trivs och utvecklas. Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på FI och vad vi erbjuder: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/lediga-jobb/vi-erbjuder/  En anställning på FI kan innebära att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll görs enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen.    Välkommen med din ansökan som ska innehålla cv, personligt brev och relevanta intyg eller examensbevis.  Vi avböjer all hjälp med rekrytering och annonsering.    Anställningen är tillsvidare och inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.    Heltid    Johan Berg, avdelningschef, 08-408 984 74    2022-08-31

About the job Schibsted is a growing and diverse family of over 50 brands whose mission is to empower people in their daily lives, and each brand contributes to it in its own way. Amongst our brands you can find leading Nordic marketplaces like Finn and Blocket, world-class media houses like VG and Aftonbladet (we are the largest media group in Scandinavia) and other rapidly developing digital companies like Prisjakt, Lendo and many others.  Data Foundations is a central department within Schibsted that is responsible for the data platform and is working on data-fueled products with an emphasis on volume, velocity and privacy. We are building products at scale, serving the whole of Schibsted and its brands.  Our team within Data Foundations is responsible for making data accessible in Schibsted in a simple, robust, timely and privacy compliant way to enable data driven business decisions. We help data consumers manage access to their behavioral datasets and dispatch events to 3rd party data services to unlock the value of their data with minimum latency. This team manages data for millions of users across the Nordic countries!  The Management and Distribution (MaD) team has a strong soul: we aim to be of service to our stakeholders and teammates, persevere and cooperate when facing challenges, are curious to figure out how stuff works (especially when it doesn’t), and most importantly put our team first by helping each other.    We are looking for a Data Engineer who has completed a few features together with their team, and is also respectfully proactive in taking ownership of, and investigating the “why’s”, of things.  If you also enjoy working in a team where teammates express their thought process around tasks clearly, share and receive constructive feedback on their work to both increase the quality of their work but also grow professionally, then you might be our new teammate!              As a part of Schibsted, you will also have the opportunity to share knowledge and learn from other data engineers across the organization. We encourage a diverse, collaborative and creative work environment, where you will develop and push for state-of-the-art solutions in big data processing as well as building reliable and highly scalable services.

About the job Data Engineer for a leading global appliance company  You will join a new team within the company which is the data product team which currently consists of 20+. The focus of this team is developing mobile apps, backend services, and connectivity components for connected appliances globally, guided by contemporary product management and agile principles.  The Data Product team is essential to their operation as it develops consumer facing and internal data products to enhance the quality of decision making for both consumers and internal stakeholders. Data Product team assesses the value of the data and enhances the consumers' experience through new, data-driven services in connectivity domain. Their ambition is to provide a seamless experience for connected appliances consumers by monitoring and analysing their behaviour and launching top-notch products/features tailored to their needs, powered by data!  The engineering challenges involved in storing, processing and analysing data at this scale, velocity and complexity are simply too much for traditional enterprise solutions, so our small team of Data Engineers are currently building a scalable data platform in the cloud to address these challenges and help transform them into a fundamentally data-driven company.  To achieve this, they need experienced cloud/data engineers.    They are looking for an extraordinary technical data engineer to join their self-directed team. Working alongside both data engineers and data product owner, you will be instrumental in scaling, storing, processing, and migrating data assets to the Connectivity Data Platform for OneApp; other Data Platform related tasks (solution design and implementation of stream processing, ETL and pipeline automation toolchains) as well as concrete pipelining tasks (configuring data flows from source systems to the data lake and/or various lakeshore access layer stacks). You will collaborate with Global IOT Platform and app development teams.

About the job We are looking for an experienced data engineer to join our team. You will use various methods to transform raw data into useful data systems. For example, you’ll create algorithms and conduct statistical analysis. Overall, you’ll strive for efficiency by aligning data systems with business goals.  To succeed in this data engineering position, you should have strong analytical skills and the ability to combine data from different sources. Data engineer skills also include familiarity with several programming languages and knowledge of machine learning methods.  If you are detail-oriented, with excellent organizational skills and experience in this field, we’d like to hear from you.  Vinter’s mission is to institutionalize crypto. Our customers are some of the most successful crypto funds in the world, and our investors are some of the most well-respected in the industry. We recently raised a $3.4M Series Seed and are now looking to build one of the greatest teams in our industry.  Since our incorporation in 2019, we’ve been listed as a top European startup and won the ETF Express Awards 2022 Crypto Index Provider of the Year. Our team is a diverse group of people from over 8 countries who speak 13 different languages.           N.B. You will be hired through our entity in the UK and Sweden. About the job We are now hiring for a Data Engineer for our Data Platform team based in Stockholm. This is an opportunity to become part of a skilled team building a real time data platform and scaling it to support Kambi's growing needs. To achieve this the team is developing a new data lake to scale with a variety of constantly growing data points.  About the Data team:  You will join a team dedicated to solving problems and exploring new technologies together in a DevOps environment. A quick look at our tech stack shows Java, Python, Docker and AWS (EKS, S3, Terraform). As we are a company in transition, with an ongoing AWS cloud migration, we can offer an exciting environment for growth and learning.    We are looking for a Data Engineer to grow our team, with interests in Big Data, CI/CD and AWS. We would like for you to have experience working in an Agile environment. If you have experience with Kafka or Spark that is a great plus, if not, then you will learn on the job with us. Since a large part of the teams work is exploratory, we believe you will thrive in this role if you are solution-oriented and enjoy finding new ways to solve problems in collaboration with the rest of the team.  Here at Kambi we believe in an encouraging environment with lots of room to learn, and we embrace diversity. If you are interested in joining a committed team in an inclusive and international environment in central Stockholm, please apply with your CV.    Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.  Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.  With offices in Malta (HQ), Bucharest, London, Manila, Sydney, Uppsala and Stockholm and together with over 1000 passionate and highly skilled people; Kambi live and breathe sports betting. It is in everything we do. From delivering a premium service to our operators, to creating an entertaining experience for the end user; we are unwavering in our mission to create the worlds’ leading sports betting experience.

job_title: Senior analytiker med intresse för samhällsekonomisk analys
job_description: About the job Är du en person som är intresserad av samhällsekonomisk analys och tilltalas av att vara med och påverka spelreglerna på marknaden för elektronisk kommunikation? Då kan du vara den analytiker som vår expertenhet för ekonomisk analys behöver!  På PTS bidrar du till samhällsnytta. Se filmen om vårt uppdrag.    medverka i och driva analyser av ekonomiska och tekniska frågor rörande konkurrensreglering, strategisk analys, samhällsnytta, policyutvärdering och förutsättningar för politiska mål.    Som analytiker på analysavdelningen ansvarar du för att ge ett kvalificerat stöd till övriga delar av myndigheten när det gäller olika typer av analyser. Till exempel statistikinsamling och tillhörande marknadsanalys, kostnadsberäkningsmodeller för området elektronisk kommunikation, spektrumanalys, utveckling och förvaltning av metoder för samhällsekonomiska analyser samt analyser av affärsmodeller, investeringar och andra ekonomiska och finansiella frågor.      Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Som person är du samarbetsinriktad och kreativ. Det är viktigt att du tar egna initiativ och att du har förmåga att få med dig andra. Rollen som analytiker inbegriper att driva och genomföra tekniskt, juridiskt och ekonomiskt komplexa uppdrag där du kan komma att ha ansvar för att uppsatta mål uppnås. Detta kräver en förmåga att kunna hantera olika perspektiv samt en god pedagogisk förmåga att kommunicera med berörda inom och utom organisationen.    Analysavdelningen har ett övergripande ansvar inom exempelvis samhällsekonomiska analyser, marknadsbevakning, omvärldsanalys, statistik, spektrumanalyser och spektrumpolicyarbete.  Enheten för ekonomisk analys är en expertresurs inom PTS som är specialiserad på att framför allt arbeta med ekonomiska analysmetoder. På enheten analyseras vilka konsekvenser av olika förändringar, historiska eller framtida, planerade eller möjliga, kan få på ett övergripande plan på hela eller delar av samhället.  För att upprätthålla och kontinuerligt vässa förmågan på avdelningen och enheten pågår ett löpande arbete med metodutveckling rörande bland annat kvantitativ analys och databaser, omvärldsanalys, strategisk analys och samhällsnyttoanalys.    Hos oss får du arbeta med ett meningsfullt uppdrag, till nytta för samhället, och tillsammans med cirka 380 kollegor. Vår verksamhet präglas av komplexa frågor och den snabba teknikutvecklingen, vilket gör att du får verka i en innovativ och kreativ miljö.  Vi är angelägna om att alla medarbetare mår bra och har förutsättningar att nå goda resultat. Vi arbetar strukturerat med varje medarbetares mål och utveckling. Vi värdesätter god balans mellan arbete och fritid, därför är friskvård en del av arbetet.  Om du är flexibel, tar initiativ och gillar att samarbeta kommer du att trivas hos oss och bidra till vår kultur. Vi utvecklar verksamheten tillsammans, vilket är en förutsättning för att vi ska nå våra höga ambitioner – att vara Sveriges bästa arbetsplats!    Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med inledande provanställning om sex månader. Placering i Stockholm med start snarast möjligt enligt överenskommelse.    För mer information kontakta tf. enhetschef Josef Ålander på 08-678 57 39 eller HR-specialist Linn Arnewing, telefonnummer 08-678 57 01.  För kontakt med vår lokala fackliga arbetstagarorganisation maila till saco@pts.se.

About the job Data Engineer - Stockholm - Sustainable end-user  If you're looking for your next data engineering role with a BI focus then this one is for you…  My client is a leading facility management provider in the Nordic region and they offer services for a company to function well and efficiently. About the job At Trustly, we’re passionate about simplifying the way people pay and get paid online. We’re a licensed payment institution and our B2B products available across Europe, North America and Australia attract global merchants in segments such as e-commerce, telecom, travel, financial services and gaming. In June 2018, private equity firm Nordic Capital acquired a majority stake in Trustly with ambitions to support us in becoming the leading global online banking payments provider.      Trustly is developing fast and so are the requirements on data being made available for analytics, data science, reporting and BI. The Data Engineering team’s part in this is to provide a platform and tools to enable data producers and consumers to share data in a frictionless way. Trustly’s European data platform is built on GCP using components such as Airflow (Cloud Composer), Beam (Dataflow), BigQuery, Pub/Sub and Google Cloud Storage. We also maintain the company’s dbt Cloud installation to enable Analytics Engineers and other downstream SQL power users to build their own data pipelines and not become dependent on a single data team that does everything. Parts of Trustly’s payment product run on AWS so knowledge about that ecosystem is important to us as well.  What you'll do:  Who you are:

About the job Hos oss arbetar Skandinaviens främsta Data-, Analytics & AI-experter, vilket ger oss bästa möjliga förutsättningar att hjälpa våra kunder att lyckas på sin resa mot ett datadrivet beslutsfattande.  I din roll som Data Engineer hos oss kommer du att arbeta med att designa, modellera och integrera data från strukturerade- och ostrukturerade datakällor. Du kommer att bygga robusta dataflöden, att skapa effektiva datatransporter och du kommer att arbeta med att bygga dataarkitektur för Machine Learning-lösningar och BI-lösningar.  Inom Insights & Data är vi ett stort team med specialister och våra tjänster spänner över områden såsom – rådgivning, framtagning av digitala strategier och roadmaps, design och implementation av AI-, IoT-, Analytics- och Data Management-lösningar. Givetvis understött av molnarkitektur och cybersäkerhet. Vår CFO Office-funktion bidrar även med expertis inom finansiell planering, budgetering och prognos samt finansiell konsolidering och koncernrapportering. Som Data Engineer hos oss har du alltid erfarna och duktiga kollegor att ta hjälp av och vi har ett mycket nära samarbeta med alla våra produktpartners.    För denna tjänst söker vi utåtriktade, lösningsorienterade och erfarna personer (konsult eller linjebefattning) som har erfarenheter av att bygga & optimera data-pipelines, data-set och att arbeta med data via APIer. Du har även följande kompetenser:   Du har relevant högskoleutbildning och du kan svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.  Hos oss är medarbetarnas utrymme att utvecklas stort och kulturen präglas av frihet under ansvar. För dig som lockas av att vara med i Sveriges vassaste team inom Data, Analytics och AI, är detta ett jobb med framtidsmöjligheter för dig! ****

About the job Job Overview  We are looking for a savvy Data Engineer to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. The position also requires collaboration with our software developers and architects to understand the data structure and make sure relevant data is stored.          We are always striving to implement and use the best tools in the market in order to be more efficient and agile. Therefore we use cutting-edge technology when it comes to the end-to-end data flow.  You will have full ownership of the data platform and the freedom to suggest and choose the best tool/approach to solving data engineering problems.  You will work in AWS and utilize various services to support our data platform and have the opportunity to work alongside data scientists and data analysts on interesting projects. You will also handle a multitude of data pipelines, deriving hundreds of metrics, and promoting data-driven culture.  Northmill is a tech company with a banking license aiming to improve financial life, offer merchants smart solutions and erase the borders between in-store and online.  Northmill creates a more personal and relevant experience for people and companies, helping more than 2,500 merchants and 600,000 end users.  2006  500 MSEK  160  31 MSEK  4.8 of 5  100 %  600 000  🇸🇪 🇳🇴 🇩🇰 🇫🇮 🇵🇱

About the job Gillar du energisystem, att räkna på energidata samt att ha kontakt direkt med kunden? Vill du arbeta mot energibolag i alla storlekar och lära dig om deras utmaningar och processerna hos dessa? Vi på SENS söker vår nästa konsult och medarbetare som vill räkna på våra kunders energisystem, och på så sätt vara med och bidra till ett mer hållbart samhälle.    SENS söker en konsult för Dataanalys som har ett stort intresse för teknik och energi. Här får du chansen att komma till ett företag som växer där du får möjlighet att forma din roll i den riktningen du önskar!  SENS är ett lättrörligt bolag som arbetar inom hela energisektorn, från projektering i egen portfölj till optimeringar och beräkningar i befintliga system hos kund. Vi är specialiserade inom energiberäkningar och energidata. Vi har djupgående samarbeten och är konsulter hos några av Sveriges största fjärrvärmebolag, men utvecklar även egna lösningar och verktyg för energioptimering inom både värme och el.  Vi är ett bolag som lyssnar på våra kunders behov och speglar dessa i marknadens förutsättningar. Du kommer därför ha nära kontakt med både externa kunder men även medarbetare för att maximera våra lösningars nytta, både för kundens ekonomi och miljön.    Som dataanalytiker hos SENS Consulting kommer du att vara med och utveckla SENS digitaliseringslösningar. Du kommer även arbeta utåt som konsult där du har en nära dialog med våra kunder för att utföra analyser och beräkningar i energirelaterade projekt. Ditt fokus kommer att ligga på bearbetning och analys av kvantitativ energidata samt modellering för fjärrvärme, geoenergi, fastigheter och stadsområden. Du kommer även arbeta med att visualisera data och aktivt delta i affärsutvecklingsprocessen samt presentera resultat för kunder och företagsledning.  På SENS projekterar vi även storskalig energilagring och förnybar energi. En del av ditt arbete kommer därför bli att vidareutveckla dessa produkter. Exempel på detta kan vara beräkningar och dataanalys för ett batteri i ett elsystem, exempelvis genom att optimera dess drift tillsammans med vind- och solkraftsproduktion.  Vi söker därför dig som vill lära dig mer om hela energisystemet och tillsammans med oss utveckla detta för en mer hållbar framtid!    Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer främst beröra följande   SENS har en platt organisation vilket innebär att alla möjligheter till personlig utveckling finns. Här kan du vara med och påverka din framtid och det är upp till dig i vilken riktning. Du tar mycket eget ansvar och gillar att leda projekt framåt.    För att lyckas i rollen som Data Analyst hos oss behöver du ha   Det är meriterande om du...   Som person är du nyfiken och har ett brinnande intresse för energifrågor. Du har en stark analytisk färdighet och är noggrann. Något som ger framgång är också att du har god förmåga att översätta teori till praktik samt att du kan uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift. Du trivs i en roll med stora kontaktytor och är mån om att utveckla goda samarbeten såväl internt som externt. Vidare har du förmågan att tala inför grupp, planera och organisera. Då du kommer ha en fri roll för att hitta möjligheter söker vi dig som är självgående, orädd och säljande.

About the job Do you thrive on tackling challenges? Do you love to take initiative? Do you want to grow as an individual and a professional? If you answered yes to these questions, we want you. We're always looking for talented coworkers who are eager to make a difference and go the extra mile to make it happen. We believe that the community you work in is just as important as the job you do. That's why we have breakfast together every Monday, fika together every Wednesday, and croissants every Friday. Knowledge sharing and collaboration is the backbone of our office and maintaining a strong work family is what makes that possible. We work hard to create a diverse, inclusive workplace where you can have a great work-life balance and love the work you do. Qualifications  We see that you mainly have skills and experience with  Building data processing pipelines using Big Data tools (Dataflow, Spark, Flink)  Build, schedule and monitor workflows with Apache Airflow or similar orchestration tool  Java SE  Automated testing  Version control    Data modelling and Data warehousing  Other Big Data technologies: Hadoop, Kafka, Kinesis  Build automation and continuous integration  GCP, AWS, Cloudera, Hortonworks or similar Are you a big data enthusiast? We are building our data infrastructure using the latest big data technology in the cloud. As a data engineer, you will play a key role in our organization by collaborating with data analysts and data scientists to enable data-driven decision making.  Our data infrastructure is built using Google Cloud Platform (GCP). A focal point in it is our new data warehouse where all data from various sources is centralized for analysis and reporting. In this role, you will start by integrating new data sources into the data warehouse and building data models to be used by other tools. For our ETL-pipelines, there is a strong focus on data quality and automated testing. It is also essential to write structured and maintainable code.  The Data Engineering team works closely with product managers, product analysts and growth specialists to figure out ways to acquire new customers, retain existing ones and optimize their experience - all of this using massive amounts of data. In this role, you will see a direct link between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction.  We are looking for a highly motivated Data Engineer who:  Wants to work with the latest big data technology in the cloud  Wants to make impact during the early stages of a major project  Would love to become a member of a team who is encouraged to explore new technical solutions    Google Cloud Dataflow through the Java SDK in Apache Beam, Google BigQuery, Google Cloud Storage, Kafka, Apache Airflow, and Maven.

About the job Global migration is a 21st-century reality. People from all around the world, as of now 18 countries and more to come. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. About the job kevin. is a startup with a bright present and even brighter future. Here we dream big, and then we commit to making those dreams come true. We have already built things that were never built before - in-app payments, card redirect, and there is more to come.  How did we manage that? By hiring people that are talented, driven, ambitious. Our company provides an environment where people like that can flourish - they can learn, explore, innovate. And they do just that!  So come join us and add rocket fuel to your career! kevin. is a great place to explore paths that were not explored before, and actually make impactful decisions.    Join the Insights & Analytics team where we provide analytical and number crunching assistance across the organisation. Our input at kevin. ensures that every department and team has the required information to make an informed decision and can operate at maximum efficiency.           kevin.’s advanced A2A (account-to-account) payment infrastructure solution was created to swiftly change costly card payments to payments linked directly from customers’ bank accounts without using any third-party providers. kevin.’s technology scales to businesses of any size and across industries, including retail, parking, fashion, car-sharing, deliveries, insurance and many more. kevin. focuses on mobile and POS payments where customers predominantly pay using cards currently. Its payment infrastructure is based on open banking – regulated by the European PSD2 Directive – which requires all banks and financial institutions in the European Economic Area to open their API for licensed third-party providers. kevin. develops only own connections to the banks without using any third-party aggregators.  Currently, the Company supports more than 6,000 merchants in 15 markets, including Sweden, Finland, Poland, Spain, Netherlands, Baltics and Portugal, where the company has a coverage of more than 85% of bank customers. The firm’s services will be available in 28 European Economic Area (EEA) countries by the end of 2022. kevin. has a team of more than 220 employees in 20 countries and it plans to expand its workforce to beyond 350 employees in 2022.  kevin. is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

job_title: Dataanalytiker och Verksamhetsutvecklare till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset
job_description: About the job Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är ett av Europas största universitetssjukhus med cirka 15 000 medarbetare. Sjukhuset är ledande inom den medicinska utvecklingen i Sverige och internationellt och vi rankas bland världens främsta sjukhus.  Vårt arbete präglas av ett professionellt, utvecklande och verksamhetsinriktat angreppssätt som aktivt stödjer Karolinskas strategier och mål samt bidrar till utvecklingen av Karolinska utifrån sjukhusets värderingar; ansvar, helhetssyn och medmänsklighet.  En förutsättning för vår verksamhet är rätt person på rätt plats vid rätt tillfälle. För att uppnå det behöver vi aktivt arbeta med vår kompetensförsörjning. En effektiv kompetensförsörjning säkerställer en personalstyrka av rätt storlek och rätt kompetens för att möta framtidens vård, utbildning och forskningsbehov. För att ytterligare utveckla detta arbete arbetar vi för närvarande med att etablera en ny enhet för expertis inom kompetensförsörjning på Karolinska, ”Karolinska Kompetensförsörjningscentrum”.    En viktig del av Kompetensförsörjningscentrums arbete är analyser och skapande informationsstrukturer. Karolinska vill i en större utsträckning ska styra datadrivet och med bättre digital information som beslutsstöd och så även inom kompetensförsörjning och därför tillsätter vi två nya tjänster i vårt team med fokus på dataanalys (och viss verksamhetsutveckling). Ta chansen att bli en betydelsefull del av ett ambitiöst arbetslag med ansvar för Karolinska Universitetssjukhusets uppföljning och informationsförsörjning inom kompetensförsörjning!        Du kommer att arbeta på avdelningen Kompetensförsörjningscentrum som är placerat inom HR och arbetar nära sjukhusets ledning. Teamet arbetar även med strategiska, taktiska och operativa frågor på sjukhusövergripande nivå – både genom att driva, utveckla och förvalta processer samt som stöd i större projekt.  I samarbete med verksamheten kommer du använda din pedagogiska och tekniska förmåga för att förse verksamheter med data och beslutsunderlag samt med att strukturera och utveckla datadriven styrning och verksamhetsutveckling. Du bidrar till att Karolinskas patienter får den vård de behöver och får samtidigt en stor förståelse för hur ett sjukhus fungerar och styrs.    Vi söker dig som har en förmåga att djupdyka i olika datakällor samt har god analytisk förmåga och öga för att skapa intuitiva visualiseringar. Du kan effektivt ta fram och genomföra kvantitativa och kvalitativa analyser samt kommunicera resultat på ett tydligt och strukturerat sätt. Vi ser även att du är en person som är noggrann, lyhörd och lösningsfokuserad.  Du har en god förmåga att pedagogiskt beskriva dina resonemang i både tal och skrift samt behärskar att anpassa redovisningar och presentationer till olika målgrupper som exempelvis sjukhusledning, styrelse, chefer, sjuksköterskor, läkare och roller däremellan. Vi arbetar i en dynamisk miljö med högt tempo och omväxlande arbetsuppgifter.        Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.      Läs mer om rekryteringsprocessen på Karolinska på https://www.karolinska.se/jobba-hos-oss/rekrytering-pa-karolinska/    Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.  Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.  Läs gärna mer om oss på www.karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!    För att stödja sjukhusets alla kliniska verksamheter arbetar jurister, ekonomer, kommunikatörer, HR, Inköpare och IT för att vi tillsammans ska generera vård i världsklass och vara en verkligt Attraktiv Arbetsgivare! På https://www.karolinska.se/om-oss/om/organisation/Administrativa-verksamheter/ kan du läsa mer om oss.    Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.  Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.  Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen.  Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion.  Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm  Fackliga representanter  Namn  SACO  Telefon  saco.karolinska.karolinska@regionstockholm.se  Namn  Vision  Telefon  vision.karolinska@regionstockholm.se

About the job Be part of something bigger. Decode the future.  At Electrolux, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.  Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute and grow together.  Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home.    The Digital Product Organization (DPO) of Electrolux consists of 20+ product teams plus enabling teams and leaders. We develop mobile apps, backend services, and connectivity components for connected appliances globally, guided by contemporary product management and agile principles. Now, we are looking for a Data Engineer to the new Data Product team.  The Data Product team is essential to our operation as it develops consumer facing and internal data products to enhance the quality of decision making for both consumers and internal stakeholders. Data Product team assesses the value of the data and enhances the consumers' experience through new, data-driven services in connectivity domain. Our ambition is to provide a seamless experience for connected appliances consumers by monitoring and analyzing their behavior and launching top-notch products/features tailored to their needs, powered by data!    We are looking for an extraordinary technical data engineer to join our self-directed team. Working alongside both data engineers and data product owner, you will be instrumental in scaling, storing, processing, and migrating data assets to the Connectivity Data Platform for OneApp; other Data Platform related tasks (solution design and implementation of stream processing, ETL and pipeline automation toolchains) as well as concrete pipelining tasks (configuring data flows from source systems to the data lake and/or various lakeshore access layer stacks). You will collaborate with Global IOT Platform and app development teams.         ElasticSearch, etc.     Electrolux Group
