About the job A Data Engineer at Media.Monks, with a thorough understanding of cloud technologies, will help to deploy Big Data solutions, build and manage data pipelines, ETL processes, and cloud data migrations in a production, secure and scalable manner. The data engineer should be a data specialist with strong experience in the deployment and automation of data pipelines, data development, data cleansing, data warehousing, monitoring data processing systems, and dealing with large and various sets of structured and unstructured data. The data engineer will have experience ingesting real-time data from various data sources and designing new data platforms.            Upon meeting the Company's eligibility requirements mentioned above, you will/may also be entitled to the following benefits at the discretion of the Board:     Media.Monks is on a mission to create a new future for this industry. Our vision? Build everything with a belief that changing for good comes from changing who does the work. Yep, that means you. Welcome to the party—one global, cross-cultural collective with a passion for using our skills to create better and a better world. That’s how we’re able to connect the dots between data, content, digital media, and technology from everywhere we are—a true end-to-end model. Joining the Media.Monks collective means having the opportunity to create award-winning work with some of the most gifted, focused, joyful, talents from all over the world.  At Media.Monks, you’ll be joining a highly ambitious company on a global mission to win the decade by changing the industry for good. Partner to 8 of the 10 most innovative companies in the world, Media.Monks works with established as well as up-and-coming global, regional, DTC and B2B brands, helping them own their data and build out customer ecosystems to elicit smart, efficient, high-impact engines for growth. We deliver table stakes quickly, creating cost efficiencies from day one to push up the creative effectiveness of our work with every cycle.  We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.

job_title: Graph Data Engineer- Graph & Semantics - Tietoevry Create
job_description: About the job You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.  Joining Findwise as a Graph Data Engineer, means that you will work on engaging projects, creating business value by making data and information accessible, user-friendly and valuable for clients in various industries. In Team Findwise we are passionate about helping our customers to find, analyze and act on their data and information to become data-driven. We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, an open culture with outstanding work life balance!    The reason many digital transformation initiatives fail or at least struggle to scale is not having access to sustainable and scalable data. One important key to success is to create interoperability of data scattered around various data silos and extract value from it. We want to help our clients in reaching their business goals by unlocking information, extracting knowledge and enable automation.  A new generation of tools are developing around Knowledge Graphs to support the understanding and complex querying of data, hyper-automation and explainable AI  Graph and Semantic Engineering are emerging enterprise data roles that leverage ontologies and related advanced analytics – including artificial intelligence – to build and represent knowledge in expressive and novel ways.  Several of our clients have started to exploit this paradigm shift – a shift in how highly variable structured and unstructured information is linked – to building knowledge that can be meaningfully understood by people and machines                 Since 2020 Findwise is a global business unit and team within Tietoevry, which is one of the largest IT companies in the Nordic region.    We look forward to your application!  Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we’ll reach out to you.  Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Anders Häggdahl, anders.haggdahl@findwise.com          Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.  Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.  #LI - remote

About the job Working as part of a global team of analysts and data experts across TUI, the Senior Reporting Analyst within our Marketing, Sales and Service (MSS) Business Intelligence team will be responsible for providing the measurement of our key performance indicators across a suite of dashboards. Using sales and customer data, you will provide meaningful commercial insights for key stakeholders within the TUI Group.  You will take a lead role of managing the transformation from source-market specific to group reporting and be an evangelist for dashboarding best-practice.  As a Senior Reporting Analyst, you have a fantastic opportunity to shape our new reporting landscape within Marketing Sales and Service and work closely with experts across source markets and group to drive alignment between local and global reporting and a common business understanding of the data. You will need excellent communication and influencing skills to bring multiple and varied stakeholders together, as well as project management skills to handle dependencies and drive a timely delivery of dashboards in line with the project roadmap.                       We want to be the best-loved holiday company not only for our customers, but for our colleagues too. That’s why we offer a variety of benefits that go above and beyond a competitive salary, so we can help you to live your best life happily at TUI. Click here to find out more. job_title: Senior Business Analyst to Master Data Management, Group Business Support
job_description: About the job Job ID: 4251  Would you like to become a member of Master Data Quality and Analytics Team and work with Customer and Counterparty data? We are now looking for an IT competent Senior Business Analysts to strengthen and empower our group of data analysts.  At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of data and technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.    Welcome to the Master Data Quality team. Our team support all business areas in the bank with in-depth knowledge and expertise of our master data, especially our customer and counterparty data. We participate in different development initiatives as well as in the daily operations of the bank in case of issues.  As a part of our team you will be working with existing SQL solutions as well as helping us design and develop new self service solutions for ourselves and our stakeholders. We are looking to modernize our analytics platform and are therefore looking for someone with a strong IT background. job_title: Data Engineer Consultant to Redpill Linpro Data Analytics Stockholm AB
job_description: About the job Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. Located in Oslo, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Copenhagen and Karlstad with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society. We're passionate about open solutions, open business models and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We've got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particular within our main areas which is API management, microservices, IT operations, cloud, DevOps and automation. Welcome to Redpill Linpro, the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordic countries. Our business concept is to offer services that accelerate and help spread open-source software. We are an open-minded and humble company with a strong focus on knowledge sharing. We are passionate about available solutions, open business models and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. What is this position about and why would you want it?! You would be joining the nascent Data & Analytics team within Redpill Linpro, where we together will build up a fun, challenging and rewarding team of data professionals! Working as a data engineering consultant based in a D&A team, that in turn is part of a greater team of other technical consultants within Redpill Linpro – will provide an excellent combination of continuous personal development, good salary and varying projects! What specifically we will work on, will of course depend on ongoing projects, but generally the vision has a couple of overarching components: -Technology: Google Cloud platform through Bigquery, Looker & Data Studio, BQML, Vertex AI and more, is going to be our main focus. Not limited to of course, since our clients will likely have a plethora of different tech stacks, and as a data professional we love to learn! -Utilizing the latest trends such as analytical engineering & ingestion platforms. -Learning: A typical treat of a true data professional is the need to keep developing, trying new things. Being coached, coaching others and supporting each others’ projects will be a core aspect of the team. -For the clients: Typically it costs a company more to have consultants compared to employees, however this will not be the case for us. We will be a team of experts that through experience, skills, using the right tools for the job and helping each other – will deliver serious value-for-money. -Teamwork: We will take inspiration from other consulting industries such as management consulting, and utilize the synergies found in combining seniors with juniors in projects. For more leverage on the seniors’ experience and higher efficiency/learning for the juniors A data engineer typically needs to have a strong technical understanding of our tools, build pipelines, design data models, understand business logic and much more that you are familiar with. Acting as a consultant also adds an additional dimension where communication & collaboration skills are highly valuable. This is an opportunity for you to: -As a consultant you will be allowed to really focus on the project at hand. -As a consultant you will see more companies, projects, data environments – which can be challenging but also developing! -Work with other D&A ambitious colleagues who likes to learn and move fast. -Be part of a larger group of technical consultants. -Be able to boost your salary through your performance. Experience & training we believe that you have: -You have a strong and relevant academic background that supports you in your work. Such as computer science, engineering, Mathematics, informatics or a related degree. -You have worked on cloud data warehouses before, and preferably have been designing environments and data models in these as well. -You have at least some experience in developing Business Intelligence, dashboards, reports as well. -Even if doing analysis may not be your forte, you are at a minimum skilled at supporting the business in delivering it, and understanding the business requirements around it. You have at least 3 years of experience working as a data professional, with at least 1 of those in a data engineering role and with cloud based solutions. -Orchestration, joins, data types, computational efforts, (de)normalized data, APIs, nested tables - are concepts that you are adept in. -We are looking for both senior and junior team members – being able to have a mix of junior and senior team members is a recipe for success! View on the technical skills needed: -Cloud datawarehouses: Bigquery primarily, but redshift and azure are a plus as well. -On-premise datawarehouses: Not our focus, but very useful to be able to manage and develop non-cloud datawarehouses such as mysql/mariadb/mongodb, since many companies are either already invested in these, require on-premise or otherwise at least have data sourced from them. -Orchestration: A good orchestration design is key to a good data model. If you are used to Airflow, dbt, and dataform are all good. The greatest strength lies in understanding the orchestration steps and the process around it. -BI tools: Looker & Data studio are likely our main bets – but clients will often have other existing installations, so wide experience in being able to develop in different BI tools, is good. -Version control: You are comfortable with GIT version control and understand why it is so useful. -Languages: The more the better as a consultant, but you are an expert in SQL and quite advanced in Python at least. Please read more about us here: https://www.redpill-linpro.com/ If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Recruitment consultant Peder Hansson at the recruitment company Terminalen Executive and Specialist Search via e-mail peder.hansson@terminalen.nu Note! Terminalen Executive and Specialist Search does not work with staffing services, so you will be directly employed by our client. Welcome with your application no later than August 28 2022 to www.terminalen.nu/rekryteringar We are not able to receive applications by e-mail or letter.

Tags: Data Engineer, Game Engineer, Backend Engineer, Data Analyst, Game Analyst, Game Data, Games Jobs, Sweden Jobs, Stockholm Jobs A little bit about the city: Stockholm A gorgeous, green and peaceful city, theres a lot to love about life in this city which makes up a quarter of the Swedish population. Often referred to as the capital of Scandinavia, theres a lot of culture to be found here. This includes a mix of nightlife and variety of restaurants, howeverin spite ofthis, the city maintains its calm vibe. For residents, the warmer months are filled with barbecues, sporting events and time in the countryside. The colder months are also taken advantage of with skiing, hiking, sledding and ice skating becoming the popular activities for that time of year! Stockholm is one third water and one third green space, making for an abundance of natural beauty, which is great for all family members to enjoy. In terms of expatriates enjoying life here, there area number ofhigh-quality bilingual schools and other international schools which are perfect for expats who are relocating to Stockholm with kids in tow. One thing to be aware of is that home-schooling in Sweden is heavily regulated and is only allowed in very rare circumstances.

About the job Är du en digital rörmokare? Då är rollen som Data Engineer på HiQ rätt för dig. Här kommer du att jobba i spännande projekt – både hos kund och internt. Du blir en del av ett tech-team där du kommer att få fokusera på att bygga robusta data-intensiva applikationer vilka organiserar, tvättar och tillgängliggör stora mängder data. Output kan sedan användas för analys eller som input-data till en algoritm. Datakvalitet ser du som något väsentligt och något du säkerställer i ditt sätt att arbeta.  Hos oss kommer du finna variation i ditt arbete, du kan i ena uppdraget skapa applikationer som förkortar vårdköer till att förutspå när en lastbil behöver service. För HiQ jobbar med många spännande kunder i de flesta branscher, allt från fordon- och flygindustrin till e-hälsa och retail.    För att matcha med våra uppdrag på bästa sätt, ska du helst vara utbildad civilingenjör i datavetenskap eller likvärdigt. HiQ är ett kulturdrivet företag där våra ledord; resultat, ansvar, enkelhet och glädje driver oss framåt. Det är anledningen att vi fokuserar mycket på vem du är. Tyvärr kan vi inte bara anställa dig på grund av din härliga personlighet, vi ser gärna att du har arbetat i minst 2 år som Data Engineer eller liknande och har arbetat med något av de följande:   Vi matchar ännu bättre om du också har erfarenhet av:   Vi tror du är nyfiken på att testa nya sätt att skapa de bästa lösningarna för olika behov och du säker ständigt ny kunskap för att hålla dig uppdaterad inom området. Du gillar att lösa problem i en snabbt växande miljö och uppskattar en arbetsplats som drivs av lagarbete, kreativitet, nyfikenhet och glädje.    Att vara HiQare är både utmanande och omväxlande. Vi är alla konsulter vilket innebär att vi i våra projekt hos kund eller in-house får prova nytt och bli exponerad för nya branscher, arbetsplatser och tech-stacks. Variationen är stor och utvecklingstakten snabb. Hos oss får du bidra och bemästra dina starkaste kompetenser, men även utforska och utveckla nya. Med rätt attityd och kompetens bidrar du med värde både i ditt uppdrag och till dina kollegor på HiQ.  Tillsammans består vi idag av över 1500 HiQare i fem länder. Hos oss hittar du allt från marknadens vassaste utvecklare, testare och hackers, till projektledare, agila coacher och designers. Även om våra kompetenser är många och olika så har vi mycket gemensamt – vi tycker om att driva utveckling, att förbättra och förenkla... och framför allt – att ha kul på vägen!  Vi sätter stor tilltro att du vill vara med och skapa bolaget som vi jobbar på. Detta tror vi att du bland annat gör genom att dela med dig av din kompetens (vare sig det handlar om de senaste ramverken eller i detalj hur en push & pull-rörförstärkare med KT88-rör funkar) och genom att ta dig an uppdrag med ett öppet sinne, nyfikenhet och driv. Vi tror att du trivs i en enkel organisation där korta beslutsvägar och en närvarande chef är viktigt för dig.  Utöver stor variation i uppdragstyper, härliga kollegor, någorlunda disciplin i Teams-möten kan vi också erbjuda en väldigt spännande resa in i ett nytt HiQ – där vi har ställt in siktet på att bygga norra Europas ledande tech-konsultbolag.  HiQ är kulturdrivet, inte regelstyrt, och det gör att man kan vara sig själv till 100%. En följd av det är att man som HiQ:are tar sitt jobb seriöst, men inte alltid sig själva :) Det som genomsyrar oss all är viljan och ambitionen att bidra till att göra världen lite bättre med hjälp av teknik och kommunikationslösningar som förenklar människors liv. På riktigt.

About the job Location: Bulgaria, France, Germany, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom  Docker is a remote-first company with employees across Europe and the Americas. This means we value transparency and asynchronous communication, but also understand that meeting in person is important.  Millions of developers use Docker daily to help them be more productive and to build better software. In order to build products that developers love, we collect billions of anonymized data points generated by our products and services to gain actionable insights that directly impact our product strategy and development. Our cross-functional Data team works with Engineering, Product, Sales, Marketing, Finance and Customer Support teams to empower them.  The Content Data team helps product development teams in the broader Content Group to deliver reliable data and follow company data processes. Data is collected from various sources (like PostgreSQL databases, log files, Segment, etc.), processed with ETL pipelines currently implemented in Python and stored in Snowflake before being exposed in Looker and/or Salesforce.  We are looking for data engineers excited to join Docker and advocate for good data practices. You will join the Content group whose objectives are:   As a Sr. Data Engineer, you will develop and maintain the different data pipelines and APIs to provide curated data generated by teams inside the Content group to the rest of Docker. You will ensure the data quality and accuracy to support building metrics and reports for both our internal users and customers. Here at Docker, we advocate creating products that developers love, so data engineers must enjoy participating in meetings and working closely with Software Engineers and Product Managers to fulfil our product roadmap. For this position is also expected to collaborate with our Infrastructure team in order to build a reliable data platform.           Docker embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.  Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.

About the job We have established a new data science practice at Canonical. The team will innovate in the open source data science technology stack, deliver advanced business analytics, support product roadmap decisions for Canonical through actionable insights, and lead by example in setting and publicly advocating for industry standards in open source data science.  The team will have both Data Scientists and Data Engineers, apply here if you are most excited about the Data Engineer role!  As a Data Engineer at Canonical you will act as a technical expert in an exciting field at the intersection of data engineering, data science, and machine learning technologies, with particular emphasis on the open source ecosystem of Canonical and Ubuntu. You will drive the organisation, instrumentation, ingestion, and transformation of data from a wide range of sources in the company.  You will deploy and evaluate machine learning models at scale on cutting-edge infrastructure, and contribute to open source data platforms and MLOps cloud solutions. This work requires proactive collaboration in a worldwide distributed team of engineers who are experts in many fields.  At Canonical you will partner with key stakeholders to build data products to support our diverse offerings - from Ubuntu Desktop and Server, cloud infrastructure at the largest scale, to open source robotics and IoT solutions.  You will be at the forefront of technical development in open source data science. As such, you will get the chance to advocate for solutions, which you help to build, at the most prestigious industrial and academic venues worldwide.  We expect   What Canonical offers   Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

About the job At Storytel we believe that powerful stories add an extra dimension to life. Storytel is one of the world’s leading audiobook and ebook streaming services and we offer listening to consumers in 25+ markets. Our vision is to make the world a more empathetic place with great stories to be shared and enjoyed by anyone, anywhere, anytime. We are now looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team.    Storytel is hiring a Senior Data Engineer to join the Data Engineering team, within the Data & Engineering Foundation domain. We are working to build the next generation data ecosystem which enables our machine learning and product teams to deliver automated insights and recommendations internally to Storytel’s internal partners and end users.       The Data Engineering team is responsible for delivering data and insights to the entire Storytel organisation. We drive the full data lifecycle, from ingestion to delivery, and help ensure that the rest of the business has the data, tools and engineering collaboration needed to help them make informed data-driven decisions. As a team we provide cross-functional competencies in data engineering as well as BI development to the rest of Storytel.    The ideal candidate has several of the following qualifications:      Moreover, collaboration will be key in everything you do, therefore humility and strong verbal and written communication skills are of utmost importance.    Storytel offers a friendly, entrepreneurial and fast-moving work environment where new ideas and creativity are welcomed. At Storytel we trust our employees and believe in their autonomy, we like doing things in new ways and questioning old methods. The Storytel culture - characterised by being welcoming and helpful - is important to us. We don’t believe in hierarchy and micromanagement; we highly believe in giving responsibility and having people grow alongside it.  We offer flexible working hours, remote working possibilities and flexible public holidays for people to celebrate what they truly believe in. And of course – you get unlimited access to audio and ebooks from our service!  This candidate will ideally be located in Copenhagen, Denmark or Stockholm, Sweden. We also welcome fully remote positions in the EU region for the right candidate. Does this sound like an opportunity for you? If you feel like Storytel is a place where you could thrive, let us know and we will contact you as soon as possible.

About the job Tycker du att marknadsföring och kommunikation verkar som en spännande bransch, och älskar att jobba med data och skapa effektfulla visualiseringar? Vill du jobba med datavisualisering, dataplattformar, data engineering och Business Intelligence?  Välkommen att ansluta till ett erfaret och växande team med analytiker och data scientists som jobbar med att driva ökad effekt av marknadsföringen för några av Sveriges och världens största varumärken.  Som en del av mediebyråkoncernen GroupM arbetar vi på Acceleration med att omvandla stora datamängder till lösningar på komplexa problemställningar inom media och marknadsföring. Projeketen inkluderar såväl implementering av dashboards, algoritmer, automatisering, statistisk analys och modeller som strategiprojekt och konsulttjänster.  Acceleration driver GroupM och resten av industrin framåt genom innovation kring teknik och data och jobbar nära de största annonsörerna, publicisterna och teknikbolagen inom industrin. Detta är en position med en uppsjö av möjligheter till tillväxt både professionellt och personligt.    Acceleration på GroupM Sverige levererar projekt och dagliga leveranser inom Data och Analys för våra mediebyråer och externa kunder och modern BI är en förutsättning för att leverera strategisk rådgivning och analys inom marknadsföring för våra klienter. Du kommer att vara ansvarig för drift och utveckling av Business Intelligence, vilket innefattar self service analytics, data engineering, dataplattformar och datavisualisering för några av nordens största företag och marknadsavdelningar  Dina huvudsakliga uppgifter kommer att vara att hantera utveckling av datamodeller, dashboards och andra tekniska lösningar för datapipelines och automatisering av data för våra kunder och interna projekt.  Hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta med många av Sveriges och världens mest ambitiösa varumärken, tillsammans med ett team som brinner för digital marknadsföring, och med marknadsledande teknologier. Du kommer att sitta i centrala lokaler på Birger Jarlsgatan med inspirerande kollegor från olika bakgrunder, som tillsammans driver digital marknadsföring till nästa nivå genom innovation och gediget arbete. Vidare finns stora möjligheter för personlig utveckling och karriärsutveckling inom GroupM Sverige, såväl som inom vårt globala nätverk.    Du är bekväm med data i alla dess former, och har lätt för att lära dig nya system och verktyg. Kunskap om media- och marknadsföringsbranschen är en fördel, men på inga sätt ett krav.  Utöver detta vill vi att du:     Vi är ett familjärt företag som är en del av WPP, en stor internationell koncern, och vi arbetar för att kombinera det bästa av dessa två världar. Du erbjuds att arbeta på en stimulerande och utvecklande arbetsplats med hög trivselfaktor och kollegor som har nära till skratt.  Förutom det självklara, som bra arbetsvillkor, trevlig arbetsmiljö och spännande utmaningar så finns det ett par saker som gör det lite extra bra att jobba här:     Du ansöker genom att registrera ditt CV och personliga brev via "Ansök nu" högst upp på denna sida. Vi önskar hitta rätt kandidat så snart som möjligt och håller intervjuer löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snabbt som möjligt.    Om du är intresserad att höra mer om denna position är du välkommen att kontakta Viktor Ahlen Director Sweden, Acceleration.

They're characterised by clear dialogue and short decision paths where their ambitious employees contribute to the bank's development with their specific skills and knowledge. job_title: Cloud Data Engineer, Professional Services, Google Cloud
job_description: About the job Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a technical or engineering field or equivalent practical experience. Experience with data processing software and data processing algorithms. Experience in writing software in one or more languages. Experience in working with technical customers. Experience in Big Data within the cloud, including data analytics/warehousing, and with database design/querying.  Preferred qualifications:     The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.  As a Cloud Data Engineer, you'll guide customers on how to ingest, store, process, analyze, and explore data on the Google Cloud Platform. You will work on data migrations and transformational projects. You will also work with customers to design large-scale data processing systems, develop data pipelines optimized for scaling, and troubleshoot potential platform issues. You'll travel to customer sites to deploy solutions and deliver workshops to educate and empower customers. Additionally, you will work closely with Product Management and Product Engineering to build and constantly drive excellence in our products.  Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.      Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

About the job Qualifications Degree educated in computer science, engineering, mathematics, or related field Business level fluency in the local language and English (verbal and written) mandatory Ability to write clean, maintainable, and robust code in Python and SQL; familiarity with Java and Scala is a plus    As a data engineer at QuantumBlack, you will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organisations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.      While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies Python, PySpark, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, Kedro (an OSS developed by QuantumBlack), container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP or Azure, and more! You'll work hands in hands with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives.

About the job Data and insight is fundamental to achieve Schibsted’s News Media strategy. In the central media insights team, our vision is to enable high quality and compliant data access in order to facilitate data driven product development and data informed decisions at all levels.  As the News Media division is converging on common infrastructure, the data sources and data warehouse solutions for separate publishers will be replaced by a common self-serve data platform. The new platform supports all teams from both central functions and local brands, such as Aftonbladet, SvD, VG, Aftenposten and more.  Schibsted promotes learning and growth, and to make sure it happens, every second Friday in our team is dedicated to learning or hacking. There are no expectations on you that anything actionable comes out of it, only that you use the time to actually learn and delve deeper into something that is meaningful to you.  As a Data Engineer, you will be a part of the team that designs, implements and maintains what will be the News Media Data Platform. The Team is located in the Shared Products & Platforms organisation (SPP) and is currently staffed with two Senior Data Engineers, three Data Analysts, and an Engineering Manager.          .

About the job Hos oss arbetar Skandinaviens främsta Data-, Analytics & AI-experter, vilket ger oss bästa möjliga förutsättningar att hjälpa våra kunder att lyckas på sin resa mot ett datadrivet beslutsfattande.  I din roll som Data Engineer hos oss kommer du att arbeta med att designa, modellera och integrera data från strukturerade- och ostrukturerade datakällor. Du kommer att bygga robusta dataflöden, att skapa effektiva datatransporter och du kommer att arbeta med att bygga dataarkitektur för Machine Learning-lösningar och BI-lösningar.  Inom Insights & Data är vi ett stort team med specialister och våra tjänster spänner över områden såsom – rådgivning, framtagning av digitala strategier och roadmaps, design och implementation av AI-, IoT-, Analytics- och Data Management-lösningar. Givetvis understött av molnarkitektur och cybersäkerhet. Vår CFO Office-funktion bidrar även med expertis inom finansiell planering, budgetering och prognos samt finansiell konsolidering och koncernrapportering. Som Data Engineer hos oss har du alltid erfarna och duktiga kollegor att ta hjälp av och vi har ett mycket nära samarbeta med alla våra produktpartners.    För denna tjänst söker vi utåtriktade, lösningsorienterade och erfarna personer (konsult eller linjebefattning) som har erfarenheter av att bygga & optimera data-pipelines, data-set och att arbeta med data via APIer. Du har även följande kompetenser:  Du har relevant högskoleutbildning och du kan svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.  Hos oss är medarbetarnas utrymme att utvecklas stort och kulturen präglas av frihet under ansvar. För dig som lockas av att vara med i Sveriges vassaste team inom Data, Analytics och AI, är detta ett jobb med framtidsmöjligheter för dig! ****

About the job Tillsammans utvecklar vi framtiden. Vill du vara med?  Stora ord, vi vet, men det är vad vi kan göra med vår kompetens i AI/Analytics-teamet!  Kort om Analytics-teamet  I teamet arbetar vi som Data Scientists och Data Engineers. I våra uppdrag bygger vi bland annat rekommendationsmodeller för streamingtjänster och förutspår arbetslöshet för att underlätta Arbetsförmedlingens arbete. I teamet har vi bakgrund från flera olika världsdelar och pratar därför engelska på våra interna möten.    Branscher som vi är verksamma inom är allt ifrån bank, finans, försäkring till underhållning och myndigheter. Den gemensamma nämnaren är oftast att det är större bolag eftersom de har en högre kvalitet på sin data.  Utöver den erfarenhet du får från ditt uppdrag vill vi såklart hjälpa dig att utvecklas! Därför har vi avsatt pengar för din kompetensutveckling och vi anordnar kontinuerligt kompetensaktiviteter där vi både tar in experter utifrån och delar kunskap mellan varandra. Sharing is caring!

job_title: System developer / Data Engineer to SEB in Stockholm
job_description: About the job SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a significant impact for our customers and colleagues.  Does that sound like a good fit for you?    Reporting Solutions at Technology Common Functions delivers IT services to most of the central financial control functions at SEB including compliance reporting to Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority. We are now in an intensive strategic development phase – collecting and refining the tools, data, and processes for migration towards Cloud.  We are looking for an experienced system developer in Oracle (PL/SQL), SAS (EG, Base, Viya, VA), Python, someone who is curious about the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and wants to grow into a role as Data Engineer/Cloud Engineer.  (Psst! If you already are an experienced Data Engineer/Data Analyst familiar with GCP – you might be the perfect fit for us! Since there are a lot of exciting things happening in our team, we also might have a role for the one who is passionate about system and server maintenance in SAS in a Linux environment. As you can hear, the possibilities are wide so let us discuss them when we meet!)       We believe that you like to find creative solutions to complex problems, like innovative modern technologies and are passionate about agile ways of working. We also believe that you are analytical, curious and have a passion for discovering new ways of working. As a person, you are communicative, driven, collaborative and a real team player. You will thrive extra well with us if you are interested in finance and asset management.  Other skills we are looking for:  It is extra meritorious if you     In this position you will be able to combine working from one of the most modern and inspiring offices, with the possibility to work from your home. You will together with your manager discuss the best set-up for you and the team before you start. Other than that, the core of our offering is:     It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.    Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 27th of August. If you have questions about the position please contact Patrick Schwalbe, Hiring manager, at patrik.schwalbe @seb.se    sebgroup.com/techcareers

About the job Data Engineer for GlobalConnect  GlobalConnect is a leading technology and telecommunications company in Northern Europe. The group delivers comprehensive communications solutions from the ground to the cloud. The solutions are based on our own infrastructure consisting of a 100,000 kilometre fibre network and 30,000 square metres of data centre. GlobalConnect has 30,000 enterprise customers covering all sectors from SMEs to the public sector and multinational companies. In the B2C segment, GlobalConnect has 420,000 customers across the Nordic region. With EQT Infrastructure as owner, GlobalConnect has launched an ambitious growth strategy, which includes investments in new infrastructure, storage and outsourcing, collaboration solutions, intelligent automation and security solutions. GlobalConnect has over 1,700 employees and a turnover of approximately SEK 6 billion in 2020, with headquarters in Stockholm, Oslo and Copenhagen.  We at GlobalConnect can offer you a flexible as well as stimulating job, where you will have great freedom to shape your own daily life and develop your skills in an inspiring and fast-paced environment.    You now have the opportunity to become part of our fantastic and fast-growing Analytics team, which currently consists of 10 people spread between Uppsala, Stockholm and Oslo. The team is responsible for the group's data platform and possesses expertise in Python, SQL, Qlik Sense, Power BI, JavaScript, GO and Azure Cloud etc. You will work with incredibly dedicated colleagues who are eager to share their knowledge and who are passionate about making GlobalConnect data-driven.  You can choose to work at our office in Uppsala or Stockholm and some time remotely.    In the role of Data Engineer, you will develop and manage our data platform VERUM. As we have built three different in-house applications for our platform here at GlobalConnect, this position will also involve system development. You will bring in new data, handle our CI/CD flows and watch over our running procedures. Furthermore, you will keep track of the data pipeline. A usual week includes both maintenance and the development of new features for our applications.    Our platform is based in Azure Cloud where we have chosen Snowflake as our data warehouse. We have Power BI as our primary front-end tool for future development, but also manage a large Qlik Sense environment. Our extract pipelines are managed and run through a team-built application developed in Python, React.js/Node.js and PostgreSQL. Our CI/CD flows are managed in GitLab.    We are looking for you with a background in data engineering or system development who is interested in leveraging data to make GlobalConnect more data-driven. You like to take responsibility for the bigger picture, are solution-oriented and eager to develop by giving to and receiving feedback from your colleagues. In addition, you are a team player.  Need to have   It is an advantage if you have a broad programming background as well as experience with JavaScript (Node.js, React.js) and data modeling.  GlobalConnect is now in an exciting phase where we are expanding to become a company across the Nordics and parts of Germany. In the coming years there will be a strong focus on automation and efficiency.  Analytics is at the heart of the company's strategy and is a prerequisite for our success. Want to join us?  We are processing applications on a rolling basis, so don't hesitate, submit your application today! If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Antonia Englert, antonia.englert@globalconnect.se This recruitment is handled by Ants.  Apply here

job_title: Graduate Program - Data Science & Machine Learning Engineer (Stockholm)
job_description: About the job Accelerate your career in Cloud with Datatonic, an award-winning Google Cloud partner!  Are you passionate about innovation within the data space? Would you like to fastrack your career at a company that has learning & development at its core, where you'll be afforded the opportunity to work alongside some hugely talented technologists? Then look no further!  The Datatonic graduate program is now in its fifth year, with an excellent track record of training and equipping graduates in disciplines such as Data Engineer, BI Analytics, Data Science, and ML Engineering.  Our October 2022 cohort will focus on the following two engineering roles:   If you're unsure which would suit you best, don't worry as we can help you determine what the most appropriate fit would be. All of the above roles are excellent entry points into the Cloud Data space - and have rewarding career paths with multiple options ahead!    The program starts with 6-weeks in our Academy, where you'll be trained by some of the best Google Cloud trainers from around the globe. Upon finishing the Academy program, you'll move into your designated team at the 'Associate' level, where you'll buddy up with senior colleagues who will support you on your ongoing journey! You'll learn a broad range of skills within your chosen discipline, using cutting-edge technologies to work on real client projects and innovative internal R&D projects.          30 days holiday in addition to bank holidays, Private Occupational Pension (Salary Sacrifice), Team Bonus payable annually, choice of laptop  : 4500 kr Private Health Insurance Allowance per year, 5000 kr Wellness Allowance per year, Employee Assistance Program  8500 kr Conference Budget + 4 days attendance per year, Access to Linux Academy, Coursera, and LinkedIn Learning  A personalised development plan to ensure you hit your professional goals with a clear roadmap for progression  The opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI and ML solutions spanning multiple industries and with market-leading organisations  Access to Datatonic LABs, our Research & Development hub. Experiment and bring forward ideas, create impactful and meaningful work in a creative and collaborative environment - even just for fun!  A mix of office and remote working, 1200 kr Home Equipment Allowance  : A welcoming and friendly team plus weekly Team Lunches and Monthly Social Events    We’re an eclectic team with lots of different interests and personalities. We have many different roles across data science, engineering, analytics, consulting, marketing, business development, and operations. We have offices in the UK, Stockholm, Geneva, Munich, and Barcelona, and we work with clients in many other European countries. We allow for flexible working hours and the possibility of remote work.  As a company, we have a strong emphasis on learning and professional development. Our core values are:    A hub for continuous learning, curiosity, developing ideas, testing things out - and then putting ‘excellence’ into practice.  Owning It  Working collaboratively in cross-functional teams to achieve customer delight. We love what we do and draw immense satisfaction from taking responsibility and seeing the results of our work.    Creating positive change for our customers, using the most relevant machine learning and analytics approaches and the best technologies to meet real business needs.    Our business has been built on great partnerships and open-source collaboration. It’s one thing to be successful, but to do it in partnership with great people and other great companies is even better in our opinion.

We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities across the world. We already have more than 100 production partners in 34 countries. About the job I en värld som svämmar över av oanvänt data har Sogeti tagit på sig ansvaret att konvertera denna valuta till verkligt värde. Just nu händer mycket inom AI och vi söker framtidens talanger inom området. Blir du exalterad av tanken av informationshantering och alla dess möjligheter? Då är denna roll nästa steg för dig!  Sogeti befinner sig i en expansiv fas inom Artificiell Intelligens där vi ligger i framkant hos våra kunder med att erbjuda de senaste lösningarna och teknikerna inom AI, Analytics, Masterdata, Business Intelligence och Integration. Nu söker vi fler talanger för att växa teamet av vassa konsulter inom nämnda områden som vill vara med och bygga och utveckla framtidens lösningar på de problem som finns i samhället. Vi tror starkt på att framtiden handlar om informationshantering, och där kommer du att spela en nyckelroll med dina kollegor för att ta fram innovativa lösningar.  Våra konsulter är vår viktigaste tillgång, och därför satsar vi hårt på individens utveckling. Vi gör allt för att just du ska utvecklas i den riktning du önskar, och därför ser vi till att du får arbeta med de uppdrag du brinner för samt att vi möjliggör utbildningar och certifieringar för din fortsatta utveckling. Utöver detta lägger vi stor vikt vid teamkänslan och att ha kul på jobbet.    Med ditt driv och engagemang samt sinne för problemlösning tror vi att du kommer lyckas galant i denna roll!  Vi erbjuder utöver härliga kollegor och en rolig samt utvecklande arbetsplats ett kompetensnätverk där din utveckling är prioriterad. Även om samarbete är kärnan i vårt sätt att arbeta ser vi även till individuella behov med ett flexibelt förmånspaket som du kan skräddarsy för att passa just dig.

About the job We’re creating our own future  At Volvo Cars, we are making bold digital visions come true. We aim to be the leader in the automotive world by creating a digital ecosystem built around making our customers' lives less complicated. What we all have in common at Volvo Cars is our passion for protecting lives, our endless curiosity, and our dedication to create a new future for the automotive industry. Our human centric focus is what separates us from all other car companies.  Would you like to influence and craft the technical strategy that helps Volvo Cars to grow and reach our goal of being an electric car company by 2030?  Excellent, then we would like you to join our Cluster as Senior Data Engineer!  The Data & Identity Cluster is a part of the Global Online Experience (GOX) area and our mission is to ensure we know our customers well and keep this information safe and secure. We support the rest of the organisation in using this knowledge to serve the customers in the best possible way. We’re looking for someone that will help us craft a world class data ecosystem that spans across multiple product teams and clusters. We have only just begun this journey in earnest, and you’ll be joining us at a time where you can really have a great impact and help us set the tone for the next chapter in our company's history!          For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Senior Tech Recruiter, Noopur Thatte at noopur.thatte@volvocars.com . Please note that applications via email will not be accepted. Please note that this position is open for several of our locations.    Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.  Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

About the job MAJORITY is a groundbreaking digital banking service for migrants, nomads, internationals and immigrants. Our all-in-one membership includes an FDIC-insured account, Visa® Prepaid card, international money transfers, cross-border, bill pay solutions and international calling. We are built for migrants, by migrants.  Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are following their dreams, love or new experiences, more and more of us are leaning towards new environments. Our purpose at MAJORITY is to empower the amazing, the brave, and the talented and help them achieve all of their ambitions. We believe that everyone deserves the same opportunity to succeed. Our mission is to provide migrants the tools to thrive in their new country. Come join us!    As our Senior Data Engineer, you will be a part of the data team where you will play a key role in bringing our data stack to the next level. This is a highly impactful role where you can take the lead in driving the direction of the technical architecture and roadmap for the company. In our data team you can work with everything from integrating with APIs with AWS Lambdas to advanced SQL queries and data streams.  Our data platform is key in helping migrants from all over the world!  Current stack: Snowflake, dbt_, Looker, Airflow, AWS (Kinesis, S3, Lamda), Terraform

About the job We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to take a crucial part in our data journey. We are developing our data platform with Snowflake and dbt core in the center and you should be familiar and have experience with both. You will work in a remote team of data engineers, software engineers, data scientists & BI developers. In this role, you will be responsible for growing, maintaining and optimising the core architecture for our data products that are business critical for Qliro. Our mission is to build a company wide data platform using Snowflake, dbt and Airflow.  Snowflake, dbt, Airflow, Docker, AWS & New Relic    Passionate about solving complex problems and building awesome data products with strong ELT knowledge, ensuring quality ensured data and information. You are someone who continuously seeks improvements, enjoys learning new tools and techniques and having fun together as a data team. You are logical and analytical minded and are able to communicate technical content to end users. Have strong knowledge in the data and information management area and have worked with data technologies, preferably within financial and/or related industries. Proficient in verbal and written English and enjoys working in a remote team.  Qliro offers a dynamic and fast-paced Fintech environment with teams of driven and flexible individuals. We thrive on challenges and personal growth. Together, we will ensure we continue to create WOW in everything we do.

job_title: Senior/Junior Business Analyst in the Financial Crime Risk Data Development unit
job_description: About the job Job ID: 8470  Would you like to play a significant cross-functional role across several segments and business areas, in defining Financial Crime Risk Reporting data for the Bank, automating data and Financial Crime reporting through data sourcing, visualisation tool development and providing ad hoc data analysis? We are now looking for an Analyst to perform such tasks.  At Nordea, we’re committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you’ll have an impact on how we do banking – today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.    In Group Financial Crime Prevention unit we work with securing insightful, impactful best practices to secure we are able to manage, monitor and mitigate financial crime risks in Nordea.  Welcome to the Financial Crime Risk Data Development team. We add value by playing a significant cross-functional role across several segments and business areas in providing timely and insightful reporting, while enhancing Nordea’s Control Environment and reducing its Inherent Risk as part of Financial Crime Strategy.    The role is based in Nordics, Estonia or Poland.    Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.      If this sounds like you, get in touch!    Submit your application no later than 04/09/2022. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Lirong Yang at Lirong.yang@nordea.com.  At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are. About the job Hi! Before diving into the job details, let's give you some context on who we are and what to expect when joining the team.  Typeform has seen significant change since it was founded 10 years ago. We’re expanding from a small Barcelona-based business to a truly international and remote company. Our vision is a world of more personal business relationships. We believe we can create that world by living our mission: .  To do so, we look for people who are curious, ready to own their objectives, and passionate about taking organizations to their next chapter. But we are aware it’s not for everyone, our environment is perfect for those willing to become a change agent and roll up their sleeves to build our rocket ship.    At Typeform, the Data team is making data our #1 asset. And we know how important that is— our product helps people collect information in the best way possible, by making it conversational.  The Core Analytics team has the mission of speeding up Typeformers' decisions by providing reliable data that's easy to consume. The team focuses on maintaining & evolving our data warehouse as well as connecting it with Looker - our visualisation tool. Within the team you will work with our Data Warehouse Architects and Analytics Engineers and also collaborate with Funnel Analytics, Product Analytics, Data Platform, and Data Science teams on scalable analytics solutions.  That's why we need you. We're looking for a Data Visualisation Engineer - Looker to work within the Core Analytics team.  Things you will do:   What you already bring to the table:      To fulfill our vision and mission ), our 500 remote Typeformers from 55 different countries come together to live up and deliver on that promise.  As a remote-first company, we can hire in Spain, the United States, the United Kingdom, Colombia, France, Germany, Ireland, the Netherlands, Poland and Portugal. The location is to be subjected to change, depending on the role.  With our (future) Typeformers, we will accelerate our product development, nurture emerging technologies, expand headcount, and deepen strategic partnerships across our platform with this investment.  Why? Simply because 89% of companies say online is their principal customer interaction channel.  Yet, only 34% of companies treat customers as unique individuals.

job_title: Customer Engineer, Smart Analytics, Google Cloud
job_description: About the job Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, or equivalent practical experience. Experience with analytic warehouse solutions, data movement from data stores into analytic warehouses, and with performance/scalability optimizations. Experience in implementing analytics systems architecture and cloud computing.  Preferred qualifications:     When leading companies choose Google Cloud it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.  As a Customer Engineer, you'll engage with customers to understand their business and technical requirements, and present practical and useful solutions on Google Cloud. In this role, you will work with the Sales team to introduce Google Cloud to our customers. You'll help prospective customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, explain technical features, and problem-solve any potential roadblocks.  Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.      Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

About the job Join a global Insurance and Banking company that is migrating their platform to Azure.  They're looking for a skilled data passionate to help them set up and drive the next generation of Business Intelligence and Analytics platforms, allowing them to be truly data driven and create a more stable foundation for the business.  Their focus on innovative solutions are key in this development phase as they transition to cloud. They're characterised by clear dialogue and short decision paths where their ambitious employees contribute to the company's development with their specific skills and knowledge.  You will be responsible for the Data Warehouse, which includes pulling data and reports from the DW, monitoring data quality, optimising ETL pipelines and integration using the Microsoft BI stack. You'll also be an integral part of the team that drives their migration to Azure, so experience in (or a curiosity to work with) cloud is an added bonus!  Due to the strong feedback loop and collab with other teams in the business, you'll get the opportunity to really shape their data landscape, and will genuinely see the impact of your work on the wider business.          Yes? Then apply to this advert and we can schedule in a chat to go into even further depth of how these guys are making a difference.  I am also available on 46 8-502 425 38 and m.mcdermott@nigelfrank.com, or you can find me on LinkedIn ( https://bit.ly/2TORgSb )

About the job Data Engineer | Microsoft, Azure |  This position is for a Nordic leader in service management industry with an aim to improve Nordic working culture and environments. They have a complex and modern Data ecosystem with a team of 15 BI and Data people which includes Data Engineers, Data Scientists and BI Developers (both internal and consultants).  Their modern cloud platform is in Azure, using Synapse, Data Lake and Data Factory and as the Data Engineer you will take responsibility of ensuring they have a stable and high-quality solution while following IT Security standards. You will also be working with automation, data modelling, data warehousing, building data pipelines, ETL, analysing data and working alongside other teams across the IT Group and Business representatives to drive overall data success across the business.  On top of this, they have a fantastic culture where there is a strong feedback loop and the chance to very clearly see your effect on the wider business and stakeholders. About the job What We Do At Detectify  The fear of cyber threats should never stand in the way of digital greatness. That is why we are changing the fundamentals of how cyber security works. We collaborate with ethical hackers to build a powerful platform that automates and scales crowdsourced vulnerability research.  For us, security is not just about protecting what you have but more so a tool to achieve what you want. At Detectify, your opinion and ideas matter. You belong to a dedicated, driven and forever curious team that recognises the power of knowledge sharing and challenging the status quo.  We value diversity of minds, different backgrounds, and perspectives. We are all here because we want to make a positive impact in the world. If you are collaborative and passionate about what you do, then you too could be a Detectifyer.    In engineering and product we strive to create an enabling, empowered culture where you have the ability to make use of all your skills and personality. A fun and engaging environment where we can have open and passionate discussions to learn and grow together. A highly diverse culture allowing all genders, preferences, personalities and backgrounds to thrive.  You will be part of the Data team, which works horizontally throughout the company to promote a data-driven culture and its mission is to enable other teams by providing access to information and recommendations to promote impactful decisions.    In this role you will have the unique opportunity to work in a team that is responsible for the development, automation and scaling of data services. Your stakeholders will be data scientists and analysts, as well as anyone else in the company that has any interest in access to data.  As a Data Engineer at Detectify, you will handle the growth and performance of the data infrastructure, including:   Together with your fellow data engineers, you will own the data infrastructure and take the responsibility to design, develop and maintain it as you see best fit internal business needs and industry practice. If you are eager to be challenged, challenge the way we work and have an impact on how we work with data, we think that this is the right place for you.  Our data infrastructure is built on an event-sourcing architecture and deployed in the AWS cloud. Some of the technologies we use are S3, Kubernetes, Glue, Athena, Firehose, Elasticsearch, Docker, PostgreSQL, Looker and Luigi. Our infrastructure is entirely written in python.    You are a creative person who sets and achieves ambitious goals in a collaborative and challenging environment. You continuously evaluate and reflect on your own solutions and seek recommendations to improve your skills. Furthermore, you have no problems speaking to different stakeholders within the organization.       If you wish to be a part of this innovative, problem-solving tech team and help developers to build a more secure internet, send us your contact details through the application below and we'll take it from there. This is going to be fun!    This position is for the Stockholm office. We offer remote working, with access to our office in central Stockholm. We think you should be able to work from anywhere but for tax reasons we need you to be located in Sweden, and we are more than happy to help you relocate.

About the job Vill du skapa molnlösningar för några av Sveriges största företag? Vi söker dig som håller koll på de senaste tekniska trenderna och sätter kvalitet högt när du implementerar det bästa molnet har att erbjuda. Du älskar att skapa värde genom att sammanställa, bearbeta och använda stora mängder data!  Think. Make. Shift  Knowit Experience Stockholm är arbetsplatsen för dig som njuter av uppstartsfasen i projekt, som älskar att gå på djupet och samla så många insikter du kan. Som sedan lika peppad sätter dig för att lösa identifierade problem och skapa helt nya vägar. Du arbetar med personer som har helt olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter. Du är en del av en större digital byrå, samtidigt som du tillhör ett mindre tvärfunktionellt team och alltid kan bolla frågor med ditt kompetensnätverk.    Som Google Cloud Partner och Google Marketing Platform Partner kommer du använda tjänster från Googles universum för att utnyttja potentialen hos data från en mängd olika oberoende källor och system. Rollen innebär en hög grad av frihet under ansvar och ett stort inflytande på hur teamet ska utvecklas och drivas i framtiden. Tillsammans med cirka 150 duktiga kollegor här i Stockholm kommer du att arbeta för att positionera Knowit Experience som bäst i stan på att skapa datadrivna kundupplevelser. Du kommer att arbeta nära bland annat analytiker, strateger, utvecklare och designers.     Du guidar och stöttar med lätthet våra kunder i att dra nytta av större delar i Google Cloud-erbjudandet. Du omvärldsbevakar och utforskar möjligheterna i Google Cloud, för att kunna leda teamet i rätt riktning.       Det största vi har att erbjuda dig är våra fantastiska medarbetare. Vi stöttar, sporrar och lär av varandra hela tiden. Du får all möjlighet att ta plats, växa och skapa din framtid hos oss – vi värdesätter dina initiativ! Du kommer att ha varierade uppgifter samtidigt som du själv är med och styr din vardag. Distans eller på kontoret? En mix, vi är flexibla. Våra lokaler är moderna och trevliga, anpassade efter olika sorters arbete – fokuserat själv och tillsammans i mötesrum anpassade för kreativa workshops. Kontoret ligger ett stenkast från Centralen och Sergels torg med gym, trevliga restauranger och shopping runt knuten.  Knowit Experience Stockholm är ett självständigt bolag och en del av Knowit-koncernen. Känslan att vara en del av ett litet team, fast med stora karriärmöjligheter och närmare 4 000 kollegor att inspireras av.  Tjänsten är på heltid och tillträdesdatum kommer vi överens om men vi ser gärna att du börjar snarast möjligt. Vi jobbar med löpande urval och ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan. Kanske ses vi över en kopp kaffe eller i ett digitalt möte!     At Knowit we breath development, both professional and personal. In our innovative and fast-moving environment we see that development take place in the meeting between responsible leaders and coworkers. Our different abilities and perspectives empower us to challenge our customers and in close collaboration build better digital solutions. With 3,800 digitalization consultants in six countries we enable a sustainable development of our society. We are makers of a sustainable future.

About the job Come work with us and join our team! We are an engaged, tech-savvy, fun and kind group of people that are focusing on basically everything related to Google Cloud. We are involved in everything from selling Google Cloud related projects to working on clients’ transformations to architecting solutions to building IaC with Terraform to integrating BigQuery with data sources and building pipelines. You get the picture.  If you are interested in working with Google Cloud in a friendly team with clients that are disrupting the market, and you appreciate learning new things then stop looking. Accenture's Google Cloud Business Group (AGBG) is Google’s #1 business partner globally. We are collaborating closely with our global expert networks in areas such as Google Cloud and Industry specifics. You will be an integral member in our entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business.  We are looking for a tech-savvy, kind, curious, engaged data engineer and possibly who has previous experience in GCP that wants to work with us and build an exciting career within Accenture together with a mentor.  As a Google Cloud Data Engineer, you help our clients to democratize their data to enable data-driven decision making. You will be responsible for designing and developing data solutions such as data sinks, data pipelines and data warehouses using GCP tools like Pub/Sub, Dataflow, BigQuery etc. This is an exceptional opportunity to grow technical skills in some of the market’s biggest and toughest challenges.

Would you like to influence and craft the technical strategy that helps Volvo Cars to grow and reach our goal of being an electric car company by 2030? Excellent, then we would like you to join our Cluster as Data Engineer!  The Data & Identity Cluster is a part of the Global Online Experience (GOX) area and our mission is to ensure we know our customers well and keep this information safe and secure. We support the rest of the organisation in using this knowledge to serve the customers in the best possible way. We’re looking for someone that will help us craft a world class data ecosystem that spans across multiple product teams and clusters. We have only just begun this journey in earnest, and you’ll be joining us at a time where you can really have a great impact and help us set the tone for the next chapter in our company's history! Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. job_title: IT - Produktägare till Ving (Data och Analys)
job_description: About the job Om Ving  Ving ingår i ett nordiskt reseföretag (Nordic Leisure Travel Group) som har huvudkontoret på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. IT-avdelningen har all utveckling nära verksamheten på huvudkontoret. Beslutsvägarna är korta och IT är en integrerad del av företaget.  Vårt arbetssätt  Vi jobbar agilt med ramverket SAFe i tvåveckorssprintar med Continuos Delivery där teamen levererar sin kod direkt till produktionsmiljön. Teamen ansvarar för hela kedjan från kravförståelse, utveckling, produktionssättning till förvaltning och support.  Om tjänsten  Till Ving söker vi nu en engagerad Produktägare till vårt agila team som ansvarar för området Data och Analys (Business Intelligence).  Hos oss kallar vi rollen för TBO - Team Backlog Owner.    I den här tjänsten så kommer du att arbeta med det bästa du vet, data och analys tillsammans med ett mycket kompetent team.  Din profil  Vi söker dig som har en förmåga att arbeta proaktivt, se helheten och inte minst hur saker är beroende av och påverkar varandra. Du är driven, ansvarstagande, engagerad och har goda kommunikativa egenskaper. Du trivs med att äga och driva initiativ.  Du brinner för förbättring och att skapa den bästa användar- och kundupplevelsen. Du är nyfiken och har anammat ett bra arbetssätt med snabba feedbackloopar för att säkra att teamet är på rätt väg.  Du har en god fallenhet att kommunicera kring lösningar på såväl affärsnivå som teknisk nivå. Du kommer ha många olika kontaktytor inom och utom leveransorganisationen varför det är viktigt att du även har en social förmåga och god förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift. Att förstå danska och norska underlättar din vardag.      Vi erbjuder  Du får ett stimulerande jobb på en arbetsplats där IT jobbar tätt ihop med verksamheten. Vi har bra stöd för vårt agila arbetssätt. Vi har roligt, bryr oss om varandra och är engagerade i vårt arbete.  Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får goda möjligheter till en intern karriär. Hos oss får du som anställd unika reseförmåner då vi tycker det är viktigt att du ska få uppleva de bästa veckorna på året som vi levererar. Du får bra tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag samt möjlighet till vinstutdelning om alla våra insatser leder till ett bra ekonomiskt resultat.  Vi har dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa!  Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst på Vings huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Vi arbetar minst 3 dagar i veckan på plats på kontoret och har möjlighet att arbeta från annan plats 2 dagar i veckan.  Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Carolina Thörne på carolina.thorne@ving.se eller 0709-51 34 06. Intervjuer sker löpande.  Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
