About the job Analytics Engineer for GlobalConnect  GlobalConnect is a leading technology and telecommunications company in Northern Europe. The group delivers comprehensive communications solutions from the ground to the cloud. The solutions are based on our own infrastructure consisting of a 93,600 kilometer fiber network and 30,000 square meters of data center. GlobalConnect has 30,000 enterprise customers, covering all sectors from SMEs to the public sector and multinationals, and in the B2C segment, GlobalConnect has 420,000 customers across the Nordic region. With EQT Infrastructure as owner, GlobalConnect has launched an ambitious growth strategy, which includes investments in new infrastructure, storage and outsourcing, collaboration solutions, intelligent automation and security solutions. GlobalConnect has over 1700 employees and a turnover of approximately SEK 6 billion in 2020, with headquarters in Stockholm, Oslo and Copenhagen.  We can offer you a flexible as well as stimulating job, where you will have great freedom to shape your own daily life and develop your skills in an inspiring and fast-paced environment.  The team  You now have the opportunity to become part of our fantastic and fast-growing Analytics team, which currently consists of 11 people spread between Uppsala, Stockholm and Oslo. The team is responsible for the group's data platform and possesses expertise in Python, SQL, QlikSense, Power BI, JavaScript, GO and Azure Cloud etc. You will work with incredibly dedicated colleagues who are eager to share their knowledge and who are passionate about making GlobalConnect data-driven.  You can choose to work at our office in Uppsala or Stockholm and sometime remotely.    As an , you will have the opportunity to be the link between data engineers and analysts. You will work with data modeling and inspire analysts by creating appealing and advanced data visualizations in Power BI/QlikSense. Moreover, you will translate business requests into data models and dashboards. You will also drive our journey towards self-service analytics by educating and inspiring our users.  Technology Stack  Our platform is based in Azure Cloud where we have chosen Snowflake as our data warehouse. We have Power BI as our primary front-end tool for future development, but also manage a large Qlik Sense environment. Our extract pipelines are run by a proprietary application built in Python and React/Node.js. Our CI/CD flows are managed in GitLab.  Who you are  You are used to working with relational databases and normalized data models. Furthermore, you have experience of building compelling dashboards in Power BI. You have an interest in data and a passion for creating business value from data. You have a good business mindset, are service-oriented and have good communication skills. In addition, you are a team player.  Your skills   GlobalConnect is now in an exciting phase where we are expanding to become a company across the Nordics and parts of Germany. In the coming years there will be a strong focus on automation and efficiency.  Analytics is at the heart of the company's strategy and is a prerequisite for our success. Want to join us?  We are processing applications on a rolling basis, so don't hesitate, submit your application today! If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Antonia Englert, antonia.englert@globalconnect.se  This recruitment process is handled by Ants, apply here.

About the job Nu söker vi på Svenska Spel en ny kollega till domänen Martech (Marketing Technology) för att komplettera befintligt team med rutin och teknisk kompetens. Martech handlar om att synka system, teknik, data, analys och kundinsikt för en förbättrad kundupplevelse. Vi vill arbeta i tvärfunktionella team som drivs av att skapa kund- och affärsnytta i en legalt och tekniskt utmanande värld, detta för att rätt kund ska få rätt budskap, i rätt kanal och vid rätt tidpunkt. Hos oss får du inte bara möjlighet att hänga med i den tekniska utvecklingen – du får vara med och driva den framåt!    I rollen som Data Engineer hos oss på Martech ansvarar du för våra dataflöden, datalager och deras integrationer. Du är med och hanterar vår kunddataplattform för digital marknadsföring och sköter hantering, modellering och segmentering av data. På Svenska Spel och Martech vill vi demokratisera data och på den resan blir du en av nyckelspelarna genom ditt djupdykande inom rättighetshantering, datastyrning, datavalidering och som ett stöd till våra utvecklare. Vad gäller produktspecifika anpassningar och specifik systemexpertis så är det något du självklart kan lära dig av oss som en del av din egen utveckling.  Du jobbar i nära samarbete med arkitekter, kravledare, test och andra interna och externa leverantörer i en agil miljö. För att lyckas kommer du och affären resonera kring de behov som finns och lyfta dessa till nästa nivå.  Eftersom vi utgår mer och mer från data när vi designar våra lösningar så kommer du ha en viktig roll i att se till att Svenska Spels Martech-lösningar förädlas på ett bra sätt över tid. Detta är ett starkt bidrag i vår förflyttning till att få en ytterst användbar helhetsbild av våra kunder.    Vi tror att du är en nyfiken person och har koll på vad som händer i Data-världen. Du tycker inte att förändringar är obehagliga utan snarare inspirerande och en drivkraft i ditt arbete. Det är viktigt att du är engagerad, kundorienterad och har ett intresse för att utvecklas både som person och yrkesmässigt.  Utöver ovanstående sitter du på följande erfarenheter och kompetenser  Det är även meriterande om du tidigare jobbat med någon form av kunddatabas (CDP/CXP) eller Adobe Experience Platform.    På Svenska Spel hanterar vi 10 000 000 transaktioner varje dag, året runt och på sex dagar har vi hanterat samma transaktionsvolym som den största pengaöverföringsappen gör på en månad. Varje dag utvecklar, driftar och supportar vi ett av världens mest avancerade spelsystem, vi är med andra ord ett techbolag som sysslar med spel - inte tvärtom. Och som ett techbolag som sysslar med spel kommer ett ansvar, både för folks drömmar och spänning, men även för deras spelande. Det är också därför du kommer märka att vårt spelansvarsarbete genomsyrar hela företaget från första dagen du börjar jobba hos oss.    Vi är modiga, nyfikna och vi strävar efter enkelhet i allt vi gör. Vi vill att spel ska vara till glädje för alla – för våra medarbetare, kunder och gäster, för idrotten och för samhället i stort. Vi sponsrar idrottsrörelsen på alla nivåer, förebygger spelproblem och låter vinsten gå tillbaka till samhället.  Är du nyfiken på våra förmåner? Då hittar du dem här:  https://career.svenskaspel.se/pages/formaner    Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering där det passar dig bäst. Vi har kontor i Visby och i Solna och det vore förstås toppen om du bodde i närheten men det går också bra att utföra arbetet hemifrån någon annanstans i Sverige.  Vi utför intervjuer och urval löpande så tveka in med att skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.  För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Erik Andersson, Chef MarTech, erik.andersson@svenskaspel.se  För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Team Talent Acquisition, teamta@svenskaspel.se

About the job Job ID: 11982  Data Analyst, IT Analyst, BI Specialist, Data Modeller, Data Specialist  We are now looking for candidates to perform data analysis and transform data models. You will be working as an interface between business and IT to help translate the business requirements into IT mappings, as well as design data integrations.  At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.    Welcome to the IT Analysis Data Warehouse Design team. We provide data platform experts to a variety of internal projects in a capability based model. You will be allocated to a project in credit technology where we are working to transform the bank’s credit systems. We specialize in data integration, data analysis, data modelling, and data architecture. As IT Analyst you will play a crucial role in project development lifecycle. The data warehouses you will work on are primarily built in Snowflake, Teradata, or Oracle. Your role as IT Analyst will help us greatly in understanding the information available to us and also help the technical team in building optimal solutions.    You'll join an international team without boundaries. We are spread across 4 countries with diverse backgrounds and one thing in common: Passion for data. The role is based in Stockholm; Helsinki; Warsaw; Gdansk.    Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best- and that we imagine you share with us.      If this sounds like you, get in touch!    At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

About the job User Platform (UP) is a tribe in Spotify's Platform mission. The Platform mission is responsible for building the tooling and support platforms for the engineering teams at Spotify. UP owns the platforms for authentication, authorization, user account data and user experience configuration at Spotify.  We are looking for talented, engaged software engineers to join our teams who are passionate about working on large and highly available data sets that form the backbone of our product experience for hundreds of millions of users across the globe. At peak, we serve >2m requests per second to power tens of teams within Spotify and handle serving >3TB of user data to live services. You will also be able to innovate to build better, more flawless user experiences to help users access Spotify.  What you’ll do   Who you are   Where you'll be   Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.  Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.    Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.

job_description: About the job This client are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join their team. You will be a part of the growing insights team and work closely with the product, marketing and business team to empower data driven decisions. About the job Till flera nya projekt under hösten söker vi nu erfarna konsulter inom MDM – Master Data management. För dessa spännande projekt behöver vi stärka upp vårt MDM-team med både utvecklare, projektledare och Business Analysts.  Hos oss arbetar några av Nordens främsta experter inom Data, Analytics & AI, vilket ger oss bästa möjliga förutsättningar att hjälpa våra kunder att lyckas på sin resa mot ett datadrivet beslutsfattande.  Vi bistår våra uppdragsgivare med datadriven affärs- och verksamhetsutveckling hela vägen från strategiska vägval till implementerad lösning och realiserad nytta.  Inom Insights & Data är vi ett stort team med specialister och våra tjänster spänner över områden såsom – rådgivning, framtagning av digitala strategier och roadmaps, design och implementation av AI-, IoT-, Analytics- och Data Management-lösningar. Givetvis understött av molnarkitektur och cybersäkerhet. Vår CFO Office-funktion bidrar även med expertis inom finansiell planering, budgetering och prognos samt finansiell konsolidering och koncernrapportering.    Vi söker nu dig som har flera års erfarenhet inom området MDM – Master Data Management i roller som utvecklare, projektledare och/eller Business Analyst. Du har erfarenhet ifrån ett antal olika MDM projekt och du är van att arbeta med kunder i olika branscher och inom olika funktioner.  Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med olika MDM verktyg, där minst ett av dom är Profisee eller Informatica. Vi tror även att du har lång erfarenhet av att arbeta med SQL.  Det är viktigt att du är analytisk, lösningsorienterad och nyfiken, att du har en god samarbetsförmåga samt lätt för att kommunicera. Du har relevant högskoleutbildning och du kan svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.  Hos oss är medarbetarnas utrymme att utvecklas stort och kulturen präglas av frihet under ansvar. För dig som lockas av att vara med i Sveriges vassaste team inom Data, Analytics och AI, är detta ett jobb med framtidsmöjligheter för dig.

About the job Starting salary of 80,000 - 84,000 USD per annum in a zero-tax environment.  Job Location: Dubai, UAE  About Cobblestone  Cobblestone Energy is an independent trading firm. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading. Although we have experienced very strong growth so far, we are still near the start of our journey. We have ambitions to go a lot further.  Energy in one form or another is fundamental to almost all the world's economic activities. By understanding the demand, supply, and logistics of these commodities, we can better understand the world.  We specialise in the proprietary trading of the short-term wholesale electricity markets across Europe. We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country and growing every day. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.  Over the years we have grown organically. As part of our journey to be the best in all markets we enter, we would like to welcome a Data Engineer into our team. They will already be on a successful career path and looking to take the next step with increased responsibility and be a part of our growth story.       At Cobblestone Energy we are on a mission to build the most advanced European electricity trading and analytics platform, with our technology being used by our teams of commercial traders to create significant value. Being the Data Engineer of our team, you will work on exciting challenges that come with large-scale data processing, automation, and analytics. We work in an agile and highly collaborative environment and challenge the norms of traditional business leadership. We are looking for enthusiastic and resourceful engineers who are passionate about building highly reliable and performance data processing solutions. You want to help the commercial team make data-informed decisions, have a curious mindset, and are motivated to understand our business better. Developing a strong domain knowledge of our industry over time is key to long term success in this role.  This is a rare opportunity to take a leading role in the growth of a major player in the European Electricity Markets. We are looking for someone who would be committed to the long-term success of the business. We operate in the European Energy markets, but our commercial trading operations are in Dubai, UAE.  We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our Tech team at Cobblestone Energy. You will be responsible for building our data pipelines and you will be also participating in setting the right Infrastructure and developing the needed tools for our Analytics.  If you have excellent data engineering skills, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for developing applications utilizing cutting edge technologies, then we would like to meet you.             Who is Elexon? For the UK market, they are the system administrator.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A5j-S6VGqpw#action=share  Some general information about electricity trading arrangements in the UK  https://youtu.be/UDv04q3U6e0  Elexon sushi video. Tries to explain the balancing of the UK's electricity grid  https://vimeo.com/65768597  The videos above are UK centric, but our current interest is Europe wide. Feel free to research the other markets. This is a longer video that to me explains why there is such large opportunity going forward for the electricity traders who are able to efficiently analyse supply and demand fundamentals and move power between countries, for the benefit of all.  https://youtu.be/gacGuWjqKco  Once Europe is conquered, we do genuinely intend on going global. The American power markets look next on the plate, followed by the Australian and Japanese.

About the job About ROYC  ROYC is a new WealthTech company that specialises in digitalised asset management solutions for private investors and partner banks.  Operations are underway in London, Sweden, Norway, Denmark and the rest of Europe.  Royc is discreet but passionate about helping investors enrich and diversify their portfolios, and we are excited for the role we will play in developing investment opportunities in the near future.  We are in a take off phase of our company’s journey that focuses on new product development and international expansion.  During 2022, ROYC raised one of the largest seed rounds in Europe.  This funding round was made possible due to the established and respected advisory network of the founding team.  The team has an unquestionable track-record at the pinnacle of international private equity, fintech and banking.    You will be a part of our product development team and build with the latest software platforms which runs using the cutting edge technologies offered within Amazon web services.  We are building on top of server-less lambdas, stateless data storage and evaluating the uses of AWS managed blockchain in combination by implementing a pioneering feature toggle tenant setup.       In the product development team it is about user centricity, alignment, integrity and innovation. We have a flexible working environment where you would work closely with people pushing the boundaries of the wealth-tech space . If you like to innovate and use modern technology and want to avoid legacy code, you would fit well here. We don't have heavy decision making processes and aim to have fun whilst expanding the capabilities of the business.    We are a diverse multi-disciplinary and international team of people who bring creativity, energy, and excellence to every situation. It's a fun start-up atmosphere in a scale-up environment with a short path from idea to action. We offer flexibility, lovely breakfasts, fun team activities and after works, the MAXIMUM legal wellness allowance and actively support work-life balance.    This is a full-time, permanent position based in central Stockholm. We are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.  ROYC celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.

About the job Job Description  Do you love working with data and feel good about making a genuine human impact? Do you want to develop and refine your skills at one of the world's leading digital innovators?  Avanade is a world-leading provider of innovative solutions based on Microsoft's ecosystem with the goal of enabling our customers to achieve more and be successful in their business. We are growing and are looking for a highly driven and skilled to join our Data & AI team. We’ll surround you with people who are as passionate about technology and innovation as you are.  Why Avanade? Because there´s literally no place like this!  We have two parent companies that give us a strong Microsoft ecosystem with space to be ourselves. People who thrive here are motivated, interested in learning and genuinely have a desire to be the best at what they do. If that sounds like you, then we’re the perfect match. You’ll have access to the latest technology in the Microsoft ecosystem, partnering with some of the biggest and best companies across the world and some seriously smart people to work with to make career-defining things happen. If you want to get even better at what you do and transform businesses from the inside out, there’s no better place. At Avanade Sweden, you get the opportunity to work with the latest technology in socially beneficial projects. Additionally, we help you reach your full potential so that you grow and develop.  We can offer a position in a great team of diverse backgrounds, skills, and experiences, where you will work with some of the largest organizations and companies in Sweden or internationally. As part of a global company, there are plenty of opportunities to collaborate with and learn from colleagues from all over the world. This collaboration can be both in technical or more social form, Avanade has several programs and employee resource groups dedicated to supporting minority groups (women, LGBT+, BIPOC) and volunteering / corporate citizenships.    First of all, we believe you´re passionate about deriving insights through data and have a problem-solving attitude. You like to work in teams but also enjoy the challenge to delve into difficult tasks alone, always knowing that Avanade´s global community of experienced Data & AI experts are within your grasp.  As a Senior Data Engineer your responsibilities will be developing and expanding our client's data and data pipeline architecture. As a data wrangler and data pipeline builder you will optimize data flows and the collection of data from the ground up. In your role you will often support multi-functional teams as well as software developers, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and ensure consistent data delivery throughout the entirety of a project.  At times be involved in presale activities including client meetings, workshops and internal Avanade bid processes where you work with your sales team and technical consultants to transition sales from qualification to closing.  At Avanade we like the art of consulting, analyzing background data to shape and deliver the message to our client. Long experience is of course merit, but above all, we are looking for the right person who has a good balance of drive, experience, forward-thinking and technical knowledge. We believe you communicate difficult matters with ease at every level, ranging from operational to executive.    You will be working on highly complex projects for some of Sweden’s most well-known companies, all while developing your own career. As a team who loves technology, we have fun together both in our daily work and during our social activities after hours. So, we hope you like so be part of a diverse team where everybody has a lot to contribute with - including yourself!  Day to day, you will:    Is this you or could it be you with the help of our unlimited learning?    Even though we have a flexible working remote policy, we expect you to be based in Sweden. Most of our clients are based in Stockholm or Gothenburg, so we expect you to visit them as they request to provide excelent consultancy services .  Did you get interested? Apply today!      Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 56,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.  We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.  We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.  Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

About the job HAYPP GROUP  We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.  Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in 9 countries where we serve more than 300 000 active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches as well as Swedish style snus online. With our headquarters located on Birger Jarlsgatan in Stockholm we are 140 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.  If you are interested in hearing more, watch our CEO Gavin O’Dowd explaining more about Haypp Group here: Haypp Group - A Brief Introduction    We are looking for a skilled Web Analyst to focus on understanding the customer journey and behaviour in our web stores and how we can improve the user experience. You will ensure that our data in Google Analytics is correct and secure and that we optimize implementation to improve tracking as we now are migrating into GA 4. We are on a journey of becoming more data driven and basing decisions on insights from data and customer behaviour. You will help us develop this way of working with e.g. Google analytics, SEO tools, CRM tools etc.  The demand for healthier alternatives to smoking has never been higher. We currently have 10 different e-commerce sites with 16 different store fronts on 6 different markets. To make Haypp Group excel you’ll work closely with all other functions within our digital marketing department, but also with a lot of other stakeholders around the organization. As we are scaling there is a lot of potential, both in terms of growing on a personal level, but also in getting opportunities to work with completely new and unexplored markets.       We believe you are a web savvy person with a general understanding of online tactics. You are into the numbers, analytical, creative, curious and dare to try new things.  In order to succeed in this role, we believe that you possess the following qualifications:     We are a values driven company with our values , , and at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.  Because we recognise that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:     We hope that you are enjoying summer vacations as much as we are. As we are taking a short break, our response on your application will be somewhat delayed. Talk more in August!  If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!  Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you a great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.  If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Max Moen at max.moen@hayppgroup.com. We are looking forward to hearing from you!

About the job Northvolt is looking for a Database Engineer ( Linux )to join our Digitalization Platform team. As a Database engineer, you will be contributing towards building the first set of large scale European battery factories (Northvolt will build a total of 5 Gigafactory’s across Europe in the next few years with a total of 170GWH output ), which will play an important role in the transformation to a carbon free society.  Northvolt Ett, Northvolt’s first Gigafactory in Europe, sets a global example in the world of manufacturing with its cloud-first strategy, also referred to as the next-gen connected factory, or Industry 4.0 . To build this connected factory, Northvolt is extensively using Amazon Web Services (AWS) for modern cloud capabilities. Using the higher levels of abstractions provided by modern cloud services allows us to increase developer productivity, operational effectiveness, security, and reliability. Examples include detailed product traceability, near-real-time monitoring of manufacturing line effectiveness, computer vision powered defect detection, and machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) modeling to predict quality and performance of the produced battery cells. Check out this blogpost on our blueprint strategy for our factories.    We work with a "cloud-first"-mindset which presents us with unique and interesting challenges, pushing the traditional ways of working in manufacturing. We have a ruthless focus on automating all our (development) processes, helping us to deliver value to our customers as quickly as possible.  Currently we are a team of 12 engineers focusing on a wide variety of technologies including Kubernetes (EKS & k3s), backend development, frontend development, networking, serverless, embedded Linux and anything security. We work in an agile framework, with a product owner who demonstrates confidence in our ability to do the job, and with hands-on experience to chip into our discussions. We work as a cross-functional team, where we collaborate tightly to have a common view on our strategy and the recommendations we provide. Far from the ivory towers, we work closely with the product teams to provide guidance based on need, ensuring coherence and hands on development of shared components.  In general you have a long experience in the field and have been driving large, innovative and challenging database projects with high demands on reliability and availability.  Northvolt is a data driven company with a "cloud first" strategy, meaning we have a lot of data streaming from our factories to our cloud environments. Storing and managing this data, making it available for different types of consumers is key to our success.    We rely on many different databases and data stores, as often as possible using hosted services, or running in kubernetes.    The person we are looking for is strongly goal oriented, curious and eager to learn. You will get the chance to have a real impact on our success story in Sweden (to start with) and see the results of your work. Our organization requires and values great self-discipline and a natural talent to make things happen. The DBA is a vital member of the Platform team and key to Northvolt's mission to enable the future of energy.  Apply with CV and cover letter or your complete LinkedIn profile.  Full time employment, fixed salary.  Planned starting date is asap.

About the job Do you wish to play an active part in building healthy, sustainable environments? At Wavin, we have a ‘calling’ … to service. A purpose. To build healthy, sustainable environments. And where is our help most needed? The very places we live in: our cities. Our cities’ drinking water is leaking away, greenery has been disappearing, streets are flooding after heavy rainfall and its sewer systems are outdated, polluting our groundwater. It’s time to join forces and build long-lasting cities. It’s time for you to join our team!

job_title: Coffee loving Data & BI Engineer at Espresso House
job_description: About the job Are you a big fan of great coffee with tons of variations? Maybe a sweet tooth hungry for a salad now and then? If You feel like enjoying this in an ethical way, working for a better tomorrow You should join our team. We are looking for an experienced data – BI engineer with an analytical mind. A social and communicative coffee drinker with a deep understanding of database system, especially SQL. As our data and BI engineer, you will be handling our data architecture and enterprise data warehouse. You will be that colleague that supports several stakeholders with key figures from our critical data.    You will contribute to our continued success by maintaining and develop a robust and resilient data architecture that scales with the business needs, and thereby enabling and encouraging a data driven culture. A key role as this concerns several stakeholders with different business needs. Your primary role will be to enable data access to different stakeholders in the organization. In this role you will develop and maintain EHs databases, EDW (enterprise data warehouse), data pipelines, integrations, and our internal business platform-Qlik Sense. You will be the product owner of our internal BI platform and you will be the one prioritizing and delivering all projects from maintenance to largescale developments along with a team of external BI consultants that you will lead and work with on a daily basis. You will be communicating with key stakeholders and translating business requirements into technical and actionable specifications based on their requirements.  In this role You will be the one supporting all our markets and work cross functional to help Espresso House achieve its goals. You will be a part of the IT/digital division and report to our CTO.  Some of your key activities will also include:     As a Data & BI Engineer you have extensive experience in BI and good understanding of data integration and data warehouse. Experience similar to Qlik Sense is very valuable. You have BI knowledge in SQL and can create tables, make transforms, and manipulate and refine data. You are familiar with and understand how to modulate and transform data and have good knowledge of how ETL tools work to be successful You need very good understanding of APIs such as REST, SOAP, GRAF QL or similar.  You have probably worked a couple of years, or more, as a Data / BI Engineer or in a similar role. You have proven experience from working with:   To be successful in this role we believe you must also be able to program and design structures in SQL and NoSQL.  If you also have experience within Python, data pipelines and big data those are good merits as well as certificates from cloud services such as Microsoft Azure or AWS.  Obviously, you like coffee, it does not matter what type (we can provide). Besides being a java lover, we believe you are a communicative leader and have a great understanding of business intelligence with analytical skills. You have a strong sense of ownership and great ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. While creating a leaf or heart in your caffè latte, problem solving and strategic thinking comes natural to you. Our written and spoken language is English which you are fluent in, a little Swedish is good to know because our BI system is created in Swedish.  In this recruitment, we collaborate with Wise IT. If you want to know more about the job, contact the responsible recruitment consultant, Alexander Lindgren 0760 00 18 26  Unfortunately, Wise IT cannot accept applications via email, as they protect your personal privacy. You can read more about how they process personal data according to GDPR in https://www.wisegroup.se/gdpr/  Selection is ongoing.    At Espresso House Group, we are passionate about coffee, people, and the planet. We strive above all to create the world’s best coffee experience for the world’s best guest, and to do so in a way that is ethical, sustainable, and ensures a great tomorrow. Everything we do at our offices supports our coffee shops and helps them continuously create and reinvent a world class coffee experience.

As a BI Consultant at Bricobomba, you will be part of an innovative team. job_title: Site Reliability Engineer – Data & Analytics at SEB in Stockholm
job_description: About the job SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues.  Our tribe Data and Analytics lead all parts of SEB in becoming a data driven company, and we are looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to strengthen our team in Stockholm working in the area of large-scale data solutions    You will be part of our Data Lake Platform Foundation team with the mission to provide a future-proof, reliable and efficient data platform for SEB. Together with your colleagues you will be responsible for data storage, batch processing and operations, workflow automation and orchestration, monitoring, hybrid cloud integration with GCP and much more. Everything with security and automation in mind. You will have the opportunity to broaden your competence and will be given a generous amount of time for your own ideas and projects.  We belong to the SEB Data & Analytics tribe, an international environment with multiple agile development teams located in Stockholm and Vilnius, consisting of experts in various Big Data technologies.  In order to thrive here you should be interested in data engineering and like finding creative solutions to complex problems. If you are analytical, curious and have a passion for discovering new ways of working, you will enjoy it here.        It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.      Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to our journey. Since we select candidates on running bases, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2022-09-28. If you have questions about the position, please contact hiring manager: Mattias Kumlin, mattias.kumlin@seb.se . SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.    sebgroup.com/techcareers

About the job We are looking for a Senior Workday Analyst to join the band as part of our Global HR Information Systems team. This team member will play a central role in the HR Information Systems roadmap, be a part of a hard-working team, and work within an award-winning HR function.  In today’s sophisticated business environment, an organization’s resourcefulness, agility, and ability to lead constant change through innovation are the keys to success. We are looking for a forward-thinking problem solver with superb communication skills. Come join the band!  What you'll do   Who you are   Where you'll be   Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.  Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.    Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.

job_description: About the job Your Role at Cabot Cabot Corporation is seeking a Data Engineer to join the Data & Analytics and IPA team within the Digital Organization. This position plays the important role of bridging the gap between our business stakeholders and third-party implementation team and will be key to the continued successful implementation of the Cabot RENEW Digitalization project. The Data and Analytics team supports key initiatives that accelerate the development of the data management platforms and architecture (Master Data Management, Data Quality Monitoring, Data Governance and Advanced Analytics). The Data Engineer will collaborate with various stakeholders across the Company to deliver reporting solutions and facilitate seamless data access across the corporate functions and plant solutions landscape This role requires familiarity with BI, Data Warehousing, ETL, relational database concepts as well as experience in the data and analytics domain. Reporting to the Senior Director of Data and Analytics and IPA, the Data Engineer must have a passion for data and deep understanding of data concepts and modeling. The ideal candidate has experience understanding process and reporting needs in a manufacturing organization and will support Cabot in becoming a data driven organization by stewardship of data hygiene, security, and compliance .

About the job We have established a new data science practice at Canonical. The team will innovate in the open source data science technology stack, deliver advanced business analytics, support product roadmap decisions for Canonical through actionable insights, and lead by example in setting and publicly advocating for industry standards in open source data science.  The team will have both Data Scientists and Data Engineers, apply here if you are most excited about the Data Engineer role!  As a Data Engineer at Canonical you will act as a technical expert in an exciting field at the intersection of data engineering, data science, and machine learning technologies, with particular emphasis on the open source ecosystem of Canonical and Ubuntu. You will drive the organisation, instrumentation, ingestion, and transformation of data from a wide range of sources in the company.  You will deploy and evaluate machine learning models at scale on cutting-edge infrastructure, and contribute to open source data platforms and MLOps cloud solutions. This work requires proactive collaboration in a worldwide distributed team of engineers who are experts in many fields.  At Canonical you will partner with key stakeholders to build data products to support our diverse offerings - from Ubuntu Desktop and Server, cloud infrastructure at the largest scale, to open source robotics and IoT solutions.  You will be at the forefront of technical development in open source data science. As such, you will get the chance to advocate for solutions, which you help to build, at the most prestigious industrial and academic venues worldwide.  We expect   What Canonical offers   Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world’s best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

About the job If you are passionate about data and want to be part of shaping the future of Trygg Hansa / part of Tryg, then we would like to hear from you! Come help us to create value out of data and maintain our edge in operating a fast Datawarehouse.  Trygg Hansa has a long tradition for working with data  We have used this ability to implement efficient financial closing processes that enable us to publish our financial results before any other listed company in the Nordics.  As more companies and branches are added to the group we need to extend and mature our solution even further.  which in collaboration with our sourcing partner is delivering application maintenance, development and a number of projects. The position will initially be related to an ongoing project pertaining to a new claims system in Tryg / Trygg Hansa.  The position is located in Stockholm, Sweden, but a low level of travelling to Denmark and Norway is expected.   In your role you will be given full responsibility for integrating one or more data sources into our data warehouse. This work comprises several disciplines such as data profiling, understanding of the target data model and ETL development. As the best solutions are developed in collaboration, you will get to engage with people throughout the organization. You will be joining a team which is spread across multiple countries, such as Norway, Denmark, Sweden, and India. Depending on your level of experience and your personal skills and interests it will be possible to obtain a delivery responsibility for an offshore team.  The position is primarily as a developer, but some operational support may be required.   We have recently migrated our on-premise Exadata stack to Oracle Cloud (OCI). We have been using Oracle Warehouse Builder (OWB), but we are on a path of transitioning into other ETL-tools. It is of course an advantage if you can demonstrate experience with these technologies, but your curiosity and willingness to learn is equally appreciated.  You most likely have a background in Computer Science or a related technical field. You may have worked with data warehousing and business intelligence. Solid experience with data analysis, Oracle, SQL, ETL-development and/or PL-SQL is needed but it can be developed given good analytical skills and a “can-do” attitude.  As a person you are engaged and have a collaborative attitude, as we believe that this is key to drive success in our partly outsourced setup. You are persistent in meeting your targets and deadlines even under difficult conditions.   We look forward to your application! Please submit it via the link below. We urge you to apply as soon as possible, but no later than 2022-08-28.  For specific questions about the position, please contact Peter Lundberg +46 70 168 35 61 / peter.lundberg@trygghansa.se or Per Jensen +45 418 62 174 / p.j@tryg.dk   Lena Darin, 070-168 28 44  Christer Bjellert, 070-168 28 06

About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Job Description Airmee is a well-capitalized start-up that is looking for an extremely talented database engineer to work on some of the most complex problems in the world and help revolutionize logistics. You must have experience designing and building large and complex (yet maintainable) systems. Airmee is one Sweden's fastest growing logistics startups focusing on fast and convenient deliveries for retailers and other businesses. Our technology that optimizes our logistics fleet in real-time is based on our world-leading research at KTH allows us to do this more cost-efficiently and environmentally sustainably than anyone else. What're we looking for? We're looking for a Database Engineer who will be part of the team in charge of internationally scaling the services offered by Airmee. The tasks include database design and development, as well as scaling up our infrastructure to handle ever increasing data loads. The API is built using NodeJS Amazon Lambdas (Serverless) and the database that provides the functions consumed via the API is built in PostgreSQL. The system infrastructure is hosted on AWS. You are used to TDD since we aim at having 100% test coverage. We put a great focus on good documentation and code readability, so we expect you to write clean code and properly document it. You are comfortable working with staging and production environments. You have considerable experience maintaining and scaling up databases, in particular on indexing databases and managing connection pooling and latency. You have top-notch communication skills and work ethic. Skills & Requirements BASIC QUALIFICATIONS - a minimum of 5 years of experience managing large scale relational databases - experience working with database multitenancy - experience working with large scale database indexing, database replication and high availability databases - experience working with large volumes of spatial data, e.g., in PostGIS - experience working with caches in front of databases for load offsetting - have used pgTAP (for Postgres) in previous projects - have experience handling PostgreSQL instances hosted on AWS RDS - have experience monitoring and setting up alarms and relevant action points to be proactive for performance and connection issues - comfortable working with agile methods PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS - have at least one project on a public repository (any sharable repository would work) - 2 years of experience with JS and NodeJS - experience working with Serverless technology, ideally on AWS Lambdas that make use of database connections - you are a contributor to the open source community - have used the PostGIS spatial extension for PostgreSQL for more than 5 years - have used pgTAP (for Postgres) in previous projects to prevent performance regressions Why join us? You will be working with talented, motivated, intense, and interesting co-workers. Being part of a startup in its growth phase you will have the opportunity to influence the culture and build a team around you. You will also have a lot of freedom in how to execute tasks. It’s easier to invent the future than to predict it.” - Alan Kay

About the job At Trustly, we’re passionate about simplifying the way people pay and get paid online. We’re a licensed payment institution and our B2B products available across Europe, North America and Australia attract global merchants in segments such as e-commerce, telecom, travel, financial services, and gaming. In June 2018, private equity firm Nordic Capital acquired a majority stake in Trustly with ambitions to support us in becoming the leading global online banking payments provider.      Trustly is growing rapidly and we work continuously to maintain, improve and modernize the current product platform. We are very humble and grateful that our products are attracting more and more customers in e-commerce, travel, gaming, and financial services. Due to the fast growth of our business and the number of transactions we are looking for Database Developers to join our team.  In this position, you will work with new development as well as maintenance of our transaction system. Most of Trustly's backend system is written using an extensive collection of PostgreSQL functions, SQL & PL/pgSQL, as well as other languages, where appropriate, to implement the business logic. For future work, however, we have decided on SQL, PL/pgSQL & Python3. The team is experienced and several developers are active in the PostgreSQL Community and have contributed to the DB Core. job_title: Förvaltningsledare/ Business Analyst inom Analytics - Stockholm/Göteborg/ Malmö
job_description: About the job På Capgemini Insights & Data arbetar några av Nordens och världens främsta Data-, Analytics & AI-experter. Det ger oss bästa möjliga förutsättningar att hjälpa våra kunder att lyckas på sin resa mot ett datadrivet beslutsfattande.  Vårt fokus på att leverera värde och att hjälpa våra kunder realisera sina mål inom Analytics fortsätter att generera nya samarbeten och förtroenden. För att kunna möta våra kunders behov behöver vi nu förstärka vårt team med ytterligare en Förvaltningsledare/ Business Analyst.  I din roll kommer du att driva leveranser mot våra kunder. Det kan röra sig om förvaltning & vidareutveckling av datalager, analytics-lösningar och strategi- och roadmap-framtagning. Du är en van ledare och drivs av att skapa effektiva team och bidra till att ge våra konsulter bästa möjliga förutsättningar för att tillsammans åstadkomma smarta lösningar och bra leveranser.  Som BA kommer du att arbeta med att hjälpa våra kunder att förstå, kartlägga och kravställa olika behov och möjligheter kring BI/ Analytics. Du kommer att hjälpa kunderna att prioritera och utvärdera olika möjligheter och du kommer att coacha olika personer och funktioner kring hur de kan bli mer datadrivna och effektiva med hjälp av Analytics-lösningar.  I vissa leveranser kommer du att ha en kombinerad Förvaltningsledare/Business analyst-roll, medan du i andra projekt kommer att ha en renodlad roll som Förvaltningsledare eller Business Analyst.  Hos Capgemini Insights & Data får du vidareutveckla både din affärsmässiga och din tekniska sida. Vi erbjuder en trivsam arbetsmiljö där gemenskap och teamkänsla är lika viktigt som den enskilda prestationen. På Capgemini är medarbetarens utrymme att utvecklas stort och kulturen präglas av frihet under ansvar.    Vi söker nu dig som är erfaren inom Business Intelligence, Data Management och/eller Data Science och som vill fortsätta utvecklas och ta nästa steg. Vi ser gärna att du har relevant högskoleutbildning, erfarenhet av att arbeta som konsult och att utveckla kundrelationer. Du trivs med att driva olika dialoger och du är van att hålla workshops och presentationer.  För att vara framgångsrik i rollen bör du tidigare arbetat ett antal år som konsult inom BI/Analytics och på senare år har du gått över till att arbeta mer med projektledning, rådgivning och gärna även förändringsledning. Du har en bra affärsförståelse och en gedigen teknisk förståelse inom Analytics.     Som person är du driven, verksamhetsorienterad och du trivs lika bra med att arbeta självständigt som i grupp. Du sätter stort fokus på dialogen med kund, men är även intresserad av att engagera dig i att utveckla oss till att bli en ännu bättre arbetsplats. Det är viktigt att du är analytisk, lösningsorienterad och nyfiken, att du har en god samarbetsförmåga, vana att leda samt lätt för att kommunicera. Därtill är det meriterande om du har erfarenhet av eller intresse för att hålla utbildningar och workshops.  Det är viktigt att du behärskar svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift, då vi har en nära dialog med våra kunder.  Inom Capgemini Insights & Data är vi ett stort team med specialister och våra tjänster spänner över områden såsom – rådgivning, framtagning av digitala strategier och roadmaps, design och implementation av AI-, IoT-, Analytics- och Data Management-lösningar. Givetvis understött av molnarkitektur och cybersäkerhet. Som ett konsultbolag inom IT är vi smala, med vår nisch mot Analytics, men inom Analytics är vi breda. För dig som lockas av att vara med i ett av Sveriges och Nordens vassaste team inom Analytics är detta ett jobb för dig!

About the job Bluestep is a dedicated, solution-oriented lender offering mortgages loans in Sweden, Norway and Finland. We also offer retail deposits at highly competitive rates in Sweden and Norway. We strive to ensure we are a transparent bank, and we therefore make relevant policies, targets and results available to both our customers and to the market  Our vision is to increase financial inclusion in society in a responsible way; by embracing our customers' differences and focusing on their future potential. We are passionate about enabling more people to get a mortgage. We are a digital first bank. We are Bluestep Bank.    The Digital Analyst is a central role for the whole marketing team. We have an extremely data driven approach to everything we do. Accurate data and insights are at the core of our daily life and are imperative in keeping us moving forward with the customer centric focus that we aim for. The marketing team is an agile, fast moving, fantastic group of people that work, win and learn together.  The focus of the analyst role is to collect, interpret and bring understanding around data and to support the marketing team with correct data and ongoing analysis. This is to ensure that we take appropriate actions based on data. You will be responsible for maintaining the quality of our data. Your everyday tools are: Google Analytics, Tag Manager, Data Studio and Power BI to name a few.       You are well versed around digital marketing channels and attribution models. But you are now ready to move beyond the tools to make it understandable also for a less digital audience. This role works with many different stakeholders, and you will connect with the entire company to really understand our customers as well as our products. You enjoy interaction with people and are not afraid to ask the questions you need. We think that you enjoy team work, but can also hold your own. You are organized, structured and have your own internal drive to both start and finish things. In short: we believe that you are curious a self-starter that make things happen!       As part of our company, you will be part of an open-minded and inclusive culture, characterized by engagement and innovation where we dare to challenge and change. We believe in the values of co-operation and different perspectives. For the right person, we provide great opportunities for an exciting career. Welcome as you are.

About the job Din vardag  Analytics och ny teknik är ett spännande och växande hos oss på Lantmännen IT och därför vill vi nu förstärka vårt team med en BI-utvecklare. Teamet Analytics & Ny Teknik ansvarar för BI och analyslösningar inom hela Lantmännenkoncernen. Som Dataingenjör kommer du att arbeta i ett team tillsammans med två andra BI-utvecklare, arkitekt, analyslösningsspecialister och produktägare.  Här får du möjlighet att utveckla dina kunskaper med dedikerade kollegor i ett team med stor laganda som strävar efter samarbete och kunskapsdelning. Vi arbetar efter agila arbetssätt.  Datadriven affärsutveckling är en strategi på Lantmännen och som vår BI-utvecklare kommer du att arbeta nära verksamheten gällande krav, design, utveckling och underhåll av Analytics-lösningarna inom Lantmännenkoncernen. Du kommer att arbeta från back-end till visualisering och använda de senaste molnteknikerna i Azure. Du kommer också att ha möjlighet att vara involverad i spännande projekt med hjälp av molnteknik, maskininlärning, IoT och andra nya teknologier för att stödja ett datadrivet sätt att arbeta i verksamheten.    Som person tror vi att du är driven och nyfiken. Du är intresserad av hur data och analyser kan bidra till att skapa möjligheter och värde för verksamheten. Du är en stark kommunikatör som tycker om att samarbeta i team och bygga långvariga relationer, är inte rädd för att utmana och rekommenderar gärna förbättringar. Ett analytiskt tänkande med ett lösningsorienterat sätt gör dig till en strukturerad person med ett kritiskt öga för detaljer.       Vi är en stor internationell koncern med mångsidig verksamhet genom hela spannmålsvärdekedjan – från själva grodden på fältet till maten på våra bord. Med ett brett utbud av verksamheter inom livsmedel, jordbruk, maskiner, bioenergi och fastigheter erbjuder vi karriärmöjligheter i alla riktningar över branscher, länder, företag och kompetensområden.  I denna rekrytering samarbetar Lantmännen med Wise IT. Välkommen att kontakta rekryterare Josefine Lindborg vid frågor. josefine.lindborg@wiseit.se. Inga ansökningar via mail. Pga. sommar och semester kan utval och intervjuer dröja längre än vanligt.

About the job Vi utvecklar den analytiska förmågan hos modiga företag  Alla som arbetar hos oss på Kayenta har lång erfarenhet av analytisk förflyttning och arbetar ofta i gränslandet mellan verksamhet och IT. Kundernas efterfrågan på det vi gör ökar kraftigt, därför utökar vi nu vår konsultgrupp med ytterligare en ny härlig medarbetare med stort engagemang för det vi gör. Kayenta erbjuder en utvecklingsresa där du kommer att få lära dig om flera nya verksamheter och ny teknik där dina insatser kommer att ge långvarig effekt för våra kunder.  Vi lägger stort värde i dina personliga egenskaper. Vi är ett prestigelöst gäng med mycket stort intresse för det vi gör. På Kayenta är det viktigt att ha roligt på jobbet och här är alla delaktiga i att driva bolaget framåt. Hos oss får du arbeta med allt från att vara delaktig i att få in nya uppdrag till att genomföra uppdrag ute hos kunderna. Som person är det viktigt att du är social, nätverkande, strukturerad, analytisk/logisk och noggrann. Du behöver ha en god förmåga att samarbeta med andra och upplevas som en god kommunikatör. Att ha drivet och engagemanget är ngt vi premierar starkt.    Som konsult hos oss hjälper du våra kunder att utveckla deras analytiska förmåga i förändrings- samt utvecklingsprojekt inom analytics-området. Arbetet sker främst ute hos kunderna men visst arbete sker även från vårt kontor. I rollen kommer du att vara drivande i att etablera nya förmågor för hur kunderna ska realisera sin vision för hur de jobbar med data. Det sker genom att tillsammans i ett team implementera tekniska lösningar som stöttar kundens analytiska resa med syfte att öka deras förmåga att fatta datadrivna beslut.  Många av våra kunder genomför just nu stora moderniseringsresor vilket ställer höga krav på vårt kunnande gällande både arbetssätt och teknik. Du kommer i ditt arbete ha nära samverkan med verksamheten hos Kayentas kunder då vi alltid jobbar med att stötta beslutsfattande i kundernas huvudprocesser. Våra långsiktiga kundrelationer gör att du kommer att ha en stor möjlighet att påverka både arbetssätt, road map samt hur arbetet med arkitekturen framöver ska se ut.    För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande flerårig erfarenhet av arbete inom analytics, SQL-utveckling och databaser, rapportutveckling eller ledarskap som delivery lead eller produktägare. Det är meriterande med erfarenhet av samt ett stort intresse för arbete med arkitektur. Att föra aktiv dialog med verksamheten rörande behov kopplade till analys är ett krav. Du kan ha erfarenhet av olika BI-lösningar såsom MS BI, Tableau, Qlick el dyl.  Ifall du har erfarenhet av någon/några av nedan ser vi det som mycket meriterande.   Vidare har du god kommunikationsförmåga i såväl svenska som engelska, i både tal och skrift.

About the job WELCOME TO UTOPIA  Music is incredible. It can excite hundreds, and unite thousands. But as an industry, it has been slow, complicated, and disparate. While the tech world has moved into the future, the music industry continues to be shaped by inefficient systems of the past. At Utopia we believe there is a better way. Which is why today we are setting out to transform the entire industry; creating new revenue streams, consolidating the data and decluttering the admin. Unlocking the industry’s full potential by unifying it all in one truly holistic space. Some might call that a Utopia.  Funnily enough, so do we.    The open secret is that the music industry is struggling with the very basics of music accounting: What was played, when and where? Who should get paid and how much?  Utopia Music is bridging the data gap by connecting global consumption, accurate metadata, and fast payments to an industry-wide trust platform. Our goal is to unlock creative value and enable to make a better world for Music. The solutions we offer do not threaten to usurp the role of industry incumbents - it is about bringing transparency in the industry and supporting efficient royalty collection for all.    At Utopia we continuously evaluate the value of music catalogs and would like to go from monitoring towards forecasting. To this end, we would like you to help us build a forecasting engine that, based on previous metrics from a song’s or an artist’s performance can predict the future evolution of a song’s/artist’s performance and accompanying financial metrics.  For this position, we are looking for people with a track record in time series analysis, forecasting / predictive analytics who can devise and prototype such an engine, given the manyfold data streams we receive as input. This engine is then going to be built together with you in a team of engineers and data scientists / data engineers.  The mission is to build a reliable, scalable solution for forecasting a catalog’s value.              As we want to bring transparency, trust, and clarity to the music industry we serve, we know a change comes from within. Utopia is a transparent, trust-based organization striving to have clarity in thinking and doing what we set out to do.  We execute urgently and innovate to grow faster. We ship things that make a difference today, so we can make them better tomorrow. We embrace fairness and are all accountable.  Strictly diverse and inclusive.  We celebrate our diverse backgrounds and we welcome everyone who identifies with the above to apply.  We’re eager to meet :)  Utopia Music is a Swiss Music fintech company through clear, transparent, and reliable data-based solutions. We support the whole Industry to make more money, faster, with less costs, and less errors.  In Utopia, the Industry sees market opportunities live. Investors elevate Music catalogs into a real asset class. Collection societies track more and spend less. Labels, publishers, and distributors simplify and enhance their business. And everyone gets Fair Pay for Every Play.  Utopia is serving the music copyrights and the industry from creation to consumption, and will never compete against it. It means that we will never own copyrights. We will never be owned by the major stakeholders of the industry. We will never share or sell data of our customers to anyone else.

job_description: About the job SEB is a leading financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. If you also have knowledge in .NET, C# and/or in SSIS, SSRS that is a plus. We see that you have experience maintaining applications from development or requirement perspective, maybe a history in a back office role. You have a structured approach. Experience working with both business and technology-oriented people is desired. You have ability to communicate in Swedish as well as in English.  We are looking for someone that meet several of the following criteria:     Ready to join?  Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute. Feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2022-09-16. Due to summer vacation we initiate selection process in full during the end of August. If you have questions about the position, please contact Tomas Bonderud, Team Manager PMPF at phone no +46 761 62 63 64 or by mail Tomas.Bonderud@seb.se.  SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.    sebgroup.com/techcareers
