About the job Position Description  At CGI our approach is what sets us apart and we’re excited to be creating more opportunities in Stockholm.  We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists on data initiatives and will ensure optimal data delivery is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You will join our growing Financial Services unit in Stockholm and will be working with some of CGI’s key Banking clients on global market leading solutions. When you start your CGI story, not only will you be improving people’s lives, you can be sure we’ll do the same for you.  Your future duties and responsibilities  You will work in a really cool team that is tasked with creating and managing Data/Information infrastructure and tools, typically designing and building data pipelines and platforms. As a member of our team at CGI, you will get the chance to influence and make a difference on a global arena but with a local base in Stockholm. We will challenge you and we will provide you with an excellent opportunity to build your future career.  To be able to succeed in the role, we are looking for you who have strong drive with client focused mindset; have experience with popular data warehouse, like Redshift / BigQuery / Snowflake; have experience with AWS/Azure/GCP cloud services.  In this role, you will need to:        We look forward to hearing from you! If there is still something you are wondering about, feel free to contact Vishal Khaparde, Director Consulting Services, at: vishal.khaparde@cgi.com.  Travel is included in the role.  Background checks and security checks may be required.  Read more about CGI: www.cgi.se    CGI's combination of global and local presence, with offices in 30 locations in Sweden, provides satisfied clients but also means that you as an employee always have an office near you. This in combination with flexible working hours gives you the opportunity for a balance between private life and work, no matter where in life you are.  At CGI, there are also great opportunities for internal career paths where you can choose to become a specialist in your field, broaden yourself in new areas or take a senior position  Benefits for our employees:     While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.  When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today — one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.  At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.  Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI — where your ideas and actions make a difference.

job_title: Business Analyst at Sales and Customer Relationship (CR) to SEB Kort in Stockholm
job_description: About the job Are you are a true data-minded person with interest and knowledge in business and sales? Can you convert numbers and statistics into trends, process improvements and result? Then this job is for you!  Numbers, statistics and data has never been more valuable. To know your business and to be true customer-centric, data is key. In order to meet the ever changing digital environment we are now looking for a Business Analyst to Sales and Customer Relationship (CR) in SEB Kort.  What you will be doing  As today’s sales organization are increasingly reliant on data and technology, we need to continuously optimize our processes, enablers and way of working to improve efficiency and meet the customer needs.  The SEB Kort business is cross Nordic, enabling synergies in sales channels, digital solutions, processes and most importantly – a holistic customer view regardless channel of choice.  You will be part of a Martech and Sales Analyst team and work closely with our sales teams. By continuously optimizing the sales process through data and tools, the aim is to provide strategic insight, best practices to guide training, and technology to drive performance.  Tasks and responsibility:  The role can be positioned either in Stockholm, Oslo, Copenhagen or Helsinki.  Who we are looking for  To succeed you need to love numbers, be proactive and able to suggest improvements towards management, be creative and able to think outside the box, have collaboration skills, self-driven, have analytic skills and the ability to translate numbers into trends, customer behavior and then communicate this internally in the organization. You need to be able to combine internal and external data sources, and have a clear business mind.  You are a structured and well organized person with good communication skills. You have an academic education or equivalent degree with at least three years’ experience of data analytics and/or Business Intelligence work, preferably within sales. You are fluent in written and spoken English and at least one more of the Nordic languages.  What we offer  It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.  Great people often know great people – please share if you have a friend who would love this job.  Ready to join?  Attach your CV and a short personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to Sales and CR, SEB Kort. Since we select candidates on running basis, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 31 August. If you have questions about the position, please contact Stefan Söderberg, Head of Digital Sales, at +46 707 39 13 90 or by e-mail Stefan.soderberg@seb.se.  SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment

About the job Who's behind Deel?  We're a global team that loves to build and solve problems, especially when it comes to the world of remote work. Made up of self-driven people spanning 150+ countries, Deel's unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and improving.  Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we're building the tools to make that a reality. Our market-leading tech, expertise, and, most importantly, the team are crucial. As a whole, we find fulfillment in working together towards our shared mission.    A significant shift has occurred within today's workforce, and with it, business as we know it has drastically changed. At Deel, we see a world without hiring borders, but we needed to find a solution to make it happen. A 30-mile hiring radius should no longer limit how companies hire because great talent lives everywhere. Deel exists to stay on top (and ahead) of the accelerating global talent market by offering global teams all the tools needed to hire, manage, pay, and scale at rocket speed.  And speaking of scale, Deel has officially raised $425 million in Series D funding, bringing our valuation to $5.5 billion. There's never been a more exciting time to join Deel - the market leader in international payroll and compliance.             At Deel, our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are, no matter their location. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all. Because a good life brings great innovation.     Perks are nice, but perks don’t make a company or individual successful - the work does. At Deel, we’re building technology and products to engage the ever-changing global workforce and to ensure businesses may hire anyone anywhere. While you’re building for our customers, we’re building for you.

About the job We are looking for a DataOps Engineer to take a crucial part in our data infrastructure and our data platform that impacts the way our 2,5 million customers handle their payments. We are developing our data platform with dbt & Airflow running on AWS and our data engineers working on Snowflake. You will work in a remote team of data engineers, software engineers & BI developers.  In this role, you will be responsible for growing, maintaining and optimising the core data infrastructure for our data products that are business critical for Qliro. You will be leading and driving our data infrastructure on AWS with focus on maturing dbt within Qliro to support both Data Engineers, BI Developers, Analysts and Data Scientists. You will also maintain and optimise Airflow and our streaming data solutions in Kafka and Kinesis.    Snowflake, dbt, Airflow, Docker, Kafka, Kinesis, AWS & New Relic        Passionate about solving complex problems and building awesome data infrastructure with strong coding skills, ensuring our data platform and infrastructure is built for robustness and scale. You are someone who continuously seeks improvements, enjoys learning new tools and techniques and having fun together as a data team.  You are logical and analytical minded and are able to communicate technical content to end users. Have strong knowledge in the data infrastructure area and have worked with data technologies, preferably within financial and/or related industries.  Proficient in verbal and written English and enjoys working in a remote team.    Qliro is the place for you who are curious, passionate and love collaboration. Together we have the power to create wow in everything we do. Feel comfortable being you, bringing your own unique perspectives. At Qliro there is a place for you whoever you are. Differences are a strength.  We love flexibility and remote work, we also believe in the power of meeting in real life. With a mix of working remote and collaborating in the office, we believe in a flexible workplace that suits you and Qliro.

About the job Business Analyst for a global leader in business decisioning data and analytics.  They've been dominating this market for almost 20 centuries and work with an incredibly strong portfolio of clients (including almost all of the Fortune 500), therefore building a fantastic reputation and working with some cutting edge methods and tools.  Although they're a global company with a presence across the entirety of Europe and the Nordics, they have a great culture with a real feeling that what you're doing is making an impact. This is because you're working directly with stakeholders and clients to understand the data and provide business-impacting solutions.  Data is at the very core of what they do, so if you're passionate about data-driven decisions within the consumer market and seeing how data can improve businesses from the inside-out, then this is the place for you.  As the Senior Associate you will be working alongside the Data Science and Analytics Advisory teams to help understand data needs and deliver on projects for both B2C customers and internally.  Main responsibilities include:  Analyze large datasets with different types of data sources as well as several different types of customer data. Each project solves different needs, but we deliver predictive models, segmentations, profiling, campaign and channel analyzes, follow-ups and tests.  Prioritize and lead their ambitious development agenda - not a project management position but will be working a lot with investigating what can be done in projects and then prioritizing. Involved in customer interviews to understand this.  Be a key player in our collaboration with other teams and stakeholders (eg Product, Advisory, Sales etc)  Involved in running scripts, handling data and working Excel  The Analytics team want to cover the blanks and help their customers understand these missing data points, by predicting the data.  The Analytics team is split into 3 areas: B2B, B2C and Public - this position is in the B2C team. There are 60 people in the EU Analytics team and around 120 in the Global Analytics team, that you will be working alongside. They also have a mixture of seniority levels from Associate to Senior Principal, with plenty of room for progression.  The role involves discovering underlying trends in data, deriving value-add information from these trends, and driving implementations to drive revenue. You will perform analytics to improve and develop their offering as well delivering value in as in client specific case in close collaboration with related teams.  What can they offer you?  They're is the definition of data-driven - their company model is built on helping companies to understand their customers based on data and insights. The amount of data you will be working with is phenomenal, working with hundreds of thousands of data points.  Working closely with the business including stakeholders in the growth, finance and product teams - helping to understand that's needed from the data and very much feeling like your work is meaningful.  Stability of a large global organisation but has a feel of a smaller more autonomous environment, with plenty of opportunity to work with people across the globe and relocate if you want.  They have a great culture - everybody is very socialable, friendly and passionate about what they do. Lots of knowledge sharing and chances to collaborate with different teams and people in the business.  Plenty of progression opportunities and room to grow into areas you enjoy - they discuss the progression options with you from day 1 so you know exactly what you're working towards.  Very collaborative environment as working very hands-on with various teams. Working with customer deliveries also means you can see the impact of your work immediately and often on a long-term basis as well when you will work with a customer on multiple projects.  Does this sound like a good fit to your experience and passions? Then apply to this advert and we can schedule in a chat to go into even further depth of how these guys are making a difference.  I am also available on +46 8-502 425 38 and m.mcdermott@nigelfrank.com, or you can find me on LinkedIn ( https://bit.ly/2TORgSb )

You will carry out evaluative and exploratory data analysis to generate insights useful for product and strategy decisions, and you will be able to communicate these insights in a clear way for non-technical stakeholders. About the role As a Data Scientist, you understand solutions in an overall perspective. Your specialty is to work closely with stakeholders across the organisation to define complex business problems and suggest the right analytical and technical solutions. Overall you are passionate about developing and implementing advanced models using state-of-the-art data technologies. Required skills:

About the job The Senior Statistician reports to the Biostatistics Coordinator, serve as primary point of contact to the study team for statistical related matters, liaises with external stakeholders and ensure clinical data are analyzed in compliance with applicable standards, regulatory guidelines and OPIS SOPs. The Senior Statistician provide the study team and the Sponsor with advices on statistical methodology and study design and acts as a mentor for junior staff.

About the job FOREX förstärker nu sin funktion för IT Drift och utveckling med en Data Engineer.  FOREX är sedan starten 1965 Nordens marknadsledare på resevaluta. Utöver resevaluta erbjuder vi också reseförsäkringar, betalningsförmedling, kassaservice och kreditkort. Vårt mål är att vara människors främsta källa till reseinformation och bli en marknadsplats för tjänster och produkter som relaterar till resor.  Som på FOREX kommer du få vara delaktig i allt från att skapa integrationer och ta emot filer till att paketera information på ett ändamålsenligt och tydligt sätt för respektive mottagare. Du jobbar i ett team som stöder verksamheten med rapportering, analyser och vidareutveckling av datalagret. Teamet jobbar i Microsoft-stacken i en hybridmiljö. Ambitionen finns att röra oss mer åt molnhållet och då i synnerhet Azure. För ETL-flöden används SSIS och vid presentation använder vi oss av SSRS, SSAS och Power BI.  Tjänsten, som är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid, kommer innebära stora möjligheter att utvecklas inom området. Du är placerad på vårt huvudkontor i Gamla stan i Stockholm men förutsättningar att jobba hemifrån finns.          Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av, men framför allt intresse för, data och dataanalys.  Som person är du prestigelös och gillar både att arbeta i grupp och självständigt. Du gillar att ta initiativ och dela med dig av insikter och kompetenser inom teamet,  Låter det som något för dig? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!    Av säkerhetsskäl kommer vi att ta en kreditupplysning samt be om ett utdrag ur belastningsregistret innan anställning kan ske. Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kan du komma att få inbjudan till ett eller flera kortare tester.  Frågor besvaras av Viktor Jussila, Chef IT-Drift och utveckling, 0722-084 413  Vid frågor till fackliga företrädare, Finansförbundet, kontaktas finansforbundet@forex.se

company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
job_description: About the job Background  We need to take huge leaps to improve our capabilities understanding the efficiency of processes, flow of goods, warehouse utilization and lead times, equipment telemetry… We have the data, and now it needs to be turned into information, refined to insights to guide our decisions and recommendations.  You love big data sets, exploring and extracting the patterns hidden within and enjoy visualizing these for others to see what you see. You are comfortable working with unstructured data and come with suggestions on how the data architecture should be improved to make the next round even faster and more precise.  With so much data at hand, we believe there is ample opportunity to feed various machine learning algorithms and come up with predictive models in a variety of areas.  Your days are filled with the joy of:   Who you are  Curious, bordering on nerdy (in the most positive sense of the word) about data and data relations. You do not shy away from loosely formulated problems and terabytes of data.  You have at least three years of experience in an analytics role, and a degree in a relevant field (e.g. statistics, economics, computer science).  You know the difference between inner and outer join, and you comfortably write both throw-away and production grade code in languages like for instance R, Python and you might know enough C# to get by a dinner conversation.  Experience visualizing data and/or building dashboards, probably in tools like PowerBI, Tableau or Looker.  You can communicate your ideas to the team and your findings to a wider audience.  Deep understanding of statistics and experience working with real-world data.  You are good in finding problems and excellent in solving them, via prototyping and experiments to a scalable solution together with the rest of the team.  With so much data at your fingertips, you have probably taken the first steps into Machine Learning.  Where you'll be  Our epicenter of development is in Stockholm, Hornsbergs Strand. We have warehouses in central and southern Sweden. We offer ample opportunities to working from home, but there will be a lot of creative sessions where your presence by the white board is a key to interaction, success and team spirit.  We work “normal” business hours, 40h work week, with lots of flexibilities for picking up kids from day care or avoiding rush hour traffic.  We believe in developing people, knowledge, software, methods and relations. You will be a part of that, reaping all the benefits.    We are a technology driven fulfillment company. Born in logistics and raised by technology – some say. We kind of love e-commerce, retail and FMCG. Our mission is pretty simple. Through smart, simple and flexible fulfillment solutions - with a technological and digital way of thinking - we give our customers clear competitive advantages. We wanna call it LogTech – you´ll probably call it unbeatable.Part of Posti Group since 2020  Aditro Logistics is an equal opportunity employer. We want you to be a part of our team because you are great, no matter where you come from, looks, religious affiliation or gender identification. More voices make a more powerful choir.  We are about to move the industry. Move with us!  Aditro Logistics is an equal opportunity employer. We want you to be a part of our team because you are great, no matter where you come from, looks, religious affiliation or gender identification. More voices make a more powerful choir.  We are about to move the industry. Move with us!

About the job At Storytel we believe that powerful stories add an extra dimension to life. Storytel is one of the world’s leading audiobook and ebook streaming services that offers unlimited listening to consumers in 25+ markets. Our vision is to make the world a more empathetic place with great stories to be shared and enjoyed by anyone, anywhere, anytime. We are now looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Machine Learning team.    Storytel is hiring a Senior Data Scientist to join the Machine Learning team, within the Data & Engineering Foundation domain. We are working on a range of exciting problems centered on automated content curation, recommendations, and customer engagement. In this role you will be part of a team that is creating solutions that connect our users to stories from all over the world.       We expect the ideal candidate to have several qualifications:         Collaboration is key in everything we do, therefore humility and strong verbal and written communication skills are of utmost importance.    Storytel offers a friendly, entrepreneurial and fast-moving work environment where new ideas and creativity are welcomed. At Storytel we trust our employees and believe in their autonomy. We believe in doing things in new ways and questioning old methods. The Storytel culture - characterized by being welcoming and helpful - is important to us. We don’t believe in hierarchy and micromanagement; we value individual responsibility and having people grow alongside their peers.  We offer flexible working hours, learning opportunities to continuously develop yourself, remote working possibilities and flexible public holidays for people to celebrate what they truly believe in. And of course – you get unlimited access to audio and ebooks from our service!  This candidate will ideally be located in Copenhagen, Denmark or Stockholm, Sweden. We also welcome fully remote positions in the EU region for the right profile.

About the job WELCOME TO UTOPIA  Music is incredible. It can excite hundreds, and unite thousands. But as an industry, it has been slow, complicated, and disparate. While the tech world has moved into the future, the music industry continues to be shaped by inefficient systems of the past. At Utopia we believe there is a better way. Which is why today we are setting out to transform the entire industry; creating new revenue streams, consolidating the data and decluttering the admin. Unlocking the industry’s full potential by unifying it all in one truly holistic space. Some might call that a Utopia.

About the job Qliro is growing and we are now looking for a Credit Analyst to the Credit Risk Management team. The ideal candidate has a passion for understanding what drives risk and profitability and is eager to develop us even further.  The Credit Risk Management team is responsible for the entire credit life cycle, from setting the underwriting strategy to monitoring of the portfolio performance and plays an essential role in driving profit and loss. As part of the team, you work in Qliro’s core business and have a direct impact on our success.            We could talk for ages about all the amazing things we do (because it's a lot). But let's cut the crap and get to the point. At Qliro we offer safe and simple payment solutions for e-commerce with the most popular payments methods on the market. Come join us on our journey building the future of payments!    Qliro is the place for you who are curious, passionate and love collaboration. Together we have the power to create wow in everything we do. Feel comfortable being you, bringing your own unique perspectives. At Qliro there is a place for you whoever you are. Differences are a strength.  We love flexibility and remote work, we also believe in the power of meeting in real life. With a mix of working remote and collaborating in the office, we believe in a flexible workplace that suits you and Qliro.

About the job We are on a mission to make science open so everyone can live healthy lives on a healthy planet  Who We Are  Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.  We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.  Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published, evaluated, and communicated to the world.    In this role, you'll be responsible to discover, understand, and orchestrate our customer experiences and journeys. You take charge to make these insights known and acted upon across the business.  To do that, you introduce and shape our landscape of tools, data sources, methods, and journey operations. You support our marketing and customer journeys with this customer-centric perspective. You also coach less senior members of the team.  Your main partners are our customer journey owners, and marketing journey owners, who you will teach everything they need to know about actual experiences to support our growth.  You'll be at home in a team of five journey analysts, with the extended team having journey management and customer experience specialists.          With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team, you will work regularly with teammates in other countries, and with our community of researchers, editors, and authors from around the globe.  Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.      Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work, with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite, in the office).    All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team), an annual personal learning budget, and dedicated L&D time.    We offer free online yoga classes, an employee assistance plan, access to the Headspace app, and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.    Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform, Alaya.

About the job NOTE: This role can be based remotely from Europe (UK, Germany, Italy, Spain, Netherlands, Poland, Ireland, France, Romania)  A Senior Biostatistician is responsible for directing assigned projects and providing statistical support for clinical trials. This includes generating randomization schedules, participating in protocol and SAP development, preparing and reviewing programming specifications used in creating derived datasets, tables, listings, and figures, and reviewing case report forms (CRFs), and database structures.

Yes, we are by definition an energy company, but we’re more techy than most. How and why you might ask. Our main goal is to empower people, and to reduce the amount of energy being used unnecessarily all around the globe – with the help of cool fancy tech. Good for our customers, their wallets, and the planet.

The mobile gaming company LeoVegas has since its foundation shown strong growth every quarter. You will develop your skills immensely and become even better at what you do  You will have incredible co-workers who are willing to work together to meet any goals  You will be a part of revolutionizing the industry and we promise you’ll have fun doing it  You will participate in regular team recreational activities and outings  And we offer very competitive salaries and benefits  If there's one thing we know, it's picking people, so you'll work with a team of enthusiastic and ambitious people from a dozen different countries that aim to create a caring and inclusive workplace. We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date, our 200,000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science, health, humanities and social sciences, engineering, and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access. About the job The Freemium R&D team oversees the entire user journey on Spotify and ensures we engage with people in innovative ways, every step of the way. Our team grows Spotify’s audience by finding future listeners around the world and delivering the right value to them, at the right time. With research, product development, product design, engineering, and marketing all collaborating in one organization, we’re able to quickly create meaningful features and services for millions of people around the world, resulting in joyful, long-lasting relationships with Spotify.  We're looking for a Data Scientist to join our Product Insights team to support strategic decision-making for user growth in all emerging markets around the world.  What You'll Do   Who You Are   Where You'll Be   Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.  Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.    Spotify is committed to safety and well-being of our employees, vendors and clients. We are following regional guidelines mandating vaccination and testing requirements, including those requiring vaccinations and testing for in-person roles and event attendance. For the US, we have mandated that all employees and contractors be fully vaccinated in order to work in our offices and externally with any third-parties. For all other locations, we strongly encourage our employees to get vaccinated and also follow local COVID and safety protocols.

The successful candidate will join a dynamic and supportive team who work on varied projects in the Property Management, Global Investment Accounting and Property Management Accounting lines of business.

About the job Job Summary  DESCRIPTION  Possible locations: Stockholm  AWS Professional Services is a unique organization. Our customers are most-advanced companies in the world. We build for them world-class, -native IT solutions to solve real business problems and we help them get business outcomes with AWS. Our projects are often unique, one-of-a-kind endeavors that no one ever has done before.  At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we are helping large enterprises build ML models on the AWS Cloud. We are applying predictive technology to large volumes of data and against a wide spectrum of problems. AWS Professional Services works together with AWS customers to address their business needs using AI solutions. About the job kevin. is a startup with a bright present and even brighter future. Here we dream big, and then we commit to making those dreams come true. We have already built things that were never built before - in-app payments, card redirect, and there is more to come.  How did we manage that? By hiring people that are talented, driven, ambitious. Our company provides an environment where people like that can flourish - they can learn, explore, innovate. And they do just that!  So come join us and add rocket fuel to your career! kevin. is a great place to explore paths that were not explored before, and actually make impactful decisions.             kevin.’s advanced A2A (account-to-account) payment infrastructure solution was created to swiftly change costly card payments to payments linked directly from customers’ bank accounts without using any third-party providers. kevin.’s technology scales to businesses of any size and across industries, including retail, parking, fashion, car-sharing, deliveries, insurance and many more. kevin. focuses on mobile and POS payments where customers predominantly pay using cards currently. Its payment infrastructure is based on open banking – regulated by the European PSD2 Directive – which requires all banks and financial institutions in the European Economic Area to open their API for licensed third-party providers. kevin. develops only own connections to the banks without using any third-party aggregators.  Currently, the Company supports more than 6,000 merchants in 15 markets, including Sweden, Finland, Poland, Spain, Netherlands, Baltics and Portugal, where the company has a coverage of more than 85% of bank customers. The firm’s services will be available in 28 European Economic Area (EEA) countries by the end of 2022. kevin. has a team of more than 220 employees in 20 countries and it plans to expand its workforce to beyond 350 employees in 2022.  kevin. is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

AI and Business Process Automation is a prioritized area and one of the core building blocks of Digital Shift.  We’re looking for a Business Analyst for our AI & Automation move to join our newly established team at Sandvik that is aimed to enable and drive the adoption of AI & Automation in the organization. We welcome you to a place where you’re allowed to develop both on a personal and professional level, while keeping a healthy work-life balance and a work environment where freedom and responsibilities go hand in hand. Are you in for an exciting journey where you’ll take a leading role in enabling the overall Digital Shift for Sandvik Group? Then, keep reading!     In this position, you provide the best-in-class offerings together with thought-out leadership in order to help our organization to excel. You guide in the usage of new tools and technologies as well as communicating with different stakeholders on all levels. You help identify the needs of our business and support us in defining suitable strategies for progressing forward. Navigating in an international business environment, like this one, you take on an advisory role since much of our future work will be to support our decentralized organization in the most efficient way possible. About the job Är du intresserad av att jobba i ett bolag som kombinerar passionen för entreprenörskap tillsammans med tryggheten i en anställning, och där du har frihet att påverka dina utvecklingsmöjligheter och din karriär? Läs vidare. | Dina utmaningar? Som Data Scientist på TMC kommer du att arbeta med framtagande av prediktiva modeller på historiskt data samt sätta dessa modeller i produktion. I rollen ingår att ansvara för kvalitetssäkring av prognoser och systemdesign och är genuint intresserad av att testa och tillämpa nya lösningar inom data science hos olika kunder. Du kommer att arbeta i en miljö som erbjuder stora möjligheter till både professionell och personlig utveckling. I rollen som Employeneur inom data science tar du dig an spännande projekt där du jobbar med att identifiera de uppgifter som företaget ska samla in, definiera system för att extrahera information och utveckla processerna som omvandlar rådata till användbar information för affärsutveckling. Du kommer att arbeta om ostrukturerade datamängder så att de går att använda för analyser och tillgodose olika affärsbehov samt identifiera och implementera processförbättringar, genom att analysera underliggande data inom olika affärsprocesser.  Du har ett genuint intresse för dataanalys och för att passa in i vårt team tror vi att du har en stark analytisk förmåga samt ett pedagogiskt sätt att kommunicera dina analyser. Du är trygg i att presentera resultat samt förklara hur de kan användas i verksamheten. Din kompetens:  Meriterande:  Vi förutsätter att du talar och skriver svenska och engelska flytande.  Tack vare Employeneurship-modellen är TMC unika. Det är affärsmodellen för 2000-talets ingenjörer och forskare och den är uppbyggd på fem huvudpelare:  På TMC kombinerar du säkerheten av en trygg anställning med de möjligheter som entreprenörskap erbjuder. Detta eliminerar osäkerheten man kan uppleva som konsult eller entreprenör och du får mer tid och energi till att fokusera på ditt arbete och dina långsiktiga ambitioner.  Employeneurship-modellen erbjuder en marknadsmässig grundlön samtidigt som dina entreprenöriella förmågor premieras ytterligare genom en vinstdelning. Genom vinstdelningen så har du som Employeneur möjlighet att själv ansvara för säljprocessen vilket ytterligare ökar på din vinstandel. Vi är transparenta när det kommer till ditt projekts kostnader och omsättning och vinsten delas med dig. Ditt kontrakt är skräddarsytt efter dig och tar hänsyn till dina personliga önskemål och preferenser. Känn ditt marknadsvärde och dela vinsten som ditt arbete genererar!  Som Employeneur tillhör du en Business Cell baserat på ditt tekniska kompetensområde. Dessa specialistområden utgår från teknologiska nischkompetenser och skapar olika nätverk av ingenjörer och forskare. Du som Employeneur blir del av ett starkt och relevant internationellt nätverk som skapar intensivt engagemang, kunskaps- och erfarenhetsutbyte.  TMC värderar dig som Employeneur högt och har utvecklat ett program för att garantera din personliga och professionella utveckling, din YOUrney. YOUniversity är ett unikt program för din utveckling och kommer att stödja dig i alla skeden av din karriär. Genom personlig coaching får du möjlighet att utvecklas, både som individ och i ditt entreprenörskap. Att ta sig tid för personlig och professionell utveckling är en bra investering.  Entrepreneurial Lab erbjuder ett utrymme där employeneurer kan samarbeta över gränser. Vi vill att du ska förverkliga dina tekniska drömmar och utveckla ditt entreprenörskap. Entrepreneurial Lab drivs av en självgående proaktiv attityd hos dig som Employeneur som skapar värde för dig själv men självklart också för kunden. Se Entrepreneurial Lab som en lekplats för nya idéer, produkter som tjänster. Eftersom TMC är ett internationellt företag kan vi erbjuda projekt på olika platser i olika länder. För närvarande finns vi representerade i Sverige, Nederländerna, Belgien, Frankrike, Spanien, Italien, U.A.E. och Kanada. Du får världen som arbetsplats.  Uttrycket Employeneurship kanske låter obekant, det beror på att vi uppfann det. Inte bara som ett ord utan som ett sätt att arbeta, eller till och med ett paradigm. Att vara Employeneur är mycket mer än att bara arbeta som teknisk konsult. Denna unika roll ger dig möjlighet att tänka och agera som en entreprenör i kombination med den trygghet en anställning ger. Viktigast av allt, du får en garanti för ständig utveckling och möjligheten att vara fullt ansvarig för din egen karriär. Ta chansen att vara del av vår växande verksamhet. Ansök så pratar vi mer om din plan!

About the job Do you want to be part of an exciting journey? Data driven business development is an important piece of the puzzle in the digital journey that we at Lantmännen have in front of us. Analytics and New Technology is an exciting and growing area within Lantmännen IT and we are now strengthening our team with two BI Developers to join us. Together - towards smarter ways of working.    The Analytics & New Technology team is responsible for BI and analytics solutions within the entire Lantmännen Group. As a Business Intelligence developer, you will work in a team together with several other BI developers, architect, analytics solution specialists, and product owners. Here you will get the opportunity to develop your skills with a highly dedicated BI team. It is a team with a great team spirit that strives for cooperation and knowledge sharing. We work according to agile ways of working.    Data driven business development is a strategy at Lantmännen and as our BI Developer you will work close to the business regarding requirements, design, development and maintenance of the Analytics solutions within the Lantmännen Group. You will work from back-end to visualization, both on-prem and using the latest Cloud techniques in Azure. You will also have the possibility to be involved in exciting projects using cloud technologies, Machine learning, IoT and other new technologies to support a data-driven way of working in the business.  Through this close collaboration with our businesses, you will get unique insights in our entire value chain from “Field to Fork”: agriculture, machinery, bioenergy, food and real estate. You will be involved in several cross-functional projects that require your expertise, cooperating with multiple stakeholders across our group to support our business units in making the right strategic and operational decisions. You will report to Head of Analytics and New Technology and be located at Lantmännens headquarters in Stockholm.          You share our values - Openness, Holistic view, Drive - and our promise of taking responsibility from Field to Fork.    We are a large international Group with diverse activities throughout the entire grain value chain –from the very sprout in the field to the food on our tables. With a wide range of businesses within food, agriculture, machinery, bioenergy and real estate, we offer career opportunities in every direction across industries, countries, companies and areas of expertise.    We hope so! As the screening process is ongoing, we kindly ask you to submit your application as soon as possible but no later than the 31st of Oktober 2021. The recruitment process will include several interviews, psychometric tests and the final candidate will go through a background check. Considering the current situation and everyone's well-being, the first interviews will be conducted over telephone and video.  This recruitment is a collaboration with Wise IT. If you have any questions regarding this position, please contact responsible recruiter Timmy Konneus, 0766-20 29 45. We look forward to hearing from you!

job_title: Senior Computer Vision Engineer- Technology Development Group
job_description: About the job  Summary  The Technology Development Group is looking for help to drive breakthrough developments in machine learning and computer vision problems. We are on the lookout for people who are experienced in working on shipping products to help power future revolutionary Apple devices. Now is a great opportunity for you to push the limits computer vision on embedded devices in the Apple ecosystem. Your role will be as a lead, focused on researching and prototyping technologies, both traditional computer vision and deep learning, collaborating with partners in this space within Apple, helping impact long-term decisions and strategy.    Passionate about Augmented Reality  Passionate about working with hardware architectures  Experienced Software Engineer with proficiency in C/C++  Solid foundation in Computer Vision with key areas being SfM/SLAM, optical flow and depth estimation  Understanding of Deep Learning is preferable, with key areas being mobile friendly architectures, image regression and classification problems  Self-motivated and great teammate    We are the Technology Development Group that is responsible for many of the key algorithms in ARKit and beyond. We are looking for talented engineers who are passionate about building products for millions of customers around the world. You’ll be working on cutting-edge technology and develop algorithms that enable a high-quality user experience across a range of tentpole use cases and applications. As a part of our team, you will closely collaborate with HW engineers (cameras, silicon, electrical engineering, product design) and other technology development software teams (computer graphics, video engineering, data generation/annotation, drivers/OS). You can make a difference by leading our efforts in tailoring algorithms to new platforms which bring forth a new set of challenges and help them to excel on Apple silicon. The key strength is your willingness to learn and adopt to new technologies.    Ph.D or M.Sc. degree in Computer Science or similar, alternatively a comparable industry career with a consistent track record of successful projects.    Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.  Role Number: 200414922

About the job WELCOME TO UTOPIA  Music is incredible. It can excite hundreds, and unite thousands. But as an industry, it has been slow, complicated, and disparate. While the tech world has moved into the future, the music industry continues to be shaped by inefficient systems of the past. At Utopia we believe there is a better way. Which is why today we are setting out to transform the entire industry; creating new revenue streams, consolidating the data and decluttering the admin. Unlocking the industry’s full potential by unifying it all in one truly holistic space. Some might call that a Utopia.  Funnily enough, so do we.    The open secret is that the music industry is struggling with the very basics of music accounting: What was played, when and where? Who should get paid and how much?  Utopia Music is bridging the data gap by connecting global consumption, accurate metadata, and fast payments to an industry-wide trust platform. Our goal is to unlock creative value and enable to make a better world for Music. The solutions we offer do not threaten to usurp the role of industry incumbents - it is about bringing transparency in the industry and supporting efficient royalty collection for all.    As a Business Analyst at Utopia Music, you will initially touch on such a wide range of responsibilities and tasks that you will ultimately make of the role what you wish, and where your skills fit best within the team. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with every business unit within the company on topics such as tailored market research, revenue forecasts, deliveries to clients, and even commercially focused due diligence reports on potential M&A opportunities. This is a great opportunity to grow your career in a direction that you can steer within a very fast growing company!  You will report to the Business Analyst Manager, and the team of business analysts operates as a functional team within the commercial department, meaning it is not directly affiliated to any one business unit, but is a service provider of sorts to all the business units.  We strongly encourage you to apply even if you do not meet 100% of the criteria below! Whether you have years of experience or not, anyone with a passion for, and knowledge of, the music industry can be successful in this role.                   As we want to bring transparency, trust, and clarity to the music industry we serve, we know a change comes from within. Utopia is a transparent, trust-based organization striving to have clarity in thinking and doing what we set out to do.  We execute urgently and innovate to grow faster. We ship things that make a difference today, so we can make them better tomorrow. We embrace fairness and are all accountable.  Strictly diverse and inclusive.  We celebrate our diverse backgrounds and we welcome everyone who identifies with the above to apply.  We’re eager to meet :)  Utopia Music is a Swiss Music fintech company through clear, transparent, and reliable data-based solutions. We support the whole Industry to make more money, faster, with less costs, and less errors.  In Utopia, the Industry sees market opportunities live. Investors elevate Music catalogs into a real asset class. Collection societies track more and spend less. Labels, publishers, and distributors simplify and enhance their business. And everyone gets Fair Pay for Every Play.  Utopia is serving the music copyrights and the industry from creation to consumption, and will never compete against it. It means that we will never own copyrights. We will never be owned by the major stakeholders of the industry. We will never share or sell data of our customers to anyone else.

job_title: Kofax Developer to SEB in Stockholm
job_description: About the job SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?  We are now looking for a Solution Developer to join our analysis and capture (Kofax) team in Stockholm.    We need to strengthen our analyze and capture (Kofax) team with an additional Solution Developer. The team is an agile team located in Stockholm and works with digital transformation of analog data captured from sources such as PDF files. The analyzed data from scanned documents are refined and then made available for the users. The team enables SEB to succeed in its journey towards the digitalization of analog flows.  Currently we work with the following Kofax components; Kofax Capture, Kofax Transformation Module, Kofax Import Connector (KIC) and Kofax Frontoffice Server (KFS). We are now exploring container and future cloud solutions. We work together with our Product Owner, vendors, and stakeholders to define our next steps. As a team member you will work with requirement analyze, design, implementation, test, operations, and troubleshooting. We also provide support to our users.    You have a background in IT and work with high focus and curiosity, always striving to learn new things. You are experienced in creating solutions by scripting in for example VB.net, Powershell or Python and have some experience and insight in the PDF fileformat. You have genuine interest for technology and its ability to support our business. You share our interests in the areas of DevOps principles and you have good communication skills in English.  You can work together with others in the team or independently and you can communicate with stakeholders or vendors in a professional way. We believe that you are comfortable with Windows environments and you are not afraid to work with troubleshooting.       We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:     It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.    Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 31 August 2022. If you have questions about the position please contact Amar Mirascic, Talent Acquisition Partner at amar.mirascic@seb.se .    sebgroup.com/techcareers

job_title: Är du vår nästa Data Engineer?
job_description: About the job Lockas du av att jobba med modern teknologi och skapa bestående värde hos våra kunder och i samhället? Vi letar nu efter data engineers till vårt team i Sverige; personer som gillar att gräva ned sig i data och analys och som kan förklara dessa för våra kunder!  Lockas du av att jobba med modern teknologi och skapa bestående värde hos våra kunder och i samhället? Vi letar nu efter data engineers till vårt team i Sverige; personer som gillar att gräva ned sig i data och analys och som kan förklara dessa för våra kunder!  Våra dataexperter finns för tillfället i 6 olika länder, och vi jobbar med datalösningar inom nästan alla teknologier. Våra data engineers bygger tekniska lösningar som består av datamodeller, dataintegration och data pipelines baserat på cloud. En stor del av tiden jobbar man hands-on med konfigurering, integration, installation och scripting av data, men också med designarkitektur och möten där man förklarar lösningarna för våra kunder. Inte sällan sitter man vid samma bord som de högsta cheferna hos våra kunder.  Oavsett kund, projekt eller bransch har du hos oss alltid tillgång till ett stort nätverk av fantastiskt kunniga, passionerade datakollegor, som bara är ett slackmeddelande bort. Därtill kan du ständigt lära dig nytt genom våra autonoma competence communities, otaliga infosessions och möjligheten att ta olika certifikationer etc. Vi jobbar också mycket med våra techpartners så som AWS, Azure, Snowflake och Semarchy. Vill du verkligen utvecklas och ligga i framkant inom datalösningar, så har vi rätt mycket att komma med!    Det viktigaste för oss är ändå att du delar våra värderingar och att du gärna delar din kunskap med dina kollegor. Våra anställda på Solita har själva valt våra värderingar.  I våra bloggar kan du läsa mera om vad dina framtida kollegor har att säga om AI, data och analys.    Vår företagskultur är väldigt, väldigt viktig för oss, och vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete, och trevliga kollegor. Läs mer om Solita som företag!  Som anställd hos oss kan du vänta dig;      Vi värdesätter dina kunskaper, men är också nyfikna på dig som person. Berätta för oss vad du brinner för och drömmer, så återkommer vi strax!

About the job Working in ICON Strategic Solutions is more than a job, it’s a calling for people who care and have passion for improving patients’ lives. It takes courage to move from one job to another and the process involves careful consideration. At ICON, we care about our people as they are the key to our success and provide an open and friendly work environment where we empower people and provide them with opportunities to develop their long-term career.

job_title: Cloud Data Engineer till Finity People
job_description: About the job Har du hittat ditt kall inom DW och Analytics och är redo för nästa steg i karriären? Finity People fortsätter att växa och söker nu ytterligare en Data Engineer som vill utvecklas och utmanas med spännande projekt hos Finity People:s kunder i Stockholm.  Här kommer du till en utvecklande miljö där du får givande utbyten med kunniga kollegor som besitter en stor bredd av erfarenheter. Att vara Data Engineer hos Finity People innebär en roll med stor frihet i vardagen och där du både tillämpar och växer inom din specialistkompetens. Låter det intressant? Läs mer och ansök idag!    Som Data Engineer hos Finity People blir du en del av ett personligt och familjärt specialistbolag inom Analytics, Business Intelligence och Data Science. Som konsult har du en bred och omväxlande roll där du i ett uppdrag kliver in som DW-arkitekt och utvecklare för att sätta upp en molnarkitektur för cloud native och bygga datalager. I ett annat uppdrag hjälper du kunden med att designa och bygga automatiska integrationer från externa API:er mot Data Lake. DW-arkitektur, datamodellering och utveckling är också stående inslag flertalet projekt.  Hos oss kommer du att möta kunder med hybridlösningar i både cloud och on-prem med tekniker som Azure Data Factory, Apache Spark / Databricks, Python, Scala, Snowflake, Google Cloud Platform, SQL Server SSIS och modelleringsmetoder som ER, star-schema/dimensionell och data vault.  Uppdragen varierar både i längd och omfattning och Finity Peoples kunder återfinns inom ett flertal branscher såsom: industri, finans, banker, FMCG, dagligvaruhandel och hälsovård.     Som person är du öppen och bidrar gärna med din kunskap samtidigt som du är nyfiken på att lära dig mer. Du är förtroendeingivande och har lätt för att trivas i olika miljöer och tillsammans med olika människor. Du värdesätter en rak och tydlig dialog samtidigt som du uppskattar vikten av en ödmjuk approach.  Du underbygger gärna dina argument med teorier, best practices och tidigare erfarenheter. Du är intresserad av att ta dialogen med verksamheten, kravställare och användare för att förstå behoven och för att kunna diskutera lösningar. Du förstår hur data och teknik bäst kan stödja affärsmål och bidra med värde. Goda kommunikativa färdigheter både i svenska och engelska är en förutsättning.  I denna rekrytering är en bakgrundskontroll ett obligatoriskt sista steg    I denna rekrytering samarbetar Finity People med IDG Recruitment. Om du vill veta mer eller har frågor kring vänligen kontakta Marcus Grahn, Rekryteringskonsult 070 669 00 28, marcus.grahn@idg.se.  För att ansöka, vänligen skicka in ditt CV eller ansök med Linkedin. Urval/intervjuer sker löpande.  Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!    Finity People är ett konsultbolag som specialiserar sig på Analytics, Business Intelligence och Data Science. Vi hjälper våra kunder med strategi, arkitektur, projektledning, kravarbete och utveckling av lösningar inom hela Analytics-området på moderna plattformar och verktyg. Läs mer: www.finitypeople.se

About the job Job ID: 11914  Would you like to work as a financial crime expert to support Group Financial Crime Prevention in mitigating financial crime risks? We are now looking for a Senior Expert to join our team to drive financial crime mitigation activities in the area of transaction monitoring.    Welcome to Mature TM Requirements within Transaction Monitoring Risk Management. We are a part of the TM Unit in Group Financial Crime Prevention and together with other units within and outside of TM Unit, we help protect our customers, society and Nordea against financial crime, including money laundering, terrorist financing and bribery and corruption.  We are the team responsible for delivering new automated controls to the Transaction Monitoring area. We add value by defining the business requirements for new transaction monitoring scenarios in Nordea in order drive new development to mitigate financial crime risks. We work cross Nordic, cross BA’s and also support legal entities.  This position is a parental cover for one year.    The role is based in Finland, Norway, Sweden, Estonia or Poland.    Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.      If this sounds like you, get in touch!    Submit your application no later than 16/09/2022. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Head of Mature TM Requirements Terje Fjelleng, terje.fjelleng@nordea.com / +46720833503.  At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.  Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
About the job Role : Business Analyst  Location : Sweden  Duration : Longterm Contract  Skills : Business Analyst

About the job An opportunity for a seasoned business analyst to build a career with Canonical and drive the success of the business.  The Commercial Systems group design, develop, and operate services for millions of Ubuntu machines all over the world, associated with both free and paid operations. These services live at the intersection of open source capabilities (kernel live patching, distro package updates) and business SAAS (contract and subscription management, selective service delivery). These are real-time services which integrate deeply with public clouds and the OS to ensure a consistent Ubuntu experience in every environment.  Developing these systems requires deep understanding of financial reporting and sales processes, as well as technical operating system requirements. It is crucial to integrate seamlessly with stakeholder business processes. You will enjoy this role if you would like to be at the center of business and open source, connecting all the dots, and be the catalyst of cooperation between engineering and business teams.  If successful, you will work with a team of Salesforce engineers and administrators who ensure that business operations teams have the right data at a hand and the right business processes in place. You will also work with software engineers developing a data lake, automating business processes, and integrating a number of software systems used across Canonical, ensuring that the right data flows in the right direction.  We are looking for a business analyst with a background in software engineering, who has the drive, energy, and skills to ensure seamless business processes leveraging the power of software engineering.  Key responsibilities   We expect   Nice to have   What Canonical offers   Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

job_title: Product Manager - Data Quality & Standards (Informatica IDQ and/or Axon)
job_description: About the job Department: Group Digital & Technology Platform Services (DTPS) - Data Governance Team Location: location free within Coca-Cola Hellenic countries Contract: Permanent  As a Data Quality & Data Standards Product Manager you will be responsible for guiding the Functional alignment, design, delivery, deployment, monitoring and the withdrawal of Data Quality Management products fully meeting business needs and requirements, on optimal cost, with maximized return on the investment and ensuring high customer satisfaction. You will own the implementation and the adoption growth of new and existing data standards related to new business processes, data attributes etc.
About the job Senior Business Analyst  Fully Remote 6 months with a view to extending

About the job Business/Data Analyst for one of Sweden's fastest growing Fintech companies  Do you want to further develop your analysis skills in close collaboration with the internal organization, while at the same time giving you a great opportunity to influence and contribute to the business? Then I have a role for you.  They are looking for someone with analytical ability, communication skills, business understanding and a willingness to share insights and spread knowledge in the organization.  Your new role  They have identified a need to strengthen our ability in data analysis as they see that it has great opportunities to be applied and used in several different parts of their business. They are looking for someone who wants to be part of that journey and have experience of having answered business challenges by immersing yourself in large amounts of data and that you have in an understandable way been able to explain these to other parts of a business and have experience of having visualized these using visualization tools. In addition to this, it is an advantage to have worked with predictive modelling and text analysis.  In this role you will work with both challenges related to the business today and be part of project groups that work cross-functionally with major strategic changes and initiatives. Your main task is to develop actionable insights that create business value.  Your background  To succeed in the role, they see that you have an academic degree, preferably with a focus on statistics, economics or equivalent engineering education. We would like you to have relevant experience of working with data analysis, with advantage in industries with large amounts of data and / or customer bases. You are used to working in SQL and have experience of, for example, Python, R or similar tools and have very good knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint. They see that you are business-like, analytical and have good communication skills in writing and speaking.  As a person, we attach great importance to you being curious, committed and driven. You like free frames and see no problem with independently setting your structure and your approach. Through your analytical and structured approach, you can switch between the overall strategic perspective and details in the delivery of your analyses.  If this sounds like something you would be interested in, call or email me to find out more!  Email: a.short@nigelfrank.com  Call: +46 8 502 425 47
