About the job Yubico , the inventor of the YubiKey (security key), makes secure login easy and available for everyone. Backed by major investors like Andreessen Horowitz, Meritech Capital, AMF, and Marc Benioff, CEO of Salesforce, the company is led by an inspirational female CEO and founder. Millions of individuals in over 160+ countries rely on the YubiKey to protect their accounts, and companies like Google, Facebook, Twitter, and the U.S. State Government rely on our technology to keep their employees secure. We are a multinational, fast-growing company offering an opportunity to bring your ideas to life with our global team.    At Yubico, we want you to be your most productive selves whether you decide to work 100% from home or choose to work hybrid/onsite. The way we balance the fast-paced demands of a high-growth company and sustainability is making rest a priority. There are some roles, however, that do require onsite presence in one of our local offices and you can find specific details on those respective job descriptions.  We work to ensure that our employees have an open space to have their voices amplified to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Aligned with this, our employees have created some pretty cool Employee Resource Groups: YubiPride, YubiBIPOC, YubiSustainability and YubiWomen. Additionally, Yubico donates YubiKeys to organizations in need all over the world (you can read more about our work here ).  Relationships and connectedness matter, and we love spending time with our team! Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Yubico celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. We host an all-team event in a new location every year where we plan for upcoming quarters, set goals, and most importantly, host fun events to encourage team building outside of the workplace. Check out our Life at Yubico Page on LinkedIn and our awards here    You will be part of the Corporate Applications team located in Sweden and the US. Together the Corporate Applications team enables employees to conduct their work faster and more efficiently and ensures scalability as Yubico grows.  If you are looking for a fun challenge, are passionate about usable security, and want to work at a fast-moving company, this opportunity is for you! In this role, you will:  ¤Work with a wide range of technologies - from hardware to web services  ¤Put systems in place to support the whole company  ¤Innovate and experiment. We actively support outside-the-box thinking.  ¤Work collaboratively with your team and other engineering teams to solve problems  This role requires detailed technical knowledge of identity systems and protocols, combined with applied Python coding experience to implement those concepts.          ¤Knowledge in some of these frameworks and technologies: REST APIs, Linux, Docker, GIT, etc.  ¤Data extraction and transformation (JSON, csv, SQL) and database schema design    ¤Experience with IAM concepts such as Identity Federation and SSO, using relevant protocols (OAuth, SAML 2.0, SCIM)  ¤Experience implementing IAM solutions or owning IAM products        We are an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and uphold an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, religion, national origin, veteran or disability status. We'd love to learn about what you can add to our diverse team.  Yubico does not accept agency resumes or referrals so please do not send them to our careers staff or employees. Yubico is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes or referrals. Personal data submitted through this form is used for managing Yubico’s recruitment activities, which include facilitating any application you make, setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing results and selecting candidates, and as otherwise needed in our recruitment and onboarding processes.  The use of your personal data may also be necessary prior to entering into a contract with you (that is prior to offering you a job with Yubico). Your personal data will only be used for the purposes for which it was collected and in accordance with the Yubico Privacy Notice . We only keep your personal data for as long as necessary and in compliance with Yubico’s record retention policies. If you have asked us to, we will keep you informed of other opportunities at Yubico. We do this in various ways, including email and by phone. If at any time you do not want us to contact you or use your information as described herein please contact us at jobs@yubico.com to let us know and we will delete all such information. Providing your personal data is voluntary, but necessary to join our talent community, and if you do not agree to provide your data, we will not be able to consider you as part of our talent community. As part of providing the requested service, we will transfer your data to be processed by Lever, Inc. , a service provider contracted by Yubico AB and/or its subsidiaries that meets legally mandated privacy requirements. The Yubico Privacy Notice offers more information about Yubico privacy practices, including the lawful basis for processing of personal data, how to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority, and how to contact Yubico to exercise your data subject rights. In this notice, when we refer to "Yubico", "us", "we" or "our", we mean the Yubico group company or companies that you apply to, or correspond with, and which are responsible for any personal data collected about you.

About the job At Seco Tools, our Analytical & BI team is ready to support business to raise the digital bar! Our focus is to secure even more value out of data by enhancing our analytics, as well as self-service analytics capabilities. We’re now looking for a Senior BI Back-End Developer to be part of our global, passionate Seco family. Someone with a great interest for our business and who enjoy working within a large global organization. Come join a team with great cooperation and forward thinking. With our expertise within the team, we aim to take our information and solutions into Azure Cloud to adopt to a more modern and flexible platform meeting the expectations from our user communities. Are you eager to join us on this journey? Apply today and we look forward to meeting you!    In this position you work with architecture, information management and developing back-end solutions – picking up and refine data to be high-value information that can be consumed by our end-users. This is a flexible role where your tasks are to keep and build the knowledge and information in the flows and support the front-end developers with guiding in information and architecture. The flexibility is needed to contribute to our continuous work of refining architecture and our way of working. This position is really important to strengthen our team in the achievement of having an analytical platform with even more data available and exposed as high-quality information for our business stakeholders.  Your responsibility also include:  This is a flexible position, but you’re preferably based at our site in Fagersta or at Gasverket in Stockholm.    We’re looking for someone with a background in back-end development and knowledge in architecture, analytical thinking, data modeling and azure cloud. The most important part is a solid interest and knowledge in the field, and since we value working experience higher than educational experience, a degree within IT is a plus but not a requirement for this position. Naturally, you need experience and understanding of software and services within Azure, Microsoft databases, ETL tool and SQL. As we’re a global organization, excellent English skills, both written and verbal, is required.  Your personal qualities are important to us, and we’re primarily looking for your strong passion for analytics and management of information. You have a genuine interest and a good competence in understanding business requirements and purpose. You’re service-minded and through your excellent communication skills you connect with stakeholders to establish a strong collaborative environment throughout the organization and at all levels.    Seco employees across the globe share our family spirit, along with a passion for our customers and a personal commitment to ensure success in everything we do. For us, it’s also clear that our diversities form an amazing foundation for achieving great results. Visit our LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us and our products further.    Send your application no later than August 28, 2022. Read more about us and apply at secotools.com (Job ID: R0041833).  As we aim for an open and fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. Shortly after the last application date, you’ll therefore be asked to take a personality and logic ability test.    For more detailed information about this position, please contact:  Mikael Erhardsson, recruiting manager, +46 (0)73 805 70 03  Union contacts  Monica Andersson, Unionen, +46 (0)223-403 23  Fuad Mucic, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)589-856 20  Benny Christiansen, Ledarna, +46 (0)223- 405 76  For more information about the recruitment process, please contact HR Services, +46 (0)26 261 444.    Anton Karlsson

About the job Hos oss är det ena projektet inte det andra likt. Just nu söker vi efter erfarna Data Engineers. Vi har uppdrag för flera stora och mindre kunder i alla delar av Stockholm. Våra kunder ligger oftast i teknikframkanten och du kommer att få uppdrag där din insats kommer att göra skillnad för människor lång tid framöver, kanske till och med ändra på vad vi idag ser som normalt till något nytt. I uppdraget kommer du att tillhöra ett team där man arbetar tillsammans med utvecklare och testare.        Vi behandlar ansökningar löpande, så varmt välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Just nu söker vi efter personer som behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.

About the job Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to deliver a multi-cloud and on-premise data solution for the enterprise, which spans the full range of data stores and data technologies from big data, with Yugabyte, Spark and Kafka, through NoSQL and cache-layer capabilities like Redis, MongoDB and Opensearch, all the way to structured SQL engines like PostgreSQL and MySQL.  This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about delivering high quality, reliable and automated infrastructure based on open source software running on Kubernetes, the public cloud and bare-metal. We are facing the challenge of fault-tolerant mission critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.  Experience using data platform tools is desirable, but not over hands-on experience installing, configuring and operating such technologies.  Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, automation, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of open source community dynamics, and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organizations.  What you'll do   Who you are

About the job Job Description  With this company, you will be working on what has been dubbed the "Simple development Process" - Minimal meetings, two-week sprints, and developers working the full lifecycle.  With two core product teams you have the flexibility to work solely in one, spread across both or just transfer between freely. You have the flexibility to allow this  You will be building products that allow the financial market to facilitate the transfer of money to areas that will drive increasing environmental awareness into property development and green renovations  Role & Responsibilities

job_title: Software Developer - Laboratory Informatic Management Services
job_description: About the job Join Accenture’s fast-growing Scientific Informatics Services (SIS) business unit, where you can help pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical technology, distributor consumer products, resources and consumer health clients to combine the latest technology with scientific breakthroughs, revolutionizing how medical treatments and products are discovered, developed and delivered to patients around the world!

job_title: Senior IT Analyst to Business Institutional Technology
job_description: About the job Job ID: 9167  Would you like to work in an agile, friendly and diverse environment, in close collaboration with our business stakeholders, and at the same time apply and grow your IT analytical skills? Then this is a unique opportunity for you to join us and grow as a professional.  We are looking for senior IT analysts, to help our business creating the best capabilities and solutions for the financial markets.  We are instrumental in doing IT analysis for our different business stakeholders which are called Business Banking and Large Corporates & Institution (including Markets) at Nordea. Besides servicing our front line businesses and customers, we deliver services to Nordea’s full value chain including Treasury, Risk, Control and Operations.  At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make a true impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your stamp on something bigger for the greater good.    Warm welcome to our analysis team. We add value by providing great people, primarily working as IT analysts. As a Senior IT analyst, you’ll play a valuable role in creating business and IT requirements and aligning our IT solutions to these requirements, applying Nordea market standards and frameworks in a mindful way. At the same time, we will help you build your future skills as an IT analyst in general.    You will join a team of highly skilled people in a fun and friendly environment where people and learning are key. If you are not already an expert, you will for sure become one, with the opportunity to make a positive impact on our customers and our society by enabling Nordea to create an even more sustainable international banking capability.    Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.      If this sounds like you, get in touch with us and we will arrange a meeting.    Submit your application no later than 01/09/2022. Please note that we are interviewing on ongoing basis, so don't wait for the last date to apply for the position.  For more information, you’re welcome to contact Erik Rune.  At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more The role  As a System Admin for the IT Internal Services team, you must liaise and collaborate cross-functionally with various members in our offices worldwide and coordinate the change, release management and maintenance of different 3rd party application systems. You will recommend a resolution to complex matters of significance and coordinate the implementation of the approved course of action.  You will work in coordination with the IT department to develop and support cloud and Linux infrastructure, ideally, you are familiar with Windows infra as well. You will provide technical assistance on Linux/Windows and Cloud-based systems, and resolve complex operational problems.  The role involves heavy interface and working closely with other key members of the IT Services team and stakeholders with different focus & areas of expertise which include, however not limited to; Linux/Unix Administrators, DBA's, Application Developers, Network Administrators, and IT Operations staff.        Click on the "Apply Now" button and complete the short web form. Please add a covering letter in English to let us know your motivation for applying and your salary expectation.  Kindred is an equal opportunities employer committed to employing a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. As such, we oppose all forms of discrimination in the workplace. We create equal opportunities for all our applicants and will treat people equally regardless of and not limited to, gender, age, disability, race, or sexual orientation. We are committed not only to our legal obligations but also to the positive promotion that equal opportunities bring to our operations as set out in our sustainability framework.    Not suited to this role but interested in working at Kindred Group?  We are always on the lookout for talented, passionate people to join our global teams so if you'd like us to let you know when suitable jobs come up, please click on “Register for Alerts”.

About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Do you want to work with cutting-edge machine learning technology? Would it feel good to see your work result in software used by tens of thousands of users, bringing more creativity and emotion to this world? If the answer is yes, you will be a great addition to our Smart Tech team as our new Machine Learning Engineer! At XLN Audio, we create software for music production and award-winning virtual instruments used worldwide by creative enthusiasts, professional music producers, songwriters, and bands. With Max Martin as a co-owner, music studios and instruments at the office ready to use, there is no doubt that we have rhythm in our blood. We love what we do - helping people express themselves through music. Our ambition is to build the world’s most inspiring and innovative software, to help bring ideas to life and be part of the powerful feeling only music can create. As for the team, we are a bunch of driven, quirky, caring music nerds who never fail to make work fun. We work better when our lives are balanced and flexibility is an essential part of our success. We want to ensure everyone can have the best combination of their families - the one at home and the one at XLN. To allow you to be at your most productive and creative self, you also have the opportunity to combine working from the office and remote - wherever it suits you and your work best. About the role As our Machine Learning Engineer you will test new ideas and concepts related to audio signal processing, midi signal processing and music in general, focusing on researching new technologies that might drive forward the industry. You will also be focusing on the application of machine learning concepts to deliver great ideas for the rest of the teams by distilling others’ and conducting our own research. To do so, you will be reading relevant research papers and testing and documenting their results. You will be responsible for combining these into new models as well as collecting relevant data that can be used to train them. Except for a passion for music as big as ours, you enjoy working with a variety of tasks and like to dive into new prototypes. As far as the technical competences we believe you have:

About the job Är du en erfaren kravanalytiker/business analyst med intresse för teknik och gärna med bakgrund inom systemutveckling? Vill du hjälpa våra kunder göra världen lite bättre? Då kan du vara den vi söker.  HiQ är utan tvekan ett av Sveriges mest tekniktunga och spännande konsultbolag med kunder inom en rad olika branscher såsom exempelvis fordon, telekom, e-hälsa, myndigheter och finans. Förutom att vi bidragit till utvecklingen av att snart bli ett kontantlöst samhälle, utvecklar vi även allt från digitaliseringen av vården till framtidens autonoma fordon. Enkelt sagt, vi gillar att skapa sådant som förenklar och gör vardagen lite roligare för oss alla.    Vi söker dig som:   Eftersom HiQ är värderingsstyrt är det avgörande att du som person kan vara en bärare av våra värderingar: resultat, ansvar, enkelhet och glädje.

job_title: Cloud Engineer - GCP Cloud SQL Specialist
job_description: About the job At DoiT International, we believe the cloud transforms the way we build technology, and we are on a mission to help companies, big or small, go through this transformation.  We are a team of cloud professionals who love working with other people to solve challenging technical problems. We are committed to personal development and enjoy sharing our knowledge and experience through blogging, training, public speaking, and contributing to open-source.  We work hands-on, side-by-side with our customers to educate, mentor, advise, and solve problems to make sure they are getting the most out of what the cloud has to offer.  We are looking for people to join us on our mission and share the honor and delight of being able to help companies to realize their ideas into successful products.    From experience, the ideal candidate will have:     DoiT International is a world-leading cloud advisory company, Google Cloud’s top partner and Amazon Web Services Premier Partner. Our mission is to enable customers to harness the power of the public cloud at peak efficiency so they can focus on building the best products for their own customers.  Our core values guide us in creating a diverse team, a welcoming and supportive working environment, and a stellar employee experience with plenty of opportunities for personal and professional development. Challenging work, continuous learning, opportunities for promotion as we continue to scale, and a remote-first culture rooted in communication, transparency, and trust help us to attract and retain some of the best talents in the industry and we would love for you to join us on our mission.  We’ve created a remote first culture that thrives in a virtual environment so you have the resources you need to connect with talented people around the world.

About the job Job Description  Business Analyst  Who Are We  As a global consulting partnership in more than 40 countries, our people make us who we are. We’re individuals with different passions and strengths who take as much joy in the work we do as from those we work with. Over the years we’ve fostered a culture in which we are united by shared values—passion, solidarity, generosity, curiosity and boldness—and these come alive in the work we do and how we do it.  Together, we know our people are our difference—for our clients, our colleagues, and our communities. That’s why we take pride in being individual and inclusive and create a place where everyone can bring their full self to work.        Collaborating with our clients across a range of industries and service practices, our people are always learning. At Kearney, you will broaden your knowledge and experience across a breadth of areas, no matter your role. Being rooted in expertise, we know our people deserve opportunities to go places and further their exposure to the business world.  We believe in the power of apprenticeship. At Kearney, you work alongside colleagues who help you be the best you can be. Through both, our structured programs and apprenticeship model, you will continue to learn and develop every day. After all, we are here to help you not just perform, but to thrive in your career .  At Kearney, we give you the freedom to contribute creatively while you also pursue your dreams. We want you to bring your whole self to work and to find joy in what you do. That’s why we support our people when they want to let their uniqueness show and offer personalized opportunities including tuition support, flexible work programs, and externships.    If you’re reading this, you’re smart enough to already know what we’re looking for. Insightful, yes. Inquisitive, naturally. Collaborative, of course. But we’re also looking for problem-solvers who think further than that, who don’t accept the first thing in front of them, and who are always unapologetically themselves.    This business is fundamentally about making connections—between facts, figures, insights, strategies, tools, technologies and above all, people.    Kearney prides itself on providing a culture that allows employees to bring their best selves to work every day. Our people can feel comfortable, confident, and joyful to do great things for our firm, our colleagues, and our clients. That’s why, Kearney is committed to building a diverse, unbiased and inclusive workforce. Kearney is an equal opportunity employer; we recruit, hire, train, promote, develop, and provide other conditions of employment without regard to a person’s gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, disability, marital status, pregnancy status, veteran status, genetic information or any other differences consistent with applicable laws. This includes providing reasonable accommodation for disabilities, or religious beliefs and practices. Members of communities historically underrepresented in consulting are encouraged to apply    N/A

job_title: Software Engineer - User Productivity & RPA / IT Tools & Products
job_description: About the job We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Software Engineer or Solutions Developer who wants to be a part of the Tools & Products team of IT and work on developing and implementing several software systems based on our tool stack with a focus on enhancing the productivity of our teams at Northvolt.  You will be involved in gathering and translating quantitative company data and qualitative insights into creative ideas leading to product decisions and development efforts by aiming at building a user-focused digital product company.  We see you interacting with other department leads, business units, and technical stakeholders to improve their systems and working methodologies with an acute lean on cloud transformation of data and automated/intelligent handling of it.  As an engineer in the Tools & Products team you will help us optimize our tools and applications, find ways of removing cognitive load of our engineers, office and management users, while performing their day to day activities. In this role you would be working with IT and multidisciplinary teams to analyze how our engineering, business and office tools and applications are delivered, experienced and used, identify gaps and find ways to optimize and automate workflows within our organization. You will get the chance to operate and manage the internal configs of our main used systems, Atlassian Jira (Software & Service Management), Confluence, GitHub, Microsoft PowerAutomate, Microsoft PowerApp and develop flows and automated tasks through our RPA tool.  Furthermore, in the position as a Software Engineer you will work with several IT processes and tools, from developing customized tools throughout Microsoft's solutions to tasks concerning the analysis, configuration, and implementation of future upgrades of our Atlassian platform. This includes optimizing our centralized service desk strategy, incident and on-call management process, developing further linkings and integrations of all of our digital user platforms. You will focus on enhancing the usage of existing tools and optimizing how various teams of the company operate and make use of applications – as well as develop in-house tools when there is a need for them in the development environments of the platforms mentioned.  Full time employment, fixed salary.  Planned starting date is asap.          Sounds fun and challenging? Apply and be a part of the digitalization side in our journey for enabling the future of energy.

About the job Hallon is a sister operator of the mobile operator Tre and started in May 2013 with the vision to provide a simple connection every day for everyone. We’ve had a digital focus from the very beginning with a focus on selling and serving our customers via hallon.se and our apps.  About The Role  We are looking for an IT operations engineer for hallon’s internal system. As a member of hallon’s IT team, this position is associated with the daily operation of internal applications. In this critical role, you will be engaged in driving process automation and improvements. A major part of this role will be taking actions on billing systems continuous availability, supporting business with daily customer related tasks as well as being involved in new releases and functional system changes.          To succeed and thrive in the role, you are a team player that find it enjoyable to collaborate with others. You value team spirit and see it as a matter of course, to support your colleagues in their daily challenges. Furthermore, you thrive in a department with talented colleagues and who works well in a busy environment with few identical days and many different tasks.  As a person, you are accurate and able to coordinate and talk across disciplines, colleagues who work with core functionality and network as well as with technical suppliers and our technical back line. The position requires that you be fluent in both spoken and written English. Knowledge of Swedish is an advantage but not critical for the role.  We are looking for someone who has a keen interest in the telecom industry and has a couple of years of relevant experience in a similar role. You have knowledge in PL/SQL. Knowledge in .Net/C# development is a big plus.    We will start interviewing 15th August. For questions about the role, please contact Saul Amram. Applications are only accepted through the link below.  We look forward to receiving and reading your application!

job_title: Business Analyst- Beds Network (Bangkok Based, relocation provided)
job_description: About the job About Agoda  Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.    The Agoda Beds Network team is a new department within Agoda, focusing on improving Agoda’s wholesale supply quality and inventory. As our accommodation partners are a key to our success, we work hard to ensure their success. The Agoda Beds Network team specializes in strategic account management, and data is at the core of everything we do. We serve as consultants and thought leaders to our partners, offering strategic advice on how best to excel on Agoda’s commercial platforms through innovative solutions. With the help of industry-leading technology, we work and collaborate globally to bring together the best ideas from diverse perspectives and strive in ensuring the best value for our partners, our customers, and Agoda overall.    As Business Analyst, your main objective will be to lead the analysis and data visibility required to identify opportunities for optimization for our hotel partners to grow on the Agoda platform. Your role is also to use data to provide transparency and efficiency to the Business Development teams on the ground and guide them in growing the business. You will be instrumental in ensuring there is consistency in data being used for reporting, identifying value-added data to help the business grow as well as using data to make strategic business decisions. You will be expected to dig into data to provide business insights, guide decision-making and offer valuable inputs to further grow our business model.          #STRA#ANLS#MRKT#3 #sanfrancisco About the job What we are looking for:  The DevOps Engineer is part of the Cardano Foundation’s Infrastructure team and will report to the Head of Infrastructure. You will collaborate with developers from different teams to understand their requirements and enable them to build applications using CI/CD infrastructure that make our operations more reliable, secure and scalable. You will advance innovation with the support of our entire engineering team.

About the job The Job  Implementation Engineer Working as part of a team and individually, you will be responsible for the development and the implementation of TEOCO's Service Assurance suite. The individual will possess strong technical skills and be capable of proactively working on projects without requiring constant supervision by the team leader. Education, Knowledge and Skills: * Educated to degree level or equivalent (preferably in Industrial Engineering, Management Information Systems or Electronic Engineering) * Very high command of English - both written and verbal * Presentation / training skills * Energetic, flexible, team player, able to use own initiative and take the lead when needed * Have an aptitude to learning * Be comfortable with working to tight deadlines * Be able to demonstrate a methodical and consistent approach to their work * Be able to 'Multi-task' Specific Technical Requirements * Scripting capabilities such as (Python, KornShell…). Desirable Technical Qualities * Experience with Unix and SQL - an advantage * Experience with Delivery groups and/or Telecom knowledge - an advantage  Schedule of Responsibilities  Implementation Engineer  Responsibilities & Duties * Development of software adaptors / drivers per customers' requirements and Telecom designs Install, configure and train the project teams with the customized solution package * Support the testing teams internally and onsite * Support and guide the customer remotely and onsite * Technically support Pre-sale and demo activities  This

About the job Job Summary  MathWorks has a hybrid work model that enables staff members to split their time between office and home. The hybrid model provides the advantage of having both in-person time with colleagues and flexible at-home life optimizations. Learn More: https://www.mathworks.com/company/jobs/resources/hybrid-model.html.  Are you proactive with a background in engineering or science, and passionate about impacting education and research? Do you enjoy interacting with academics and tackling their research and education challenges? Read on.  In this role you are the primary technical point of contact for university customers. It is your responsibility to empower them to solve their technical and business challenges and to build long-term partnerships. You demonstrate the value of MATLAB and Simulink to grow their adoption in teaching, research, and commercial projects, and leverage your insight into academia to paint a vision of how MathWorks fosters success in education and discovery.  This role will require interaction with Universities and Research Institutions.  The position is based in our Kista office at Stockholm with some travel when safety allows.  MathWorks nurtures growth, appreciates diversity, encourages initiative, values teamwork, shares success, and rewards excellence.

About the job Tobii is the world leader in eye tracking – a computer vision and machine learning based technology that enables a computing device to tell exactly where a person is looking. Eye tracking is used in a broad range of applications including market research and eye-controlled computer interfaces. Headquartered in Stockholm, Tobii covers the global market with offices in USA, China, Japan, UK, and South Korea. If you want to work with meaningful products and solve interesting problems, we are the right company for you!  We are now looking for a QA Engineer that will be working with eye tracking solutions for virtual and augmented reality. You will work in a multidisciplinary team consisting of QA and system engineers as well as algorithm and firmware developers that enjoy collaborating, learning, improving and most of all delivering solutions that help our customers reach their goals. We need your help to make sure Tobii’s technology is delivered with quality!    As a QA Engineer in Tobii, you will contribute to make sure our customers are able to integrate Tobii’s eye tracking technology into their products with confidence. About the job Start date 31st July 2022  Training location Amsterdam, under normal circumstances. Due to Covid-19 there is the possibility of the program starting virtually.  Stockholm, Sweden  Sales –Product    Cisco Sales Associates Program offers a global environment that provides structured training and on-the-job-experience. We will develop your technical, sales and communication skills and give the opportunity to rotate through a variety of areas based on our model of Education Exposure Experience. You will learn how to position Cisco’s architectures, solutions and products to our customers.  Your career will continue in a sales engineering role as part of Cisco’s Global Virtual Engineering (GVE) Team. GVE is a technical presales organisation, that provides software and systems engineering services to customers, partners, and internal Cisco sales employees. As a sales engineer, you’ll discover, demonstrate and design solutions by engaging with our customers and partners to bring simple solutions to their complex challenges.  From there, your career can develop and grow into a variety of sales opportunities at Cisco.  While challenging, it will push you to become the best version of yourself. You will achieve industry-standard certifications, as part our perpetual learning approach, and be assessed and mentored through customer simulations and on-the-job activities. We’ll offer you a safe and fun environment to practice what you’ve learnt, all the while providing you with feedback to develop your potential.    You’ll be part of our Cisco Sales Associates Program (CSAP), an award-winning and industry recognised early-in-career development program for top university graduates from around the world. You’ll train alongside incredibly hardworking individuals, like yourself, from different countries and diverse backgrounds. Early on, you’ll make long-lasting friendships and belong to a rich human network that will support you throughout your career.  As a successful Associate Solutions Engineer (ASE), you’ll expand your software and networking knowledge to collaborate with Cisco sales professionals and provide technical solutions that drive business outcomes for our customers and partners.  You’ll learn from experts and coaches in an unrivalled setting using our own leading-edge technology. You’ll have your own mentor, a CSAP alumnus who’s been in your shoes and will help guide you in your first year. With a strong Cisco team committed to your success, you’ll gain hands-on education and experience, while receiving an attractive salary and pursuing your career dreams!       At Cisco, each person brings their own talents to work as a team and make a difference.  Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.   Colourful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Be you, with us. #WeAreCisco  Cisco is an equal opportunity employer.    Cisco are always looking to identify talented people. If you are reading this posting then we may not have an open job right now, however it is highly likely we will in the future. If you are interested in working for Cisco in this capacity then please submit your details and CV or resume against this requisition so that when a suitable vacancy arises a Cisco representative can contact you directly.  Please note that vacancies will be filled on a rolling basis after opening, and we will close applications as offers are accepted; possibly before the stated deadline. Therefore, we highly recommend you submit your application as early as possible in order to be considered for the opportunity of your choice

About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Modulai works with fish, trains, clothes, money, pets, office spaces, sound sensors and much more. If there is data, we do ML (Machine Learning) on it.  Our team consists of devoted ML engineers with strong track records from some of Sweden’s most successful startups. We work on project basis and take end-to-end responsibility. We love ML and we think that the best way for us to expand our knowledge is to be exposed to a diversified set of challenging and fun projects.  MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER  As a member of the ML-team you will be working with a broad range of problems with one common denominator – ML will be the key ingredient. The projects could be external as well as internal – and in all cases – delivery is central.  You will have to analyze the problem at hand, come up with a solution strategy and execute on it. This typically entails gaining an in-depth understanding of the challenge, understanding the available data and then re-formulating it as a ML problem. It requires openness, creativity and an eagerness to learn new methodology and exploring new terrains.  We frequently attack these problems as a team, meaning that you will have to be able to clearly explain your reasoning and code in order to engage the rest of us.    Python / R – standard open source libraries Scikit-learn and various specialized Python and R ML libraries Deep learning frameworks such as Pytorch and Tensorflow/Keras Cloud platforms such as GCP and AWS Relational database management systems Distributed processing such as Apache Spark    Analyzing and planning problem, solution and delivery  Preprocessing, feature engineering and dataset creation Validation of results Preprocessing, feature engineering and dataset creation Data pipelining and infrastructure development.    MSc or PhD in a quantitative field Excellent understanding of a broad set of ML algorithms and frameworks A passion for lean, clean and maintainable code The desire to grow and to share insights with others.    Deep learning frameworks and theory Data pipelining and infrastructure Some basic devops stuff, creating and maintaining instances.  Apply here: https://modulai.teamtailor.com/

About the job Job Description  Are you a Mathematician ready to level up? Do you love numbers, problem solving and games (everything from online gaming to Go and chess counts, to gaming)? Having tons of fun in a diverse and creative environment has made Evolution Gaming and NetEnt leading providers of premium gaming solutions to the online casino industry. Creating everything in-house, from design to game production and platforms. Now we have joined forces and not even the sky is the limit! Sounds intriguing?    As a Game Mathematician, you will be responsible for developing game concepts from a mathematical/mechanical point of view and help the Product Owners fine-tune these game concepts into the best possible games on the market, for both the NetEnt games and Evolution Live brands. You will develop maths models for games and perform simulations to understand the math parameters and how they compare to other games in our portfolio.  The team also consists of an analytics/Data Science section that deep dives into player and game behaviours to make sure we create as fun games as possible. As a Game Mathematician, you will not only have access to data insights but also the opportunity to collaborate on data-related projects, as well as risk analysis together with the Analytics team to investigate casino risk and fraud attempts.  We offer you a great opportunity to be a part of our ingenious Math team and work with new innovative ideas, from developing the initial gaming concept through to the production of the final mathematical game design.      We're looking for a team player with an innovative personality with a passion to learn new things. You hold a natural talent for understanding and solving abstract and complex problems and have a good eye for detail. It is important that you have an interest in understanding how different math models relate to and translate into player behaviour and what appeals to the end-user. We think you should have an interest in games both from a designer and player perspective.        Additional Information    A fantastic office located in the city centre of Stockholm with amazing colleagues. We are a driven, multi-cultural company at the forefront of the gambling industry. As a member of our awesome team, you will become part of an atmosphere of hard work, (side by side with game nights and pool and table tennis tournaments.)    Here is to apply, it´s super easy!  We want your resume, cover letter/summary, in English and you can choose to either upload files or simply apply directly with your LinkedIn profile. We are keen to get to know you and what makes you tick! So, focus on the requirements as well as letting us know about your passion and why you want to join us.

job_title: Computer Vision Research Engineer - 3D Vision (Stockholm or Gothenburg, Sweden)
job_description: About the job  Summary  The 3D Vision team at Apple Maps is looking for best-in-class talent to join our team of computer vision and machine learning experts. With us, you will be working on ground breaking technology as well as researching and developing new algorithms for processing and making sense of vast volumes of sensor data!   As part of this team you would be working on extremely large data sets of different modalities, collected by various moving platforms - aerial/satellite/ground. You need to have a strong interest in solving real world problems where developing and implementing algorithms are meaningful parts. You would join a team of fast moving and pragmatic problem solvers that are solving some of the toughest problems in the industry.    Proven fundamentals in 3D Computer Vision  Solid C/C++ and system building skills  Experience with modern machine learning technologies is a plus  Experience with deep learning frameworks and infrastructure is a plus  Ability to communicate the results of analyses in a clear and effective manner    The ideal candidate should be an excellent programmer and also excel in one or more of the following areas: Multi-view geometry, 3D reconstruction and texturing, Visual-Inertial Odometry, Bundle Adjustment. Meriting experience include: computational geometry, computer graphics, image processing, applied mathematics.    PhD or Master of Science degree in Computer Science or similar, alternatively a comparable industry career with a consistent track record of successful projects.  Role Number: 200308396

About the job An opportunity for a seasoned business analyst to build a career with Canonical and drive the success of the business.  The Commercial Systems group design, develop, and operate services for millions of Ubuntu machines all over the world, associated with both free and paid operations. These services live at the intersection of open source capabilities (kernel live patching, distro package updates) and business SAAS (contract and subscription management, selective service delivery). These are real-time services which integrate deeply with public clouds and the OS to ensure a consistent Ubuntu experience in every environment.  Developing these systems requires deep understanding of financial reporting and sales processes, as well as technical operating system requirements. It is crucial to integrate seamlessly with stakeholder business processes. You will enjoy this role if you would like to be at the center of business and open source, connecting all the dots, and be the catalyst of cooperation between engineering and business teams.  If successful, you will work with a team of Salesforce engineers and administrators who ensure that business operations teams have the right data at a hand and the right business processes in place. You will also work with software engineers developing a data lake, automating business processes, and integrating a number of software systems used across Canonical, ensuring that the right data flows in the right direction.  We are looking for a business analyst with a background in software engineering, who has the drive, energy, and skills to ensure seamless business processes leveraging the power of software engineering.  Key responsibilities   We expect   Nice to have   What Canonical offers   Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world’s best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

About the job På Capgemini Insights & Data arbetar Nordens och några av världens främsta Data-, Analytics & AI-experter. Det ger oss bästa möjliga förutsättningar att hjälpa våra kunder att lyckas på sin resa mot ett datadrivet beslutsfattande.  Vårt fokus på AI & Data Science fortsätter att ge resultat och vi behöver nu stärka upp med ytterligare Machine Learning Engineers. Arbetar du som Machine Learning Engineer idag? Då är vi intresserade av en dialog med just dig!    I din roll som ML Engineer kommer du med hjälp av data och maskininlärning ta våra kunder in i framtiden. Vår utgångspunkt är alltid i verksamhetsfrågorna, vi skapar insikter inför eller automatiserar beslut. Du kommer därav att vara en nyckelspelare i projektens alla faser med fokus på produktionssättning och skapandet av Machine Learning-system. Dessutom kommer du ofta inkluderas i projektens tidigare faser; från affärs- och dataförståelse till data science-prototyper. Vi bistår alltså våra uppdragsgivare med datadriven affärs- och verksamhetsutveckling hela vägen från strategiska vägval till implementerad lösning och realiserad nytta. Utvecklingen sker genom de senaste open-source verktygen, i exempelvis Python, oberoende av plattform. Tillämpningsområdet är brett; från att göra prognoser på antal besökare till nöjesparker, eller att inom den psykiatriska vården prediktera om en patient kommer att återinläggas, eller att konfigurera verktyg för Data Science & Machine Learning i olika molntjänster. Om du vill läsa på om flera tidigare projekt eller hur vi arbetar finns det mer information på vår hemsida.  Hos Capgemini Insights & Data får du alltså utvecklas genom att tillämpa maskininlärning i flera olika branscher med olika typer av data och målsättningar. Vi erbjuder en trivsam arbetsmiljö där gemenskap och teamkänsla är lika viktigt som den enskilda prestationen. På Capgemini är medarbetarens utrymme att utvecklas stort och kulturen präglas av frihet under ansvar. För oss är det viktigt att skapa goda förutsättningar för lärande; bland annat genom interna kompetensnätverk, läroplattformar interna utbildningssatsningar såsom Cloud Academy.

About the job Every day, people come to Meta to connect with friends and family, discover what's going on in the world, interact with businesses, find potential customers, and build community. Meta's Global Operations team exists to help them.The Developer Operations team ensures that applications integrated with our platforms are high-quality and trustworthy. Working closely with other Meta teams, we investigate and detect apps not compliant with our Platform Policies. Depending on the nature of the violation and the best user experience, we may take a variety of actions; everything from helping the developer/publisher fix the problem, to permanently removing the developer/publisher and application from our platform. We are committed to improving the platform experience for users, publishers and developers through the use of automated detection tools, analysis of on and off platform investigative findings, data analysis, guidance, and coordination with product teams. Meta is looking for a strong team player who will be responsible for auditing and investigating Meta integrated apps, developers and respective companies to identify potential violations of our policies. In this position, you will interface with internal teams such as Partnerships, Policy, Legal, Marketing and Engineering, as well as with external developers using the out platforms. The candidate must be able to understand causation, share lessons learnt and demonstrate impact by preventing recurrence. job_title: Senior Business Analyst inom digitaliseringsprojekt - Stockholm
job_description: About the job Hos oss varierar komplexiteten på projektet utifrån din erfarenhet. Det här betyder att du ständigt blir utmanad i din roll som Business Analyst på Capgemini. Ju längre erfarenhet, desto större och mer komplexa projekt. Samtidigt värdesätter vi en god work-life-balance och erbjuder därför en hög flexibilitet i jobbet. Teamet verkar för att skapa goda samarbeten och kompetensdelning både internt, och ute hos kunden.    Som Senior Business Analyst arbetar du med att leverera IT-lösningar av högsta kaliber till våra kunder, i ett nära samarbete med ditt projektteam. Projektens längd, storlek och komplexitet varierar utifrån din senioritet.  Våra kunder arbetar i olika branscher som statlig myndighet, telekombranschen och retail. Den röda tråden i de projekt som vi tar oss an, är att bidra i våra kunders nästa steg av deras unika digitaliseringsresa, och tillföra samhällsnytta genom kunds digitala transformationer.  Rollen är till stor del en rådgivande roll, där du initialt lyssnar in, ställer frågor, utmanar och analyserar kundens nuvarande situation för att förstå verksamhetens behov på djupet. Vidare driver du workshops och kartlägger processer för att slutligen definiera och formulera IT-kraven, som utvecklarna sedan kan utgå från.  Aleksandra, en av våra Business Analyst, beskriver våra olika projekt och arbetssätt som väldigt varierande, då våra kunder har olika utmaningar. Det gör att vi ständigt utmanas i vårt sätt att lösa problem. Vi får anpassa vårt sätt att leda och lära ut samt vara kreativa i arbetet. På mitt nuvarande uppdrag är det stort fokus på att driva hela projektet framåt på en högre nivå utöver att arbeta med krav en vilket är intressant och dynamiskt.           Vi jobbar självklart agilt i denna rekryteringsprocess vilket innebär att visa steg kan ske parallellt. Varmt välkommen in med din ansökan!

About the job About Rillion We are a global company founded in Sweden with 30 years’ experience in the AP Automation industry. We help finance professionals transform how they manage invoices by digitalizing and automating the entire process.  By removing the manual steps of invoice handling, we enable finance teams to save time and effort, reducing the possibility of human error. Because we’re AP professionals ourselves, we understand how to give our customers everything they need, and nothing they don’t.

About the job About the HCL:- HCL Technologies is a next-generation global technology company that helps enterprises reimagine their businesses for the digital age. Our technology products, services, and engineering are built on four decades of innovation, with a world-renowned management philosophy, a strong culture of invention and risk-taking, and a relentless focus on customer relationships.

About the job WELCOME TO UTOPIA  Music is incredible. It can excite hundreds, and unite thousands. But as an industry, it has been slow, complicated, and disparate. While the tech world has moved into the future, the music industry continues to be shaped by inefficient systems of the past. At Utopia we believe there is a better way. Which is why today we are setting out to transform the entire industry; creating new revenue streams, consolidating the data and decluttering the admin. Unlocking the industry’s full potential by unifying it all in one truly holistic space. Some might call that a Utopia.  Funnily enough, so do we.    The open secret is that the music industry is struggling with the very basics of music accounting: What was played, when and where? Who should get paid and how much?  Utopia Music is bridging the data gap by connecting global consumption, accurate metadata, and fast payments to an industry-wide trust platform. Our goal is to unlock creative value and enable to make a better world for Music. The solutions we offer do not threaten to usurp the role of industry incumbents - it is about bringing transparency in the industry and supporting efficient royalty collection for all.    As IP Analyst, you will work on the first line, advising on all matters relating to IP landscaping and provide regular IP reports to different business and functions. As a key member of the BA – Intellectual Property team you will be a corner stone in achieving Utopia’s objective to Gain the Trust of the Industry, and will collaborate closely with our Strategy and Business Units.  You will be a key player, a strategic business partner providing IP searches and analysis to enable effective and informed decision making within Utopia Group.  You will collaborate closely with our inventor’s community to develop a first class WW IP portfolio, and with our Business Analysts to provide insights on dynamic market changes within the competition and other insights that positively impact business decisions and strategy, by ensuring all competitive IP intelligence is available and easily accessible to key customers, partners and other stakeholders.    In this position, you will be primarily accountable for consistently and effectively:              As we want to bring transparency, trust, and clarity to the music industry we serve, we know a change comes from within. Utopia is a transparent, trust-based organization striving to have clarity in thinking and doing what we set out to do.  We execute urgently and innovate to grow faster. We ship things that make a difference today, so we can make them better tomorrow. We embrace fairness and are all accountable.  Strictly diverse and inclusive.  We celebrate our diverse backgrounds and we welcome everyone who identifies with the above to apply.  We’re eager to meet :)  Utopia Music is a Swiss Music fintech company through clear, transparent, and reliable data-based solutions. We support the whole Industry to make more money, faster, with less costs, and less errors.  In Utopia, the Industry sees market opportunities live. Investors elevate Music catalogs into a real asset class. Collection societies track more and spend less. Labels, publishers, and distributors simplify and enhance their business. And everyone gets Fair Pay for Every Play.  Utopia is serving the music copyrights and the industry from creation to consumption, and will never compete against it. It means that we will never own copyrights. We will never be owned by the major stakeholders of the industry. We will never share or sell data of our customers to anyone else.

About the job Summary  Nordic Senior Reforecasting Analyst  Job Description    We are actively recruiting a Nordic Senior Reforecasting Analyst within our Group Investments department. You have data analytics and cashflow forecasting experience and are naturally inquisitive, with a desire to get into the detail and present comprehensive analysis. If your mission and drive is to translate detailed analysis and data interpretation into actionable steps to drive real results this could be your next career step!    Lowell is one of Europe's leading and most respected credit management companies, we believe in the importance of good relationships. Whether that’s with our customers or our people.  We want to listen to and understand our customers, not judge them, so that we can find the most affordable and fair ways to help them pay off their debts. Fairness runs through everything we do.  We believe our greatest assets are our people and we’re keen to develop teams who want to make a difference.  So that’s us, now let’s talk about your role…    You will be responsible for building, monitoring and maintaining the active gross and cost cashflow forecasts for our Debt Purchase portfolios, in order to support the robust on-going valuation of the company’s considerable asset base.  Partnering with key stakeholders across the business (including Portfolio Analytics, Operations and Pricing), you will build a thorough understanding of portfolio performance to date, in order to complete robust portfolio evaluations and cashflow curve reforecasting.  This means you will have strong business acumen and commercial awareness, combined with professional experience working within asset valuation, cash flow forecasting and/or portfolio analysis, with the proven ability to translate complex data into high quality and detailed work to drive insight and value.  Armed with a professional curiosity and a naturally analytical mindset, you will take real enjoyment in utilising your skills in a solutions orientated, problem solving approach, and in doing so will make a significant contribution to the management of the Group’s sizable Debt Purchase asset base.    We welcome you to an exciting company with high goals and ambitions, which is constantly working to develop and challenge itself. We offer you a warm company climate, great colleagues and good benefits and working conditions. At Lowell, we have chosen to work in a hybrid model, which means that we work both in the office and from home. A little depending on the role and tasks of course.  Lowell is a value-driven company that lives by the values of Pioneering, Ambition, Compassion, Excellence and Responsibility. These values are the foundation of Lowell's business and way of being and working.

About the job Vi utmanar de traditionella konsultbolagen och vi kan med stolthet säga att Castra är konsultbranschens mest utvecklande arbetsplats där allt är möjligt. Känns det här som företaget för dig så läs gärna vidare.  Rollen  Vi söker en erfaren Business analyst/dataspecialist vars arbete innebär att tillhandahålla analys, prognoser samt fungera som rapporteringsstöd till kundens lokaliserings- och trafikteam som sitter inom Global Content Operations. Lokaliserings- och trafikteamen är företagets nyckelfunktion i förberedelsen av innehåll som levereras till plattformen och en viktig del av detta är att förse med uppdaterad data om de framsteg som gjorts och förutsäga framtida prestanda och resultat.  I rollen som Business Analyst ingår uppgifter som att granska vad som för närvarande finns på plats, förnya och uppdatera vår prognos- och rapporteringsutdata samt att aktivt underhålla data och fungera som en nyckelkontakt till den högsta ledningen.    Denna roll skulle idealt passa någon med erfarenhet från broadcast- eller kreativa mediebranscher eller med digitalt innehåll.    Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Att alla får vara med och forma och påverka bolaget genom delägarskap, advisory board och projektgrupper. Att det är viktigt att ha ett sammanhang, känna tillhörighet och att man har kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och tror på en.    Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systemutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.  Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work® fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring företagskultur. Våra tankar om delaktighet, påverkansmöjligheter och respekt för individens egna val och möjligheter fungerar.  Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida www.castra.se.  Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta semir.jasarevic@castra.se Tfn: 073-643 84 72

About the job About Us  Description  TriOptima’s services stabilizes the global financial system. Our customers depend on our services to save them money, time, and help them follow regulations. Since 2018, TriOptima has been a part of CME Group, the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace.  Working at TriOptima  We have a flat management structure and everyone has a stake in the success of our products. We value innovation and empower our development teams to be a driving force in the evolution of our products. Teams are highly self-driven doing continuous deployment. We are continuously adjusting our way of working as we find what works for us. We have mob programming teams running most of the time and when appropriate we do pair programming encouraging collaboration and continued learning. We believe that diversity is what makes a good team great, and that diversity of experience and thought create inclusive and successful products. As a global company with colleagues around the world we work in English, even in the Stockholm office where the TriOptima technology department is located.  The office space is modern, spacious and designed for social interactions and our rooftop terrace makes for scenic lunches in the summertime, right in the middle of Stockholm. We will provide you with equipment for remote work and always encourage a healthy work-life balance. We believe our colleagues are fantastic and the most important part of us and our culture. We strive to make this a place where everyone feels like they have a place, can grow and have fun while doing something valuable.  Technologies  We build web-based services and our teams individually choose the technology best suited for their needs. Some technologies used are: Python/Django, Kotlin/Spring Boot, React, Cassandra/MySQL/Vertica, Docker/Kubernetes  While it's good if you are familiar with some of the above, we don't expect you to know it all. We expect most people to have solid experience in some tech stack and learn on the job. The stack is just a small part compared to the product itself.    We have developers with a lot of different backgrounds, regarding both work experience and education. At the end of the day, what really matters is that you have a genuine interest in programming, problem solving, and learning new things.  We truly believe TriOptima is one of the best places to work in Stockholm, if not the world. We look forward to hearing from you.  CME Group: Where Futures Are Made  CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. With 3,500 employees located around the world, we're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.

About the job One of my clients in the Banking industry are building their BI team with a DW Specialist, and they need your help!  They are at the beginning of their cloud journey - their main goal is to have all data in the cloud but this will require a lot of various projects and dedication from the team to get there. The Data Architect has started this journey and has built the data lake ready for the migration.  Their focus on innovative solutions are key in this development phase as they transition to cloud (Azure and Snowflake). They're characterised by clear dialogue and short decision paths where their ambitious employees contribute to the bank's development with their specific skills and knowledge.  You will be responsible for the DW (SAS and SQL), which includes pulling data and reports from the DW, developing and maintain data marts, overseeing ETL processes, monitoring the data quality and generally ensuring that data flows are efficient.  Due to the strong feedback loop and collaboration with other teams in the business, you will get the opportunity to really shape their soon to be cloud-based DW, and will genuinely see the impact of your work on the wider business.  You will also get the chance to work beside some expert BI professionals who are very well regarded in the community - so plenty of chance for knowledge sharing!  Your profile:

About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Är du en fena på att förstå kundens behov och omvandla dessa till tydliga systemkrav? Är du noggrann och strävar efter att leverera med god kvalité i ditt arbete? Har du ett brinnande intresse för användarvänlighet? Har du samtidigt intresse och kunskap inom ekonomi? Då får du inte missa chansen att söka tjänsten som Business Analyst hos oss!    Som business analyst kommer du att analysera krav från våra användare och ta fram lösningsförslag. Du kommer att arbeta med att ta fram testscenarier för att säkerställa kvalité. Du kommer att arbeta tätt ihop med utvecklare, testare, produktägare och produktchef i ett agilt utvecklingsteam i en internationell miljö, baserade i Sverige och Baltikum. I linje med Vismas produktstrategi arbetar vi aktivt för att leverera våra produkter genom hela kedjan från krav till produktion.  Vi ser framför oss att du vill göra skillnad för vår produkt, lägger stor vikt vid användbarhet och har en förmåga att se helheten i produkten. Vi ser även att du inte är rädd för att komma med nya idéer för hållbara lösningar i linje med produktens roadmap och att samtidigt värna om kvalité.  I rollen kommer du att arbeta med Visma Affärslösningar som är en komplett lösning för ekonomiprocesser för svenska kommuner. I ditt arbete bygger du tillsammans med teamen upp en gemensam kompetens om såväl vår domän som produkt och arbetar med att öka förståelsen för marknadens och våra kunders behov nu och i framtiden.  Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning och placeringsort är flexibelt mellan Stockholm, Malmö, Göteborg, Växjö och Skellefteå. Vi ser också att andra orter kan vara möjliga.    Du är en person som är noggrann och strävar efter att leverera med god kvalité. Du är duktig på att analysera och förstå våra kunders behov. Vidare gillar du att arbeta självständigt och är ansvarstagande. Du gillar samtidigt att tillhöra ett team där du är en hjälpsam och stöttande kollega.  Vi ser att du har goda kunskaper och en djup förståelse för ekonomiprocesser. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av agil produktutveckling eller har arbetet i en liknande roll tidigare. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.    I denna rekrytering samarbetar Visma PubliTech med Level Recruitment. Rekryteringen är en direkt rekrytering, d.v.s. anställning erbjuds direkt hos Visma PubliTech. Vänligen sök tjänsten genom att klicka på "ansök"-knappen här intill. Vid frågor vänligen kontakta rekryteringskonsult Daniel Stenberg på Daniel.stenberg@levelrecruitment.se (inga ansökningar tas emot via mail, vänligen ansök genom knappen ”ansök”) alternativt 08-120 50 429. Då urvalet av ansökningar sker löpande välkomnar vi din ansökan så snart som möjligt    Visma PubliTech är ett nybildat bolag inom Visma koncernen. Vi drar fördelarna av att vara ett mindre, entreprenöriellt bolag med nära samarbete och en varm familjär kultur, samtidigt som vi ingår i en av Europas ledande IT-koncerner. Vår vision är att stärka offentlig sektor med innovativa lösningar som bidrar till maximerad verksamhetsnytta och ett hållbart samhälle.  Hos oss jobbar du i en av Europas ledande IT-koncerner som kännetecknas av stark framåtanda, prestigelöshet och entreprenörskap. Vi är stolta över våra kompetenta och engagerade medarbetare och vi tror att engagemang skapas genom utmaningar, trygghet samt flexibilitet.  Visma är mer än bara systemlösningar- våra lösningar svarar på riktiga utmaningar med syfte att förenkla våra kunders vardag och ge dem möjligheten att arbeta smartare. Vi är här för att bidra till tillväxt och välstånd för företag och samhälle. Tack vare våra lösningar förbättrar vi affärer, karriärer och liv.  Sökord: applikationskonsult, ekonomikonsult, ekonomiansvarig,
