About the job Do you want to be an important part of shaping the future within the Nordic Telecom market? Then find out how we can give you the future you want!  The Mission  As a Business Analyst @ Capgemini you will have a unique opportunity to help our customers design and implement the best technology solutions. From the early pre-design phase until the first go-live. In general, our assignments cover various sectors like telecom, retail, finance, utilities, industries, media, and the public sector. This role will be in the telecom segment. Here you will cooperate closely with our experts in roles covering requirements, architecture, project leaders, and developers normally working in an Agile way. You will have your Capgemini colleagues both in the Nordics as well as within some of the Capgemini companies globally, including State Of the Art solutions, education, and support from our partners    At the core, you understand how to translate client needs and requirements into clear user stories. You can engage and elicit responses from a diverse set of business stakeholders, understand and analyze clients’ current business processes, operational challenges while defining their future roadmap. Working in a highly collaborative way with diverse stakeholders across Business and IT is a must. Working closely with Product Managers/Product owners to understand EPICs and break them down to capabilities & features and grooming user story backlogs comes naturally to you. Story grooming skills and documenting specifications are essential to be successful in this role.

About the job At Elastic, we see endless possibility in a world of endless data. And we use the power of search to help people and organizations turn that possibility into results. Elastic is the leading platform for search-powered solutions. With solutions in Enterprise Search, Observability, and Security, we help improve customer and employee search experiences, keep critical applications running smoothly, and protect against cyber threats. Elastic enables organizations worldwide to use the power of Elastic, including Netflix, Uber, BBC, Microsoft, and thousands of others.  Elastic was built on a foundation of being free and open, which trickles down to how we work. We’re a distributed organization and have been from the beginning. Being distributed isn’t just a way of doing business—it’s a mentality that is at the core of our culture.  The Elastic Threat Intelligence Services team designs, builds, and runs data processing pipelines and product features to synthesize security data from a broad set of sources, delivering innovative detection capabilities for our users. We are looking for a Software Engineer to craft data processing and analytics systems to help find new threats in the wild and better understand our users. You will collaborate with the broader Elastic Security team - a diverse set of security researchers, data scientists, and engineers who lend domain expertise and work with you to solve creative security problems and deliver fantastic user experiences.        Experience with one or more of the following:    As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.  We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.

About the job kevin. is a startup with a bright present and even brighter future. Here we dream big, and then we commit to making those dreams come true. We have already built things that were never built before - in-app payments, card redirect, and there is more to come.  How did we manage that? By hiring people that are talented, driven, ambitious. Our company provides an environment where people like that can flourish - they can learn, explore, innovate. And they do just that!  So come join us and add rocket fuel to your career! kevin. is a great place to explore paths that were not explored before, and actually make impactful decisions.     :        kevin.’s advanced A2A (account-to-account) payment infrastructure solution was created to swiftly change costly card payments to payments linked directly from customers’ bank accounts without using any third-party providers. kevin.’s technology scales to businesses of any size and across industries, including retail, parking, fashion, car-sharing, deliveries, insurance and many more. kevin. focuses on mobile and POS payments where customers predominantly pay using cards currently. Its payment infrastructure is based on open banking – regulated by the European PSD2 Directive – which requires all banks and financial institutions in the European Economic Area to open their API for licensed third-party providers. kevin. develops only own connections to the banks without using any third-party aggregators.  Currently, the Company supports more than 6,000 merchants in 15 markets, including Sweden, Finland, Poland, Spain, Netherlands, Baltics and Portugal, where the company has a coverage of more than 85% of bank customers. The firm’s services will be available in 28 European Economic Area (EEA) countries by the end of 2022. kevin. has a team of more than 220 employees in 20 countries and it plans to expand its workforce to beyond 350 employees in 2022.  kevin. is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

About the job På Capgemini Insights & Data arbetar Nordens och några av världens främsta Data-, Analytics & AI-experter. Det ger oss bästa möjliga förutsättningar att hjälpa våra kunder att lyckas på sin resa mot ett datadrivet beslutsfattande.  Vårt fokus på AI & Data Science fortsätter att ge resultat och vi behöver nu stärka upp med ytterligare Machine Learning Engineers. Arbetar du som Machine Learning Engineer idag? Då är vi intresserade av en dialog med just dig!    I din roll som ML Engineer kommer du med hjälp av data och maskininlärning ta våra kunder in i framtiden. Vår utgångspunkt är alltid i verksamhetsfrågorna, vi skapar insikter inför eller automatiserar beslut. Du kommer därav att vara en nyckelspelare i projektens alla faser med fokus på produktionssättning och skapandet av Machine Learning-system. Dessutom kommer du ofta inkluderas i projektens tidigare faser; från affärs- och dataförståelse till data science-prototyper. Vi bistår alltså våra uppdragsgivare med datadriven affärs- och verksamhetsutveckling hela vägen från strategiska vägval till implementerad lösning och realiserad nytta. Utvecklingen sker genom de senaste open-source verktygen, i exempelvis Python, oberoende av plattform. Tillämpningsområdet är brett; från att göra prognoser på antal besökare till nöjesparker, eller att inom den psykiatriska vården prediktera om en patient kommer att återinläggas, eller att konfigurera verktyg för Data Science & Machine Learning i olika molntjänster. Om du vill läsa på om flera tidigare projekt eller hur vi arbetar finns det mer information på vår hemsida .  Hos Capgemini Insights & Data får du alltså utvecklas genom att tillämpa maskininlärning i flera olika branscher med olika typer av data och målsättningar. Vi erbjuder en trivsam arbetsmiljö där gemenskap och teamkänsla är lika viktigt som den enskilda prestationen. På Capgemini är medarbetarens utrymme att utvecklas stort och kulturen präglas av frihet under ansvar. För oss är det viktigt att skapa goda förutsättningar för lärande; bland annat genom interna kompetensnätverk, läroplattformar interna utbildningssatsningar såsom Cloud Academy.  Vi söker nu dig som är erfaren inom Machine Learning och som vill fortsätta utvecklas och ta nästa steg. Vi ser gärna att du har relevant högskoleutbildning och erfarenhet av att arbeta som Data Scientist eller Machine Learning Engineer (eller liknande roll) i flertalet tidigare projekt. Vidare bör du ha vana av mjukvaruutveckling i projektform med tillhörande verktyg (exempelvis git). Du förstår och har beprövad erfarenhet av att jobba med open-source lösningar, och du har även ett driv och intresse för att kommunicera möjligheterna med tekniker som Machine Learning till våra kunder. Du kommer därav att vara en nyckelspelare i projektens alla faser med fokus på produktionssättning och skapandet av Machine Learning-system.        Som person är du driven, verksamhetsorienterad och du trivs lika bra med att arbeta självständigt som i grupp. Du sätter stort fokus på dialogen med kund men är även intresserad av att engagera dig i att utveckla oss till att bli en ännu bättre arbetsplats. Det är viktigt att du är analytisk, lösningsorienterad och nyfiken, att du har en god samarbetsförmåga samt lätt för att kommunicera. Därtill är det meriterande om du har erfarenhet av eller intresse för att hålla utbildningar och workshops. Det är viktigt att du behärskar svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift, då vi har en nära dialog med våra kunder.  Inom Capgemini Insights & Data är vi ett stort team med specialister och våra tjänster spänner över områden såsom – rådgivning, framtagning av digitala strategier och roadmaps, design och implementation av AI-, IoT-, Analytics- och Data Management-lösningar. Givetvis understött av molnarkitektur och cybersäkerhet. Som ett konsultbolag inom IT är vi smala, med vår nisch mot Analytics, men inom Analytics är vi breda. För dig som lockas av att vara med i ett av Sveriges och Nordens vassaste team inom Analytics, och mer specifikt Data Science, är detta ett jobb för dig!

About the job TUI Group is the world’s number one integrated tourism business. The Product Domain is a global team within TUI technology responsible for managing the products sold by TUI. We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts across Architecture, Engineering, DevOps and Agile Delivery providing services across the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Belgium and The Netherlands.  At TUI we’re ambitious to become the leader in technology within the travel industry and to achieve this we are looking to build a capable, creative team who want to be a part of accomplishing that goal.  The Senior Business Analyst is a critical thinker with a keen eye for detail. Actively consulting with stakeholders, probing to create and communicate a common understanding of the problem that needs solving. Working within a fast-paced agile environment, the Senior Business Analyst thinks outside of the box, loves collaborating across teams and is a lifelong learner.    As a Senior Business Analyst, you are part of a cross-functional team that delivers end to end solutions from conception to operation. You will collaborate with architects, analysts, business stakeholders, product owners, software developers, technology leads and UX/UI designers to clearly define, document and communicate requirements that will enable implementation of new changes and enhancements to our digital platforms in an agile manner.  You’re responsible for evaluating solution options, consulting with a range of stakeholders as needed to define and articulate business needs in a way that enables the design and delivery of technical solutions that add value across TUI global platforms and services. You use your deep understanding of TUI products and systems, business models, processes, data flows and their link to business capabilities to plan and deliver high quality business analysis that supports the ongoing delivery of growth and digital transformation across our key markets.  Working alongside a varied set of technology and business stakeholders, you define and document new business, user, and system requirements, considering impacts to upstream/downstream services. You manage the requirement lifecycle from planning through to elicitation, testing, delivery, and business acceptance. You can provide business analysis to multiple delivery teams using different development methodologies, but mainly agile, and work closely with the product owners and business leads to prioritise and manage complex backlogs.  As a Senior Business Analyst you distil the needs of business and using your excellent collaboration skills you support your team to deliver the best solutions to our customers’ needs. You are commercially astute, focusing on solving business problems in the best way and are well-connected across the domain, within the broader TUI community and relevant Communities of Practice.  Security is part of everyone’s job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.        We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA  If you require any further information regarding this opportunity, please email recruitment@tui.co.uk

job_title: InfoSec - Senior Governance and Customer Assurance Analyst
job_description: About the job At Elastic, we see endless possibility in a world of endless data. And we use the power of search to help people and organizations turn that possibility into results. Elastic is the leading platform for search-powered solutions. With solutions in Enterprise Search, Observability, and Security, we help improve customer and employee search experiences, keep critical applications running smoothly, and protect against cyber threats. Elastic enables organizations worldwide to use the power of Elastic, including Netflix, Uber, BBC, Microsoft, and thousands of others.  Elastic was built on a foundation of being free and open, which trickles down to how we work. We’re a distributed organization and have been from the beginning. Being distributed isn’t just a way of doing business—it’s a mentality that is at the core of our culture.  We’re always on the search for amazing people. People who have a real passion for what they do and are masters at their craft. We are looking for a to join our team in Information Security (InfoSec). The InfoSec team leads the strategy, policy, and programs for information security company-wide. Our responsibilities include risk management, implementing a comprehensive security program, driving compliance initiatives, recommending and implementing security controls, preventing and detecting security threats, and handling incident response. We do all of this in a globally distributed company, thinking differently about how we best achieve critical information security objectives.  This could be your dream job, and we'd love to meet you!        As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.  We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.

job_title: Performance Test Engineer to SEB in Stockholm
job_description: About the job Are you a Performance Test Engineer and interested in Cloud, automation, CI/CD and new technology? Welcome to SEB in Stockholm!  As a Performance Test Engineer at SEB in Stockholm, you will work with end-to-end performance testing and further develop our performance testing from a Continuous Delivery/DevOps perspective as well as be part of our journey to the Cloud with GCP. We have more than 1200 applications and you will test everything from applications used by millions of customers to applications designed to protect the bank from money laundering.    You will work as a performance test engineer against SEB´s development teams and technical platforms such as Java, .NET and Mainframe. You can expect a developing role where each assignment is unique. You work consultatively with assignment leaders from the development teams where you are responsible for test management, execute the performance tests and deliver results. You will also be involved in how we establish performance tests from a Continuous Delivery/DevOps perspective and our goal to shift left.    You will belong to a team of Performance Test Engineers, Scrum Master and Product Owner. We collaborate and work together with all delivery teams throughout SEB and we are known for our deep expertise within the area performance testing.  The entire bank is working according to the same agile framework and ceremonies. The office is located in Arenastaden, Solna and is award-winning for Swedens best office 2019 and has among many things, restaurants, cafes, modern gym, top of the art bicycle garage and roof-top garden.    We believe that you have a couple of years of experience in a similar role with end-to-end performance testing. You have worked with tools like LoadRunner, JMeter or similar and have experience of scripting and analyzing test results.  As a person, you are eager to learn more and have genuine interest in new technologies. You work well in a team and are happy to share your knowledge with others. To be able to communicate effectively with your colleagues, you are fluent in both written and spoken English.  Welcome with your application!        We have chosen to work with Ada Digital in this recruitment. Their recruitment process focuses on transparency, inclusion and a fast moving candidate experience. And now we want to know more about you – on your own terms! To apply, please fill out the short form, briefly motivate why you are interested in the position, and attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile. No additional documentation is needed. You can then, in real-time, follow your application online as our recruiters are working with it. We work with a continues selection process which means we might hire a candidate before the final apply date, so apply already today! Interested and want to know more? Please contact our recruiter today. We are looking forward to connecting soon!

About the job We have established a new data science practice at Canonical. The team will innovate in the open source data science technology stack, deliver advanced business analytics, support product roadmap decisions for Canonical through actionable insights, and lead by example in setting and publicly advocating for industry standards in open source data science. The team will have both Data Scientists and Data Engineers.  As a Data Scientist at Canonical you will work to generate actionable insights from data across the Canonical ecosystem. Our Data Engineers work hard to make sure that you have the right data - with the right safeguards - in your hands at any time. As a Data Scientist, your challenge is to transform that data into meaningful changes in our operations, decision-making or awareness.  You will design, deploy and evaluate machine learning models at scale on cutting-edge infrastructure. You will use a range of analytics capabilities to build decision-support tools, dashboards, monitoring and reports.  As an internal user, you will shape, beta test and contribute to our open source data platforms and MLOps solutions. This work requires proactive collaboration in a worldwide distributed team of engineers who are experts in many fields.  At Canonical you will partner up with key stakeholders to build data products to support our diverse offerings - from Ubuntu Desktop and Server, cloud infrastructure at the largest scale, to open source robotics and IoT solutions.  You will be at the forefront of technical development in open source data science. As such, you will get the chance to advocate for solutions, which you help to build, at the most prestigious industrial and academic venues worldwide.  We expect   What Canonical offers   Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world’s best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

job_title: Senior Deal Desk & Sales Operations Analyst
job_description: About the job Pleo is looking for a Deal Desk & Sales Operations Specialist to support the sales teams throughout the sales cycle.  But wait, you haven't heard of Pleo before? Really?  Cash is old school. Out of pocket expenses suck. Workplaces need to be more trusting, progressive and – that's right, we're gonna say it – fun. We're a company that deals with company spending: we think that all employees should be trusted to spend company money.  It's an exciting time for us: we raised over $350M in our latest investment Series C round, and Pleo is launching in 15 new markets this year (we currently have offices in Copenhagen, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid and Lisbon).    Here in the Revenue Operations team, we set our people & partners up for success in order to deliver great distribution experience across the customer lifecycle, which results in unlocking true growth potential & improving customer lifetime value. We do this by supporting all operational, enablement & strategic activities across the customer lifecycle.  As a Deal Desk Specialist, you will work cross-functionally within Rev.Ops, but also Billing, Contracts and Legal teams to provide quoting and deal structuring support to the Sales teams. This will be a growth position as Pleo’s business continues to massively expand.           At Pleo, we use English for all our internal communication to keep everyone on the same page; please submit your application in English unless otherwise stated above.  We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs.  Not everyone interviews the same: if you have accessibility needs that you would like us to know about, send an email to our Inclusion team at belonging@pleo.io and we’ll make sure to design an interview format that works for you.  Why work here?  Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Through fintech we've seen a way to impact how people work; we think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Based on some pretty amazing Series C-round investment in 2021 we think we're onto something big.  So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 800+ team, from over 74 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal, or Lisbon offices – and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by sensible things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us we'll help you get up the best remote setup possible, and will fly you in for our amazing team camps ✈️  Things to look up about us  Sometimes, we win awards 🤩 🏆  If you want to know how we hire company-wide, there's a post on our blog.  Or have a sneak peek into what happens when get together for Pleo Team Camp on our YouTube 👈🏾  Check out what we think about the realities of working remotely on our blog.  No one says it quite like our customers. Hear what they have to say this week on Trustpilot.  Also, check out Glassdoor if you'd like to hear about us from other people.  PS. we treat all candidates equally: 🙂

job_title: Senior Digital Analyst till Adding Insight
job_description: About the job Adding Insight är en specialistbyrå inom digital analys grundad 2015. Under åren har de haft arbetat tätt med kunder som IKEA, Dustin, Axfood, SBAB och Epidemic Sound.  De är för närvarande fyra personer i teamet, men efterfrågan från kunderna är stor och för att kunna hjälpa flera önskar man att växa med ytterligare seniora personer. Affärskulturen präglas av schyssta värderingar och kundsamarbeten av högsta kvalité.    Som konsult hos Adding Insight arbetar du i ett par parallella projekt med fokus på digital mätning, analys och optimering. Du arbetar nära kundernas marknads- och analysteam, oftast som en integrerad resurs i kundernas team. Du kommer att stötta kunderna i förståelse av hur deras webbplatser eller appar används samt utvärdera och ge förslag på optimering av deras digitala marknadsföring.  Uppdragen innebär varierande arbetsuppgifter och inkluderar allt från att ta fram mätplaner, säkerställa en hög datakvalitet till att vara med och förbättra webbplatser och appar. Du kommer främst att arbeta med verktygen Google Analytics, Microsoft Excel, Google Data Studio, Google Tag Manager, Google Optimize och Google BigQuery.  Adding Insight främjar kundsamarbeten med fokus på jämställdhet och en klimat-positiv framtid. Man arbetar främst med mellanstora och stora företagskunder i Norden.  Rollen är en heltidsanställning med placering på kontor i centrala Stockholm alternativt ute hos kund. Men som situationen ser ut idag så arbetar man främst hemifrån. About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Om tjänsten Wrknest söker nu Fullstack-utvecklare samt Frontend-utvecklare till Fondo. Fondo är ett startup och har en bred bakgrund från finans och teknik. Vi letar efter dig som vill jobba i ett snabbrörligt företag där du har stort ansvar i det du levererar. Du kommer att arbeta nära produkten och komma in tidigt i företaget, vilket ger dig stora möjligheter att vara med och sätta din prägel. Fondos stack är baserad på mikrotjänster i en Google Cloud-miljö, främst i Kubernetes, som tillsammans med frontend-applikationer utgör deras plattform. I backend finns flera REST API:er och integrationer mot tredjepartssystem. De har byggt upp sitt system och appen själva vilket gör att systemet är anpassningsbart och implementationer går snabbt. De använder JavaScript och TypeScript över hela stacken med hjälp av framförallt Node.js och React. De håller ett ständigt öga på allt spännande som händer inom området och är öppna för ny teknik och nya metoder. Detta är en direktrekrytering via Wrknest med anställning hos Fondo och all kontakt sköts direkt med Wrknest för denna process. Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter Beroende på vilken inriktning och intresse du har kommer din roll att se lite olika ut. Om du är mer mot Frontend jobbar du antingen mer inriktat mot marknad, design och hemsidan med webbutveckling, eller mer i appen som är skriven i React Native, där man kommer sköta all typ av kodning kring den. Den ena rollen som Fullstack-utvecklare riktas mer mot app och den andra mer Backend kring deras interna och tredjepartssystem. Hos Fondo kommer du att få möjlighet att utvecklas kunskapsmässigt och påverka teknikstacken, där det finns alla möjligheter för dig att växa i din roll och i företaget. Vi tror att de flesta människor kan lära sig det mesta så länge de är nyfikna och har rätta viljan. Det vi vill se av dig är ett genuint intresse för utveckling och teknik och en förmåga att se lösningar i problem. Fondo är ett team som har kul tillsammans och vi letar efter dig som uppskattar en arbetsplats som både kan utmana och utveckla dig! Vi söker dig som har

About the job Description  About us TriOptima's services stabilizes the global financial system. Our customers depend on our services to save them money, time, and help them follow regulations. Since 2018, TriOptima has been a part of CME Group, the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace.  Working at TriOptima We have a flat management structure and everyone has a stake in the success of our products. We value innovation and empower our development teams to be a driving force in the evolution of our products. Teams are highly self-driven doing continuous deployment. We are continuously adjusting our way of working as we find what works for us. We have mob programming teams running most of the time and when appropriate we do pair programming encouraging collaboration and continued learning. We believe that diversity is what makes a good team great, and that diversity of experience and thought create inclusive and successful products. As a global company with colleagues around the world we work in English, even in the Stockholm office where the TriOptima technology department is located.  The office space is modern, spacious and designed for social interactions and our rooftop terrace makes for scenic lunches in the summertime, right in the middle of Stockholm. We will provide you with equipment for remote work and always encourage a healthy work-life balance. We believe our colleagues are fantastic and the most important part of us and our culture. We strive to make this a place where everyone feels like they have a place, can grow and have fun while doing something valuable.  Technologies We build web-based services and our teams individually choose the technology best suited for their needs. Some technologies used are: Python/Django, Kotlin/Spring Boot, React, Cassandra/MySQL/Vertica, Docker/Kubernetes  While it's good if you are familiar with some of the above, we don't expect you to know it all. We expect most people to have solid experience in some tech stack and learn on the job. The stack is just a small part compared to the product itself.  Experience We have developers with a lot of different backgrounds, regarding both work experience and education. At the end of the day, what really matters is that you have a genuine interest in programming, problem solving, and learning new things.  We truly believe TriOptima is one of the best places to work in Stockholm, if not the world. We look forward to hearing from you.  CME Group: Where Futures Are Made  CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. With 3,500 employees located around the world, we're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.  The Candidate Privacy Policy can be found here.

company_name: Inspektionen för vård och omsorg, IVO
job_description: About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Vill du vara med och bidra till en god och säker hälso- och sjukvård samt omsorg genom datadrivna och avancerade analyser? IVO:s tillsyn och tillståndsprövning sträcker sig över sektorer som tillsammans utgör mer än 10 procent av svensk BNP. Till exempel genomförs varje år 69 miljoner vårdbesök, vid mer än 100 sjukhus och tusentals vård- och hälsocentraler. Det finns flera tusen särskilda boenden för personer med olika typer av omsorgsbehov och inom hälso- och sjukvården finns cirka 240 000 legitimerad personal. En förutsättning för att tillsynen och tillståndsprövningen ska räcka till för mer är ökad digitalisering och att IVO använder data som en kunskapskälla för risker och brister i vården och omsorgen. Under början av 2021 bildades IVO:s analysavdelning. Analysavdelningen ska bidra till utvecklingen av datadriven tillsyn och tillståndsprövning genom analyser av risker, kvalitet och säkerhet i svensk vård och omsorg. Analysavdelningen förstärker myndighetens analyskapacitet och digitalisering för att få mer genomslag till nytta för patienter och brukare. Vi söker nu data scientists till den nya avdelningen. I din roll kommer du ges möjlighet att verka på den analytiska innovationsfronten, driva nästa generations analys inom vården och omsorgen samt tillvarata myndighetens unika analysmöjligheter inom vård och omsorg. Arbetsuppgifter Som data scientist kommer du att:  Myndigheten har cirka 770 anställda. Arbetet med tillsyn bedrivs vid sex regionala avdelningar runt om i landet. Avdelningarna för tillståndsprövning och analys är placerade i Stockholm, liksom myndighetens två övergripande avdelningar verksamhetsstöd och generaldirektörens stab.

About the job Company Description  Our Mission  At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:  Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.  We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren’t easy goals to accomplish – but we’re not here for easy. We’re here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.  Disruption is at the core of our technology and on our way of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. We’re changing the nature of work from benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together.      As a Palo Alto Networks Systems Engineering (Pre-Sales) Specialist, you will be the expert for our Security Operations or Cortex portfolio with a focus on State, Local Government, and Education (SLED) Accounts. Your portfolio includes Advanced Endpoint Protection (XDR), Cortex XDR - Investigations and Response, Cortex XDR - Analytics, Autofocus, Cortex Data Lake and XSOAR (Security Orchestration, Automation & Response).  You are the “go to” resource for customer interactions that exceed standard SE support requirements. Your role is one of technical mentorship – working with your account manager to build integrated solutions for our client’s unique environments. With your colleagues, you will displace competing technologies, and build market share within your targeted list of major SLED accounts, and most importantly, help your client sleep at night as our product integrates to build secure digital transactions. This position does not work in a physical Palo Alto Networks office location, but instead covers a particular market for our sales prospects.            As part of our Systems Engineering team, you’ll support the Sales team with technical expertise and guidance when establishing trust with key clients. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks who isn’t committed to your success – everyone pitches in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. As a member of our Systems Engineering team, you are motivated by a solutions-focused sales environment and find fulfillment in working with clients to resolve incredible complex cyberthreats.    We’re trailblazers who dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: We can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.  Palo Alto Networks is evolving and changing the nature of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we’ve rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together.  We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with disabilities. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.  Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

About the job Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector. Ebury is a Global FinTech: we apply new technologies to enhance and automate financial services and processes. This allows small and medium-sized businesses to trade and transact internationally by eliminating boundaries related to more traditional procedures. Founded in 2009, we are now positioned among the fastest-growing companies in the sector. Headquartered in London, we have more than 1000 staff covering over 50 nationalities (and counting!) working across more than 27 offices worldwide and serving more than 45,000 clients every day. Hard work pays off: Ebury has just received a £350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won over 20 internationally recognised awards such as the Growing Business of the Year 2019: Larger Company (Turnover £50m+) and Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies (which we have been awarded twice: 2017 and 2019!). In September 2021, Ebury was named one of the top 15 European Fintechs to work for by Glassdoor and AltFi. None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced Fintech sector.  Our Tech Team hub is located in Málaga, Spain, and we are all fully remote workers! Our team members are based in more than ten countries. You'll be a key part of a Salesforce development team, working closely with your peers and the product team, and helping to develop and deliver Ebury’s Salesforce Solutions, striving for more robust and faster applications that contribute to remove the boundaries to the clients money and making business around the world possible.   The ideal candidate will be able to work on the integration and deployment of the CRM solution. This will include analysis, design, development and deployment. So, what do we need from you?    This is a full time, direct-hire opportunity. You will join Ebury's Salesforce Team that has grown over the last 4 years into a reference centre of excellence in the industry.   Ebury is characterized by a horizontal structure, where teams join all the steps of the production process in a proactive way and in permanent contact with stakeholders. That’s why the ideal candidate needs teamwork aptitudes and be ready to leave a footprint in this sector.   Due to our and our remote-focused onboarding system, you will feel a crucial part of the team since day one. Curious about what working remotely is like at Ebury? Take a look and see what our team say about us! If there’s something that you can do in our Tech team, it is : thanks to our career path and our collaborative and cross-team working, every day is a new adventure. We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.

About the job Are you an ambitious telco industry engineer that wants to continuously learn new? Join the Elisa Polystar journey!  Elisa Polystar -a subsidiary of Elisa Corporation- is a growth company focused on the Telco Monitoring, Analytics and Automation. Elisa Polystar makes software for networks to assure quality, to automate operations and make autonomous, software-driven networks happen. Our mission is to contribute to a sustainable future through digitalization.

About the job Kan du få siffror att berätta en historia? Trivs du i en roll där du får ta ett stort eget ansvar och får möjlighet att påverka affärer? Hos Skarpa erbjuds du en roll där du formar dina egna framgångar i en familjär miljö.        Den här tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Bravura och du anställs direkt hos Skarpa AB.        Skarpa är M & A rådgivare till koncerner, entreprenörer och Private Equity-bolag i samband med värdering, försäljning och förvärv av företag. Sedan starten 2007 har Skarpa värderat över 600 företag och utfört mer än 100 transaktioner av företag värda mellan 25 och 300 miljoner till ett ackumulerat transaktionsvärde om 3 miljarder kronor. I denna roll kommer du att arbeta tätt ihop med övriga medarbetare. Det arbetar totalt 10 personer på Skarpa idag, varav 2 personer arbetar i en liknande roll.        I rollen som junior analytiker kommer du att vara delaktig i samband med värdering, försäljning och förvärv av företag. Du kommer att arbeta i både försäljnings- och värderingsprojekt och arbeta simultant med 1–4 projekt. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar att skapa dig en bild av kundens verksamhet, genom att analysera företagets data i Excel, omformulera datan till text och sedan skriva en presentation eller rapport av företaget. Du kommer ha kontakt med potentiella kunder och granska deras verksamhet samt skapa underlaget för värderingsrapporter och försäljningsprocessen. Detta sker både via telefon, mail och fysiska kundmöten.    Du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med både kollegor och delägare i projekten och det finns på sikt goda utvecklingsmöjligheter i rollen.        För denna roll läggs stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper. Som person har du god verksamhetsförståelse och är flexibel i ditt sätt att arbeta. Du har en analytisk sida som innebär att du har förmågan och trivs med att analysera stora mängder data. För att trivas i rollen är du driven som person och tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter. Vidare ser vi att du är prestigelös och brinner för att ge god service gentemot både kollegor och kunder.        Start Enligt överenskommelse    Plats Stockholm    Lön Enligt överenskommelse    Funderingar kring Bravuras rekryteringsprocess? Du finner svar på de vanligast förekommande frågorna här    Är du nyfiken på hur vår rekryteringsprocess är upplagd? Du hittar mer information här https//www.bravura.se/din-karriar.    Har du frågor om tjänsten eller kring din registrering är du välkommen att kontakta vår kandidatsupport på vår chatt, info@bravura.se eller 08-400 240 50 så hjälper vi dig. Ange vilken tjänst det gäller.    Vi rekommenderar att du skickar in din ansökan omgående då vi gör ett löpande urval. Välkommen med din ansökan!    Sökord

About the job As a Security Operations Engineer, you’ll help take our security processes to the next level. This is achieved through security operations focused on event data, incident response, tooling, and automation to focus on what matters. In this role you’ll also act as a security champion, working closely and tirelessly with IT in helping them make security-conscious decisions.             We don't really care about certificates, degrees, and all that jazz. However, we won't penalize you for talking about your super-relevant degree in computer science or showing off your brand new certificate. We also don't need you to have x years of experience in information security, but would of course love for you to tell us about any experience that you think is relevant for the job.  At Pleo, we use English for all our internal communication to keep everyone on the same page; please submit your application in English unless otherwise stated above.  We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs.  Not everyone interviews the same: if you have accessibility needs that you would like us to know about, send an email to our Inclusion team at belonging@pleo.io and we’ll make sure to design an interview format that works for you.  Why work here?  Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Through fintech we've seen a way to impact how people work; we think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Based on some pretty amazing Series C-round investment in 2021 we think we're onto something big.  So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 800+ team, from over 74 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal, or Lisbon offices – and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by sensible things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us we'll help you get up the best remote setup possible, and will fly you in for our amazing team camps ✈️  Things to look up about us  Sometimes, we win awards 🤩 🏆  If you want to know how we hire company-wide, there's a post on our blog.  Or have a sneak peek into what happens when get together for Pleo Team Camp on our YouTube 👈🏾  Check out what we think about the realities of working remotely on our blog.  No one says it quite like our customers. Hear what they have to say this week on Trustpilot.  Also, check out Glassdoor if you'd like to hear about us from other people.  PS. we treat all candidates equally: 🙂

About the job About Us  We love pets - which is why we're on a mission to make the world a better place for pets and their parents. We offer pet insurance policies with generous pet health benefits that are designed with their needs in mind. We've helped over half a million pets stay happy and healthy since 2017 - and many more customers throughout the world are joining us every day. We've won numerous awards, have offices in the USA, UK, and Sweden - and we now employ over 500 people globally.  Award-winning, innovative technology and exceptional customer service are at the heart of our offer: our "Complete" policy ranks top of the Which? cat and dog insurance Best Buy tables. (December 2021) We've also been voted the Pet Insurance Provider Of The Year in the Moneyfacts Consumer Awards (2021) - and we've received over 21,000 5-star Feefo reviews in the past 12 months.  We're proud to be driving unprecedented change in insurance and have doubled our revenues annually for the last 4 years with more ambitious growth still to come. Our latest Series D funding round was $350m which values us at over $2bn.  Our company is fast-moving, respectful, fun-loving and (most importantly) passionate about pets and their wellbeing. We think big and we can only do that if we have a wonderful array of different people who are able to bring their whole selves to work every day. Throughout our business you'll meet people who think differently, aim for impact and love to try new things. Want to join our pack? Join us. Love every moment. Love ManyPets.    We take great pride in offering amazing cover for customers – coupling best in class customer service with competitive pricing for our products. We're looking to grow our inhouse Actuarial team in Sweden by bring in someone to champion the development of our pricing function at a local level.  You'll play a big part in supporting the development of our book, while working closely with our global Actuarial and Risk team to support us in meeting our loss ratio targets. You'll bring impact to our customers from day one by creating responsive control of our pricing – innovating our approach as we scale-up in Sweden. You'll have plenty of scope to partner with our Product and Partnership teams on both commercial and loss ratio initiatives – plus you'll get close to our Claims, Engineering and Marketing teams when developing the products our customers love.  We're looking for someone who is motivated by both the opportunities and challenges we face in our expanding sector. No two days will be the same and we can promise plenty of scope to learn from peers across our global business – plus scope to bring your new ideas to life!  Your Focus   What Leads to Success  Here are some of the individual skills we know will enable you to succeed in this position. If you don't tick every box - don't worry, we can support you in both your personal and professional development:   What We're Looking For   Inclusion at ManyPets  We believe diversity, belonging and inclusion are more than just words or things we should be 'seen' to be doing. Having diversity at the core of our business makes us stronger - and the responsibility for creating an inclusive workplace rests with all of us. We believe Black Lives Matter and we want you to join a company that makes unbiased choices and is committed to being anti-racist. If you'd like to read more about this, please download our Approach to Inclusion pack.  We promise to give you the same opportunities as everyone else and we won't discriminate against you at any point in the process. This includes how we source talent, our interview process, our conditions of employment (including pay) and feedback.  Hybrid-Working  Everything changed overnight when the pandemic happened. Suddenly everything was different: whether we were in a home office, spare room, or makeshift desk: we were working on our own and dealing with Zoom calls, bad Wi-Fi, and a very different working day. We now work from home and our company office, so we've created our Making Work, Work guide, which explains it all.  We offer a fantastic range of company benefits to suit everyone in a remote-first world, with a focus on supporting our physical and mental wellbeing. Coupled with a generous holiday allowance and regular care packs, we're always looking for new ways to look out for our people.  Our Values  Our company values drive everything we do - and they are:  Show You Care | Do The Right Thing | Think Big | Work Together | Be Tenacious  Connect With Us!  LinkedIn | Instagram: UK USA Sweden| Facebook: UK USA Sweden | Twitter: UK USA | TikTok | Glassdoor | Indeed | FeeFo | Trustpilot | Crunchbase  Reasonable Adjustments and Support  If you need any help, support or advice at any point during the hiring process please email our Inclusion Council in complete confidence. Our Inclusion Council is a cross-functional group of people from our global business - and they are not the hiring managers for this role. We're here to make sure everyone has a fair and equitable experience when they're considering joining us. If you want to talk or ask any questions, we are here to listen (and we'll do what we can to flex our approach to a process that suits you.)

job_title: Utvecklare/systemarkitekt inom Data Warehouse och Business Intelligence
job_description: About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Är du en erfaren utvecklare/systemarkitekt med stort intresse och har erfarenhet av Data Warehouse och Business Intelligence - då är det här jobbet något för dig. Här får du chansen att jobba brett och varierande med många kontaktytor - dina insatser kommer att göra skillnad!  AMF är inne i en spännande fas på väg mot ett agilt arbetssätt med SAFe som ramverk. Samtidigt skapar den digitala transformationen nya möjligheter och krav på snabba IT-leveranser och tätt samarbete med verksamheten då vi moderniserar och introducerar ny teknik. En aktuell transformation är vår förflyttning mot molnet, till Azure.  Nu söker vi en utvecklare med fokus på systemarkitektur inom Data Warehouse och BI till vår kreativa och moderna miljö mitt i Stockholms city. AMF erbjuder goda möjligheter till personlig utveckling och fina personalförmåner. Vi sitter på absolut toppläge mitt i City med utsikt mot Klara kyrka. Vi erbjuder självklart möjlighet att jobba hemifrån, vi har gym i våra lokaler och förutsättningar för utbildning och kompetenshöjning. Du får ett nätverk av utvecklare och arkitekter att samarbeta och utvecklas med.  Ansvarsområde  Du kommer tillhöra ett av våra team som ansvarar för att tillhandahålla företagsgemensam information som bl a används för affärsanalys och rapportering, som t ex finansiell rapportering till vår egen ekonomiavdelning och externa intressenter. Som utvecklare kommer du arbeta över hela området, dvs från bearbetning av källdata och modellering till presentation och visualisering av data. Du kommer även att ansvara för att våra lösningar är i linje med uppsatt målarkitektur i dialog med våra IT-arkitekter. I rollen som systemarkitekt behöver du se till helheten, men kan samtidigt dyka ner i detalj. Du säkerställer att valda mönster används samt att lösningarna livscykelhanteras. Du är också med och utvärderar nya tekniker.  Idag använder vi tekniker och verktyg så som Microsoft SQL Server inkl. SSIS, SSRS och SSAS samt Tableau. Du har stora möjligheter att utvecklas och bidra i vår förflyttning till molnet.  Du har akademisk utbildning och praktisk erfarenhet av systemutveckling, som SQL och programmering. Du är bekant med Microsoft SQL Server och dess komponenter. Du behärskar SQL/T-SQL och har stort intresse för datalagerhantering, Business Intelligence och dataintegration där du vill utvecklas. Det är meriterande om du är certifierad inom arkitektur och har erfarenhet av Azure. Du har vana att arbeta med system med höga krav på prestanda och säkerhet samt erfarenhet av Microsoft servermiljö. Du är bekväm med ett agilt och behovsstyrt arbetssätt med erfarenheter av tillämpning av metoder såsom Scrum och Kanban. Du har en god förmåga att beskriva, modellera, visualisera och analysera även komplexa strukturer och samband. Du behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.  Dina egenskaper  För att passa i rollen är du är en nyfiken person som trivs i att vara i en ständigt lärande miljö där du hjälper oss att tänka nytt och se positivt på vår föränderliga resa. Som person beskriver du dig som social och öppen, har lätt för att knyta kontakter och bygga långvariga relationer. Du en analytisk person som trivs i att jobba på ett resultatorienterat vis gentemot givna tidsramar. Du är en lagspelare som värdesätter teamarbete högt!  Övrigt Annonsen är tillgänglig tom 19 augusti. Under denna period har vi semester, och kommer återta processen efter sista ansökningsdatumet. Missa inte att skicka in din ansökan! AMF ligger mitt i centrala Stockholm och vi är idag cirka 350 medarbetare. Med fyra miljoner kunder och ett förvaltat kapital på mer än 750 miljarder kronor, har vi ett stort samhällsansvar, och är en av de största aktörerna på den svenska pensionsmarknaden. Vårt uppdrag är att ge våra kunder en så hög och trygg pension som möjligt. Vi ägs av fack och arbetsgivare tillsammans. Vår vision är att bli bäst i Sverige på pensionen från jobbet. Vi drivs av ett stort engagemang för våra kunder och en stolthet för vårt uppdrag. Vi lever enligt våra värdeord; enkel, trygg och mänsklig. Därför tycker vi att det är viktigt att visa varandra respekt och öppenhet på jobbet. Vi jobbar också för ett tydligt ledarskap, jämlikhet och mångfald genom rätten att få vara sig själv. Vi vill att alla ska känna arbetsglädje och trivas hos oss.

About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more We are looking for a resourceful Full stack engineer to join our diverse team at Market Partner Scandinavia AB in Sverige.  Growing your career as a Full Time Full stack engineer is a great opportunity to develop relevant skills.  If you are strong in decision-making, project management and have the right personality for the job, then apply for the position of Full stack engineer at Market Partner Scandinavia AB today!  One of the Swedens most exciting Tech companies are now looking for Full Stack Engineer to join in a consultant assignment with big possibilities to land in a fixed contract after the assignment!    Working remotely with a team based in Stockholm. Candidates working in the Europe Time Zone are welcome to apply.  We are looking for 2 strong technical leaders, who can join our autonomous teams and contribute to all aspects of development.  You will be joining a team of talented developers that are holding a shared interest in distributed backend systems, their scalability and continued development. We work together in autonomous teams that take full responsibility for our own part of the ecosystem. That includes writing code with high standards, hosting our services in Google Cloud Platform with Kubernetes, monitoring our services, measuring quality and guaranteeing service reliability.  We always believe in the growth and empowerment of our people. To that effect, we promote an open and proactive culture where engineers are encouraged to learn and contribute in ways outside the usual coding assignment. Our mission is to make all of the world’s music available to everyone, everywhere, and we want your help at it!    We are looking for a senior full stack engineer with experience working in a larger company and reasoning around complex systems. They are comfortable mapping features into managed services and can deliver on both backend and frontend tasks.  Experience with Python web applications and Javascript frontend frameworks is a must.  Experience with Java is a plus.  Excellence in Asyncio, React (Hooks), Typescript and Mobx is music to our ears.  With excellent collaboration skills, you can work well with a team, in a hands on way, and put the success of the team first. Daily communication is key, with a humble and positive attitude, open to new ideas and suggestions, and not afraid to bring their experience and expertise into every decision we make together.    You will together with the other engineers in the team, implement new and improve existing micro service integrations into the customer administration tool made for our Customer Support. We are also planning to platformarize our tool.  You will work together with many other parts of RnD to understand APIs and negotiate API contracts. There will be both a backend and a frontend part of most tasks. You care about improving the overall architecture and health of the systems and drive things to completion.  As a senior engineer we see you playing a big part in the team in technical decisions and improvements and initiating and driving work and ways of working together with the team. We also see you sharing your knowledge and experience with less senior engineers.  You are welcome for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.

About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Visste Du Att Fastigheter står för 40% av jordens totala energianvändning Fastighetsbranschen ligger ca 10 år efter vad gäller IT och digitalisering. Det svenska startup-bolaget MYRSPOVEN AB är först med att applicera det senaste inom AI och industriell optimering på fastigheters energisystem. Bland dessa finns bl.a. flera av Sveriges största och främsta fastighetsbolag samt globala och lokala automationsbolag.  Vi söker dig som har goda och dokumenterade kunskaper i programmeringsspråket Python. Vi värdesätter om du som person är driven, ansvarstagande samt har en lösningsorienterad personlighet. Myrspovens använder sig av den senaste tekniken inom ML och multivariabeloptimering. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att bestå i att förbättra och vidareutvecklar funktioner i Myrspovens plattform för autonom energioptimering av komplexa fastigheter. Du kommer dels att arbeta i team tillsammans med andra utvecklare men även tillsammans med energiingenjörer. I rollen ingår även viss kundkontakt.

About the job Our offer  Capgemini Engineering Sweden has established a Center of Excellence within Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), pooling PLM experts together, creating a place where we can be inspired, inspire others, coach and be coached, and find a common ground for insights and deliveries. We want you as a PLM Business Consultant to become a part of our team, to help us grow and let the synergies of great talent take us to new levels with our clients and with the rest of Capgemini.  We offer you a work environment branded by innovation and a career with freedom, full of learning and development opportunities in a global environment and the support to help you achieve your best. You will be working with the cutting edge of IT and technology, surrounded by dedicated and skilled colleagues with high expertise.  We at Capgemini are committed to improving our collective performance by utilizing our inclusive work environment where different talents can thrive, hence diversity and inclusion are important cornerstones for us – which is also proven when we won the "World's Most Ethical Companies (WME) award" nine years in a row as well as other awards and accreditations.    The PLM Business Analyst will blend business analysis and daily operations to deliver PLM solutions that support the development, manufacturing and service of all PLM products. Responsibilities include working with key stakeholders to define improvements in the areas of efficiency, quality, cost and information security; provide ongoing applications support; evaluate business problems, their impact, and propose solutions to work around or overcome problems; define system requirements, as-is and to-be processes; mitigate risk; manage, author and execute user acceptance testing; support external projects needing PLM input and help to manage and enforce system governance.
