job_title: Data Scientist med intresse för TV och streaming
job_description: About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Om Tjänsten  I rollen som Data Scientist på MMS kommer du att vara den viktiga bryggan mellan Team Media och IT och på ett effektivt sätt ta fram underlag som bidrar till relevanta analyser om hur många som faktiskt tittar på TV och annan rörlig bild. Fokuset kommer således ligga på att utveckla mått och nya modeller. Du kommer att tillhöra Team Media, ett kompetent och kreativt gäng med 14 kollegor som erbjuder ett bra arbetsklimat och fin sammanhållning. Tillsammans kommer ni arbeta med att ta fram siffror för ett totalt tv-tittande som kombineras av linjär TV och tittande på rörlig bild online. Detta ställer höga krav på ett stort intresse för, och erfarenhet av, analysera och hantering av stora mängder data.  MMS är ett bolag med bra förmåner och stort fokus på personlig utveckling. Kontoret ligger mitt i City och erbjuder en trygg och trevlig arbetsplats och arbetsuppgifter med fokus på hög kvalitet.    Som person är du analytisk, noggrann, nyfiken och intresserad av att lära dig nya saker. Du gillar att analysera data och drivs av att hitta potentiella samband och förstå orsaker.  Verktyg och tekniker som du främst kommer jobba med:  MMS Kommer även, vad tiden lider, att börja titta på AI/ML för vissa delar av flöden och modeller    Har relevant eftergymnasial utbildning och gärna något eller några års erfarenhet som Data Scientist.  Du är initiativtagande, självgående, noggrann och nyfiken. Du tycker det är roligt med siffror och har förmågan att prestera på egen hand men även att samarbeta och bolla lösningar tillsammans med övriga kollegor.    MMS bevakar trender och utvecklar nya metoder för mätning av rörlig bild samt publicerar rapporter och resultat från undersökningar. MMS uppdragsgivare är de stora mediehusen, mediebyråer och annonsörer. Man mäter tittandet på program, klipp och reklam där mätningarna fungerar som mediebranschens valuta. Siffrornas kvalitet kontrolleras noga av MMS varje dag och detta arbete är en grundbult i uppdraget att leverera en stabil valuta till branschen.    Detta är en rekrytering vilket innebär att du kommer bli anställd direkt av MMS.    Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Kom ihåg att vara snabb med din ansökan då vi gör löpande urval av kandidater och att annonsen kan stängs ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.

job_title: Senior Build & Release Specialist [New Game IP]
job_description: About the job Job Description  At Ubisoft Stockholm we’re exploring what’s possible with Scalar (our new cloud technology), reclaiming our playful curiosity, and building the future of games.  We’re looking for a Senior Build & Release Specialist to provide expertise in compilers and package managers to both internal teams (locally), and global Ubisoft partners working with our shared products. You will help drive the design and implementation of our infrastructure, prototype, and reiterate as needed.  You’ll play a significant role in the development of our ultra-interactive and beautiful new world on a brand New Game IP.  Games using our Ubisoft Scalar tech can rely on a virtually unlimited amount of computing power, and enable our game developers to focus on creativity and design for never-before-seen player experiences.                Ubisoft’s 20,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission – to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting-edge technologies, and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.  We’re also a distributed workforce with a hybrid setup, and in 2023 our main hideout will be at Fenix Stockholm, a re-imagined modern office in the inner-city district of Hagastaden.

job_title: Product Manager med bakgrund från Digital Marketing
job_description: About the job Är du en Digital Marknadsförare med ett intresse för att utveckla digitala produkter? Då är det dig vi söker för en unik roll där du med erfarenhet av marknadsföring får möjlighet att utvecklas och bli en stark Product Manager hos oss på Funnel.  Vi söker en snäll, skärpt och lagorienterad kollega som kan hjälpa oss fortsätta stärka vår position som den bästa användarupplevelsen i vårt segment. Vi tror att du med dina erfarenheter från användarsidan kommer ha väldigt mycket att bidra med!    Du kanske redan har erfarenhet av att använda Funnel i din vardag? Om inte så kan man säga att Funnel möjliggör ett arbetsflöde med automatisk insamling av all data kunden behöver, enkelt skapande och underhåll av en robust datamodell med kundens egna begrepp och nyckeltal, och slutligen analys och rapportering i de verktyg där de redan idag gillar att jobba. Allt detta utan att användaren behöver skriva en rad kod eller för den delen behöver vara särskilt teknisk. Vi kallar det och vår vision är att de personer som behöver data för sitt beslutsfattande ska ha verktyg byggda för dem till sitt förfogande - istället för att vara beroende av sina tekniska kollegor.    Vi söker nu efter en person med erfarenhet som digital marketer, digital marketing analyst, performance marketer eller growth marketer som kan hjälpa oss bygga den bästa produkten för marknadsförare.  jobbar du i ett tvärfunktionellt team med kollegor från utveckling och design, och tillsammans identifierar och skapar ni lösningar på kundernas problem. I teamet är du den som bottnar djupast i frågor kring affär, produktstrategi och kundens domän. Du arbetar även nära de kommersiella teamen för att säkerställa att deras feedback når produktutvecklingsprocessen och att de har den information och kunskap de behöver för att vinna nya kunder - samt hjälpa existerande kunder att vinna med Funnel.  Du blir en domänexpert inom såväl marketing analytics som business intelligence och i att kunna känna igen riktigt bra lösningar på kundernas behov. Tillsammans med ditt team gör ni svåra prioriteringar och balanserar kortsiktiga operativa beslut med långsiktig produktstrategi. Du är ständigt medveten om att du är här för att göra våra kunder framgångsrika genom produkten, samt fungera som ett stöd till övriga team på Funnel.  behöver du bygga djup förståelse för våra kunders vardag, processer, prioriteringar och problem.    Då vi tror på att alltid utgå från våra användares utmaningar, så skulle du med erfarenhet av dessa kunna bidra med dina insikter om användarnas vardag. Samtidigt ser du vikten av att lyssna på kunder, användare och kollegor för att tillsammans kunna strukturera problem som är värda att lösas och passar in i Funnels strategi.  För att trivas behöver du gilla att jobba tillsammans med andra och vara med att bygga ett team som trivs att jobba ihop.    Du har minst 2 års erfarenhet av digital marknadsföring på en agency eller i ett bolag. Du har bland annat jobbat med någon/några marknadsföring- och analyticsplattformar som tex. Google, Meta, LinkedIn, TikTok eller varför inte Salesforce eller Hubspot. Du har säkert analyserat ROAS, Reach eller andra mätvärden och förstår era kunders målsättning med marknadsföring.    Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Tveka då inte utan hör av dig så berättar vi mer!  Funnel is a fast-growing tech company within digital marketing. With a focus on non-technical users, we build a new generation of Software as a Service (SaaS) that helps our customers draw spot-on conclusions from their business data. Our solution integrates the data automatically, structures it, and then sends it to a connected system for analysis. So far, we have created integrations for around 500 platforms.  Our customers are spread out across the globe, with our biggest market in the US. Since the product launch in 2015, we have set up offices in Stockholm, Boston and Dublin (and soon London), with our headquarters in Stockholm, and grown to service thousands of marketers all over the world!

About the job Vi på Wasa Kredit söker dig som vill göra skillnad! Brinner du för krav och har förståelse för vikten av att arbeta med krav på olika nivåer? Är du dessutom kommunikativ, samarbetsorienterad och lyhörd? Vi är en grupp som värnar om varandra, har ett positiv klimat och ett starkt engagemang. Vi söker just nu efter vår nästa Business Analyst till Wasa Kredit. Låter det intressant? Läs vidare!  Om jobbet  Som Business Analyst på Wasa Kredit kommer du få arbeta med att fånga verksamhetens behov och önskemål om förändringar. Du kommer även se på möjliga lösningar utifrån befintlig systemfunktionalitet och ställa krav på nya lösningar. Du kommer driva och hantera kravarbete i nära samverkan med såväl verksamhet, partners och IT. Att vara Business Analyst hos oss innebär även att facilitera och leda workshops och säkerställa en dokumenterad testbar kravbild, så är du kommunikativ och gillar att interagera tvärfunktionellt är det en bra match.  Om du gillar tanken av att agera förändringsledare samt få arbeta med att säkerställa att intressenternas behov omhändertas i den utvecklade lösningen tror vi att du är rätt person för oss. Vi tror även att är kommunikativ och har en god pedagogisk förmåga om du ska passa i den här rollen.  Vem är du?  Vi ser gärna att du har dokumenterad erfarenhet av att bygga förutsättningarna för utveckling av verksamhet och du är van vid att driva fram kundvärde och verksamhetsnytta med stöd av IT. För att lyckas i rollen ser även vi att du har god erfarenhet av kravanalysarbete, att omsätta krav till underlag för utveckling och testbara krav. Du är stark inom metodik för kravhantering, har verkat i en agil utvecklingsorganisation och du gillar att driva förändring och bidra med struktur och tydlighet. Att vara bryggan mellan verksamhet och IT är din grej.  Vidare är det meriterande om du har djup kunskap om olika metodiker för att dokumentera krav i olika kravartefakter som exempelvis begreppsmodell, informationsmodell, user stories med acceptanskriterier, verksamhetsprocesser, prototyper och användningsfall. Flera års erfarenhet från verksamhet inom bank och finans, både från IT och verksamhet där du även har erfarenhet från arbete med regulatoriska frågor är också meriterande.  Om oss  Wasa Kredit kännetecknas av att vara varmt och välkomnande där vi behöver samarbeta för att kunna nå våra högt ställda mål. Wasa Kredit är helägt av Länsförsäkringar Bank och har ungefär 300 anställda. Länsförsäkringar äger gemensamt Länsförsäkringar AB, där Länsförsäkringar Bank ingår som ett dotterbolag.  Gillar du att ha en chef som har höga ambitioner, ger stort individuellt utrymme utifrån tydliga målsättningar och som brinner för det kommunikativa och coachande ledarskapet så har du hittat rätt. Om du dessutom gillar ett högt tempo med mycket utveckling, rak kommunikation och med möjlighet att påverka så hittar du detta sammanhang här. Hos oss arbetar vi tillsammans samtidigt som var och en bidrar med sin pusselbit!  Mer information och ansökan    Rekryterande chef: Kristina Lyckeros 08-635 37 76  Kontaktperson Forena: Ann Johansson 08-635 37 54  Kontaktperson Akademikerföreningen: Mattias Karlsson 08-635 37 37

company_name: TerraAlto a PFH Technology Group company
job_description: About the job Who we are! TerraAlto, an AWS Advanced Consulting and Managed Service Provider partner, was established in 2012 with the sole focus of working on best practice and automated usage of AWS services. We had identified AWS as a significant change in the ICT eco-system that would change how companies could and would use technology to solve business problems. Since then, we have been working hard to establish and maintain service-focused delivery of solutions and consulting on AWS. We have delivered and continue to deliver AWS Well-Architected Framework aligned projects to large and small clients across Europe and Asia, including migrations, managed services, data platforms, IoT platforms, integrated CICD pipelines and numerous other business solutions.

About the job This is a remote position.  Client Details  A highly successful international listed company who offers remote and international opportunities. This client looks for high achievers who wish to work with the best on a global playing field.          PS Even if you feel you don't have all the skills listed or if this spec isn't what you are looking for, feel free to send your CV as we probably have other opportunities that could interest you. For a more comprehensive and updated list of opportunities that we have on offer, do visit our website - www.parvana.co.uk

job_title: Senior People Tech Analyst - Workday (Recruiting & HCM)
job_description: About the job Craft  Technology & Development  Job Description  King has an exciting opportunity for a Sr People Technology Analyst to join our People Technology team. This is a dynamic and varied role that serves as the HR Technology liaison between both technical and functional areas of the business including HR Operations, Talent Acquisition, IT, and other internal and external clients to ensure effective definition and delivery of People Technology applications.  We are looking for a systems specialist from a HR background who is passionate about data, providing great service and can think holistically across the HR functions. Knowledge when it comes to Core HCM and Recruit in Workday is key. This role could be based in Barcelona, Stockholm or London.    Priorities can often change in a fast- paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities          King is the game developer behind the world- famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top- grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.    Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.    Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!  Applications need to be in English.  Discover King at careers.king.com

About the job Job Summary  DESCRIPTION  Come build the future of entertainment with us. Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching?  Prime Video is a premium streaming service that offers customers a vast collection of TV shows and movies - all with the ease of finding what they love to watch in one place. We offer customers thousands of popular movies and TV shows including Amazon Originals and exclusive licensed content to exciting live sports events. We also offer our members the opportunity to subscribe to add-on channels which they can cancel at anytime and to rent or buy new release movies and TV box sets on the Prime Video Store. Prime Video is a fast-paced, growth business - available in over 240 countries and territories worldwide. The team works in a dynamic environment where innovating on behalf of our customers is at the heart of everything we do. If this sounds exciting to you, please read on.  In this role, you will be joining the Stockholm-based live low latency streaming team. We deliver Sye, a revolutionary streaming platform primarily used for live sporting events and concerts. Our ambition is to drastically improve the customer experience of watching live streams by providing minimal latency and synchronized playback to all viewers across the globe.  Key job responsibilities  As a developer on our live low latency streaming player team, you will innovate on and improve the components providing live streaming capabilities to end user applications. The platforms we support include Android, iOS, web, smart-TVs, set-top-boxes and game consoles, where you will focus on a subset of them.  Your will work on the SDKs we provide as well as their integration into Prime Video applications that are used by millions of customers around the world. Your work will also include developing reference and demo implementations, setting up automated tests for different hardware and software platforms.  A day in the life  As part of the Sye team you will be involved with daily stand-ups, coding, code reviews for team members, internal and cross team meetings to align on technical complexities, estimate deliveries with milestones and write technical documents. Large events involves planning of new features to be deployed, tests to be performed and data to be analyzed in order to continuously improve the customer experience. Status and goals tracking are expected every so often.    The team owns the live low latency player SDKs for supported platforms, and we also work on the integration of them into Prime Video applications.  We are growing, and with us you will also be able to grow as we work together. There are lots of opportunities to interact with other teams globally. Together with partners such as Twitch and IMDb TV, we are part of a strong video streaming community that will be available to you.       Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.   - Amazon Corp Services Sweden  Job ID: A1910240

About the job Back End Python Engineer  We are Assetario  We love data. We are gamers. We are engineers. Phenomenal team of MIT graduates, technical experts and advisors who lead multi-billion dollar businesses.

About the job 29265  Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. We value the uniqueness and diversity of our employees and recognize that nurturing the diverse perspectives and strengths of our people translates into innovative breakthroughs for patients.    Location: Sweden or Denmark  Reports to: Country Director Nordics    The overall objective of this embed data driven decision making across the commercial team. You will perform regular analyze of data captured with the CRM and other digital platforms. You will identify trends, insights and make recommendations on next best action to enhance sales and campaign performance. You will also manage the governance of the CRM database and other digital platforms used by Alexion Nordics to ensure high levels of data quality within the CRM. Working with relevant International teams and Nordics team you will optimize the implementation of new digital platforms, ensures they are fully operational and meets the needs, objectives, and strategic imperatives of the Nordics business.       Alexion is a global biopharmaceutical company focused on serving patients and families affected by rare diseases and devastating conditions through the discovery, development and commercialization of life-changing medicines. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Alexion has offices around the globe and serves patients in more than 50 countries. Further information about Alexion can be found at: www.alexion.com.  Alexion is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where every single person can belong because of their uniqueness. The Company will not make decisions about employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment based on race, color, religion, creed or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), parental status (including adoption or surrogacy), military status, protected veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity or expression, genetic information, mental illness or other characteristics protected by law. Alexion provides reasonable accommodations to meet the needs of candidates and employees. To begin an interactive dialogue with Alexion regarding an accommodation, please contact accommodations@Alexion.com. Alexion participates in E-Verify.  AstraZeneca completed its acquisition of Alexion, marking the creation of Alexion, AstraZeneca Rare Disease. If you're interested in career opportunities with AstraZeneca, click here.

About the job Med våra 7 287 medarbetare arbetar vi för att erbjuda våra kunder marknadens bästa försäkringslösningar för både privatpersoner och företag. Vi försäkrar det som är värdefullt i livet.  Vår uppgift är att ge skydd mot oväntade ekonomiska förluster, och bistå med rådgivning för att minska risken att något ska hända. Om olyckan är framme, lovar vi snabb och professionell skadehantering. Det ger ökad trygghet för den enskilde individen, företaget och samhället i stort.  Tjänsten tillsätts till följd av att If kommer att fortsätta att göra betydande förändringar i reservsättningsområdet under de kommande åren. I denna resa är expertis inom processutveckling och förbättring av datakvalitet avgörande för den framtida utvecklingen.  Din utmaning  Som Business Analyst utvecklar och upprätthåller du data, system och processer för Ifs reservsättning i Norden och Baltikum som en del av den finansiella rapporteringen. I tjänsten som Business Analyst kommer du att arbeta med utveckling av processerna för reservsättning och även till stor del kravställning mot IT. I detta ingår att arbeta med affärskrav och acceptanstester i utvecklingen av IT-system. Du kommer även att vara en avgörande person i arbetet med att förbättra och upprätthålla datakvalitet och leveranser av data till reservsättningen. Därmed tror vi att du är lösningsorienterad och har kapacitet att ta ägandeskap över att lösa de problem som identifieras i den finansiella rapporteringen.  Detta är ny tjänst i teamet och därmed ges du möjlighet att själv vara med och påverka dina framtida ansvarsområden. För rätt kandidat finns även möjlighet att bredda sin kompetens ytterligare och utvecklas vidare inom gruppen.  Din bakgrund  Vi söker dig med relevant akademisk examen och några års arbetslivserfarenhet inom liknande tjänst.  Som person är du analytiskt lagd med hög integritet och samvetsgrannhet. För att bli framgångsrik i denna roll tror vi att du har ett stort intresse av att kontinuerligt förbättra och förenkla strukturer och processer. Som person har du hög integritet och stark kommunikativ förmåga.

About the job Description  CME Group is the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. We're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.  To learn more about what a career at CME Group can offer you, visit us at www.wherefuturesaremade.com .  TriOptima's services stabilize the global financial system. Our customers depend on our services to save them money, time, and help them follow financial regulations. Since 2018, TriOptima has been a part of CME Group, the world's leading and most diverse derivatives marketplace.  You will work in a small team with big opportunities and impact. We have a flat management structure and everyone has a stake in the success of our products. We value innovation and empower our team members to be a driving force in the evolution of our business.  The office space is modern, spacious and designed for social interactions and our rooftop terrace makes for scenic lunches in the summertime, right in the middle of Stockholm. We will provide you with equipment for remote work and always encourage a healthy work-life balance. We believe our colleagues are fantastic and the most important part of us and our culture. We strive to make this a place where everyone feels like they have a place, can grow and have fun while doing something valuable.  The post trade business analytics team is responsible for the internal and client facing business analytics, as well as revenue management across all TriOptima's post trade businesses. The purpose of the team is to help the organization make better, informed and data driven decisions, as well as identify business opportunities and process improvements.  The team is transforming data into insightful and actionable business information by collating, processing, analyzing and visualizing data, as well as providing analytical expertise in the organization by driving and participating in internal and external projects.  Key responsibilities    We truly believe TriOptima is one of the best places to work in Stockholm, if not the world. We look forward to hearing from you.  CME Group: Where Futures Are Made  CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. With 3,500 employees located around the world, we're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. The pace is dynamic, the work is unlike any other firm in the business, and the possibilities are endless. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.  The Candidate Privacy Policy can be found here.

About the job Northvolt has an exciting job offer for a Software Engineer in Computer Vision to join our the Digitalization Connected Factory team in Stockholm.  You will collaborate with a cross-functional group of experts from automation, control, materials flow, factory design, software engineering and machine learning to design and implement software systems which allow us to implement a highly automated production process, collect complete data from both manufacturing and battery systems, and develop innovative applications which optimize our processes and products.  This is a greenfield project in a complex field, which requires a combination of proven technologies and design of new innovative solutions. We believe you are a person who is highly motivated by solving problems and taking pride in your area of expertise.    Qualities that we cherish are flexibility, sense of quality, friendliness, motivation to take on new challenges, grit and a sense of humor.  Apply with CV and cover letter or your complete LinkedIn profile.  Full time employment, fixed salary.  Planned starting date is asap.

About the job At DoiT International, we believe the cloud transforms the way we build technology, and we are on a mission to help companies, big or small, go through this transformation.  We are a team of cloud professionals who love working with other people to solve challenging technical problems. We are committed to personal development and enjoy sharing our knowledge and experience through blogging, training, public speaking, and contributing to open-source.  We work hands-on, side-by-side with our customers to educate, mentor, advise, and solve problems to make sure they are getting the most out of what the cloud has to offer.  We are looking for people to join us on our mission and share the honor and delight of being able to help companies to realize their ideas into successful products.         DoiT International is a world-leading cloud advisory company, Google Cloud’s top partner and Amazon Web Services Premier Partner. Our mission is to enable customers to harness the power of the public cloud at peak efficiency so they can focus on building the best products for their own customers.  Our core values guide us in creating a diverse team, a welcoming and supportive working environment, and a stellar employee experience with plenty of opportunities for personal and professional development. Challenging work, continuous learning, opportunities for promotion as we continue to scale, and a remote-first culture rooted in communication, transparency, and trust help us to attract and retain some of the best talents in the industry and we would love for you to join us on our mission.  We’ve created a remote first culture that thrives in a virtual environment so you have the resources you need to connect with talented people around the world.

About the job Mission of the Role  We are looking for an experienced Cloud Engineer to work with our Technogym Engineering & IT team to develop, implement, optimize, and maintain cloud-based solutions. You will be responsible for deploying and debugging cloud stacks, educating teams on new cloud initiatives, and ensuring the security of the cloud infrastructure. Duties will include developing outstanding digital products for millions of active users, as well as directing our software programming initiatives to ensure a frictionless experience for every customer. To be successful as a Cloud Engineer, you should be able to identify the most optimal cloud-based solutions for our clients and maintain cloud infrastructures in accordance with best practices and company security policies. A top-notch Cloud Engineer should have excellent troubleshooting skills, stay current with industry trends, and should be a team player.

About the job Do you want to be an important part of shaping the future within the Nordic Telecom market? Then find out how we can give you the future you want!  The Mission  As a Business Analyst @ Capgemini you will have a unique opportunity to help our customers design and implement the best technology solutions. From the early pre-design phase until the first go-live. In general, our assignments cover various sectors like telecom, retail, finance, utilities, industries, media, and the public sector. This role will be in the telecom segment. Here you will cooperate closely with our experts in roles covering requirements, architecture, project leaders, and developers normally working in an Agile way. You will have your Capgemini colleagues both in the Nordics as well as within some of the Capgemini companies globally, including State Of the Art solutions, education, and support from our partners    At the core, you understand how to translate client needs and requirements into clear user stories. You can engage and elicit responses from a diverse set of business stakeholders, understand and analyze clients’ current business processes, operational challenges while defining their future roadmap. Working in a highly collaborative way with diverse stakeholders across Business and IT is a must. Working closely with Product Managers/Product owners to understand EPICs and break them down to capabilities & features and grooming user story backlogs comes naturally to you. Story grooming skills and documenting specifications are essential to be successful in this role.

job_title: InfoSec - Senior Governance and Customer Assurance Analyst
job_description: About the job At Elastic, we see endless possibility in a world of endless data. And we use the power of search to help people and organizations turn that possibility into results. Elastic is the leading platform for search-powered solutions. With solutions in Enterprise Search, Observability, and Security, we help improve customer and employee search experiences, keep critical applications running smoothly, and protect against cyber threats. Elastic enables organizations worldwide to use the power of Elastic, including Netflix, Uber, BBC, Microsoft, and thousands of others.  Elastic was built on a foundation of being free and open, which trickles down to how we work. We’re a distributed organization and have been from the beginning. Being distributed isn’t just a way of doing business—it’s a mentality that is at the core of our culture.  We’re always on the search for amazing people. People who have a real passion for what they do and are masters at their craft. We are looking for a to join our team in Information Security (InfoSec). The InfoSec team leads the strategy, policy, and programs for information security company-wide. Our responsibilities include risk management, implementing a comprehensive security program, driving compliance initiatives, recommending and implementing security controls, preventing and detecting security threats, and handling incident response. We do all of this in a globally distributed company, thinking differently about how we best achieve critical information security objectives.  This could be your dream job, and we'd love to meet you!        As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.  We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.

About the job SEB Kort är ett av Nordens största bolag inom kreditkort och betalningslösningar, både mot privat- likaså företagskunder. De jobbar med flertalet bolag såsom Eurocard, SAS och Circle K inom hela nordiska marknaden.  Inom avdelningen Digital Sales finns Gruppen Content & Partner Marketing. Denna grupp jobbar bland annat med Marketing Automation (MA) och säkerställer att rätt kund får rätt budskap, på rätt kanal, vid rätt tid. Gruppen utökar nu sin arbetsstyrka med en mer dataanalytisk roll – CRM Business Analyst. I denna roll blir rätt person en nyckelspelare i teamets strävan mot ett fortsatt arbete byggt på dataanalys inom kundsegmenten.  Kunddata | Optimering | Affär  Det här är en spännande roll för sig som vill ta nästa kliv mot att vara med i affärsnära beslutsfattning. I rollen som CRM Business Analyst kommer rätt kandidat få fokus på att optimera verksamhetens program för att förbättra marknadsföringen ut mot kund, med hjälp av kunddataanalys. Du kommer jobba tillsammans med både teamet inom Content & Partner Marketing, samt en grupp Business Analysts som jobbar med mer bred analys inom SEB Kort. Dina analyser kommer ligga som grund för strategiska beslut kring SEB Korts fortsatta arbete för att öka kundnöjdheten.    Din bakgrund  I den här rollen krävs det en kandidat som har en relevant akademisk examen med tekniska inslag, företrädelsevis ingenjörsutbildning eller systemvetenskap, samt några års erfarenhet med BI-verktyg såsom Tableau eller Qlikview.  Vi tror att du idag jobbar med dataanalys på ett mindre kreditmarknadsbolag eller inom retail, där du fått erfarenhet av att arbeta hands-on med arbetsflöden och dataanalys.  För att trivas i den här rollen behöver du ha ett intresse för att optimera verksamheten du jobbar i, genom att ta hjälp av dataanalys. Du trivs med att vara kommunikativ i din roll och utveckla din tekniska kompetens samtidigt som du ger underlag till beslutsfattning som starkt påverkar SEB Korts affär. Du behöver därmed även kunna tala både svenska och engelska flytande, i tal och skrift.

job_title: Senior Business analyst/Business Analyst, Capability Personal Banking Sweden
job_description: About the job Job ID: 9365  We are looking for a driven colleague on a mission to create the best possible customer experiences and to join us in creating the banking of the future. In this role you will have the opportunity to make an impact by contributing to the development of our future mortgage journey.  At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re working in an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.    Welcome to the Capability Area Product Management. We provide the Personal Banking agile development organization with skilled Product Managers, Product Owners and Business Analysts. As a Business Analyst you will play a valuable role in designing and implementing solutions that bring value to our Customers and to Nordea. You will be the team's specialist in business understanding and analysis, investigating the work of the business to find pain points to be fixed, as well as creating new attractive solutions.    The role is based in Stockholm, Sweden.    Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.      Depending on your background and profile, you will be either get the role Senior Business Analyst or Business Analyst.  If this sounds like you, get in touch!    Submit your application no later than 04/09/2022. We will conduct interviews during the application period. For more information about the position, please contact Capability Lead, Hanna Junthé, hanna.junthe@nordea.com.  At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

About the job Job Overview:  As a Senior Statistical Programmer, you will provide experienced technical expertise to develop process methodology for the department to meet internal and external clients’ needs. You will plan and coordinate the development of integrated programming solutions, serving the full spectrum of statistical programming needs, along with providing technical expertise and leadership to the department and provide internal consulting services, including specifications and user needs analysis for complex project or client requirements.

About the job Description  The multi-screen streaming video and the interactive TV space is growing rapidly. Accedo delivers rich media apps on multiple platforms ranging from Smart TVs, gaming consoles, Set Top Boxes, Roku, Apple TV, Android TV, Chromecast, Web, Smart phones, tablets and more.  At Accedo, you will be part of a diverse and multi-disciplined development team, gaining exposure to cutting-edge technologies. This means working with some of the largest global media brands in the industry, e.g. Netflix, Spotify, BBC, HBO and Deutsche Telekom, just to name a few. Working in a highly collaborative and international environment, you will help transform requirements and designs into high performing feature rich applications on a wide variety of web based platforms and devices.    We are Accedo and have more than ten years of experience helping hundreds of TV platform operators, broadcasters, media companies, and consumer electronics manufacturers across the globe to design, deliver and manage the next generation video user experience across a vast range of connected devices.  Accedo offers a truly global working environment, with offices all over the world, including Stockholm, London, New York, Silicon Valley, Sydney, Hong Kong, Guadalajara, Toronto and more.  At the end of the day, our employees are what make us who we are, which means we work hard to create a good working environment with plenty of opportunities to grow and develop within Accedo, wherever they want to be in the world. We are on a journey, and are always open to ideas and individuals that want to contribute to making that journey a success.  Accedo is looking for to join its growing Quality Assurance team in . At Accedo you will be part of a diverse and multi-disciplined team, gain exposure to cutting edge technologies and can work with some of the largest global media brands in the industry. Working in a highly collaborative environment, you will help transforming requirements and designs into high performing and feature rich applications on a wide variety of web based platforms and devices.  Primarily responsible for project testing of Accedo’s multimedia and streaming applications. You will play a key role in ensuring the quality of media applications and games being developed for world famous brands. The role will involve a close relationship with software development teams in Accedo.    P.S: The recruitment process is on a rolling basis

job_title: Infrastructure Developer in WAF team at SEB in Stockholm
job_description: About the job We are expanding our Web Application Firewall (WAF) team with an infrastructure developer who is hungry for developing shared infrastructure security solutions.  Our maintenance objects are on-premises services at SEB, many of them automated to high extent and facilitating a DevSecOps culture.  We are also on a cloud-journey developing new services in a SEB managed public cloud provider context.  Our way of working objective is to evolve to a Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) infrastructure team.  What you will be doing  The WAF team delivers services for perimeter protection, ingress controllers to our container platforms, load balancing and similar type of services used in exposing applications to users/systems. We plan incrementally and execute our plans in a scaled agile fashion.  As an infrastructure developer your tasks will include:  Who we are looking for  You are a team player with a strong logical sense, keeping calm in stressed situations and believe that when the teams succeed, we all succeed.  As a person, you are driven, accountable and curious of exploring new possibilities.  You have a degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.  We expect written and verbal communication skills in Swedish and English.  To be successful in this position you have/are:  It is an additional merit if you have experience in:     Ready to join?  Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 31 of August 2022. If you have questions about the position, please contact Petri Penttinen (WAF Team Manager), at petri.penttinen@seb.se .  SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.    sebgroup.com/techcareers

About the job Vill du göra samhällsnytta och bidra till Sveriges oberoende i världen? Vill du utveckla system för riktigt stora datamängder? Vi söker nu dig som vill jobba med Big Data-lösningar och brinner för systemutveckling. Du är nyfiken på ny teknik och vill jobba med förmågeutveckling för underrättelseproduktion. Du vill utvecklas tillsammans med kollegor i ett innovativt team och du vill använda din dyrbara tid och kunskap till att göra Sverige säkrare. På FRA arbetar vi med unika uppgifter – för Sveriges säkerhet och integritet.    I den här rollen är du både Systemutvecklare och Data Engineer. Som Data Engineer designar, utvecklar och underhåller du lösningar som tolkar, bearbetar och lagrar stora mängder inhämtad data i vårt Hadoop-kluster. Som Systemutvecklare utvecklar du användarapplikationer som gör data tillgängligt för användning i verksamhetens underrättelseproduktion. Världen förändras och så även vårt data. Därför sker kontinuerlig utveckling i takt med att nya krav och behov uppstår.  Du kommer ingå i ett team med helhetsansvar för sin informationsplattform. Teamet jobbar agilt med eget ansvar för drift och utveckling av hela stacken.  Teamet har ett nära samarbete med andra delar inom produktionen av analys och bearbetningsförmågor. Både med slutanvändare och andra tekniska team som förser systemet med data.  Du förväntas delta aktivt i kunskapsöverföringen, men också ta egna initiativ till din egen utveckling. Via utbildningar, konferenser och egen omvärldsbevakning håller vi oss uppdaterade på den senaste tekniken. Tillsammans utvärderar vi och tar del av varandras insikter.  Vi strävar alltid efter att medarbetarna ska trivas och utvecklas. Vi ser det som en förutsättning för teamets effektivitet.        Junior systemutvecklare eller gedigen erfarenhet.    Du är nyfiken på nya tekniker och håller dig uppdaterad om vad som händer, både vad gäller arbetsmetoder och nya produkter. Du gillar problemlösning och värdesätter att leverera slutprodukter av hög kvalitet. Du delar entusiastiskt med dig av dina kunskaper och lockas av möjligheten att vara med och påverka framtida teknikval och lösningar. Dessutom tycker du det är spännande och känner en stolthet i att få vara med och bygga upp FRAs lösningar kring Big Data.    FRA är en civil myndighet med ca 850 anställda som lyder under Försvarsdepartementet. Genom underrättelseverksamheten, där signalspaning bedrivs, ger FRA stöd till regeringens utrikes-, säkerhets- och försvarspolitik på kort och lång sikt. Det sker också genom vårt arbete med att skapa förutsättningar för ett cyberförsvar och att bidra till att skydda samhällsviktiga informationssystem.  Vi erbjuder flexibla arbetstider och tror att frihet under ansvar och flexibilitet bidrar till balans mellan arbete och fritid och välmående personal. Vi värdesätter god hälsa hos våra medarbetare och erbjuder bland annat friskvård under arbetstid. På FRA finns en sedan länge starkt förankrad idrottsklubb som möjliggör att våra medarbetare har tillgång till diverse olika träningsaktiviteter.  Vi erbjuder intressanta arbetsuppgifter med goda möjligheter till egen utveckling och förutsättningar till intern karriärrörlighet. Vi är övertygade om att en blandning av människor med olika bakgrund skapar en dynamisk och kreativ arbetsmiljö – våra olikheter är vår styrka.    Arbetsplatsen är belägen i närheten av Drottningholm, ca 10 min med buss från Brommaplan. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då anställning vid FRA innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Ett krav för att få anställning är godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Säkerhetsprövningen kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef på telefon 010-557 49 53. Fackliga företrädare nås på 010-557 46 00.  Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via www.fra.se  Referensnummer .  Då vi inför denna rekrytering redan tagit ställning till de rekryteringskanaler vi önskar använda undanber vi oss att bli kontaktade för ytterligare erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.

About the job 534532BR  Introduction  The Junior OpenShift Engineer will join IBM Consulting in Sweden working in the Northern Europe Hybrid Cloud Transformation team and work directly with our clients on key initiatives.  You will have the opportunity to build an in-depth understanding of their business issues and implement innovative and efficient technical solutions that drive adoption of change. We are looking for candidates who can build credibility and trust with our clients and provide knowledge and drive that addresses individual and unique business needs through the application of cloud technologies – and who will become our future experts in the field.    As a part of the Hybrid Cloud Transformation team, we are looking for engineers with a keen interest in open-source technologies. Join us to learn new technologies and expand your core base of expertise while integrating IBM and open-source technologies through real world engagement.  In this role you will work hands-on in cloud application opportunities towards adoption of container technologies (OpenShift and/or Kubernetes). You will play a key role in our customers’ evolution in enterprise development and help make our solutions both practical and workable for their businesses. You’ll work to gain an understanding of customer application landscape including infrastructure and business needs, and as member of a team develop recommendations that resolve their issues and help them make strategic decisions. You’ll then build enterprise applications and capabilities around cloud technologies to streamline development and allow for continuous feature release of applications.  We are seeking candidates who have a keen interest and some experience in architecting, designing, building, and operating cloud native applications on OpenShift and who have some experience of working in DevOps teams on OpenShift or other Kubernetes platforms.                  You must be a Swedish citizen to qualify for this position due to security clearance requirements.    IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.    Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.  Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.  It's time to define your career.    IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.    IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.    IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

About the job Northvolt is looking for Cloud Engineers to join our Digitalization Platform team. As a Platform Cloud engineer, you will be contributing towards building the first set of large scale European battery factories (Northvolt will build a total of 5 Gigafactory’s across Europe in the next few years with a total of 170GWH output ), which will play an important role in the transformation to a carbon free society.  Northvolt Ett, Northvolt’s first Gigafactory in Europe, sets a global example in the world of manufacturing with its cloud-first strategy, also referred to as the next-gen connected factory, or Industry 4.0 . To build this connected factory, Northvolt is extensively using Amazon Web Services (AWS) for modern cloud capabilities. Using the higher levels of abstractions provided by modern cloud services allows us to increase developer productivity, operational effectiveness, security, and reliability. Examples include detailed product traceability, near-real-time monitoring of manufacturing line effectiveness, computer vision powered defect detection, and machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) modeling to predict quality and performance of the produced battery cells. Check out this blogpost on our blueprint strategy for our factories.    We work with a "cloud-first"-mindset which presents us with unique and interesting challenges, pushing the traditional ways of working in manufacturing. We have a ruthless focus on automating all our (development) processes, helping us to deliver value to our customers as quickly as possible.  Currently we are a team of 12 engineers focusing on a wide variety of technologies including Kubernetes (EKS & k3s), backend development, frontend development, networking, serverless, embedded Linux and anything security. We work in an agile framework, with a product owner who demonstrates confidence in our ability to do the job, and with hands-on experience to chip into our discussions. We work as a cross-functional team, where we collaborate tightly to have a common view on our strategy and the recommendations we provide. Far from the ivory towers, we work closely with the product teams to provide guidance based on need, ensuring coherence and hands on development of shared components.  We know that many different names are given to this role in other companies, and your experience likely spans a variety of areas including software development, cloud and traditional infrastructure. It is likely that in the past you have had titles like devops, infrastructure, software, cloud or site reliability -engineer/architect.  We are a new company with great plans and great people. We are constantly figuring out solutions to new types of problems. If you are a problem solver, this is for you!    Some work experience (we need new and experienced engineers, so level of experience will determine seniority of the role):

job_title: Software Engineer - Backend Python Developer | H&M
job_description: About the job Company Description  Shaping the future of fashion with people, data, and tech - The fashion and retail industries are going through a transformation, driven by customers technology and sustainability expectations. At H&M Group, we want to shape the future of retail by harnessing the power of smart tech and data. With our 74-year history of innovation, we understand the need to collaborate and co-create with engineers and tech specialists around the world to achieve our vision.  We are creative minds; testing, experimenting, learning, and growing. With our strong values as our guide, we are empowered to create, innovate, and deliver. We work in multiple areas of the tech field. From AI to data-driven business development, user experience to engineering. We turn business challenges into innovative tech solutions – making H&M Group a global leader in combining tech, fashion and design.    CREATOR STUDIO is an end-to-end print on demand merchandise platform.  We enable creativity and cultural expression by managing all aspects of print on demand, production, fulfilment, and e-commerce, including integrations for social commerce. This leaves creators and brands free to focus on designing exceptional products, growing their audience, and driving traffic to their distribution channels powered by CREATOR STUDIO.  CREATOR STUDIO is part of H&M Group – giving access to its global supply chain, from product development to fulfilment and logistics. Working with CREATOR STUDIO means tapping into over 75 years of experience in fashion and innovation, and a supply chain that is optimised to deliver high quality products sustainably and responsibly.  As part of H&M Group Business Ventures, CREATOR STUDIO is a start-up within the greater context of H&M Group. CREATOR STUDIO is comprised of about 45 highly motivated individuals; all experts in their respective fields and all working to provide an excellent customer experience through a start-up, fail fast mentality while also leveraging H&M Group assets.  We are building a new print on demand merchandise platform that will inspire and engage both our Creators as well as our End Customers. We are looking for a new team member, Python Developer, having expertise with Docker and Kubernetes as well as microservice oriented platform architecture. As a backend developer at CREATOR STUDIO, you are part of a cross-functional product teams that work together as one team to deliver the best possible customer experience. You will be part of disrupting old ways and setting up the base for how print on demand merchandise should be done.    As a Software Engineer at CREATOR STUDIO, you will embark on a journey that will lead to something new and exciting - we will test, fail, and learn. You are an important player in this expedition, and so we believe you are communicative, flexible, stress-resistant, and able to work in an environment that is not yet formalized.  We believe you identify with having:   We also believe that you have experience working with:   You are awesome if you also have experience with:     Just like everyone at CREATOR STUDIO, we believe you are a sales-minded, social, open, communicative, and ambitious team player full of drive and optimism. You have strong communication skills and an ability to communicate and explain and discuss complex challenges and its implications to various stakeholders.  At H&M we have a strong, value-driven culture characterized by believing in people, teamwork and an entrepreneurial spirit. We welcome your application regardless of gender, age, gender expressions, sexual orientation, disabilities, religious beliefs, origin, or background.  If this sounds exciting to you, come join the journey and build the future with us!

About the job Var med och ta elitidrotten till en ny nivå där du som utvecklare får vara med och skapa marknadens mest innovativa sportanalysplattform. Vi vill hjälpa elitföreningar att säkerställa att alla jobbar mot samma mål, är involverade i beslut och diskussioner som leder till ännu bättre resultat. Kontakta Albin N Maelum eller Susanne Ohlsson om du vill veta mer om denna möjlighet.  Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

About the job At DoiT International, we believe the cloud transforms the way we build technology, and we are on a mission to help companies, big or small, go through this transformation.  We are a team of cloud professionals who love working with other people to solve challenging technical problems. We are committed to personal development and enjoy sharing our knowledge and experience through blogging, training, public speaking, and contributing to open-source.  We work hands-on, side-by-side with our customers to educate, mentor, advise, and solve problems to make sure they are getting the most out of what the cloud has to offer.  We are looking for people to join us on our mission and share the honor and delight of being able to help companies to realize their ideas into successful products.    From experience, the ideal candidate will have:     DoiT International is a world-leading cloud advisory company, Google Cloud’s top partner and Amazon Web Services Premier Partner. Our mission is to enable customers to harness the power of the public cloud at peak efficiency so they can focus on building the best products for their own customers.  Our core values guide us in creating a diverse team, a welcoming and supportive working environment, and a stellar employee experience with plenty of opportunities for personal and professional development. Challenging work, continuous learning, opportunities for promotion as we continue to scale, and a remote-first culture rooted in communication, transparency, and trust help us to attract and retain some of the best talents in the industry and we would love for you to join us on our mission.  We’ve created a remote first culture that thrives in a virtual environment so you have the resources you need to connect with talented people around the world.

About the job Do you like working with the cloud and have great knowledge of different cloud technologies such as Azure, AWS or GCP? Do you want to play a big part in helping organizations and companies with their cloud journey and make sure they are using the cloud services in an optimal way? Then you should keep reading!  Knowit has been a strategic partner for both Microsoft, Amazon and Google for a long time. It has given us the possibility to help organizations accelerate their journey to the cloud. knowit is now expanding our great cloud offerings and to support us in this, we are looking for several Cloud engineers that together with our other talented cloud consultants want to implement, configure and support different cloud solutions within AWS, Azure or GCP.    You will be responsible for supporting our clients with their journeys to the cloud by implementing, managing, and monitoring different cloud platforms.  You will work closely with our architects and developers in cross-functional agile teams. The goal is to set up cloud environments that are efficient, secure and delivers value for the customers where your expertise will play a big part in our cloud initiatives.       You are working as a cloud engineer or similar today and have done it for the past two years. It is meriting if you have one or several Cloud certificates within one or more cloud technologies Azure, AWS or GCP or the equivalent documented experience with successful projects and are on your way to become certified.  We would also like to see that you have a relevant education within IT or similar and that you are fluent in Swedish and English in both speech and writing.  As a person you are driven and like to solve problems. You are innovative, open to new ideas and like to share your knowledge. You have good communication skills and master Swedish and English in both speech and writing. Furthermore, you are service-minded and always have the customers' best interest at heart. Since you will be working in teams and deliver high-quality solutions it is important that you can work together with others.       Selection is ongoing and the appointment of the position will take place as soon as we have found the right person. Do not miss the chance to become a Maker of a Sustainable Future - Apply directly through our website or through LinkedIn!  If you have any questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Pontus Senke at pontus.senke@knowit.se . We look forward to your application!    Together with this huge investment within cloud technologies and Knowit being a local Swedish IT-consultancy company that works with short decision paths you will play a big part in our business in Stockholm and be able to influence. Depending on the project you also get to work independently and in teams.  We are Makers of a Sustainable Future. Makers do not believe in copy-paste solutions. Neither do we believe that value lies in only developing what others have drawn on tedious Powerpoint slides. We believe in less talk and more doing. Anyone can dream big and talk about business opportunities, but few have the skills to turn these ideas into reality. By learning through experience, we know what really matters and we apply our skills and creative use of technology to every client and situation to create truly unique solutions for the future. We’re passionate about what we do!  At Knowit we breath development, both professional and personal. In our innovative and fast-moving environment we see that development take place in the meeting between responsible leaders and coworkers. Our different abilities and perspectives empower us to challenge our customers and in close collaboration build better digital solutions. With 3,800 digitalization consultants in six countries we enable a sustainable development of our society. We are makers of a sustainable future.

About the job The Infrastructure Team acts as a backbone for any business. We are presenting you an opportunity to be part of an experienced team responsible for development, maintenance and operation for Schibsted servers, storage, cloud and databases. Working closely in collaboration, with network engineers and engaging with amazing internal customers along with providing you a platform to learn new technologies. As a Systems Engineer you will work together with the infrastructure team in different areas in the hybrid cloud. You will make sure the infrastructure is working and is up-to-date with the newest technology and help our internal customers with their infrastructure needs.

About the job This exclusive role is only available through Jefferson Frank, an international agency that has grown to be one of the trusted recruitment partners to businesses across Sweden in different industries and domains. To learn more about this opportunity, reach out to George Paxton on LinkedIn who is responsible for this advert. You can also reach him at g.paxton@jeffersonfrank.com.    Jefferson Frank are delighted to be working with a software-based start-up based in Stockholm that have development & their respective IT teams at the very core of their business mission. A common frustration for developers in this current market place is that software development departments are a complimentary, add-on aspect to an organisations core product/service which they deliver to customers. This results in developers feeling disillusional and that their work isn't as valued as it could be. This client takes the opposite approach, their development team is at the very centre of their product lines designed to search for a specific need to their customers.  This client was born out of the frustration with complex & inflexible hardware-driven software solutions not delivering according to application needs nor to brand promises. In the earlier days a key observation made was that existing software solutions didn't support the rapidly changing requirements of managing, processing and storing data whilst still supporting application development requirements. They have an ambitious long-term goal to become the leader in data access software building multi-cloud solutions.  They operate with 2 product lines which are build in-house that 1) Orchestrate and govern data in a secure, cloud native format and 2) transform object storage into a shared file system. What's unique about this market-disruptive software is that it provides a close-to-application abstraction layer that allows customers to get greater value from their data. When it comes to building solutions they take a simplistic approach to achieve high quality and uncomplicated design. Building their software completely from scratch, this sit's between the customers application layers with hybrid cloud configurations. This patented approach improves performance, adds redundancy of data whilst securing and protecting their data.    They're hiring for DevOps Engineers to join their growing integrations and infrastructure deployment team. You'll be joining a largely senior team who have helped to develop the product to what it consists of today. Working with a complex product that encompasses a deployment module and customer portal with supporting CLI & web interfaces there will be a high degree of variation with the tasks. Truly, no 2 days will be the same in this position. This also means that your technical competence will be tested daily, working on complex challenges requiring you to think in different ways and taking a holistic view to the software architecture.  Within this product team you'll be under the supervision of a tech lead that reports to the CTO. You'll be working on a customer facing application that enables multi-cloud integration's with protections for cloud data alongside enabling programmatic data management policies. Your day-to-day will be focused on developing their software deployment and customer integration options alongside supporting customers in defining bespoke approaches when necessary. This is a customer facing role so experience in customer environments/working extensively with customer facing applications is required.  You'll bring a wealth of experience working with DevOps, ideally in cloud/hybrid cloud environments deploying large-scale & complex solutions. A fundamental for this position is is your experience with container orchestration as there is a significant degree of work to be completed with integration's. As a sufficient proportion of this position involves greenfield development you'll bring strong knowledge working with infrastructure architecture and cloud services for object storage. Any of the popular public providers is sufficient alongside being well-versed with deployment of distribution solutions.      In return, you will joining a growing and innovative start-up that takes a technology-first approach to their business model where you will truly be at the clients core with the ability to influence key decisions which are made. You'll be working with a modern tech stack (infrastructure is built with Golang).  To apply for this position, send your CV via this portal or email it to g.paxton@jeffersonfrank.com. Alternatively, you can reach out to George Paxton on LinkedIn to learn more regarding this position or others which are available at Jefferson Frank.

About the job Beskrivning av tjänsten  Drivs du likt oss av att ligga i digitaliseringens framkant? Vill du dessutom använda denna drivkraft i en konsultroll och hjälpa våra kunder att bättre ta tillvara på digitaliseringens möjligheter?  CGI är en global IT leverantör som levererar högkvalitativ affärsrådgivning, systemintegration och outsourcing tjänster. Vi arbetar sida vid sida med kunder för att omvandla innovation, data och teknik till framgång för dem.  Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter  I rollen kommer du exempelvis att arbeta med:   Du kommer bl a dokumentera:  Processmodeller, begrepps- och informationsmodeller, Use cases samt User stories  Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll  Vi söker dig som:   Du är som person:     Du får arbeta tillsammans med mycket kompetenta kollegor i spännande uppdrag och vi vågar lova inspirerande möten och utveckling. Vi jobbar med alla delar inom ett IT-projekt, allt från förstudier till design, implementation och drift. Hos oss finns det flera olika sätt att bli framgångsrik. Med våra program för karriär- och kompetensutveckling sätter du tillsammans med din ledare individuella mål och har alltid en tydlig plan för ditt nästa steg. Vi har en öppen och generös företagskultur. Att dela med sig av sin kunskap är en förutsättning för att vi ska kunna leverera på topp. Vi som arbetar här är drivna och motiverade. Att ha balans i livet är en självklarhet.  Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Sista ansökningsdatum är: 2022-08-31.  Personliga säkerhetskrav kommer att krävas om rollen kräver det.    Heltid/deltid: 100%  Placering: Stockholm  För mer information, vänligen kontakta Susann Edvardsson, Director Consulting Services, Insurance, 073 920 87 01.  Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!  Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmånder:     CGI finns i 40 länder med 84 000 medlemmar, varav närmare 4 000 i Sverige i 25 städer. En kombination som öppnar många och flexibla utvecklingsvägar. För femte året i rad har CGI Sverige fått priset Top Employer. I motiveringen nämns bland annat CGI:s anställningsvillkor, möjligheten till karriärutveckling och starkt ledarskap. Vi har även fått utmärkelsen Karriärföretag för våra unika karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter samt utmärkelsen Guldstegen av fackförbundet Unionen för insatserna kring att skapa en arbetsmiljö där det ska vara lika enkelt för kvinnor som för män att satsa på karriären.  Vi hoppas att Du vill vara med och bidra till vår goda arbetsmiljö och vårt jämställdhetsarbete.  Hos oss på CGI får du möjlighet att bli delägare vilket innebär att du kan påverka och bygga framgång samt ta del av de värden du är med och skapar. Som delägare är vi extra engagerade i det vi gör, det påverkar hur vi bemöter våra kunder och varandra. Det är därför vi kallar våra medarbetare för medlemmar. För att vi är mer än medarbetare. Denna möjlighet att bli delägare skapar en unik entreprenörsanda och teamkänsla där alla strävar efter att utveckla företaget. På CGI kallar vi detta ett medlemskap utöver det vanliga.    Teknologin är kärnan i våra kunders digitala transformation men vi vet att det är människor som är kärnan i ett företags framgång.  När du börjar på CGI, blir du en viktig rådgivare som tillsammans med kollegor och kunder tar fram handlingskraftiga insikter som skapar meningsfulla och hållbara resultat. Vi kallar våra anställda för ""medlemmar"" då de är delägare i CGI. Vi vill erbjuda våra medlemmar en kultur där vi trivs med att jobba och utvecklas tillsammans och där vi tillsammans bygger ett företag att vara stolta över. Detta har varit vår dröm sedan 1976 och den har fört oss dit vi är idag – en av världens största oberoende leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.  På CGI vet vi vilken rikedom mångfald ger. Vi strävar efter att skapa en arbetskultur där alla känner sig välkomna och vi samarbetar med våra kunder för att skapa ett inkluderande samhälle. Som en jämställd arbetsgivare vill vi ge alla våra medlemmar samma möjlighet att lyckas och utvecklas.  Är du redo att bli en del av vår framgångsresa? Börja hos oss på CGI – där dina idéer och handlingar gör skillnad.
