About the job Vi söker nu konsulter som brinner för Krav och som vill växa med oss och förstärka vårt Advisory-team i Stockholm i rollen som Business Analyst. Som konsult på Sopra Steria är du del av en snabbrörlig, flexibel och växande organisation med stor framåtanda och attraktiva karriärmöjligheter. Ett av Sopra Sterias starkaste erbjudanden är att stötta verksamheter i sin transformation till kundcentrerade och datadrivna organisationer. Vi hjälper våra kunder att ta ett strategiskt grepp om deras data för att med utgångspunkt i affärsnyttor skapa förutsättningar för önskad förflyttning – från affär och kunderbjudande, till operativ modell, förmågor och teknik.  Bland våra kunder finns de mest renommerade företagen och organisationer i regionen och nationellt. Kombinerat med den internationella koncernens samlade kundbas, kunskap och strukturkapital finns alla möjligheter till hög grad av personlig och professionell utveckling. Power of Sharing är vårt motto – vi delar med oss av vår kunskap till varandra och till våra kunder. Det är en av ingredienserna till att vi har roligt på jobbet och utvecklas!  För att kunna möta våra kunders ökade efterfrågan på våra tjänster söker vi nu nya kollegor med erfarenhet av kravfångst i rollen som Business Analyst där vi kan hjälpa våra kunder att brygga kommunikation mellan verksamhet och IT. Vi söker dig med erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med kravfångst i utvecklingsprojekt för moderna IT-system och som har lätt att sätta sig in i olika verksamheter.    Som person tror vi att du är mycket drivande och ansvarstagande, att du brinner för smarta lösningar, har stort verksamhetsintresse och intresse för IT. I rollen som Business Analyst kan du självständigt driva insamling av användarnas behov, omvandla dessa till tydliga krav och sedan på ett förståeligt sätt förmedla och arbeta med dessa tillsammans med användarna, utvecklare och testare. Vi tror att du trivs bäst i Agila miljöer med fokus på kvalitet, samarbete och leverans.  Vi på Sopra Steria tycker att samarbete är viktigt för framgång och vi tror därför att du är en stark team-player.    Tidigare erfarenhet inom konsultyrket är meriterande.    Den största anledningen till att du bör överväga att ansöka är möjligheten till att få lära och ständigt utvecklas tillsammans med inkluderande, kompetenta och erfarna kollegor. För oss är det en självklarhet att dela kunskap mellan oss och vi löser utmaningar tillsammans. Den kulturen har också bidragit till att vi är utsedda till en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2022 av Great Place to Work. Förutom underbara kollegor får du givetvis också möjlighet att arbeta för branschens mest spännande kunder och arbeta med ett brett spektrum av projekt som bidrar till samhällsnytta.  Vi tillhör en internationell koncern och är ledande i Europa inom digitalisering. I världen är vi 47 000 medarbetare, varav 450 av oss finns här i Sverige där vi har kontor i Östersund, Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.    Via annonsen på Sopra Sterias hemsida kan du ladda upp ditt CV eller länka direkt till ditt LinkedIn-konto. Frågor kring rollen/bolaget? Välkommen att kontakta epost: karin.bildt@soprasteria.com

About the job  Company Description  When you join Turnitin, you'll be welcomed into a company that is a recognized innovator in the global education space. For more than 20 years, Turnitin has partnered with educational institutions to promote honesty, consistency, and fairness across all subject areas and assessment types. Over 16,000 academic institutions, publishers, and corporations use our services: Gradescope by Turnitin, iThenticate, Turnitin Feedback Studio, Turnitin Originality, Turnitin Similarity, ExamSoft, and ProctorExam.  Turnitin has offices in Australia, India, Indonesia, Japan, Korea, Mexico, the Netherlands, the Philippines, Ukraine, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Our diverse community of colleagues are all unified by a shared desire to make a difference in education. Come join us, and let's make change together.    Purpose overviewYou will join our growing technical department and you’ll help shape and develop a more mature team. You'll be surrounded by talented professionals. Some are passionate about honing their craft and applying it to delivering world-class experiences. Others are equally passionate about developing high performing teams in tandem with deliverables. Both are critical. We wear many hats and roll up our sleeves. We collaborate and help each other. We do what needs to get done to deliver on our commitments and deliver amazing products to our customers and users.    Key Responsibilities and Outputs                                    is to ensure the integrity of global education and meaningfully improve learning outcomes. underpin everything we do.   At Turnitin, we recognize it’s unrealistic for candidates to fulfill 100% of the criteria in a job ad. We encourage you to apply if you meet the majority of the requirements because we know that skills evolve over time. If you’re willing to learn and evolve alongside us, join our team! Turnitin, LLC is committed to the policy that all persons have equal access to its programs, facilities and employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more På FRA arbetar vi med något som ingen annan gör i Sverige, och det kan du bli en del av. Oavsett yrkesroll är vi med och gör samhällsnytta genom att bidra till ett meningsfullt syfte — tillsammans arbetar vi med unika uppgifter för Sveriges säkerhet och integritet. Vi erbjuder intressanta arbetsuppgifter med goda möjligheter till egen utveckling och vi är övertygade om att en blandning av människor med olika bakgrund skapar en dynamisk och kreativ arbetsmiljö – våra olikheter är vår styrka. Vill du göra samhällsnytta och bidra till Sveriges oberoende i världen? Vill du utveckla system för riktigt stora datamängder? Vi söker nu dig som vill jobba med Big Data-lösningar och brinner för systemutveckling. Du är nyfiken på ny teknik och vill jobba med förmågeutveckling för underrättelseproduktion. Du vill utvecklas tillsammans med kollegor i ett innovativt team och du vill använda din dyrbara tid och kunskap till att göra Sverige säkrare. På FRA arbetar vi med unika uppgifter – för Sveriges säkerhet och integritet. Ditt uppdrag I den här rollen är du både Systemutvecklare och Data Engineer. Som Data Engineer designar, utvecklar och underhåller du lösningar som tolkar, bearbetar och lagrar stora mängder inhämtad data i vårt Hadoop-kluster. Som Systemutvecklare utvecklar du användarapplikationer som gör data tillgängligt för användning i verksamhetens underrättelseproduktion. Världen förändras och så även vårt data. Därför sker kontinuerlig utveckling i takt med att nya krav och behov uppstår. Du kommer ingå i ett team med helhetsansvar för sin informationsplattform. Teamet jobbar agilt med eget ansvar för drift och utveckling av hela stacken. Teamet har ett nära samarbete med andra delar inom produktionen av analys och bearbetningsförmågor. Både med slutanvändare och andra tekniska team som förser systemet med data. Du förväntas delta aktivt i kunskapsöverföringen, men också ta egna initiativ till din egen utveckling. Via utbildningar, konferenser och egen omvärldsbevakning håller vi oss uppdaterade på den senaste tekniken. Tillsammans utvärderar vi och tar del av varandras insikter. Vi strävar alltid efter att medarbetarna ska trivas och utvecklas. Vi ser det som en förutsättning för teamets effektivitet. Du kan Du har följande kompetens/erfarenhet: Goda kunskaper i Java Högskoleutbildning inom datateknik, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande alternativt förvärvat motsvarande kompetens genom arbetslivserfarenhet Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift Junior systemutvecklare eller gedigen erfarenhet? För oss är din nyfikenhet, ödmjukhet och vilja att lära viktigare än tidigare arbetslivserfarenhet men det är även meriterande för tjänsten om du har erfarenhet från ett eller flera av följande områden: Big Data Distribuerade lagringsmodeller (HDFS, HBase, Cassandra eller liknande) Apache Spark Javascript, Angular Scala, Python, C# Data Science Notebooks (Jupyter, Zeppelin eller liknande) Puppet, Ansible Linux Informationsmodellering / Datamodellering  Du är Du är nyfiken på nya tekniker och håller dig uppdaterad om vad som händer, både vad gäller arbetsmetoder och nya produkter. Du gillar problemlösning och värdesätter att leverera slutprodukter av hög kvalitet. Du delar entusiastiskt med dig av dina kunskaper och lockas av möjligheten att vara med och påverka framtida teknikval och lösningar. Dessutom tycker du det är spännande och känner en stolthet i att få vara med och bygga upp FRAs lösningar kring Big Data. Om FRA FRA är en civil myndighet med ca 850 anställda som lyder under Försvarsdepartementet. Genom underrättelseverksamheten, där signalspaning bedrivs, ger FRA stöd till regeringens utrikes-, säkerhets- och försvarspolitik på kort och lång sikt. Det sker också genom vårt arbete med att skapa förutsättningar för ett cyberförsvar och att bidra till att skydda samhällsviktiga informationssystem. Vi erbjuder flexibla arbetstider och tror att frihet under ansvar och flexibilitet bidrar till balans mellan arbete och fritid och välmående personal. Vi värdesätter god hälsa hos våra medarbetare och erbjuder bland annat friskvård under arbetstid. På FRA finns en sedan länge starkt förankrad idrottsklubb som möjliggör att våra medarbetare har tillgång till diverse olika träningsaktiviteter. Vi erbjuder intressanta arbetsuppgifter med goda möjligheter till egen utveckling och förutsättningar till intern karriärrörlighet. Vi är övertygade om att en blandning av människor med olika bakgrund skapar en dynamisk och kreativ arbetsmiljö – våra olikheter är vår styrka. Mer information Arbetsplatsen är belägen i närheten av Drottningholm, ca 10 min med buss från Brommaplan. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då anställning vid FRA innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Ett krav för att få anställning är godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Säkerhetsprövningen kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef på telefon 010-557 49 53. Fackliga företrädare nås på 010-557 46 00. Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via www.fra.se senast 2022-08-28.  Referensnummer 3189/21 . Då vi inför denna rekrytering redan tagit ställning till de rekryteringskanaler vi önskar använda undanber vi oss att bli kontaktade för ytterligare erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.

About the job Description  Security Operations Engineers are responsible for security operations including managing security tools around malware protection, vulnerability management, log correlation and more. They maintain rulesets, operate the tools and are responsible for follow-up on findings. They will perform monitoring of security events in a SIEM-system and perform escalation to incidents and manage those.  Key responsibilities    CME Group: Where Futures Are Made  CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Joining our company gives you the opportunity to make a difference in global financial markets every day, whether you work on our industry-leading technology and risk management services, our benchmark products or in a corporate services area that helps us serve our customers better. With 3,500 employees located around the world, we're small enough for you and your contributions to be known. But big enough for your ideas to make an impact. About the job Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.  The security vision of Tink is to “make sure that our customers and our own employees trust that Tink secures their data better than what their bank does”. The aim is not a perception of trust, but real, verifiable trust. And yes ... we are well aware that for a company to gain the trust of its own employees (who actually know all the “unseen” details of how data is stored, accessed, processed and protected), this is a much harder task. But challenging existing ideas and suggesting innovative solutions is part of Tink's values & DNA and we in the security teams do not shy away from such challenges.  What we offer you  As a security engineer in the security operations team you will continuously work with our ability to identify and react to vulnerabilities and security incidents. You can identify critical resources in our cloud native environment and ensure that we are properly monitoring it with logs and alerts set up in our SIEM. You can also use Python (or Go) to automate whatever can be automated so that our security tooling can scale as Tink grows. As a member of the security operations team you should also be able to quickly and accurately identify and assess incidents and vulnerabilities. And most importantly; you will work with the rest of the organisation to do whatever it takes to keep our customers' data secure.   What we look for   Feel free to attach links to your Github account or anything else you feel we should know about.

About the job Job Summary  DESCRIPTION  Come build the future of entertainment with us. Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching?  Prime Video is a premium streaming service that offers customers a vast collection of TV shows and movies - all with the ease of finding what they love to watch in one place. We offer customers thousands of popular movies and TV shows including Amazon Originals and exclusive licensed content to exciting live sports events. We also offer our members the opportunity to subscribe to add-on channels which they can cancel at anytime and to rent or buy new release movies and TV box sets on the Prime Video Store. Prime Video is a fast-paced, growth business - available in over 240 countries and territories worldwide. The team works in a dynamic environment where innovating on behalf of our customers is at the heart of everything we do. If this sounds exciting to you, please read on.  In this role, you will be joining the Stockholm-based live low latency streaming team. We deliver Sye, a revolutionary streaming platform primarily used for live sporting events and concerts. Our ambition is to drastically improve the customer experience of watching live streams by providing minimal latency and synchronized playback to all viewers across the globe.  Key job responsibilities  As a developer on our live low latency streaming player team, you will innovate on and improve the components providing live streaming capabilities to end user applications. The platforms we support include Android, iOS, web, smart-TVs, set-top-boxes and game consoles, where you will focus on a subset of them.  Your will work on the SDKs we provide as well as their integration into Prime Video applications that are used by millions of customers around the world. Your work will also include developing reference and demo implementations, setting up automated tests for different hardware and software platforms.  A day in the life  As part of the Sye team you will be involved with daily stand-ups, coding, code reviews for team members, internal and cross team meetings to align on technical complexities, estimate deliveries with milestones and write technical documents. Large events involves planning of new features to be deployed, tests to be performed and data to be analyzed in order to continuously improve the customer experience. Status and goals tracking are expected every so often.    The team owns the live low latency player SDKs for supported platforms, and we also work on the integration of them into Prime Video applications.  We are growing, and with us you will also be able to grow as we work together. There are lots of opportunities to interact with other teams globally. Together with partners such as Twitch and IMDb TV, we are part of a strong video streaming community that will be available to you.       Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.   - Amazon Corp Services Sweden  Job ID: A1910239

About the job As Google Cloud's premier partner in AI, Datatonic provides world-class businesses with cutting-edge data solutions in the cloud. We help clients take leading technology to the limits by combining our expertise in machine learning, data engineering, and analytics. With Google Cloud Platform as our foundation, we help businesses future-proof their solutions, deepen their understanding of consumers, increase competitive advantage and unlock operational efficiencies.  Our team consists of experts in machine learning, data science, software engineering, mathematics, and design. We share a passion for data & analysis, operate at the cutting edge, and believe in a pragmatic approach to solving hard problems.    As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer you'll know how to engineer beautiful code in Python and take pride in what you produce. You'll be an advocate of high-quality engineering and best-practice in production software as well as rapid prototypes.  Whilst the position is a hands-on technical role, we'd be particularly interested to find candidates with a desire to lead projects and take an active role in leading client discussions. Your responsibilities will involve building trusted relationships with prospects, finding creative ways to use machine learning to solve problems, scoping projects, and overseeing the delivery of these engagements.  To be successful, you will need strong ML & Data Science fundamentals and will know the right tools and approach for each ML use case. You'll be comfortable with model optimisation and deployment tools and practices. Furthermore, you'll also need excellent communication and consulting skills, with the desire to meet real business needs and deliver innovative solutions using AI & Cloud.          30 days holiday in addition to bank holidays, Private Occupational Pension (Salary Sacrifice), Team Bonus payable annually, choice of laptop  : 4500 kr Private Health Insurance Allowance per year, 5000 kr Wellness Allowance per year, Employee Assistance Program  8500 kr Conference Budget + 4 days attendance per year, Access to Linux Academy, Coursera, and LinkedIn Learning  A personalised development plan to ensure you hit your professional goals with a clear roadmap for progression  The opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI and ML solutions spanning multiple industries and with market-leading organisations  Access to Datatonic LABs, our Research & Development hub. Experiment and bring forward ideas, create impactful and meaningful work in a creative and collaborative environment - even just for fun!  A mix of office and remote working, 1200 kr Home Equipment Allowance  : A welcoming and friendly team plus weekly Team Lunches and Monthly Social Events    We’re an eclectic team with lots of different interests and personalities. We have many different roles across data science, engineering, analytics, consulting, marketing, business development, and operations. We have offices in the UK, Stockholm, Geneva, Munich, and Barcelona, and we work with clients in many other European countries. We allow for flexible working hours and the possibility of remote work.  As a company, we have a strong emphasis on learning and professional development. Our core values are:    A hub for continuous learning, curiosity, developing ideas, testing things out - and then putting ‘excellence’ into practice.  Owning It  Working collaboratively in cross-functional teams to achieve customer delight. We love what we do and draw immense satisfaction from taking responsibility and seeing the results of our work.    Creating positive change for our customers, using the most relevant machine learning and analytics approaches and the best technologies to meet real business needs.    Our business has been built on great partnerships and open-source collaboration. It’s one thing to be successful, but to do it in partnership with great people and other great companies is even better in our opinion.

job_title: Junior Business Analyst till världsledande fordonstillverkare!
job_description: About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Är du intresserad av konstruktion, produktbeskrivning och brinner för att utveckla och förbättra metoder och system? Du kommer samtidigt få ta del utav en agil resa som redan är i framkant och lära dig framtidens virtuella verktyg för att utveckla deras produkter. Information om kundföretaget Vi söker nu en Junior Business Analyst som vill utvecklas inom CAD/vPDM. Vår kund genomgår nu en transformation från att vara en leverantör av lastbilar och bussar till en leverantör av kompletta och hållbara transportlösningar. Inom CAD/vPDM står de ständigt inför många nya utmaningar för att leverera nya lösningar i form av processer, metoder och systemstöd som kan möta deras kunders behov. Kulturen hos vår kund är onekligen unik, här lever man efter sina värden – konsumenten först, respekt för individen, eliminera slöseri, beslutsamhet, lagarbete och integritet! Vår kund är en av världens ledande tillverkare av lastbilar, bussar samt industri- och marinmotorer. De värderar kreativitet, problemlösning och kritiskt tänkande högt och gruppen kännetecknas av en vilja att ständigt bli bättre. Information om rollen Du kommer att tillhöra området CAD/vPDM som verkar inom flertalet områden, bland annat datadriven elkonstruktion och Digital Engineering Visualization som du troligtvis tillhör. Området jobbar, tillsammans med IT-sektionen i ett gränslöst "Value Creation Team" där alla stöttar alla, baserat på SAFe ramverket och levererar lösningar som används över hela företaget. Gruppen består av ett omtänksamt, kunnigt och glatt gäng verkssamhetsarkitekter, produktägare, projektledare och Business Analyst som nu behöver förstärkning för att möjliggöra att de kan ta nästa steg! Arbetsuppgifter I rollen som Business Analyst stöttar du konstruktörerna i hur systemen fungerar och supporterar dessa så att regelverk och arbetsprocesser är uppdaterade.

We hope that you'll join us in helping to shape and build the future of free software together.  We offer:

About the job This exclusive role is only available through Jefferson Frank, an international agency that has grown to be one of the trusted recruitment partners to businesses across Sweden in different industries and domains. To learn more about this opportunity, reach out to George Paxton on LinkedIn who is responsible for this advert. You can also reach him at g.paxton@jeffersonfrank.com.    Jefferson Frank are delighted to be working with a Stockholm-based Fintech client, providing B2B services to their network of 65'000 customers across Nordic countries. Original founded to provide financial services to personal bank accounts such as the ones you and I own, they switched to a corporate market which has accelerated the success of the business, resulting in revenue doubling year on year for the past 4 years. This has lead to them being recognised as being one of the fastest growing companies in Sweden in the last year. They operate with a versatile and agile product that allows customers to pay invoices with a credit card WITHOUT having to register with a financial institution. This makes their service flexible and makes it an efficient operation for all parties concerned. Furthermore, they charge a 3% fee for their services making them more affordable than factoring or loaning from a bank. In addition to this, they run a customer loyalty programme which allows customers to earn points on their spending which further incentives the use of their service.  Since switching to a B2B client base this has accelerated the success of this client. In combination with this impressive market performance they have caught the eye of investors which is mostly due to the €5 million in turnover achieved. Further complimenting this they've grown 500, 700 and 1100% in the last 3 years. All of this means they have acquired €15 million in funding since the beginning of 2021. Now in a significant they're in hiring mode to allow them to continue moving from strength to strength throughout the remainder of 2022 and beyond. The Fintech domain is an area of tech which continues to grow in popularity, now is a great time to be joining this area of the market due to the increased demand for digital services.    For this position the chosen candidate will be working cross-functionally across this clients 2 development teams that are both responsible for a client-facing application. Due to the growth of this client a main focus will be on integration's, on-boarding new clients to their cloud hosted infrastructure (GCP), this client also works with modern JavaScript frameworks including Node & React and have built a microservices architecture for their system. You'll be responsible for scripting and automation's of their already existing services, working with Bash/Shell whilst the system is migration to Terraform in the long-term future. Other responsibilities will including upgrading the security, implementing new services & features that have more recently been released for GCP and providing containers support to the developers with Docker machines, making changes and upgrades as one cohesive team.  You will be working alongside an SRE to automate the majority of this clients architecture as due to their growth, it is becoming increasingly difficult to manually complete these tasks. There will also be a focus on augmentation as you assist the development teams with these functions. In this role you'll be receiving 1-2-1 support, making it a fantastic opportunity for those who are dedicated to advancing their career and becoming an expert with DevOps practices. You'll be immersed in a collaborative environment where teams often work cross-functionally and promote knowledge sharing working agile with daily meetings & stand ups!      In return you will be joining a rapidly expanding company that is on the way to becoming a significant player in the market over the coming years. You'll be joining a working environment that is open and stresses attention to detail with personal profiling in their recruitment process, ensuring that they have the right personalities in their teams which align well with what they are trying to achieve. In addition to this, our client will create a bespoke personal development plan with you when you join, ensuring they are aligned and contributing to your own personal and career objectives. This client offers a comprehensive package that includes an ITP1 pension, 25 days holiday and a health & wellbeing plan.  To apply for this position, send your CV via this portal or email it to g.paxton@jeffersonfrank.com. Alternatively, you can reach out to George Paxton on LinkedIn to learn more regarding this position or others which are available at Jefferson Frank.

About the job Who's behind Deel?  We're a global team that loves to build and solve problems, especially when it comes to the world of remote work. Made up of self-driven people spanning 150+ countries, Deel's unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and improving.  Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we're building the tools to make that a reality. Our market-leading tech, expertise, and, most importantly, the team are crucial. As a whole, we find fulfillment in working together towards our shared mission.    A significant shift has occurred within today's workforce, and with it, business as we know it has drastically changed. At Deel, we see a world without hiring borders, but we needed to find a solution to make it happen. A 30-mile hiring radius should no longer limit how companies hire because great talent lives everywhere. Deel exists to stay on top (and ahead) of the accelerating global talent market by offering global teams all the tools needed to hire, manage, pay, and scale at rocket speed.  And speaking of scale, Deel has officially raised $425 million in Series D funding, bringing our valuation to $5.5 billion. There's never been a more exciting time to join Deel - the market leader in international payroll and compliance.    We are looking for a Revenue Systems Developer to join our growing Revenue Operations team and build world-class revenue applications. As the Revenue Systems Developer, you will be central to continually improving and enhancing our global revenue operations platforms.  Our ideal candidate will take ownership of all programmatic requests and work closely with the Systems Architect and Systems Administrators to collaborate on requirements, validate design and deliver solutions that meet the needs of our business.  You will report to the Global Process and Systems Leader.          At Deel, our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are, no matter their location. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all. Because a good life brings great innovation.     Perks are nice, but perks don’t make a company or individual successful - the work does. At Deel, we’re building technology and products to engage the ever-changing global workforce and to ensure businesses may hire anyone anywhere. While you’re building for our customers, we’re building for you.

About the job This is a fast-paced engineering role in Linux-based software-defined infrastructure and applications, covering all layers of the stack, including bare metal, virtualization (KVM) and containerization (LXC/LXD), storage (Ceph and Linux filesystems), networking (OVS, OVN and Core networking), up to OpenStack and Kubernetes, and the open source applications running on top of them.  This role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and open source to build a career with Canonical and drive success for our customers, community and the company. If you have great communication skills, and a passion for troubleshooting and fixing issues in technology used by millions across the world, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.    This role deals with critical issues in the open source stack that require deep debugging and troubleshooting skills. Our engineers have to be able to work productively at any level of the stack above the kernel, in a wide range of applications, to understand and address the software issues at hand. Our group is critical to the success of our enterprise customers, partners and Ubuntu itself.  You will be the final point of escalation for operational troubleshooting and driving issues to resolution with workarounds, guidance, and fixes to be released upstream and in Ubuntu.     As a Sustaining Operations Engineer you will:   The successful Sustaining Operations Engineer will have:   What you'll do   Who you are     Canonical is a growing multinational software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's leading cloud operating system. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.  We offer:     #stack

About the job Nu söker marknadsledande ESSVE en engagerad, analytisk Business Analyst vilket ger dig möjligheten att utvecklas vidare tillsammans i detta framåtlutade, internationella bolag.  ESSVE, som ingår i noterade Bergman & Beving, är en marknadsledande leverantör av skruv- och infästning som försett Norden och Baltikum med produkter sedan 1970 och har en omsättning om ca 1 miljard. Som Business Analyst på ESSVE är du ansvarig för analys av vår omsättning samt ska tillsammans med försäljningschefer analysera och utveckla vår prisprocess. Du kommer även att stötta några utvalda affärsområden med helhetsansvar på analys, utfall, prognos och måltavla. Att utveckla processer och rutiner proaktivt är en självklar del men även att kunna agera bollplank och rådgivare till våra chefer. Då bolaget befinner sig i en utvecklingsfas ges goda möjligheter till att vara med att utforma rollen framåt.  I rollen som Business Analyst kommer du tillhöra ekonomi- och IT teamet om 6 personer som är placerade på Essves huvudkontor varav ytterligare två kollegor återfinns inom controlling. Du rapporterar till CFO.      Vi söker dig som har en akademisk utbildning i ekonomi kombinerat med några års erfarenhet som Business controller/Business Analyst, gärna med tidigare erfarenhet av hantering av stora datamängder liksom BI-system. Vi ser gärna att du tidigare arbetat med redovisning och kan tolka regelverket kring IFRS då förståelsen för dess grunder gör dig framgångsrik i denna roll. Erfarenhet från internationellt bolag är en fördel. Du är en van Excel-användare och uttrycker dig obehindrat på både engelska och svenska i tal och skrift.    Som person är du en självgående teamplayer med ett öga för analys. Som många av dina blivande kollegor har du ett högt engagemang och ett proaktivt sätt vilket göra att du kommer trivas med vår tydliga vision att vi hjälper varandra och våra kunder under mottot ”get it done”.  ESSVEs framgång bygger på en företagskultur där kommunikationen är rak och stämningen hjärtlig.  Vi vill att det ska vara högt till tak och att alla ska få möjlighet att göra sin röst hörd.  Vi tror på att man blir riktigt bra på det man gör genom att ha kul på jobbet.  Kista, Stockholm    I denna rekryteringsprocess samarbetar ESSVE med Meritmind. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult . Intervjuer och urval kommer inte att ske förrän i början av augusti då vi är tillbaka efter semestrar. Denna tjänst kan du söka så länge annonsen finns tillgänglig på vår hemsida.  Meritmind arbetar kompetensbaserat för att främja en objektiv och icke-diskriminerande rekrytering. Detta innebär bl.a. att du kommer att få göra arbetspsykologiska tester om du går vidare till intervju i denna process.      För att kunna registrera din ansökan behöver vi ett godkännande att spara dina personuppgifter. Läs mer på vår    Ansök med  För att vi ska kunna genomföra en så objektiv rekryteringsprocess som möjligt ber vi dig utesluta känsliga personuppgifter så som ålder, civilstatus, familjesituation/barn, etniskt ursprung, politiska åsikter, religiös eller filosofisk övertygelse, medlemskap i fackförening, hälsa eller sexuell läggning.

job_title: Senior Build & Release Specialist [New Game IP]
job_description: About the job Job Description  At Ubisoft Stockholm we’re exploring what’s possible with Scalar (our new cloud technology), reclaiming our playful curiosity, and building the future of games.  We’re looking for a Senior Build & Release Specialist to provide expertise in compilers and package managers to both internal teams (locally), and global Ubisoft partners working with our shared products. You will help drive the design and implementation of our infrastructure, prototype, and reiterate as needed.  You’ll play a significant role in the development of our ultra-interactive and beautiful new world on a brand New Game IP.  Games using our Ubisoft Scalar tech can rely on a virtually unlimited amount of computing power, and enable our game developers to focus on creativity and design for never-before-seen player experiences.          Additional Information  Ubisoft’s 20,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission – to enrich players’ lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting-edge technologies, and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.  We’re also a distributed workforce with a hybrid setup, and in 2023 our main hideout will be at Fenix Stockholm, a re-imagined modern office in the inner-city district of Hagastaden.

Apply to G+D today by sending your application with subject: to career.gdsems@gi-de.com or apply directly here.    G+D Mobile Security is a global mobile security technology company headquartered in Munich, Germany. The company is part of the Giesecke+Devrient group. G+D Mobile Security has a workforce of 5,300 employees and generated sales of MEUR 877 in the 2019 fiscal year. More than 40 sales and partner offices as well as 20+ certified production and personalization sites and data centers ensure customer proximity worldwide.G+D Mobile Security manages and secures billions of digital identities throughout their entire life cycle. Our products and solutions are used by commercial banks, mobile network operators, car and mobile device manufacturers, business enterprises, transit authorities and health insurances and their customers every day to secure payment, communication and device-to-device interaction. G+D Mobile Security is a technology leader in its markets and holds a strong competitive position. For more information, please visit: https://www.gi-de.com/de/de/mobile-security.

About the job Description  Position at GroupM  Välkommen att ansluta till ett erfaret och växande team med data scientists och konsulter som jobbar med att driva ökad effekt av marknadsföringen för några av Sveriges och världens största varumärken.  Som en del av den ledande mediebyråkoncernen GroupM arbetar vi på Acceleration med att omvandla stora datamängder till lösningar på komplexa problemställningar inom media och marknadsföring. Projekten inkluderar såväl machine learning, konsulttjänster och strategiprojekt som algoritmer och dashboards.  Acceleration driver GroupM och resten av industrin framåt genom innovation kring teknik och data och jobbar nära de största annonsörerna, publicisterna och teknikbolagen inom industrin. Detta är en position med en uppsjö av möjligheter till tillväxt både professionellt och personligt.    Tjänsten innefattar att i ett team med erfarna kollegor:    Vi är ett team präglat av hög nivå som tror på ständig utveckling och en entreprenöriell drivkraft.    På ett personligt plan tror vi att du är intresserad av att:    Hos oss får du möjligheten att arbeta med många av Sveriges och världens mest ambitiösa varumärken, tillsammans med ett team som brinner för digital marknadsföring, och med marknadsledande teknologier. Du kommer att sitta i centrala lokaler på Birger Jarlsgatan med inspirerande kollegor från olika bakgrunder, som tillsammans driver digital marknadsföring till nästa nivå genom innovation och gediget arbete. Vidare finns stora möjligheter för personlig utveckling och karriärsutveckling inom GroupM Sverige, såväl som inom vårt globala nätverk.    Vi är ett familjärt företag som är en del av WPP, en stor internationell koncern, och vi arbetar för att kombinera det bästa av dessa två världar. Du erbjuds att arbeta på en stimulerande och utvecklande arbetsplats med hög trivselfaktor och kollegor som har nära till skratt.      Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med tillträde efter sommaren. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning.  Urval och intervjuer sker löpande, så skicka så snart som möjligt in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev.    Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Andreas Nordfors ([email protected])Director Sweden, Acceleration. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via epost.    GroupM är en av Sveriges största mediebyrågrupper och består av Wavemaker, MediaCom, Mindshare och Acceleration. GroupM:s främsta mål är att skapa fördelar för våra kunder via samarbeten med gruppens byråer. Det gör vi bland annat genom skalfördelar inom trading, teknik och data. Vi är en del av WPP som är en av världens största koncerner inom marknadskommunikation med över 190 000 medarbetare på global basis. GroupM Sverige har cirka 350 medarbetare i Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.

About the job At Northvolt, we don’t only produce innovative, ‘green’ battery cells made from recycled and ethically sourced raw materials. We also develop and produce cutting edge, cloud-connected battery systems. Do you want to be an expert on how these systems work, and help to integrate and support them in the field?  You will be part of a dedicated Embedded Software Support & Integration team in our Stockholm office where your primary role is to help our production, aftermarket teams, and our customers, with system related issues and do on-site integration of new systems.  You will work closely with our development engineers and learn the system inside out. On a typical working day, you are the main interface between production, aftermarket, customers and our software developers.    At Northvolt Systems we make full battery system solutions, at present time for industrial applications and for stationary storage solutions, but the application areas are expected to grow. The electronics, control systems, software and mechanics are mainly developed inhouse. Our battery systems are also connected by Wi-Fi or LTE to enable remote diagnosis and data collection.  We have many upcoming projects within our areas which is expanding our scope. Both the integration and customer support activities are expected to increase rapidly during the coming year.    We are looking forward to your application and hope you want join our journey!

About the job Next-gen operations at scale, with pure Python infra-as-code, from bare metal to containers and applications. Our goal is to perfect enterprise infrastructure devops.  We run hundreds of private cloud, Kubernetes, and application clusters for customers across physical and public cloud estate, and we are raising the bar on what's possible with automation by embracing a universal operator pattern and model-driven operations.  To succeed in this role you need to believe in automation as a pure software engineering problem, not a hack-it-till-it-works-for-me problem. You need to be interested in the scientific approach to operations at scale, driven by metrics and code, and you need to be able to learn the entire stack, from bare metal networking and kernel up to serverless and open source applications.  Cloud Operations Engineer  Our cloud operations engineers bring Python software-engineering skills and rigour to the operations domain. We practice devsecops from bare metal to application. We architect and run OpenStack, Kubernetes and software defined storage, and we enable devsecops for applications running on that infrastructure too.  To become a member of this team, you need to be a software engineer fluent in Python, you need a genuine interest in the full open source infrastructure stack from metal to containers, and you need the ability to work in a high pressure operations environment with mission-critical services for global brand name customers.  As a member of the team you will gain experience in a broad range of cloud technologies. We evolve our offerings as the state of the art improves, so you get to stay current with the latest capabilities in open source infrastructure. We drive upgrades to keep our customers on the latest, best solutions.  What Canonical Offers      Nice to haves   Of course we also offer...     #stack

About the job This job is sourced from a job board. You will be working with dynamic teammates on developing capabilities utilizing containers to deploy highly available applications. You will join a team responsible for ensuring and enabling highly available and high-performance inter-service communication for both synchronous and asynchronous communication. The team heavily uses hosted services from AWS such as EKS and API Gateway and hosts a Kafka distributed streaming platform in the cloud.  We expect you to be a high performing, free thinking individual who is not afraid of asking questions. Challenge the status quo with your experience not only in development but design and your experiences from past projects. We create solutions that simplify finance  You have an ability to dive deep into various hands-on solutions while developing new solutions/services and make strong contributions in architectural discussions.  You possess strong technical and communication skills with the ability to translate technical topics to user stories and tasks, work together with team members in all phases of development cycle. You will be part of the Architecture Chapter within IT Development and assigned to customer onboarding. Selected candidate will be based in Malmö or within greater Copenhagen region.  Are you the one for Ikano?  The right candidate has several years of experience working as a lead senior developer.   Added Advantage Key Responsibilities We want our customers, partners and co-workers to choose us for what we stand for, what we deliver and how we deliver it. Three basic values guide our work: common sense and simplicity, working together, and daring to be different. These values should feel natural to you.  Join us now – together we will find a better way  This position is a full-time employment, located in Malmö. We look forward to receiving your application with a CV and cover letter. Please note that we are unable to accept applications via email.    Ikano Bank creates possibilities for better living by offering simple, fair and affordable services, enabling a healthy economy for the many people. Our offer includes savings and loan products for consumers, sales support services for retailers, and leasing and factoring solutions for businesses. We conduct business in Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, the UK, Poland, Germany and Austria. Ikano Bank is a part of the Ikano Group, an international group of companies active within banking, real estate, production, insurance, data analytics and retail, who owns 51 % of the Bank. Ingka Group, a strategic partner in the IKEA franchise system, operating 378 IKEA stores in 31 countries, owns the remaining 49 % of Ikano Bank. Ikano Bank’s head office is located in Malmö, Sweden and the company is registered in Älmhult, Sweden where the business was once founded.

About the job About this opportunity!  We are now looking for a Solution Architect to the SW Flow Enabler Program in the PLM Transformation Execution.  Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) is important in most of Ericsson’s business flows. PLM enables product information creation and usage during Development, Manufacturing, Sales, Delivery and Support and includes people, ways of working, business capabilities, applications, data and technology. A continued digital transformation of Ericsson’s PLM solution is vital for our ability to continue to evolve our business models, explore new ways of engaging with customers and enable smarter product development and manufacturing. The target is a fully connected, data driven PLM.  Business Area Networks (BNEW) has been given the corporate responsibility for Development, Delivery and Operation of Ericsson’s PLM system which includes the digital transformation of the PLM solution.  The Solution Architect is the focal point for the technical implementation of requirements to improve handling of SW - from business needs to business results and to build a new, transformed way of working with SW development. Within the PLM Transformation program, we are working with several programs to implement changes to improve the speed in SW development, with improved product handling, product integrity, increased quality and efficiency.        At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next. About the job We are looking for software developers who are motivated by working on software that has a measurable impact on business.  Who We Are  Columbia Road builds seamless and commercially effective customer journeys that create impact. We help our clients get more revenue and more customers, but also to sell better. Our tight-knit team consists of business consultants who understand software and of highly talented business-driven design and technology specialists.  Currently, we have over 20 nationalities working in the company and the official language is English. Our company spirit is one of a true start-up, but with a twist of hard-core experience. We believe in giving a lot of responsibility and freedom to our employees. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the heart of our essence and everyone at Columbia Road is committed to these values.  Columbia Road has grown from 0 to over 140 exceptionally talented people in 6 years and in two countries. We are proud of the high customer satisfaction we have achieved as a result of focusing on people and creating concrete, measurable business impact for our clients every day.  Take a look at our Culture Code & People to get to know us better. We come 100% recommended on Glassdoor with a 4.8/5 score.  Columbia Road is a part of the Futurice family of companies.    As a consultant at Columbia Road, you will be working in the core of our clients’ businesses; advising, designing and implementing the tech needed to drive the business forward. You build businesses with code. You build storefronts, APIs and the integrations needed to glue them together. Your focus is likely on some part of the stack, be it frontend, backend or something like complex integrations but you aren’t too afraid to get your hands dirty with the other areas when necessary. You are comfortable working with a variety of programming languages and technology stacks - or at least you are interested to jump in and learn new skills. Columbia Road is not trying to provide the same solution to everyone, and sometimes that requires quite a bit of adapting from our side.  The focus on digital sales still means that we are tackling a large variety of projects. These range from ecommerce platforms and data platform projects to site optimisation and mobile development. For a few concrete examples of our tech cases, take a look at the Servaali case of a new microservice business-to-business shop, the full webstore renewal project for Oura, and our work for Matsmart in the optimisation of an existing store.  All of our consultants work directly with client stakeholders to build a good understanding of their business and its challenges. While development is probably where most of your time goes, we are in the business of creating impact for our clients, and that means spending some time to understand how the business functions. We help our clients in translating business opportunities into actionable plans and concrete solutions. Read more about how we code and design high performing digital sales channels.  We work as diverse teams of digital sales experts, tailored to each project. In some projects, this means working as part of a larger development team, while sometimes the setup needed is a growth team. As we believe that best results arise from employee freedom, all teams have wide latitude to choose the best tools and ways of working for themselves. This also means that your technology stack and specific role may vary between projects. We see this as a great opportunity for professional growth and are looking for colleagues who also value this. The more experience you have, the more you'll be able to take responsibility for your client projects and help other Roadies grow as well.  We pay extra attention to professional growth and learning at Columbia Road. We encourage you to follow your own points of interest, and we do this proactively. Together we'll continuously think about the best career advancement possibilities for you, both during and in between your client projects. Our internal learning opportunities come in many forms: events, courses, certifications, and afterworks, for example.       The recruitment process usually has 1-3 steps during which we get to know who you are and what motivates you. You will learn more about Columbia Road and get to meet different people from our company. You'll have the opportunity to present highlights from your career and tell us about your skills, roles, and learnings.  We’re committed to creating a good match between you and our organisation, and want to spend time to get it right. Sometimes, an assignment might be given to you to complete between interviews.  When we’re done with the face-to-face discussions, we’ll contact the people you have chosen as references.  We hope to hear from you soon!     : We are currently not able to hire outside of Sweden, so you need to already live in Sweden to apply.

About the job Craft  Technology & Development  Job Description  King operates mobile games at a massive scale. With titles like Candy Crush, Bubble Witch and Farm Heroes our code runs on hundreds of millions of devices across the world.  We are looking for a Build Engineer for Services would. They will share the knowledge and get access to Meta Jenkins.  Come join us if you want to take pride in creating the very best bite sized entertainment for millions of players worldwide!    We are looking for a dedicated person with a degree in Computer Science or similar to join our team. The SDK we work on is written in C++ for all the major platforms (iOS, Android and JavaScript/HTML5).  Our vision in Shared Tech is to provide a platform that creates material “competitive advantage” for our game studio partners and support them to provide outstanding player experiences.      As a new member of the team we offer a unique opportunity to be involved hands on and learn as you go. The wide responsibilities of the team give a wide array of challenges to conquer and King offers many opportunities for training and personal development.        King is the game developer behind the world- famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top- grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King’s games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.    Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.    Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It’s what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid- core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we’re not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!  Applications need to be in English.  Discover King at careers.king.com

job_title: Cloud Engineer to accelerate our growing cloud journey
job_description: About the job Are you ignited by cloud computing and would like to build on your skills amongst a team of fellow cloud enthusiasts? Does time fly when you get to work on and resolve complex business challenges in a dynamic yet supportive environment? Then read on, we are now looking for Cloud Engineers to join our growing team!  As a Cloud Engineer at Solita Sweden, you would form part of a community of 40+ Cloud & Connectivity experts supported by a leading network of over 1500 Solitans supporting customers’ digital transformation journey across 6 countries in Northern Europe. By joining Solita, one of the top companies in cloud services in the Nordics with solid experience in designing and implementing cloud solutions in the public and private sector, you will have the chance to work closely with our partners; AWS, Azure and Google Cloud. As a tech agnostic firm, you’ll have the opportunity to affect the technologies and methodologies we use in our projects. We want to give you the freedom to shape your future role and competence, and also the tools you may need along the way.      Mauro was one of our talented Cloud Academy students back in autumn 2021 where he was introduced to the top public cloud providers and their services. Following 4 certifications in GCP, AWS and Azure, Mauro’s curiosity for cloud infrastructure was awakened and his career at Solita quickly took off. In just a few months, he has had the chance to work on two very different projects; in the first project, his work consisted of app and integration development for a customer’s property management platform – the integrations were run in Azure, and the project has now reached the test phase.  Currently, Mauro is in a project for a major customer, alongside a team of 8 fellow Solitans, wherein he contributes to making master data user friendly through a combination of cloud engineering and API development. His work comprises Azure set-ups, IaC, release pipelines and DevOps. Mauro feels he has already been able to leverage a variety of skills by both working in a smaller scale project wherein he was involved in all stages from design to set-up and with closer contact to the customer and end user, to working in a larger scale project with clearly defined responsibilities within the team, in a more complex environment.  Mauro has thoroughly enjoyed being given the possibility to choose the path that is of interest to him. The projects that he has been assigned have involved increasingly more cloud infrastructure, which is where his passion lies and where he would like to steer his career.      Our head offices are in Stockholm and Gothenburg, and we also have smaller offices / talent hubs in Malmö, Östersund and Skellefteå. However, we are open to staying flexible to your needs and preferences and also embrace remote work. The role may include occasional travel to the customer site.    We would love to hear from you! Tell us about your skills and desires and we can figure out together if we could be a match. Send your free-form application for our review.  For more information, please contact Head of People & Culture Peter Svensson ([email protected]) or Senior Consultant & People Lead Patrik Rafstedt ([email protected]).    Unfortunately, currently we can’t offer relocation for candidates outside Sweden.

About the job Hi there, hey, hello! We are Tibber, the energy company that wants you to use less energy. Whaaat? That’s right. We’ll get back to that. Yes, we are by definition an energy company, but we’re more techy than most. How and why you might ask. Well, a third of our employees are actually working on developing products and solutions that can help you use energy in a smarter way. Our main goal is to empower people, and to reduce the amount of energy being used unnecessarily all around the globe – with the help of cool fancy tech. Good for our customers, their wallets, and the planet.

About the job Beskrivning av tjänsten  Har du tidigare erfarenhet inom testautomation/teknisk testledning, och vill utvecklas ytterligare tillsammans med duktiga CGI-kollegor och i spännande kunduppdrag? Då kanske det är just dig som vi söker! Vi vill nu utöka vårt team med duktiga testledare och testare.  Att arbeta som konsult inom Testautomation eller teknisk testledning på CGI innebär stor variation med många spännande och utmanande arbetsuppgifter. Inte bara är du med och säkerställer hög kvalitet, du är även delaktig i att påverka och förbättra systemlösningar.  Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter  De automatiserade testerna skapas med hjälp av moderna verktyg och ramverk i samarbete med programmerare och kravanalytiker. För att öka effektiviteten i våra leveranser har vi en drivkraft att automatisera alla repetitiva arbetsuppgifter som kan automatiseras i utvecklingsprocessen, inte minst tester i integrations/servicelager och gränssnittslager.  Exempel av arbetsuppgifter är:   Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll  Du har sannolikt erfarenhet av att kvalitetssäkra moderna systemlösningar med flertalet intressenter inblandade. Du förstår kraften av teamarbete och gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap lika mycket som att ta del av andras. Som person är du kommunikativ och har en förmåga att arbeta självständigt samtidigt som du är en proaktiv medspelare i ditt team. Du är ansvarstagande och engagerad och vi ser gärna att du har intresse och erfarenhet från att arbeta med agila projekt.  Erfarenheter som vi söker är:   Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:     Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande. Har du några funderingar kring rollen kan du maila till rekryterande chef Kristina Bürén, kristina.buren@cgi.com. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!    CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.  På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.  Mer information om våra förmåner:     Teknologin är kärnan i våra kunders digitala transformation men vi vet att det är människor som är kärnan i ett företags framgång.  När du börjar på CGI, blir du en viktig rådgivare som tillsammans med kollegor och kunder tar fram handlingskraftiga insikter som skapar meningsfulla och hållbara resultat. Vi kallar våra anställda för ""medlemmar"" då de är delägare i CGI. Vi vill erbjuda våra medlemmar en kultur där vi trivs med att jobba och utvecklas tillsammans och där vi tillsammans bygger ett företag att vara stolta över. Detta har varit vår dröm sedan 1976 och den har fört oss dit vi är idag – en av världens största oberoende leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.  På CGI vet vi vilken rikedom mångfald ger. Vi strävar efter att skapa en arbetskultur där alla känner sig välkomna och vi samarbetar med våra kunder för att skapa ett inkluderande samhälle. Som en jämställd arbetsgivare vill vi ge alla våra medlemmar samma möjlighet att lyckas och utvecklas.  Är du redo att bli en del av vår framgångsresa? Börja hos oss på CGI – där dina idéer och handlingar gör skillnad.

About the job Företagsbeskrivning  AFRY är ett ledande europeiskt företag med global räckvidd inom teknik, design och rådgivning. Vi accelererar omställningen mot ett hållbart samhälle.  Vi är 16 000 hängivna experter inom infrastruktur, industri, energi och digitalisering, som skapar hållbara lösningar för kommande generationer.    Inom AFRYs affärsområde Systems Management söker vi nu fler kompetenta medarbetare som vill göra skillnad i våra kunders vardag! Vi är ett härligt gäng med blandad kompetens från juniora till seniora i både ålder och erfarenhet. Kunskapsdelning är i fokus mellan oss som jobbar i teamet.  Våra kunder är främst användare av radiokommunikationssystem, t.ex. stora mobiloperatörer, försvar och myndigheter med samhällsviktig infrastruktur, eller industrier som vill implementera privata mobilnät i sina verksamheter.  Arbetet som konsult är varierande och vi söker dig som har en helhetsförståelse för tekniken.  Som konsult får du en stor variation i din vardag. Hos oss får du möjlighet att jobba med exempelvis förstudier, kravspecificering, projektering och projektledning. Du fyller en viktig funktion i skapandet av exempelvis design av radionät för tågkommunikation eller robusta nät för samhällsviktiga funktioner.    Du brinner för framtidens mobila nät och har ett stort intresse för det. Kanske har du även ett hobbyintresse inom det här vid sidan av jobbet?  Vi söker dig som har flera års arbetslivserfarenhet från ett eller flera av dessa områden:   Du är lägst högskoleingenjör eller motsvarande utbildning.  På AFRY erbjuds du arbete med frihet under ansvar samt utvecklingsmöjligheter såväl via AFRY Academy som via de uppdrag som du deltar i. Uppdragen utförs ofta nära kunden och vi lägger stor vikt vid att du är rätt person med egenskaper som öppen, initiativrik, ansvarstagande och affärsmässig.  Vi lägger också stort fokus på att hitta lämpliga utmaningar för dig som individ för att du ska trivas och utvecklas!  Ett krav är att du talar och skriver svenska flytande då vi jobbar mot olika myndigheter och därmed är stor del av dokumentationen på svenska.  Dagspendling till våra kunder kan ingå som en naturlig del av tjänsten. Även längre tjänsteresor kan förekomma. Uppdrag utomlands kan också bli aktuella, främst inom Norden  Denna anställning kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras inför säkerhetsklassat uppdrag.    AFRY är rankat som en av Sveriges mest populära arbetsgivare bland ingenjörer. Hos oss är du med och utvecklar innovativa och hållbara lösningar inom infrastruktur, energi och industri. Just nu söker vi marknadens vassaste kompetens som tillsammans med oss vill skapa framtidens samhälle.  Urval och intervjuer kommer påbörjas under augusti månad, pga semestertider. Sista ansökningsdag är 20 augusti.    Eskil Bendz, Sektionschef  Eskil.Bendz@afry.com  Ellinor Danielsson, Rekryteringspartner  ellinor.danielsson@afry.com

About the job WithSecure™ protects businesses all over the world from modern threats. We do this through a Co-security approach born from first-hand knowledge that no one can solve every cyber security problem alone. Every single day, our diverse, growing team fights against online extortion, threats to national infrastructure, the unlawful spread of sensitive information, and everything in-between. The best part about working for WithSecure is our people! We are a community of dedicated and passionate professionals that take workplace happiness seriously. If you’re looking for something that’s more than just a job – we’d love to hear from you.  We are looking for a to join our Global Incident Response & Readiness team. This is a great opportunity for someone who has a hybrid profile combining incident response and security management skills. You have hands-on experience in incident response and building up cyber detection and response capabilities. Your skills and experience will help you advise and implement security initiatives related to building resilience to cyber-attacks. You are a fantastic communicator who enjoys high-engagement interactions to ensure client satisfaction.
